review_body: I stayed at NYCASA 46 from March 10-14,2020. I was told booking the hotel was a big mistake. However, my experience contradicted that advice; the stay was great! Clean room, friendly and accommodating staff, and an excellent location. I would definitely stay there again. That’s the Pro’s. The Con’s? The hotel charged me above and beyond my $160.68 “Resort Fee” an additional $71.00. Here is the crazy part. That charge appeared AFTER I checked out! I called to complain. The only rather unpleasant person on their staff (because he insisted on rudely interrupting me) said, “Oh give it 24 hours and it will fall off your account. We do that all the time.” My problem? That you do it all the time doesn’t make it right. The person said it was for incidentals. What incidentals are there after I’ve checked out? In my opinion they do this to ride the customer’s money for a few days. The hotel was great but there are no incidentals. They have no room service, no amenities (In fact their vending machine had only two choices: Coke and waters and you have to pay at the machine. In conclusion, it was a very pleasant stay. I would stay there again, but to charge an additional $71 dollars on top of the city wide ripoff practice of charging “resort fees” that supposedly are to cover those services was the one thing that tainted the experience.

It's an old rundown hotel with a really good location next to time square. Good for the young, but not the old. It's noisy until after 3am, so if you're there to party this hotel is perfect for you. Safe enough.

This location is really good, right in times square. Hopefully no one has the same problems I did, it was just bad timing and a bad room. On the first night a hotel staff came up to our room asking if we had just showered, and we had, he said the room below us was leaking. A couple hours later of the staff not showing back up, I went to the front desk and asked if I could take a shower because of the leak, they said we could but that the leak was essentially our fault, that we had overflown the bathtub and got water all over the floor, we had not done that, there was almost no water on the floor. I told him that was not the case and he proceeded to argue with me telling me I was wrong and there HAD to be water ALL over the floor. I told him that I just wanted to shower and if it did leak again, I don't want to have to pay for damages or anything. He said "well i don't know what to tell you about that". At the check in I was told I was paying a $90 security deposit, and I have not gotten that back. I left my room in good condition so I don't know why I haven't gotten that. Apart from my bad experience, the other staff was friendly, and the place was pretty clean, you get what you pay for, the rooms are very small.

The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating. The continental breakfast was very nice. The rooms were very clean. The location is very convenient to all Times Square and Theatre District activities.

We were at the hotel in November 2019. We had already stayed there several times. We liked the excellent location of the hotel, as well as the good treatment by the staff, all very friendly and attentive. However, the last time, we noticed the presence, among the employees, of a tall, thin man who wore a turban. He seemed to be a type of manager.Such an individual never spoke to us, and he seemed to try to avoid any contact with us, as he always left the room when we approached. Such a situation was very uncomfortable. The breakfast, which according to the hotel, is a courtesy, has dropped in quality. The hotel, in addition to its name, also needs to change its furniture, which is very old and old-fashioned (the ironing board was broken ). Finally, I would like to express our thanks to all the receptionists, porters, maids and butlers, who are the best in the hotel.

Slept well, excellent breakfast. Clean room. Quiet room, very friendly staff. Very well located, 7 minutes jogging from Central Park. What else, fitness room small and trendmill was out or order, but do you spend your time in New York in a fitness room??? Will go back for sure.

I wouldn't reccomend this hotel for anyone that's not up for making do. Parts of the hotel stank, the room next door to ours looked like the lock had been broken in to.Breakfast was average as expected.Took a long time to check in, the room we booked could not be found. When checking in at 9pm after a very long day this isn't welcoming or reassuring. We left bags at the hotel which took a long time to collect, really annoying as we had a flight to catch. I didn't come on a trip to New York to hang around in the lobby of this hotel.

I stayed for 2 nights in NYCASA hotel towns square. The location is amazing. The front desk agents were fine, they were busy and always dealt with line perhaps thats why they were not that interactive but the lady i met upon check out was friendly. The room is old and need bit of renovation however the cleanliness is good. Only the issue was i put my request in Agoda that it was my birthday (feb 29th) and i requested for good view room but upon check in they didnt even aware of it and gave me 2nd floor facing the wall! While before me were another guests the reception told them he upgraded them and they were assigned in 7th floor! Well i truly understand that if they cant do my request at least highlight it and inform they cant do my request for certain reasons. The breakfast was average, could have better variety. Overall if location is the big concern for you, this place is a good option.

The location near Times Square is perfect! The breakfast continental buffet is really good and has a great variety (eggs, toasts, croissant, bagels, waffles, cereals). The only negative points are that the carpet on the floor of the room is old and the shower curtain stinks but otherwise, everything was perfect for a quick stay in New York!

Just had a quick trip to NYC to connect with friends. NYCasa 46 came up on Travelocity - good price and good location. Was worried about noise but it was very quiet. The rooms were clean and the staff was exceptionally pleasant. Will definitely come back. Thx to all the hotel staff for making it such a nice stay.

I had a very pleasant stay at NYCASA 46. It is in a good location in New York City and very reasonably priced. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. The hotel provided breakfast which was quite nice.

Hotel is situated just around the corner of Times Square. Staff was friendly and breakfast modest but well enough. Rooms were small but clean. One elevator was pretty reserved in morning times. Noise from hallways came to rooms but not from streets.

Hotel is ok and being remodeled, hence is noisy and dusty. Rooms are small dated but clean. Breakfast is horrible, no even eggs. Staff is cordial. Excellent location. Careful when booking a king room, they have very few and most of them are actually double rooms with queen beds.

I would come back and stay and would totally recommend this hotel for couples .. the rooms are not that big but for a nice getaway it works perfectly ... the location is key !! And there are alot of things for you to do at a walking distance !

So excited to find this gem. Fabulous location, walked to everything. Came with a great discount at the parking garage across the street. Clean room, comfortable bed, friendly staff, free continental breakfast, free wifi, free luggage hold so we could check out and continue our adventures the day we were leaving, and not have to carry our luggage around the city! Great find at an amazing price!

Aside from these room doors being slammed when closed and waking me up all night, the room is ok, breakfast is ok, location is great, staff is great, price is ok. If these doors closing systems were fixed, I'd definitely come again.

great location half a block from times square, subway and theaters, friendly professional staff, basic breakfast, a bit dated decor, but comfortable, quiet and clean. will use it again on a future trip.

We’ve just stayed at the NYCASA 46 and although in a really good location near Times Square, the hotel itself needs updating. The bed was comfortable and the room clean but it was tired. I was so disappointed that breakfast, which was rather lacklustre, was offered with only plastic cups, plates and cutlery!! This is surely a backward step in the current eco climate. We were also annoyed that we had to pay facility charges for WiFi, radio and coffee maker. There wasn’t an option so why don’t they just put the cost onto the price of the room?

The finest hotel in New York! Wonderfully clean, comfortable rooms, excellent staff, nice breakfast, and above all else in a perfect location! Turn right out of the hotel entrance takes you to Times Square, left takes you to Rockefeller Center. Food wagons left and right on 46th Street to buy lunch and dinner. You can't ask for a better location than that!

Work trip became a nightmare when the hotel apartament 405 caght fire on december 21 as 3:30 am and management did not manage respect and consideration fot rhe nightmare lived with the firefighters run

Rooms are very small, reception was staff not friendly, they charged for storing the luggage, the breakfast was limited but good enough, the rest was good, location was excellent right at the center..

We stayed for one night while in town to see a show. The hotel is small and dated but the staff was very nice! The bed was comfortable! That's really all we cared about as we knew we weren't spending any time in the hotel. It is one block from Times Square and a quick walk to Rockefeller Center and the Theater District. There are nice restaurants and shopping all around. The furnishings (carpet and desk etc) that look like they are 30 years old definitely need to be updated. Breakfast was included and was adequate (hard boiled eggs, waffle maker, cereal, juice, coffee/tea, fruit, yogurt). They validated parking at a local garage so that was reduced from $67/night to $27. While there was a window, our room on the 2nd floor was isolated from noise and lights of Times Square. It certainly wasn't fancy but for what we wanted, it was perfect.

Dated, over priced hotel. This was our 3rd stay in NYC and the worst accommodation we have had. Plenty of other options for a similar price with locations just as good. Times Square is also very noisy so you may want to take that into consideration before booking.

The hotel had a fire in a room on the 3rd floor the day before we arrived. When we checked in we were put in a room on the 2nd floor. There were multiple fans in the hallway to dry the water used to put out the fire. While I know the fire was not the hotels fault, we should not have been put on a floor that was affected. We immediately asked to be moved and were moved to the 5th floor. After that everything was fine. I do not blame the hotel for this but they should not put people in a room that was affected by the fire if other rooms are available.

We decided to spend the weekend before Christmas in NYC and the location of this hotel was PERFECT! So close to Time Square, shopping, Grand Central and Rockefeller Center! Pros: Location, location, location!Nice StaffOlder but still pretty cleanGood breakfastCons:This is a small hotel, one elevator and one very narrow stairwell (the stairwell is important as it comes into play below).Our experience was a little different as the hotel had a fire while we were there. YES, A FIRE. It was the heating units in one of the rooms on the 4th floor. While the alarms went off the smoke alarm lights never flashed in our room, there was no call from the front desk or announcement over the intercom. I heard people yelling, smelled smoke and grab my kid and flew down 3 flights of very narrow stairs. The hotel staff was very kind giving everyone blankets to stay warm while 4 firetrucks came to work on putting the fire out. Everyone was okay but the hotel was in disarray after the fire. Water coming out of the lights, carpets where soaked, everything smelled of smoke/burnt wire. The hotel never offered any sort of compensation which was disappointing but everyone was safe and that was my main concern. The NYFD was awesome as 16+ firefighters worked for 2 hours to make sure the hotel was safe and most people were able to return to their rooms.

For midtown Manhattan, this hotel is a very good value and has a great location. It is a well maintained smaller hotel. All of the staff have been helpful. We return annually at Christmas time and sometimes in the spring.

The location is great! Short walk to Times Square and many other cool places. Hundreds of unique restaurants within walking distance. Rooms are small but clean and nice. Walk in shower is a nice feature. I like the individual temperature control in my room. Only negative....... they empty dumpsters late night. We were in the 6th floor and heard the dumpster noises. Glad I’m a sound sleeper

We were in NYC to enjoy the city at Christmas time. We were driving our son to NY for his flight out of JFK to Europe. The gentleman at the front desk answered all my questions when I called the day before our arrival pertaining to parking and arranged a shuttle for my son from the hotel to the airport. The room was clean,quiet and cozy. All staff treated me extremely well, efficient and friendly. Continental breakfast was sufficient and your attendant was very hospitable. Even the checkout was very friendly and the staff took their time to explain charges and made sure that charges were correct as there was a change in the credit card we used.

Simple and clean hotel in a exceptional location near Times Sqare. The room was clean, with no noise and a good temperature. The worst thing perhaps is the breakfast but it is good. The wonderful location makes this hotel the best one for us

This hotel was great for the value! Clean and friendly staff, fast check-in, hard to find breakfast included so that was a plus, rooms are small but overall would stay again! Walking distance of several stores and restaurants and Radio City Music Hall. The hotel offers Parking at a discount across the street which is also helpful!

In addition for the rooms being smelly and dirty, the water that came out was grey!!! It was like a horror movie. I couldn't brush my teeth or shower. When I complained they said it is impossible until I showed them the pictures!!! I ran out of there and booked myself to a new hotel. Scary!

There is no question, this hotel is in a wonderful location only 100m from Times Square. The smaller misses could have made this a great stay. Firstly the internet was terrible. Frustratingly we had little to no reception. Secondly, the rooms were very tiny and no bar fridge for milk for your coffee or cold drink. Breakfast was bulk produced and although bagels were good, the rest was a let down. Although a 5 star location , the whole experience for the money was regrettably poor.

We booked this hotel for 4 nights through Booking.com and were initially a bit concerned as it changed names twice after we'd booked. We arrived earlier than the check-in time but received a warm welcome and fortunately our room was ready. Our room was clean, comfortable, quiet and a reasonable size for New York. It had tea and coffee making facilities which were refilled daily but no fridge, however there is an ice-maker downstairs. It wasn't a problem, but be prepared for plastic cups in the bathroom and styrofoam cups for coffee. We hadn't experienced this in any hotel before so it took us by surprise, but it might be normal for New York. Like many city hotels our room lacked a view other than roof tops and pigeons but we were out all day. Breakfast was more than adequate with a range of cereals and instant porridge, pastries, bagels, waffles, fruit, yogurt and hard boiled eggs & fruit juice. In addition there was jam or cream cheese for the bagels. A toaster was also available for use.Once again we were surprised to have paper cups and plates and plastc cutlery but it certainly wasn't a problem. The food did not run out as it was constantly being refilled and the breakfast area was kept clean and tidy by staff.We had a very enjoyable stay here and and found everyone to be very friendly. It really is in an excellent location, just minutes from Times Square and the theatres and 10 minutes walk from where the Airport Express Bus drops you off at Grand Central Station. We paid £240 per night for the room which was one of the cheapest available with a good rating of 8.3 in Times Square area on Booking.com
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: My wife and I are both senior citizens, and this was our first time in NYC. We had been told to definitely find lodging in the Times Square district. We spent hours reading reviews trying to find an affordable place. Some reviews said that this hotel had small rooms, but we found our room to very accommodating and clean. We made our reservation through Hotel Tonight and felt we got a very good price. We would definitely stay here again! The location is perfect! One thing I don't understand about the NYC hotels is that they all charge an additional "resort fee". That fee here was only $35 a night which was much cheaper than many of the other hotels we considered.

Paid top money for this hotel going by the reviews.Sadly on arrival we were given a very small room with the view being a brick wall about 6 feet from the window so pretty much no daylight was key in at all.Breakfast was ok, not spectacular. More or a grab and go kinda thing.Great location about 150m from Times Sq.Summary..... not worth the money for a tiny dark room but the location is good.

I've done hundreds of reviews and rarely are they bad, however, the whole purpose of Tripadvisor is honesty and this is only my opinion. I'm sure others have better experiences.The Good - Times Square Location: Usually we stay at the Crown Plaza two blocks away, which is also next to Times Square, but the cost was less at the Broadway @ Times Square (the name when we booked in February), Casa Tui (name last week when we visited) or NYCASA46 Hotel (name I found on TripAdvisor today in order to post my review).The Bad - Billing: Wow. So many people in the lobby having trouble with their bills. Lots of raised voices. Primary issue is that if you booked months ago under the Broadway @ Times Sq name there wasn't a facilities fee (or it was lower than the new owners' current facility fee) and the staff had to manually match your copy of the booking invoice to their computer screen pricing. If you didn't have your original booking notice it was a mess. Thankfully we prepaid in full with the actual hotel last February and had that email confirmation and they had to match it. They took a copy of the email and asked us to come back in an hour while they manually adjusted their computer system to honor it. Also those that booked through a third party (like Booking.com) had issues with the pricing of the fees as well. So... watch your invoice if booked before ownership change.The Bad - Comp Breakfast: I had thought this would save us some money, however, the food was so pitiful that we ended up eating out after that first breakfast. Unripe bananas, Trix flavored yogurt (strawberry and VERY sweet), stack of frozen Eggo waffles, hard boiled eggs in a crockpot, dry pastries... The Bad - Size of Room: I mean very tiny. We were on the 9th floor (top). There are 10 rooms per floor with one permanent resident (sweet old man we met in the lobby). Anyhow, the bathroom counter was only 11" x 25" with a corner shower of 33" x33". The 31" television is on the SIDE of the queen sized bed so the two guests can't sit and watch the television without sitting on the side-edge of the bed. We didn't watch the tv, but placement was awkward. Clock in the room had USB outlets for charging your phone bedside (great) but the time not the clock was wrong by over an hour and there was no button to adjust the time. No, it did not synch with your phone to the correct time when you were charging either. Bed was comfortable though.The Musty - AC: Beyond the tiny size, the very musty smell of the AC was barely livable. We tried spraying Fabreze but the AC/heating units need DEEP cleaning. Next time we are going back to Crown Plaza or trying another Times Square hotel.

extremely comfortable stay from all aspects...lodging, food , excursion....when you step out of hotel you are in famous Times Square. Employees of hotel were very polite and helpful .Breakfast was too excellent..I would like to recommend this hotel to everyone.

First time in the New York.Room and bed very small ,clean,good location .close to time square and everything easy to get the tours bus to everywhere. Free breakfast continental. Staff very nice. fair price

Small hotel excellent location off Times Square. Check in and out slow and very innefficient. Make sure your bill is correct. Breakfast poor. Room good clean. Noisy as adjacent rooms constantly slamming doors. Lift very slow. Hotel collects fee more than the booking agent mentioned.

When we checked in, the hotel was known as Broadway @ Times Square Hotel. On the day we checked out, we learned that the hotel had been sold and renamed Casa Tua Hotel. I can tell you that the former owners provided an outstanding breakfast (bagels, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, donuts & sweet breads, pre-made waffles, bananas/apples, yogurt, orange juice, tea, and coffee from 6 am-10 am. There was an room with more than adequate seating and an attendant made sure the food did not run out. Our room had a comfortable queen-sized bed (I have back problems so I have to have a good mattress). There was a dresser and plenty of room for our bags. The air conditioner was strong and reliable. There was a safe for valuables and a full-size iron & ironing board. The bathroom was roomy and had a good-sized shower (no bathtub). There was a hairdryer. The shower gel, shampoo, and body lotion were dispensed from wall and shower receptacles so bring your own bar soap, shower puff, etc. if you’re particular. We were in Room 905 on the ninth floor and hear absolutely no noise from the street. The location of this hotel cannot be bearer if you want just a short walk home from all the theaters and the discount TKTS booth is a short walk away. The employees were very friendly, especially the doorman, who allowed us to store our luggage for a few hours between our noon checkout and our departure for LaGuardia. I hope and pray the new owners maintain the service and facility and don’t increase the reasonable (for NYC) rates. If so, we will be back for sure!

We arrived late about 10pm Wed. July 10th.2019, we did call ref. being late arrivals. Greeted by a friendly front desk person, who was very nice and helpful. Woke breakfast was a little disappointing but ok. We did find the room sufficient but tight, bed was comfortable. As said, before great location just a block away from many Broadway Shows and Off Broadway Shows. We decided on seeing the Broadway Show, "Beautiful" the story of Carol King....it was Marvelous...There were many places within blocks to eat, drink and be a tourist. But, at the end of each day we enjoyed our time at the old and quaint Hotel Broadway....Thanks to everyone there for a marvelous time.....Bob and Shirley

Smallish hotel (width-wise) with a super friendly staff. Rooms are small without feeling confined. Rooms are also clean and nicely appointed though the wallpaper could use an update. My one real complaint is that our mattress wasn't very comfortable. Hotel offers Free wifi and continental breakfast.

Terrific Hotel. The great things about it are It was clean. The staff was terrific. Great location. Maid service sensational.The not so great things about it are · I was in room 200. Very small room but extremely clean. It was strange though. You had to turn on the TV then turn it off then turn it back again on to get a picture. And I mean every single time. The safe in the room was the same. You had to punch in the code twice to get it to lock because the first time you put in the code it read “error.” Again this happened every time. I stayed for a week. The WiFi never worked properly in my room until the day before I left. I had to call tech support nearly every hour to get them to reset the router and that only worked for about an hour. Then another call had to be made. But even with all the calls they were so courteous and friendly. The last thing I didn’t like was the view from my room. It was a dark alley. No light at all. But in the end I recommend the hotel for the price.

The staff was very helpful and very professional. We stayed one night and enjoyed the access to Times Square and nearby activities. The room is a little small but the bed was very comfortable. We didn't hear any of the noise from the street. The only thing this place is lacking is a refrigerator.

Everything was great from check in to check out. The rooms are a tad small, but you really can’t beat the location, half a block from Times Square. There was free wi-fi and a continental breakfast as well. Highly recommend.

The location of this hotel is amazing. So close toTimes Square and Broadway. The rooms are quite small but we spent minimal time in our room anyway. It’s clean, tidy, the staff are pleasant and the location is great (as I mentioned previously). I would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I stayed here for our recent trip to NYC. Our room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. All the staff we interacted with were extremely nice and helpful. They even held our bags for us after we checked out so we could travel around without toting our suitcases around Manhattan. It's close to Times Square and only a few blocks from the subway station. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again on our next trip!

We were in New York City for the first time, not sure where to stay....it was very nice, comfortable, the staff was exceptional, they had a car service we used....everything was top notch, the breakfast was even really good, everything was very close to the hotel, Times Square was less than a block away, the price of the room can not be beat.

The location is great and the staff is friendly. Our room was "cozy" but the bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was roomy with a full bathtub/shower.Our room was quiet too! Slept great after lots of sightseeing. Breakfast included waffles and warm boiled eggs. We will return!

The location is great. The hotel is fine especially if you aren’t going to spend much time there. The problem was the billing and payment. The hotel charged my daughter’s card on Saturday check in 4 times for the room as well as incidental charge. The bank then froze the card thinking fraud. System glitches happen but 3 days later the incorrect charges weren’t yet reversed. No manager was available on site to explain what was going on and when resolution might be expected

We stayed at the Broadway for a few days after a cruise. Let me just say, the staff was outstanding. They assisted us with everything. From directions, to reserving our ride to the airport (which was an excellent price) to the umbrella we needed on a rainy night!The room, for New York, was big enough. The bed was comfy, we had enough towels. Location was perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel!! Thanks for the awesome couple of days!!

Excellent stay. Had three rooms for family holiday from Australia. Excellent location right near Times square. Friendly helpful staff, clean rooms and good variety for breakfast.Thoroughly enjoyed our time here.

We stayed for 5 days, 2 adults and 2 childs. Good experience and good services. Great position, only 50 meters from Times Square. Everything has gone ok. Appreciable breakfast. GOOD experience for family b

In New York you’re going to pay if you going to stay in Time Square. This one was definitely worth it. We stayed in a two queen size bed room. Everything was clean, comfortable and the staff that work there were more than accommodating. We were able to drop her luggage off before check-in time and go see the sights. When it was time to leave they made sure we had a taxi there at the moment we want to leave. I would definitely stay there again. Oh they also had breakfast which a lot of places do not offer. It was a continental breakfast… Nothing too fancy but it was just what we needed before we had it out.

Courteous personnel at front desk. It can be noisy depending what room you are assigned. We know this since we were assigned a room on our initial stay and another room later in the week, which was quite noisy. Complimentary breakfast is standard and somewhat similar to a Holiday Inn Express. We chose this hotel because it was economical but more because of being very close to Times Square and there are several eating establishments within walking distance.

Stayed here last week for 6 nights. The rooms are ok, adequate and clean. Typically though quite small as most are in NY. However, the location is brilliant, 2 minutes walk and you are in Times Square. This alone is a good enough reason for us to book this for our next trip to NY. But the real bonus here is the amazing, helpful and welcoming staff. Nothing was to much trouble for them, everything they did they did with enthusiasm and with huge smiles. We loved it here and will definitely go back to this place.

Nice little hotel 50 mt far from Times Square.Perfect for business and for leisure trips.The room was small but very quiet. Good wifi and very nice staff at the reception and breakfast.Regarding breakfast they do same as many hotels in USA: buffet with carton dishes and glasses, fruit, coffee, and few more: minimal but good.

The check in process was easy and the rooms are reasonable. Very close to Time Square, 5th Avenue. Rockefeller Center, NBC, CBS, Fox Studios. In the heart of it all but no street noise. Clean room and free continental breakfast.

Helpful staff, clean room, at the Deluxe had king size bed, mini fridge, microwaves, tea maker.Well connected to the whole city.Haven't tried the nearby restaurants, but lots of them and very diverse.

We stayed here for 3 nights in December. Hotel was very clean and bed comfy. We stayed on the 9th floor Which was very quiet. 2 minutes walk to Times Square and 5 minutes to Radio city, we will definitely stay here again when we return

Came to this hotel with my girlfriend for 4 nights around Christmas.For our badget it was perfect and higher level than other hotels for that price.The staff was nice and welcoming, bed was pretty comfortable, bathroom bigger than I expected with hot water 24/7. The location of the hotel is one of its best perks, it is right in the middle of everything but in a side street so it’s not as loud as it is in Times Square. We barely had to take the subway because everything was so close to the hotel! Very convenient! At the same time i have to mention the breakfast that could have been better. it was very basic (which I expected) but sometimes the fruit were not fresh, the donuts were dry and not that good as were the waffles. i wish they had more options because i ended up having the same disappointing breakfast everyday that included: a waffle, donut and yogurt. The room was small as expected for new york hotel rooms but it wasn’t a big deal because we were traveling most of the time.One more thing is i wish we had a microwave in our room, that would help out a lot.So to summarize, this is a decent hotel, it was very good for my type of trip and the price made the trip possible for a young couple. But it could be improved a little more.

Stayed here for a couple of weeks in October. Amazing location - steps away from Times Square and subway (a block away). A great launderette is 5-mins walk away in the Rockefeller Center (Next Cleaners), supermarket 5-mins walk on 6th Av / W41st (Whole Foods market). Staff are very friendly and helpful. Great amenities. Clean room. We stayed on the 6th floor and heard no external noise. Self-serve breakfast set us up for the day. Totally recommend this hotel if you wanting a clean, functional, quiet stay in the heart of NYC!

A boutique hotel with excellent, inviting staff in the big cityVery clean room , easy access to all i important things to see , easy transportation about the area .I musy say the morning coffee and full contintal breakfast was wonderfulCheerful staff! Theater all around , Radio city a block away ! Ho,iday shops, whole foodsThank you new york!

I stayed at the hotel from December 16-20, 2018. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The free breakfasts were basic, doughnuts, hard boiled eggs, muffins, yogurt, juice, coffee and tea. Coffee and tea were available all day. My room was clean and the bathroom pretty large. Toiletries were very basic, think Days Inn. The rooms are drab and need updating. Location is walking distance to Times Square, Bryant Park and Rockefeller Center.

It is steps away from Time Square and short walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Radio City and many other must sees. Parking is across the street for very good rate for their guest. Staff was very nice. Will definately stay again.

The stay was wonderful! The hotel is right in Times Square, and right near other major attractions! The staff was great. The room was small, but clean. I had an issue with nightly amount showing up with the hotel as more than what I had booked it for on Travelocity, however the manager got it fixed quickly and I got refunded the difference before I left to go home.

I commute into NYC everyday. On occasion, it's easier to stay over. I went on booking.com at the last minute and found this hotel, which is only a few blocks from my office. Yes, the room is very small, but it's clean and the property itself is very nice. You can't argue with the location (next to Times Square). If you're looking for a big spacious room, then look elsewhere. But, if you just need a room for sleeping purposes, this is a great option.

Upon arrival we were booked into the wrong type of room - much smaller than expected, but were given the right room after going back down and double checking. Each breakfast was the same but you get that at most hotels. The concern at breakfast for us was that the hot water tap was quite high up on the counter which could be dangerous. I tried out the treadmill but it cut out on me after 5 minutes. I complained to reception having gone flying and they didn't seem to care suggesting that there was a sign saying do not use - there wasn't! We had an issue with our toilet as it kept on flushing and was informed that the building is old and cannot be expected to run perfectly without major repair which isn't currently possible, and told to just keep the bathroom door closed! The wallpaper in the corridors was peeling off and looked damp in places. Whilst the staff had major attitude problems, the location is great and the room kept out most of the outside noise.

I stayed at Broadway in June 2016.... I.Have not been back since, so not sure the current condition.. however when I visited, i found it quite suitable for the out and about the traveller who does not really need too many frills.t is kind of on a side street.... and the street is not too glamorous at all....It feels more comfortable if you are not by your self... all be it, i did not feel unsafe at any time. Always lots of people al lthrough the night. I visited NYC to go shopping and see some sights, this hotel was central, near to broadway, near to the train stations, near to shopping, NBC studios and so on. Lots of activity nearby including getting to a tour bus. HAd all the basic amenities in the room and a comfy bed.... VERY IMPORTANT after walking up and down each day. The room that I was assigned did not have much of a view - just the back of buildings across the street.. But it was all good. helpful front desk. easy check in and out and business centre you can print your boarding pass for travel.

Our room was very clean and comfortable! The staff was excellent and went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and fun! Check in was easy, the free breakfast had enough of a selection that everyone in my family was happy and all the sites we planned to see this visit were within walking distance!! We ran into a glitch with the parking garage we used at the time of departure and the staff did everything they could to accommodate our family which included two children! Special thanks to Prenkle and Julio (not sure of spelling) for treating us like family!! We will return soon!

Needed a place to stay in the city last Saturday. The hotel I usually stay at was priced out of my price range so I read reviews and decided to try this hotel. Requested an early check in as I had theater tickets for a 1:00 show. Arrived at the hotel at 11:30 and was greeted by a very friendly front desk clerk who told me my room would be ready in about an hour but they would check my bags free of charge. I left the hotel and walked the half block to Times Square arrived back at the hotel as 12:15 and the room was ready to check in to.I was given a relative large room on the 5th floor which was very clean and looked inviting. Room included a microwave and a fridge, neither of which I needed but nice to know they were there. I was a little skeptical of the noise factor as the room faced 46th St but it was relatively quiet.The hotel offers free "unsecured" wifi and a continental breakfast. I opted for a full breakfast at a pub around the corner. They also have soap and shampoo dispensers in the bathroom so you do have to deal with small bars of soap. I wish more hotels would do this.Would I return? Already made a reservation for February. Prices will vary depending on the day of the week and the time of year. While I paid over $200 for Saturday, the price for February was $150. Definitely I recommend.

This is an old historic hotel... literally half a block from Times Square. The lobby has been completely remodeled, and check-in was super quick and accommodating. My room was small... but nice and clean. And they've got everything you'd need: microwave, fridge, coffee maker, etc. The only negatives: there's only one elevator, and it seems to move at a snail's pace, so I opted for the stairs most of the time. The carpet could use an update, but the room itself was clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

I can’t praise this lovely boutique hotel highly enough! Location is perfect, just a short walk up the street to Times Square and the TKTS booth, and all the wonderful theatres of Broadway as well as Rockefeller Plaza within a few minutes’ walk. Easy access to subway and bus lines. Hotel is safe, quiet even though so close to all the NYC action, well-maintained, clean, bed very comfortable, staff extremely helpful and efficient. Continental breakfast was perfect to fill up on before heading out for the day, not to mention we could take a banana or muffin along for a snack along the way. Broadway at Times Square Hotel will be our go-to stay whenever we come back to visit NYC!

If you want a hotel in the middle of it all, this is it! Location is superb! This is not your upscale, fancy hotel, but a place to sleep (comfortably) after a busy day exploring the city. The staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful with any questions we had. Continental breakfast was also a great option. The hotel is an older hotel, and aspects are a bit dated (such as carpet), but our stay was comfortable and we would choose this hotel again! On our last day, the front desk reserved us a car (with flat rate fare to LaGuardia) to take us to the airport ahead of time to avoid waiting for a cab. Would recommend this hotel!

Hotel is older and shows some wear, but great value, clean, location (Time Square) and staff was extremely friendly / helpful. Recommend if using as a place to sleep and take a shower. Basic breakfasts included ....great value

We stayed there for our honeymoon and we really like our stay in this hotel. Positive points : - VERY close from Times Square : only 100m away. we really enjoyed being one minute away from it as it is a central point in Midtown.- an included breakfast (bagels, toasts, donuts, muffins, waffles, fruits..), so you can start your day with a full stomach.- a very comfortable bed.Negative points :- we are not obsessed about cleanliness but the carpet was very old and didn't look very clean... a bit gross to walk on it barefoot and there were no some kind of hotel flip flops provided.- the shower was a bit small.- a bit expensive... but you pay the location !- the staff could put some efforts into smiling a bit more... we sometimes felt like we were just annoying them.

We stayed at this hotel a couple weeks ago. The location was fantastic, just a couple blocks from Times Square. The room was so small, I get that, it’s NYC. We had no control over the AC and it was miserably hot. There were flys all over the continental breakfast area. Most concerning was the mold on the walls I found. There are many other better hotels in the area, please think twice about staying at the Broadway!

I booked the hotel through booking. Com. The payment condition of the booking was to make payment after I reach hotel. To my surprise, they deducted 200 usd before I reached the hotel on 16th September. The hotel did not adjust the amount deducted. They charged me the full amt for my stay of 3 nights. The hotel said, booking. Com will refund our money. So far no refund has come. I wrote to booking.com, but no reply. Don't know what to do now to get my money back.

The staff was very nice and rushed to get our room ready before normal check in time. They also had a dyorage room where we were able to drop off our luggage while we went to lunch. We had a kingsize bed and the bathroom was really large compared to many hotels. The room was decent sized for NYC.

My friend and I picked this hotel because we had two shows to see nearby. The location is in the middle of all of the great Times Square theaters and restaurants. Exciting and colorful everywhere you look. The hotel is very basic but has exactly what we wanted: big hugely comfortable beds, fridge, microwave and tv, nice bathroom. I never sleep well in a new place but I slept like a LOG in that wonderful bed. The continental breakfast is free. We went out for a hot breakfast but it was nice to know their breakfast was there in case we wanted to stay in for the morning.The staff was fabulous. Ivonne at the front desk was charming, genuinely friendly and helpful, flexible about our checkout time, searched for a bag for ice for me to fill in the breakfast room so I wouldn’t have to go back to my room for my ice bucket. Tall, smiling Sidibi was kind and sweet natured and quickly stored our bags for us since we’d arrived too early for check-in. I needed tissues and poof! He produced a box from the back room.A happy, convivial atmosphere at that front desk!The two of us split the $350 cost of this room, very reasonable for this great location. I will definitely stay here again to enjoy Broadway shows and great restaurants!

The hotel location is great if you want stay near Times Square, the breakfast is included, the size of the room is ok, they don’t charge your Amazon deliveries.If you want stay in a room with street view, choose the room 202, it’s the second floor.But what I like the most is the service: the receptionists, concierge, the woman that clean your room, waiter, the mens that take care your luggage, everyone is very nice, they are always ready to help you and some of the receptionists speak spanish.

The hotel location is excellent. It is right on Times Square. Step out of the hotel, look on your right and you are on Times Square! The T Mobile Shop is a minute away as SIM is the first thing I usually need after arriving. Ample food options are nearby and few are 24 hours. For me, a Halal food cart was right outside the hotel. The location made my stay comfortable. I could sightsee and then come rest for a bit or change and then head out again.The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. They guided me with directions and sightseeing. I needed to go to JFK and asked a staff member. Within 5 minutes, he arranged me a black car service (much cheaper than Uber). Luggage service is provided to and from the room. Housekeeping is good. You will find whatever you leave in the room in its original place. Thus, belongings are completely safe.The rooms and bathrooms are clean and spacious. The room had a fridge, microwave, locker, iron (usually you have to request an iron at hotels. It was in the room here all the time), coffee machine and ice box. The business centre was free. I took a few prints at no cost. There is a small gym downstairs that can be used. At this price, not every hotel offered a breakfast. They had a decent breakfast and were never out of food. Fruit Yogurt, Water, Tea and Coffee were available 24 hours. The rooms had a TV with ample programming options. Wifi was excellent.Overall, it was a pleasant stay.However, I feel the hotel needs to upgrade it's look to make it more modern. The carpets need to be changed for sure to newer and modern ones. There was a distinct smell in the hotel (reminded me of a hospital). A few times, I had to request the housekeeping to spray my room with an air freshener.I wish the breakfast had more options, preferably healthier ones. Right now, the breakfast had Bagels, Toasts, Cupcakes, Donuts, Basic fruits, Yogurt, Boiled Egg and Cornflakes. I stayed for 6 days and was fed up of eating a boiled egg daily. Wished they had an option where we could request an omelette or fried egg.For the price, if the hotel keeps a complimentary water bottle per day, don't think it should be an issue, considering the prices you get water at in the US.

My husband and I stayed at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel for four nights in early September, and it was a perfect stay. It's a budget hotel that includes an adequate breakfast (except the coffee is not good), and the staff is very friendly. Our room on the 7th floor was very quiet. The only noise was from a really loud family on Saturday night, and after I called the front desk, the noise stopped. We had taken Amtrak up to see two shows and to enjoy the restaurants, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Frick and Friday night free jazz at the Morgan Library. Even though it's near the subway, we walked everywhere because it was beautiful out, and the hotel is perfectly located. Our bed was extremely comfortable, and housekeeping did a wonderful job keeping our room tidy. It was our second visit to this hotel in the past several years, and we'll be back!

This hotel is very conveniently located to Times Square. The rooms are small but more than adequate, with a larger than usual refrigerator and a microwave. The bed wasn't all that comfortable, but the pillows were good. The carpets were worn, particularly in the hallway, and there was a musty smell in the hallway. Our biggest problem, however, was our shower drain was clogged so you had to stand in 3 inches of water when you took a shower. That was a huge problem for us. This hotel is adequate in terms of value to price, but it is definitely NOT a 4-star property. The "excellent" and "very good" ratings were not consistent with our stay.

This was a very nice place. It was nice and clean; the location was perfect and the staff was friendly and helpful! My Gdaughters and I were able to walk to may places and we were just a quick Uber or Lyft ride away when we didn't feel like walking. We were there for just an overnight and it was perfect for that. I would definitely recommend it to a friend or family member. The price was wonderful for it's location. One note: the continental breakfast was the bare minimum so be prepared to eat elsewhere if you like to start your day with a real breakfast.

We had been booked with a travel package at the Marriott Marquis for 4 nights prior to staying here. We couldn't justify the price to stay there without the package, so we moved to the Broadway @ Times Square for the last two nights of our trip. The Marriott Marquis it is not, but this hotel did have some great things going for it.Pros:The location... just a block or two from Times Square and a short walk to Avenue of the Americas. There were lots of great restaurants nearby as well.Staff - Everyone we encountered on the staff from the front desk, to the baggage valet, to the maid were very friendly and helpful.Free breakfast - it's a very basic breakfast (yogurt, fruit, toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, coffee, etc) but it's free! With how pricey things are in NYC free food is an excellent bonus.Rooms - were clean, beds were comfortable. They have soap and shampoo dispensers as opposed to the little bottles. I prefer the dispensers as it cuts down on waste and is more environmentally friendly.Cons:Rooms - While the bedding and bathroom was clean, the room was cleaned with a very strong perfumey type cleaner... the smell was so strong that we had to open a window to air it out. I sometimes feel hotels do this to give the impression the room is clean and fresh when it is actually not. That being said, the floor and wall paper were definitely in need of a deep cleaning and/or refresh. The room we were given was also VERY small... like once you get the bed in there there isn't much floor space for anything else. There was a very spacious closet though but no in room fridge. No view - Like I mentioned we had come from the Marriott Marquis where we were given a large room on the 20th floor with views of the NYC city skyline. When we looked out of our window at the Broadway @ Times Square we saw a brick wall. Overall, we did like our stay and had we not stayed at the Marquis prior to staying here we would have found these accommodations adequate. For the really high prices of NYC hotels, we felt the Broadway @ Times Square was reasonably priced and will probably stay here again in the future.

The best is the location close to Rockefeller Center ( don’t loose the opportunity to see Manhattan at night from Top of the Rock) and subway station. Times Square is few minutes walking and you can get other subway lines so you are connected to everywhere. The hotel is good, not a luxury one but comfortable and quiet. The breakfast is very good and you can start your day with the energy you’ll need for an intense and amazing city.

The lobby area seemed nice and clean and the staff were friendly when checking in.Complimentary breakfast was nice but basic, however it set you up for a day of exploring. The room we stayed in was small and basic with no view which was a disappointment due to how close we were to Times Square, unless you like a view of a brick wall. The rooms could do with a bit of an update to match how the lobby looks, and a refrigerator wouldn’t go a miss. However, the rooms were very clean and tidied every day. The helpfulness of staff was dependent on which member of staff was working that day.Overall, nice stay, the location and price sells it.

We are not the type of persons that write reviews but this time we feel that it is necessarily. If you think of booking this hotel, you better look somewhere else. This website is providing so many positive reviews about this hotel but I'm starting to think those are wrote by the night front desk clerk. It could be on their job description.The problems started on arrival. We arrived at the hotel parking, we drove there. It is a nice public parking, close by. Nobody told us that we are not allowed inside to park the car, we've been kicked out of the car, with kids and luggage, while the car was half in and half on the sidewalk. The front desk area seemed to be nice and clean, soon we discovered that it is the only area like that. The room was a total disappointment. A tiny room, 2 queen beds so close to the walls that you could barely walk in between. One of them was six inches away from the air condition unit that was blowing right towards it. To get to the bathroom you had to squeeze yourself in between the bed and the TV stand. The carpet was a dark color, mostly due to accumulated dirt. Everywhere it looked like nobody cleaned the dust in a while. The wallpaper was peeled off and it had a grey look. In the bathroom the vent was full of dust. The smell in the room was almost moldy but they tried to cover it with a lot of perfume.Breakfast was a joke. Same thing every day. Boiled eggs, bagels, doughnuts, apples, bananas, cream cheese, butter, cereals and milk. In one morning we arrived at 9:30 am, while the breakfast is served until 10 am. Everything was completely empty. When I went to the front desk to ask for some food, another employee, that was just sitting there chatting, told me that is to late because in a few minutes the breakfast will be over. When he saw that his answer almost made me explode of anger, he quickly went to the breakfast area and started to pull out of a closet different things to eat. After that he had to refill it several times, since more guests came in.I thought to change the hotel but it was in too short notice and they would have charged me the first night anyway.The only good thing about this hotel is its location, just a block away from Times Square.Over all, if you have standards, pick another place to spend the nights in New York.

I was with my 2 kids who wanted to stay in Times Square but I didnt want to pay the price of your typical 4 star hotel there. So we booked here at Broadway @ TImes Square. Relative to the other hotels I would usually stay at there are a few complaints (breakfast is just donuts and coffee; creaky water pipes, etc). But this is not a 4 star hotel and hence you are paying a very good rate for a nice room, well functioning AC, and really friendly front office staff. All in all, and especially considering the location, I would come here again god-forbid (smile) my kids want to stay in Times Square again!

This hotel exceeded my expectations. We arrived a few hours before check-in, and they were able to store our luggage while we waited. Even thought the room was not very big, it was clean, and nicely laid out. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. The location was close to the theaters and to Time Square and yet it was quiet and perfect for our stay. The bed was comfortable and I loved that there were outlets for electronics conveniently located on the night stands and the desk. They were able to store our luggage at check out since we had a few hours to kill before we had to go to the airport. They offered to arrange for pick up to the airport, and were very helpful with our questions.We will definitely be back.

We just arrived today 07/22 . My husband is military disabled with a bad back. The beds are super soft so we kindly asked the gentlemen downstairs (bald shorter guy) who wasn't doing anything but on his cell phone if they had a roll-away mattress so my husband can put it on the floor. He replied with a simple "no, we don't have that anymore" so I suggested extra blankets so he can make a bed on the floor. The gentlemen was so annoyed that we asked. He went to go get "one" blanket that looks dirty and practically threw it at him (not literally but the bad attitude and the way he handed it to my husband was rude). Needless to say....it's going to be a bad night for him. The carpet is really dirty so sleeping on the floor without anything is not an option. It's a shame that we pay for a hotel who provides a job for this guy and we can't get good service . Disappointing! Customer service is really important and it unfortunate that people can't provide it.

The biggest thing going for this hotel is its location. It is right in the heart of things for Times Square, so easy walking distance to theaters. Our room was extremely small, with a tiny closet and little room to store luggage. The room had no view, the window looked into brick wall and windows of other rooms. The room was quiet, clean. Apparently, some rooms have fridge and microwave, ours had neither. Though, there was an empty unit in the room which may have held these at some point. Breakfast was included, selection of baked goods and cereals, some fruit, juice and coffee. The hotel was OK for our 3 nights. I would feel claustrophobic if our stay was much longer.

This was a great hotel in the heart of Times Square. Breakfast was wonderful and the staff were very friendly. Considering the location it was surprisingly quiet. Rooms were very small but suited our needs.

Stayed here for 3 nights... the size of the deluxe room was good. Had a fridge and microwave in the room which was wonderful. The room was clean and the staff helpful. As for breakfast.... I feel alot can be done. The coffee didn't taste good, having the same kind of food every day. Other than that, beautiful location. A walk into time square. Overall nice experience.

I liked this hotel for 1 night stay in New York. Perfect location 1 minute walk from centre of times square. No complaints. Of course a small room but this is new york and 3 star. Was clean and free breakfast.

I stayed here for three nights. The reception and breakfast area have been renovated but the rooms are tired, dated and on the small side. Breakfast was a massive let down unless you like doughnuts and even then the cheap long life large box type. I understand this hotel offers only continental breakfast but slow cooked pre-shelled boiled eggs (literally being kept warm in a slow cooker),long life yoghurts, bread for toast etc and a fruit choice of bananas and apples served on paper plates with plastic cutlery did not make the mark, oh and the coffee was dreadful too. As stated the bedrooms need an overhaul, there was clean linen and towels but the carpet and shower area were ingrained with dirt (due to age, not the dirt that hoovers up). Due to the room size, you have to shuffle around the cupboard door to get to the safe, taking care not to smash your toes in the process as you cannot step back due to another piece of furniture. However if you are after a good location near Times Square then this is the place for you, but if you want any quality, look somewhere else. Oh yes, no fridge in the room and cheap filter coffee with no milk!. My colleague was in a nearby room and gave the same feedback...

Location, Location, Location ... Steps away from Times Square, next to great restaurants. Staff is outstanding, and very helpful. Complimentary Daily Breakfast and Free WiFi. Rooms are on the small side, but the location makes up for that.

Just spent 4 nights here. The good: Location, comfortable bed, excellent A.C., clean, quiet, continental breakfast. The bad: most of the rooms are very small. There are like 12 rooms to a floor. The rooms at ends of the hallways are a bit larger, but 2 people with normal luggage stretched the storage space a bit. There was a credenza for a mini fridge and a microwave, but was empty. Used that space for the storage of a suitcase. Also a bit of a musty smell in the room. And the cost seemed a bit high for this property. All and all not bad, but if I returned to the Times Square area I would stay at another location.

The rooms were outdated and the noise outside made sleeping nearly impossible. I would NOT use the rubber mat in the shower as it was black with filth and mold and appeared to be quite old. The continental breakfast was “ok” at best.

Great little hotel just off times square. Clean and comfortable. Would stay here again! We had a king room. The room was small but had a fridge and microwave along with a desk. Breakfast and internet were included. Only one elevator but never had an issue getting it.

The good: location! it's 2 blocks away from Times Square + free wifi + free breakfastThe bad: my room, though comfortably, was a bit smelly (I think it was the carpet)The staff was very friendly. Luggage storage for early arrivals or late departures.

A lovely almost cute hotel that serves to cater for the simpler type of traveller. Excellent location at the hearts corner of Times Square but smaller than usual rooms yet I feel they are quite pricey comparatively. Also could improve on its breakfast offering although I suspect due to the fact that it’s surrounded by restaurants it doesn’t make food offering core. Very helpful staff though that are always eager to assist and guide accordingly.

Good points: quiet room. Location-if the main highlight of your trip is Broadway shows, hotel's location is perfect, walking distance. Anything else you are doing in NY I would recommend choosing another location, Times Square is always packed, noisy and dirty.OK- breakfast, it's an OK breakfast, less choices than most hotels offer in their continental breakfasts.Rooms are small but expected in NYC. One tiny window facing a wall, no natural light.Bad points -DIRTY!! Hairs on bed, bathroom and shower. Musty smell of dirty socks that would not go away with AC. Showered with flip flops. But my main complaint is service.WORST SERVICE EVER!! Can't think of a worse experience service wise in my past. Lobby receptionist is rude, unhelpful and made us feel as if hotel was doing us a favor in hosting us. I had a problem with parking and asked to speak with manager, and that happened only two days after I had the problem and only because I insisted to speak with her. Manager did not apologize for receptionist's behavior and did not solve our problem to my liking. Would NEVER recommend this place to anyone.

Booked in advance 2 rooms for 4 nights. The rooms were better than 3 star and would honestly say between 3.5-4.0 overall. The cleanliness was very good. The continental breakfast is definitely a 4.0 and was very good for a start every day. The local NYC prices for food are very high so having drinks and some nice basic breakfast every day was a real treat. The room price was very good but the Apple Core chain itself are priced properly. This location is 300 feet from Times Square. There are several noisy restaurants close by. The luggage steward on arrival was lacking any service and the front counter staff were friendly but recommended walking the 300 feet and hail a cab on Broadway ourselves, which we did and became very successful at it. I pre-booked VIP airport pickup and redelivery thru USA Guided Tours and I was very happy with that but I would recommend that you use the GO bus thru the hotel staff as it was a lot cheaper but realize it is by the person whereas USA was by the vehicle and if you 3 or more folks it could be cheaper just to have VIP services do it. The front desk had many months to put us together with rooms but did not set aside rooms close by but 2 floors away which was NOT convenient. We was told to try and change rooms the next day. If they had done it right the first time we would have to try anything. I even called and they were not friendly or helpful on the phone to get it done months in advance. This is a great place for a NYC hotel for location and price but the shortfalls at the front desk keeps their rating down.

This was my 7th or 8th stay at the Broadway. As usual the Staff was very warm ,helpful and very friendly. Always see to it that the guest is comfortable.Evonne at the Front Desk is really very helpful .She always takes an extra step to help.My sincere thanks to ALL the Staff. I Would always love to come back to this Hotel.Thanks you Bhavesh Jhaveri

I just returned from a theatre wknd here, booked a queen w/fridge & microwave and was pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to the king version. Yes, the hallways are quite narrow, and you’ll likely have no view, and the breakfast is negligible, so much so that yesterday morning, I didn’t even bother with it. But the location is wonderful, you can walk to just about any theatre and you’re spoiled for restaurant choices in the immediate vicinity as well. Everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeepers were friendly and accommodating. The bathroom was actually rather spacious. The fridge and microwave came in quite handy for holding drinks and warming leftovers. I did think it a bit odd that some street noise did manage to filter up to my room, all the way to the seventh floor! But I’d stay here again if the price was right.

Great location only half block from Times Square. Continental breakfast was a great way to start the day.Contrary to some other reviews we really enjoyed the free breakfast. AC in room was nice and cold but only complaint of room was very little storage space. Small elevator and very narrow hallways. Hotel booked up a shuttle to airport and it was cheaper than uber. Everyone there was so friendly. If you are looking for a no frills hotel at a great price, close to Times Square, this is the hotel.
user_location: Port Saint Lucie, Florida, United States

review_body: I think I'm a pretty fair judge of NY hotels and usually have good luck. I know to expect smaller rooms, and I even try to avoid the major chains and stay at the boutique hotels when the price and location are right. So when I saw all the excellent reviews for Broadway at Times Square Hotel, I gave it a try. But this hotel goes beyond "boutique" - small is one thing, but this was a pit. First, a hotel can be small and still be modern and useful - like the Cambria. But Broadway at Times Square was not useful. It was old and cramped. To start, the elevators are so tiny 3 of us barely fit with our bags. If you needed a luggage cart, forget it. The housekeeper got on with her cart and pushed us into the corner - it was that tiny and claustrophobic. The hallway outside of the elevator is also so slim that only 4 people can wait in the hallway for an elevator. On either side of the hallway is a fire door leading to 2 rooms. So if there was anyone waiting for the elevator, you had to basically wait in your room. OK, so much for fit. The condition of our room was so disappointing. Our room was beat - peeling wallpaper, rust on the bathroom window, tiny old rusty sink, no internet service, no place to put your suitcase. Luckily, it was a one-night stay. Maybe there are better rooms at this hotel and that's why so many good reviews? I feel like the reviews I read were for another property. I didn't realize when I booked that this was "formerly Comfort Inn" -- maybe that should have been a clue.

We stayed here 9 years ago under different owner. It's still a decent hotel in a great location. The staff is exceptionally nice and helpful. The rooms are starting to look a little dated, but they are comfortable and a nice size. Breakfast is mediocre. I would recommend it to someone who is looking for an average place.

This place wasn’t too bad. There were some good things and some bad things. Let’s start with the good. The location and price was very reasonable (according to our research). Just a block from Times Square, close to subways, bus lines, restaurants, theatres, the Rockefeller center and a 15 minutes walk away from a lot of the midtown attractions. The staff was very friendly and the room was fairly spacious by NYC standards. Now the bad. The room was a little stinky/musky smelling. The carpet was damp, yes damp. Not sure where the smell came from, ventilation, moisture, or what? But that should be taken care of for future folks. I have read several reviews on here about the smell, so I am sure it wasn’t just the room we were in. The breakfast wasn’t good at all. I just went for a cuppa joe and a couple donuts every morning. If you are a breakfast person you will be going out every day. The room we were in did not have a microwave or refrigerator, so that was a bit disappointing. And only one elevator. I guess it’s not so easy to add another...We were basically in our room just to sleep, so most of the complaints I have, we could live with for the price we paid on our first trip to NYC. This place is not a dump, but it is nothing close to posh either. You get what you pay for I suppose. We will probably pay a few more $$$ and stay elsewhere next time.

My daughter and I were on a Broadway Musical spree and decided to stay here because of its location. It is a somewhat small hotel, but the room was larger than some we have stayed in. It was very quiet considering its location so close to the hub of Times Square. It also included free continental breakfast, which is unusual in NYC. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. In fact, my daughter and I decided to extend our stay by one day and JJ at the front desk was very helpful in doing that. He also arranged private transportation for us to JFK at 5:30 on Sunday morning for a very reasonable fee of $65. The taxi we took into Manhattan when we arrived was almost that much (with tip) and the ride was better. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for 5 nights while visiting NYC for a vacation. The location was great! Easy access to 47/Rockefeller Ctr and 49 St Station and (just slightly further away) Times Sq/42 Station. From there, NYC is at your fingertips. We visited locations from Harlem to Lower Manhattan with ease. We didn't really make it out to the other boroughs just due to time constraints but they were easy to reach via subway as well.Staff was friendly, our room was clean, the beds were soft and comfy, and the luggage check was really helpful so we could get out and start our visit on arrival day. The breakfast was small, but good. The fresh chocolate chip muffins are where it's at! I was a little concerned about noise, given the close proximity to Times Square, but ultimately it was an unfounded concern. The room was pretty quiet. We caught two Broadway shows (Hamilton and Lion King) during our stay, and I loved being so close to the theaters so we could walk back quickly and change before/after the shows. We chose this hotel primarily because it had two queen beds (which isn't easy to find in Manhattan) and it was centrally located to most of the attractions we were hoping to visit.If you're looking for a luxury 5-star experience, this probably isn't it, but if you want a safe, convenient, reasonable, comfortable, mid-range place from which to go out and explore the city, you've found it!

Stayed at the Broadway for 5 nights. The location is great if you want to be close to Times Square, Broadway and a number of other attractions. The hotel rooms were small but adequate; could use a little sprucing up in looks but were not a deal breaker. Bed was awesomely comfortable!! We were in the back of the hotel on the 9th floor so were not bothered by street noise. Staff was very nice, helpful and enjoyed interacting with them.

Wonderfully located hotel – just off Times Square and close to multiple subway lines. Older building, but well maintained. Room was basic and clean, but the bed was very uncomfortable. Bathroom was modern. Ok breakfast provided (i.e., no eggs, bacon etc.), free wi-fi. Only one elevator which sometimes resulted in long waits. Good security. Good value.

Perfect location, walk to the end of the street and you're in the heart of Times Square. Front desk was very helpful and breakfast was good. Room was cozy with a view of a black brick wall. Based on location and price I would recommend booking a room!

Our room was the largest one we've ever had in Times Square. We had a very comfortable king sized bed. There was a microwave and a refrigerator for your convenience. It was also well maintained and clean. The room temperature was comfortable. I immediately called friends who were coming up the next month to let them know about this hotel. There was a very large breakfast area. We never waited for a seat. In fact, it was so welcoming we met other guests and had great conversations since you never felt rushed. Their was a very pleasant staff member who constantly cleaned and restocked the area. There were fabulous, fresh NY bagels, donuts and muffins every morning along with juices, fresh fruit, had boiled eggs, yogurt, cold cereals, oatmeal and coffee. We were very pleased.The entire staff was friendly, informative and very helpful. There were brochures and maps in the lobby. Also, coffee available all day long.For someone who is NY for theatre, you can not beat this hotel. You are in the heart of the theatre district and can walk to all the Broadway theaters. We will definitely stay there in the future.

I’m not one to complain about a small room or lackluster amenities. You get what you pay for and this place was super cheap. Fine for a single night in the city when I knew it would take too much time and hassle to get home to the suburbs after a work conference with an early morning looming the next day. So no complaints about the room or amenities, but after midnight, the front desk allowed someone claiming to be a delivery person to come up to my room. This person started knocking but refused to identify themselves, trying to get into the room. I called the front desk and they said it was a delivery for me and when I told them I hadn’t ordered anything they said they’d send someone up. When I called back to get more details on what exactly it said was being delivered (since now I was panicking that someone had stolen my credit card data, room details, etc. bc apparently they knew my name) all the front desk person would say was that it was a mistake. Now maybe it was for someone with my first name and different room number, who knows. But it was still so scary I’d never come back here nor recommend that someone else does. It’s probably worth it to spend an extra $50 and get a room at the Marriott or Hilton that are close by.

Really friendly helpful staff, clean and tidy, simple and does what it said. Breakfast was included and basic but effective. Great location as only 2 mins to Times Square and 5 mins to most of the theatres.

What a show we saw, loved every moment and a wonderful cast. Well done Casey Nicholaw and crew. Most entertaining show and one of the most beautiful theaters on broadway. We were a little early and had a couple of beers while we waited. Great fun night out.

Like most rooms in theatre district hotels, this was not exactly spacious, but for one or two nights it was quite adequate, and very clean. The bathroom actually was a nice size, with room to move - something many hotels in mid-town lack. One nice amenity was a night light in the bathroom, which I've seldom seen and which was greatly appreciated. The staff was very friendly and the complimentary breakfast was varied and filling, though nothing special. The location is unbeatable - a short walk from all the Broadway theatres and "restaurant row." Will certainly return!

The location is great but the hotel only offers the minimum, yet they charge A LOT. The setting of the room is awkward, the bathroom is tiny and and the closet is small. They don't even offer the regular soap, shampoo and body lotion daily supplies. What they have is dispensers with liquids that only God know for how long have been there. The TV is not in front of the bed. Instead, they have it set on top of the drawer chest at one side of the bed. Good luck if you are the one sleeping in the other side. The worst is the breakfast: cereal, milk , boiled eggs, bagels, toasts, apples or bananas EVERY SINGLE DAY. Who ever is managing this hotel is taking it to the cheapest level.

Great hotel which was very clean. Staff were very pleasant and did everything they could to help when our flights got cancelled and we had to stay for an extra 4 nights. Bed was comfortable but not sure I’d class the bed as queen size as advertised. Couldn’t be closer to all the action that Times Square has to offer, which unfortunately comes with the noise levels you would expect but if the window closed properly I’m sure it would have been less of a problem. Breakfast was as advertised. Would highly recommend and if ever venturing to NY again will most definitely be staying there.

My daughter and I took a quick trip to NY to see the Rockefeller tree decorated for Christmas. This hotel could not have been more convenient unless it was in the middle of Times Square! It’s a very short walk to Times Square and the Rockefeller center. We were able to go shopping, eat, and see the sights. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. It’s a quick drive to and from area airports. We flew into Newark and flew out of la guardia and paid pretty much the same using Uber/Lyft. The rooms are small, but that’s to be expected.

At 2:35 AM on our second night of a four-night stay, we were awakened by flashing lights, a hideously loud alarm, but no smoke or fire. As it turns out, a cleaning person accidentally tripped the fire alarm, but the night staff didn't know how to disable it. We, ever cautiously although there was no hint of smoke, made our way downstairs (literally, not using the elevator) to the lobby, where the night manager sheepishly confessed to the cause of our rude awakening. After about 15 minutes they figured out how to use the PA system, notified the mostly still-room-bound guests of the error, and a few minutes later managed to turn off the lights and sound. Training is in order, don't you think? Located just one-half block East of famed Times Square on 46th Street, this nicely remodeled six-story property features adequate if tiny rooms, well-designed with charging stations for your devices, a desk, hairdryer and iron, a super-tiny closet (we had to remove the luggage rack to make room for clothing), and a tiled and well-appointed bathroom. Linens and towels are high-quality, the bed is comfortable, and the WIFI is no-charge. A respectably good deal for the price. We also enjoyed a continental breakfast featuring all the stuff you'd expect, and maybe more considering the fresh-every-morning NYC donuts, yogurt, and bagels, included at no extra charge. I believe in rating properties by comparing them to their peers, not to higher- or lower-priced alternatives, and the Broadway would have won a "5" had it not been for the careless alarm event. We'd stay there again when returning to Times Square and the Theatres along Broadway.

Large room (for NY standards) complete with fridge, microwave and coffee machine. Clean and cosy, bed super comfortable. Bathroom was clean and the room was well serviced. Shower powerful and holds its temperature well.Breakfast is a real bonus here, it's all self-serve, but for a Brit, tea and toast is all I want, which there was plenty of. Cereal, yoghurts and best of all, amazing doughnuts, are also on offer. The breakfast area is also clean and comfortable, with plenty of tables.The staff are all helpful and friendly, especially the guy stocking the breakfast foods.I was hesitant being close to Times Square, but the location of the hotel is perfect. You are close to a lot of the main tourist areas, plus a short walk into Hells Kitchen for that perfect evening meal away from the tourist restaurants in Times Square. Remember it's still Manhattan so take those earplugs if noise keeps you awake! (this is no fault with the hotel, every Manhattan hotel I've been in suffers from the same problem).The rooms offer a free safe too. We had a room at the front of the hotel and our window overlooked the street, which we liked.Absolutely loved my stay and when I come back I'm booking this hotel again.

We had a snowstorm coming and didn't want to drive home late from the train, so stayed last-minute at the Broadway at Times Square.
