Price was fantastic given the location, the breakfast was very good for a budget to moderate level hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and the beds were comfortable. Only downside is the size of the room - with 4 of us with suitcases it was a bit of a challenge storing things and getting around the room. But we were only really in there to sleep, so this was a minor issue far outweighed by the positive aspects of the hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

There are plenty of positives about this hotel: location, free breakfast, price and one of the best parking deals I've come across in the city. It is also one of the few hotels in New York to offer a room with 2 queen beds, making it an easier sleep for our family of 4 with two teens. This hotel is about 2 blocks down the street from Hamilton the musical. Everything Times-Squarish/Theaterish is a no-problem stroll. And the noise really isn't too bad inside the hotel. Sometimes we could hear the people in the next room but they tended to pass out quickly!The room is indeed tiny. It's definitely a one-way street to go from the bed to the bathroom, or the bed to the closet, or the bathroom to the front door, etc. Just get everyone coordinated and you'll be fine. The room was clean. The beds and pillows were super comfy. We had a view of a wall but the room still got good light. The wifi was free, good and fast (we were on 5th floor.) The business center was in good working order and we were successfully able to print things.The bath always had warm water. One thing to note -- when I refilled my water bottle from the sink, it came out a milky white. It turned out to be minerals and after a couple of minutes it cleared up. It was a little jarring, but I promise you will not die. Or, at least, I haven't yet.The best part of breakfast is that it exists. We had fruit, yogurt, donuts and cereal most mornings, but there were eggo-style waffles and hard-boiled eggs available. The coffee was really not that great, and I'm pretty easy in that department ... so I'd suggest really gussying it up with sugar/milk, making your own in the room (coffee maker) or going out. The breakfast room was large and clean. The hotel lobby is very nice and modern with plenty of places to sit. There was only one elevator, but we never had to wait long and it was always in working order. The hotel contains only 79 rooms. We were able to check in an hour early which was of great help to us, and it marks the first time EVER we have been able to check in early anywhere in NYC.If you get your parking ticket from the garage listed on the hotel's website validated, you will get a great rate. We parked our car for 3.5 days and only paid $78. That is an amazing rate in Manhattan! They do charge more for SUVs or luxury cars, but we just have a dopey old Toyota.I'm not sure where the staff-to-rave-about was. In all of our time there we only had one perky person ever say hello to us when we entered the lobby. And the maids were very nice. The rest never made eye contact or offered any sort of greeting. They were not impolite, just not very friendly. It's NYC though, those hard, jaded city people!Honestly, an overall good experience. I would stay again. The parking rate and location are huge enticers.

I can't say enough how perfectly situated the hotel was. Right in the heart of Time Square/Theater District yet set back enough to provide quiet from the hustle and bustle. The room was clean had everything one would need & affordable. They even had a tasty continental breakfast. There was no view but then again the wall of the Bldg next door shielded the hotel from any possible time square noise. Highly recommended for a few night stay in the city!

A hidden gem ,few steps from times Square and 5 th Avenue. Small but clean rooms .Ivonne on the Front desk is very helpful ,courteous and suggested the best rate,direct from the hotel ,which was 20 percent cheaper than booking or hotel .com ...instead instead of 2 nights I ended up staying 5..I ll come again surely Bhavesh

This hotel is a 30 second walk from Times Square and walking distance to all the site seeing attractions. The hotel is clean and tidy! It is noisy but to be expected, but It didn't effect our sleep. Breakfast is good and wifi in the rooms is helpful! Ideal for those who want to watch shows on broadway and perfect to use Times Square as a hub, you never get bored of walking through it. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

We had a great stay at Broadway at Times Square. The location is fantastic for site-seeing. It is a little noisy area but didn't prevent us from sleeping after all the walking we did! The staff was helpful, not overly friendly but helpful enough. The room was clean and comfortable.

Except the breakfast, everything is just fabulous. The hotel is literally located at the heart of the Manhattan. The area is quite noisy, but we did not hear anything from our room. They also allow you to leave your luggage for free, a big plus for NYC.

Stayed here for two nights. The hotel is unpretentious, but clean and comfortable. The beds were great, had a restful nights sleep - it was so quiet. Staff was super friendly. Lots to do in the area, within walking distance or by subway. Only complaint was the water temp in the shower. It took a long time to warm up in the morning.

Great location, great room, great breakfast, great price. Nothing else to ask for. VERY reasonable price for a hidden gem in the city. Small lobby with 24hr attendant made me feel safe. Great location steps from Times Square.

The hotel is perfectly located in Times Square. Considering how close it is to the hustle and bustle, we never heard any noise from the outside during our 4 night stay. Check-in was a breeze and staff were both friendly and helpful throughout the hotel.The room was a little on the small side but that didn't bother us as it was just somewhere to lay our heads. More importantly, it was clean and the bed was super comfy as we were able to get a great nights sleep.Having the breakfast right downstairs was a huge plus point in terms of convenience. The food was great with choices like toast, muffins, doughnuts, bagels (really fresh and tasty!), yoghurt and cereals as well as tea/coffee/orange juice. The breakfast room was fairly large and was never busy when we ate around 7:30 (although I would imagine it could get difficult to get to the food once it gets a little later). Also, food was always being replenished.Overall our stay here was a present one and would definitely recommend to others.

Located on 46th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, this hotel is extremely well located. It is close to Times Square and around the corner from the subway. The rooms are small, but very clean. The staff is nice, helpful, and knowledgeable. This is the third time I've stayed here and each time I am pleased with my choice. The rates are affordable.

The location of this hotel is perfect. My partner and I took the AirTrain from JFK to Jamaica and then from Jamaica to Penn Station and then took a taxi to the hotel this was very simple, a lot cheaper, and faster than getting a taxi all the way from JFK to Broadway. The hotel reception and breakfast area are all very modern however the hotels rooms are not and could do with updating particularly the bathroom. Our bed was comfy and for what we needed (somewhere to sleep and wash) this hotel was fine. Our breakfast was included in our room rate, so was okay but I wouldn't be happy if I had to pay for this as was quite basic (plastic cutlery, paper cups/plates). We stayed on the 9th floor and we had no problems with noise etc. and got a good nights sleep every night. Overall for the price and location yes we would probably stay here again.

This hotel is right in Times Square, but you wouldn't know it! I couldn't hear any outside noise from the room I was in, which was great! The room was nice, a little on the smaller side, but still had a full/queen size bed, dresser w/TV, and a full bath. My only complaint is that the mattress was too soft for my comfort, but everything else was great.The staff was so nice and they were more than accommodating. They have a luggage room in case you arrive early and check-in isn't available yet, so that makes it very convenient to drop off and start exploring Manhattan! The price was only $150 per night and it proved to be a great deal! It's in a safe part of town.

Stayed three nights. As everyone says, you can't beat staying one half block from Times Square. Bed was comfortable, room was fine - we didn't expect anything large, and it had a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. Combine the location with the very reasonable price and free breakfast, and this has to be one of the best values in NYC. Breakfast was an adequate hotel level breakfast and the nice thing was that it was open till 10:00. Our room was on the street side and a little noisy, but we were high enough that it was not a bother. We would definitely come back here on another trip to NYC.

Location you almost can find better, next to Times square. Rooms are very small and dark but sufficient, but who spends time in their room when you are in NYC? :) Breakfast they had fresh donuts, bagels pretty OK could be better.

My mum and I stayed in this hotel for our first visit to the United States from England. We picked this hotel due to the fantastic location, trip advisor reviews and low price. We were not disappointed. This is a no thrills hotel right in the centre of Manhattan, a stone's throw away from Times Square - the perfect location for first time visitors to the city! The room was small and basic but the bed was exceptionally comfortable. Our room was at the front of the hotel which was fairly noisy - not from people on the street but things like dustbin trucks at 4am. We were advised about the noise on check in and offered a quieter room from the following day but they didn't have any others that night. My mum woke up a few times during the night but I was not disturbed as I am used to the noise living in London. However, we did not feel the need to change rooms.The room also had a coffee machine and free tea bags and coffee sachets.The bathroom was basic but shower was very powerful and got nice and hot. Towels, toiletries and hairdryer all included. Our hairdryer broke on the first use but it was replaced immediately on calling reception. The breakfast again was very basic but adequate and kept us full until lunchtime each day for no additional cost - bagels and toast with cream cheese, yoghurts, donuts, boiled eggs, oatmeal pots and tea, coffee and orange juice. I wouldn't recommend the coffee! Finally, all of the staff were exceptionally friendly.We would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable place to sleep during your stay in New York in an extremely central location. This is not a hotel for anyone looking for somewhere fancy to spend the night and eat breakfast or anyone looking to spend a lot of time in the hotel. However, for our needs it was perfect and we would absolutely stay again!

My husband & I stayed for 4nights. The room is very small & nothing fancy but you can't beat the location for the price. Breakfast was reasonable. All the staff were lovely, friendly & welcoming. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

A hotel with a great location, one step away from Times Square. But the rooms are small (with large beds though) and no view. The people who work there are very very kind. The worst thing is the breakfast. This is not a breakfast guys, not even close to breakfast . About 150$ the night, you are paying the location.

Great location only metres from Times Square. Small rooms, but to be expected in New York. Friendly staff. Rooms pretty sound proof and very clean.Breakfast is basic. There appears to be no kitchen, so bought Donuts and pastries are offered along with hard boiled eggs, toast, yoghurt, cornflakes and apples or bananas. Adequate but got a bit boring after six days. Rooms at the front of the hotel can be very noisy. Sounds like the people on the street are in your room. You got used to it though. The other room was at the back and had no noise at all.

We stopped here for New Years. Just off Times square (no more that a 30 second walk) we were placed right in the middle of everything without the huge expense of higher end hotels. The room was great, the staff were incredibly helpful' even assisting in getting us across Times Square when it was closed off. We have visited New York many times and would recommend this hotel as a great base to explore the Big Apple

Great Location, Very Small rooms, Absolutely NO view. Not at all what was shown on the website. View of Times Square from Hotel steps only. Alley views from room.Staff pleasant. Rooms suitable, corners with cobwebs but overall fairly clean. Elevator extremely small -- definitely not for the claustrophobic!! Breakfast filling and hot.

Great hotel and location... such a nice reprieve from the hectic buzz of the city. Clean... friendly staff... loved it will stay here in the future!! Great decor... breakfast is marginal at best... more healthy options would be appreciated... with that being said... breakfast!! Who can beat that?

I did a ton of research on hotels as I was travelling with my teenage daughter for her first trip to NYC and what a perfect location to stay! Right in the middle of times square and walking distance to the subway, the theater district, radio city music hall and Rockefeller plaza! Being two ladies alone in the city, I felt totally safe and had no issues whatsoever. The staff was very helpful and the continental breakfast was a welcome treat. How many hotels have FREE breakfasts in NYC!? We even took a piece of fruit to go for a snack. I noted on the reviews that a few complained about the size of the rooms, but I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of space we had. The bed was so comfy! Seriously, I hate hotel beds, and my daughter and I agreed that this was the best hotel bed we've ever slept in, a queen size which was great with very nice pillows too. Everything was clean and neat in the room. We also kept our bags in the baggage room upon checkout while we went out for a few hours before leaving. Again, felt very safe doing this and it was free!I guess if there were any cons, it had a single small elevator/hallway, but who cares!? We never had to wait long and I actually like the smaller size hotel. I will definitely stay here again, especially with the good price. Thanks for a great stay!

First let me start off by saying that you can't beat the location of this hotel. It's literally a few steps away from Times Square and very near to other main attractions such as Rockefeller Center, Radio City music hall and 5th Avenue shopping. The location is excellent. Also once inside it's quiet and you don't hear the noise of Times Square.The hotel is very modern, the lobby is quite attractive. The room was nice, well appointed, clean and comfortable. I have no complaints about the room whatsoever. What I will say though is that the hallways are very narrow, which isn't much of a problem except for the fact that you hear other nearby guests going into and out of their rooms which at night can be a bit disruptive. We got continental breakfast included which was decent enough. It's not extensive, but the options are satisfactory. The staff are for the most part very friendly, courteous and helpful. I really enjoyed my stay here and will definitely be returning on my next trip.

To start, the location: Maybe the best feature of this hotel! Right in the heart of Times Square! Then, the room: Great bed, very good amenities and good space. Clean and organized bathroom. Third, the breakfast: It is good and diverse, but most importantly, is free. And finally, the price: Considering its really good features, it's beyond fair. Definitely a great deal!

We stayed here for one night and it was a really comfortable stay. The hotel is a short two min walk from Times Square, and we had breakfast included which I like. Breakfast was fine to start you off in the morning, nothing really exciting, but ok. The rooms are quite small and we had a view of a brick wall, but it was comfortable beds and quiet. The metro is only about 5 min away, Rockefeller center 8-10 min. I would consider staying here again if I am visiting NY.

We stayed at the hotel along with two other couples as a Christmas vacation. The hotel is convenient to Times Square, Rockefeller Center other areas in midtown Manhattan but still a very quite (if anything can be quite in Manhattan) reprieve from the hustle a bustle of the city. Staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful.

Considering how close this was to all the action of Times Square, it was very quiet once we were indoors. The rooms are small but clean. The continental breakfast was good and fresh. The service was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed one week as I had a conference at the Marriott Marquis. This hotel had an adequate breakfast starting at 6:30. Service was good, people were all friendly and helpful. The toilet started leaking on night, when I called in morning they promptly fixed it according to my wife as I was already gone for the day. Enjoyed having a small refrigerator and microwave available. The only complaint is that house keeping could have vaccuumed the room better and the carpets needed shampooing. We will hopefully stay here the next time we visit NYC.

My husband and I were lucky enough to attend his company seminar in Tarry Town, just outside New York so we took the opportunity to spend 2 nights prior to the weekend in this great hotel. Brilliant location, amazing value for money, room had all the facilities required with the added bonus of a fridge and microwave too. It was very clean too with a good sized bathroom. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us, especially Ivonne, Antonio and Anthony. Breakfast was included and was a great choice and a good variety. We will definitely stay here again.

This place is awesome. Location location location. you are 1 block off Broadway. Great location. The staff on arrival were smiling and happy to welcome you. The rooms are small but who spends time in their rooms when you go to NYC. SUPER CLEAN and the housekeeping staff this past week for the 7th floor was absolutely awesome. She was sweet and pleasant and did a superb job. The free breakfast just adds to the benefits of this place too. And the breakfast attendant ALWAYS had a nice friendly word to say to everyone.

We booked a last minute weekend away to visit NYC at Christmas time. Our normal brand name hotels were all priced very high. After reading the reviews of other travelers we booked Broadway @ Times Square and are so happy we did! The hotel was exceptionally clean and the two gentleman at the front were so kind. We were able to check in early on a Saturday, a huge plus! While we did not drive I did hear them mention they accommodate travelers with vehicles. We would absolutely book at this great place again, thank you!

Good hotel in the heart of NYC...short walk to Times Square and the subway...room was clean, but a bit on the small side. Staff was friendly, and the breakfast was very good. Honestly its on par with a Holiday Inn...and it can be pricey...but for the location you can't beat it.

Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband to do some sight seeing and Christmas shopping. The location is second to none right off Times Square. We got a warm welcome and check in was smooth. The room was small but clean and had everything we needed. There was a buffet continental breakfast which was lovely and a welcome surprise as this is unusual in New York. We would definitely stay here again.

With the prices in NY, I have to consider the location and make my judgment off that. This place is expensive with a super small room and bathroom. But it's comparable to the location. LOCATION is the one reason you should stay here as it's right in the heart of everything. Also the front desk agent and the gentlemen who brought my bag to the room were extremely nice and truly cared about customer service. If your looking for a place to lay your head and to be walking distance from the action, this place is for you.

The hotel was clean and quiet even though it was right in times square. The location is fabulous. The staff were so helpful and nice. We were able to get parking validation to save money on parking garage and could leave bags after checkout so we could go get lunch.

Stayed here in June for a few nights with two friends. Room was clean and nice with a good bathroom and the breakfast buffet was AMAZING! So delicious. Location is unbelievable - right next to Times Square so we walked almost everywhere. Room was quite small, but it was lovely and felt very safe and quite quiet for the location. The staff were INCREDIBLE! So friendly and kind (always remembered our faces, helped us find our way, made lots of recommendations and booked our taxi back to JFK for us). Would definitely stay again.

Just steps from hotel, we got glimpses of the big parade. Like others, we found the room small, facing a brick wall, but the bed was comfortable and small shower adequate. Facade could be better marked and updated, but lobby, breakfast area, and room were updated. Breakfast choices pretty good, except for those horrible tasting boiled eggs. Front desk morning staff were very helpful--bellman even taking our luggage half a block to get a taxi they were kind enough to arrange. Night staff fella not so friendly. All in all, I'd recommend if you want a great location at a reasonable price.

I used to stay at the Holiday Inn express. But no more. this hotel has cheaper rates and is a nicer hotel. The rooms are bigger and has much nicer public spaces and a friendly staff. One block from Times Square but suppressing quiet . Choose 9th floor for a quite room . Really nice selection of continental breakfast items. and a quiet heater in the room.

I was looking to book one night near Time Square for our family. I wanted a hotel that wasn't to pricey and be right in the heart of it hmm tough for NYC. Then I found the Broadway at Time Square which I need to point out is an eco-friendly hotel. I got a unbelieveable price. Parking garage right across the street  $24 for 24hrs with the hotels validation I think check hotel website. It's literally a half a block from heart of Times Square!! The hotel sign is fairly small but my husband spotted it. Parked our car check-in was at 3pm we arrived early. I suggest to have hotel hold your bags we didn't took a bit for garage to get our bags cars are stacked and hard to get to. Front of hotel looks like a brownstone it's a nice small hotel I felt it was homey for a hotel. Nice clean modern. Check-in went well very friendly staff. A few reviews on here said elevator was too small and slow we fit myself I am average my husband who is 6'2" 240lbs (football player build)  a teenage boy and our 10 year olds and bags we were fine who cares if it's slow you're on a getaway/vacation I need to point this out sorry. The halls were a bit small but from what I read most of NYC hotels are and same with the rooms. We were on the 3rd floor. We faced the building next door think apartments. Not too noisy at night considering Time Square was around the corner. If it's for some remember where you are new york the city that never sleeps. We live in the suburbs. We all fit perfect! Room was really nice!! all the amenities nicely decorated. Bathroom nice all was clean. No fridge. The usual hotel coffee pot. I love the soap dispensers at sink and shower (i will include pics) very eco-friendly. The pillows were the absolute best so comfortable. I should have asked about them. I still might.  2 queen beds very comfy. We fit in the room just fine. We love hotel rooms this was the best by far. We will be back!! Wouldn't stay anywhere else. One more thing no food service just breakfast. I assume they bring it in. We were eating all our meals out anyway. They do have coffee and some small snacks and fruit. Thanks for the great hospitality!!

This is a quaint hotel set just off Broadway with a Parking garage just across the street. Our room was small but doable. Breakfast was high in carbs with pancakes, waffles, donuts, bagels, fresh fruit and hard boiled eggs. Would recommend this hotel for anyone needing to be close to any of the theaters.

This hotel is half a block from Times Square . The rooms are small but updated and very clean. Staff helped with parking , so we could get a discount. Gave us maps and helped us find our way around.Did have a free breakfast.

Finding an affordable hotel in the Theater District that includes all the amenities you would expect to find in any hotel outside of the city proved to be quite a challenge! We looked at over 50 different hotels and not one them offered free breakfast, free wi-fi, two beds and a price that we could afford for a week long vacation. Until we found this one. My sister and I were both very impressed with this hotel. All members of the staff were friendly, courteous and ready to assist us with anything we needed during our stay. The free confidential breakfast did not skimp on options and included fresh donuts, cereal, waffles, yogurt, fruit and a variety of other choices.The double room itself was a bit on the small side - for example, if someone is sitting at the desk, there is no room to walk in front of the beds to get to the bathroom. But, we weren't in the room very much and since we are both young, we could just climb over the beds. But, it is something to note for people with physical limitations. The room was clean, the beds were very comfortable, and the most pleasant surprise of all - the room was very quiet, even on the second floor. We stayed there for a week and I never heard so much as a single siren from outside, despite being less than a block away from Times Square. Indeed, the only sound the permeated the room was the sound of church bells from the late-1800s church next door, which was actually quite nice. If I wasn't already up when they were ringing, they did not wake me. The sound of other doors slamming was pretty loud, but there was almost none of that after 11:00 PM or so. This may seem silly, but my favorite thing was the window-seat style window frame in the bathroom. When space is limited, having that extra shelf to place things on, such as a change of clothes when showering, was a real life saver. Wi-Fi was free, fast and easy to use. No problems at all. And finally location. The location of this hotel could not be better, especially if you're a Broadway lover me. As I already mentioned, the hotel is less than a block away from Times Square and as such, all the major Broadway theaters are a ten minute walk or less. We were able to see a show every night we were in the city because our close proximity to the theater box offices allowed us to be there when they opened in the morning. All the must-see sights of mid-town Manhattan are easily within walking distance and those that are downtown or uptown can be quickly reached by subway.The official pictures of the hotel are accurate. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation. It was an all around excellent experience.

so we originally planned to be outside the perimeter of Broadway, since we'd love to walk the streets going to Broadway shows. With injuring her knee, we decided to find a hotel centrally located right by the shows. We had no expectations except that we would be close in this hotel, but this hotel and it's staff surpassed all of our desires. we got there early before check-in and we stayed late after check out and the people at the desk could not have been friendlier as they watched our luggage. Referred restaurants, and gave us directions to our next destination. The room was small but clean and had everything someone really need as we ventured out to Broadway. after four Broadway shows three meals in 36 hours this was a great place to stay

We arrived after check in around 700pm and they were very accommodating to us . our room was comfortable and clean. They include a continental breakfast which included waffles, pancakes, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, apples, oranges bananas, muffins bagels, cereal, milk juice coffee and tea. was enough to satisfy you and start your day!!We drove and there was a parking garage across the street for $26 a day, with validation from the hotel that we stayed there.This location is one block from times square! perfect Location!

We chose this property for the location since we were on a theatre marathon. It is very clean, comfortable and best of all the staff was outstanding. The front desk clerks and bellman were beyond helpful answering questions and going out of their way to get us what we needed. The rooms are small and quaint, but didn't spend much time in it. The most comfortable queen bed ever in NYC. It's hard to find that at a good rate in midtown. There is a breakfast area with coffee and tea during off hours. We didn't have time for the breakfast but looked adequate. There is a space to store luggage if your room is not ready or after we checked out. I felt very safe at this hotel. That is always an added bonus.

Good night's rest , very comfortable beds clean rooms, but small with a family of four. The decor in the lobby and rooms was very nice and updated. The location was perfact , within walking distance to Times Square. Breakfast was the only letdown, underwhelming unfortunately.

Its location, location and location for this hotel. You walk out and you are at Times Square! I stayed for 2 nights. The rooms are average - equivalent of a 3 star property. Breakfast was complimentary - while the selection was not grand, it was good to go every morning!

This small hotel has what it takes for a restful night in the middle of Manhattan action. Nothing fancy. Needed are a room with a comfortable bed, a warm shower, quiet location and a bag check. (The latter is super important for weekend visitors.) On our second visit, we found all these items in good order. Of some worry is the single stairway which serves as a fire escape; it should be ok if all the fire doors were kept shut. Breakfast facility seems to be offering improved fare relative to our last visit.

This is close to everything in times square. The hotel was clean and comfortable and well kept. The staff at the front desk were helpful and answered any questions. They offer great rates, I would not hesitate to stay there again.

We spent the weekend in NYC, and planning on doing a lot in the theater district, we chose the Broadway @ Times Square hotel for its price and location. We are so glad we did. This hotel is located right off of the main drag, so convenient to get to almost any theater. There are several restaurants and bars with live music very close by. The hotel itself is very clean, beautifully decorated and safe. We stayed on the 9th floor, so it was very quiet as well. The room was small, but very well arranged, giving us a very nice living space. Love having a microwave and fridge and free wifi. Really liked the soap dispenser by the sink and in the shower - very eco friendly. Plenty of hot water in the shower. The king sized bed was very comfortable. The in room safe was big enough to put two laptop computers in. Nice free breakfast - lots of doughnuts and muffins. The front desk staff were very friendly and professional. Jovannie was helpful when we checked out. Don't be fooled by the lower price (in comparison to other hotels in the area). This is not a "cheap" hotel. This is a great place to stay when visiting the theater district. Highly recommend !!

Broadway @ Times Square is a real find. If you are a theater goer, it is right outside of Times Square, and a quick walk to any theater in the area. The lobby is modern, colorful, and welcoming, with two computers for guests, a couple of sitting areas, and a large breakfast room. The staff was friendly and helpful. Jovannie, one of the desk staff, was particularly helpful. The breakfasts are free, with pancakes, pastries, fresh fruit, and a few other choices. There is a fitness room with a treadmill, stationary bike, and elliptical machine. The rooms vary. Some have showers, some tubs. Some face another building, while the two rooms in the front, the “01” and “02” rooms are larger, with views of 46th Street, and small fridges and microwave ovens. For me, it was worth the $20 extra for those amenities. For midtown Manhattan, the rates were reasonable, even though it has a “boutique” feeling, with only a few rooms on each floor. If you are a senior, you will get a discounted rate. I loved this hotel and have already made reservations to return!

I returned last week from a one night stay at this hotel post cruise.I had stayed at their sister hotel further along 46th Street the last time & really liked it so thought I'd give this one a try.The amenities, price & locations are what draw me to this chain, The wifi was really fast (40+mbps) & free! The breakfast was great & the room charming. The location just 1/2 block from Times Square. I walked from the port dragging my 47 lb bag behind me the 9/10 mile it was. Upon arrival at the hotel around 11:00am I was surprised & happy to have my room available, room 800 a very quiet room with no view.I really enjoyed my stay there & would return if ever back in the Big Apple.

This is a small boutique type hotel near Broadway. The room was comfortable and of adequate size considering I don't spend a lot of time in a hotel room. There was a decent breakfast available. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. I would stay here again.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this property. It is a budget hotel that offers good value in comparison to other properties. The standouts are the location and the Front Desk staff, who are ALL outstanding. Rooms are small but clean, comfortable and presentable. Rooms in the back of the hotel are quiet, though the slamming doors of the other guests was a bit annoying. Only negatives are the breakfast which was not fresh(i.e. inedible hot food/stale coffee and stale bread) and the bellmen who would store your luggage no problem but would not assist you with it but of course expected their tip. Would stay again without hesitation. Recommend to book early.

First time in New York (first time in America!) and obviously this place can't be beaten for location as Times Square is on your doorstep (well, give or take 200m). Room on third floor managed to not be too loud at night either which was great! Rooms were on the small side with not floor space at all but the beds were comfy and bathroom was a good quality. Breakfast had a lot of different options and no limit on how much you had. Staff at reception, breakfast, and cleaning staff were all enormously helpful and friendly, ready with advice and directions. The staff at reception booked our transfer to the airport for us and were more than happy to give us lunch recommendations each day. Had a brilliant stay would go again!

We only stayed in this hotel for a night, but it was a very easy check in and check out. It was also only half a block from Times Square, and somehow, the room was always quiet when we were there.It's decently clean, but for the price you get for this location, I expected much worse. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the service was extremely helpful with any issues we had.Would recommend this hotel as a good value hotel in a fantastic location.

Functional hotel, no frills, old rooms but adequate, basic shower bathroom, literally no room to put down suitcase the room was so small. Noisy at night as no sound proofing to corridor. Polite front desk. Self service breakfast.

Decided that we needed to visit our son in NYC. We like to stay at Broadway at Times Square because it's centrally located, but also very clean and reasonable. We arrive early to the hotel around 10:30am and as you know check in is usually 3pm. They were very accommodating and had rooms for my in-laws and my wife and myself within 15 minutes. The rooms are small, but very clean and modern. The staff are friendly, organized, and professional. The will hold your baggage if you want them to. The gentleman who was on duty could speak about six languages. Not fluent, but enough to communicate. You get a free breakfast with the price of the room. Nothing spectacular, but very good. Enough to accommodate most people. I would definitely recommend Broadway at Times Square to anyone. The price for one night for a queen size bed was $296 including tax. Again, well worth it. The hotel is located close to the subway so you don't need to pay for a taxi. I believe the hotel has transportation to the airport. We will be staying there in the future. My son graduates in May.

Came for a visit to our grandson and stayed at this neat spot recommended by our daughter & son-in-law who stayed previously. Clean, with a great bonus breakfast self-serve style with many selections. All freshly made items--delicious. We arrived early and were able to check in thanks to Jovannie's kind assistance. He was very helpful and friendly as was the doorman (did not get his name.) When we make another trip to NYC, we will be staying here. Location is 1/2 block in from Times Square.

we stayed at this hotel for four nights and what can I say the entire stay was fantastic. The hotel is 2 minutes from times square and subway stations, such a prime location for the price. The hotel staff were so friendly and the guy who runs the breakfast buffet is so welcoming.The room we had was a queen sized bed which was very comfortable and quiet and very well maintained and nice and warm after chilly days out around town. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again if I was in New York. Just perfect!

This New York hotel is in a great area within walking distance of Times Square and other attractions. Rooms are small as is typical of NYC. What stood out for us was the friendly and helpful staff. Jovannie at the front desk was especially patient and accommodating. If you drive, ask about the special relationship the hotel has with a parking garage across the street. It will save you $$!

Booked this hotel back in February 2016 on booking.com using my credit card card at that time everything was fine. Had not had any further contact with with them but was sent an email two days before our check in on the 7th oct asking for an updated credit card as the card date had expired unfortunately as we were travelling so we did not receive it, so when we arrived at the hotel @ 10pm 7th oct we were informed our room had been cancelled when we asked why they said they were unable to do a credit check although payment was not due until our arrival. This was a very distressing experience but they did manage to find us a room at their sister hotel as they were fully booked so be aware if you book

Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of October. Great location yet a quiet hotel! So close to Times square, a number of subway options, restaurants and attractions. Room was clean, great having a fridge, size was small but adequate for the 2 of us. Lift can be slow but we seemed to time of use of lift at the right times! All staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again, thanks for a great stay!

Just a corner away from Times square, this hotel was very good. Friendly helpful staff, clean rooms fitted with all the necessities. Breakfast was nothing spectecular, but it was sufficient. The guy manning the breakfast room was very helpful too! Highly recommended!

I really enjoyed the quaintness of the rooms the cleanliness. The front counter staff, Ivonne and Sidini were extremely helpful in getting us to thr attractions. The hotel is convientally located to all the attractions in Times Square.

The location is the real selling point for this hotel as it is seconds from Times Sq and all the action of Mid Town with a reasonable price for the convenience. Hotel itself was fine. Rooms were a little dated and we stayed on the 2nd floor meaning we faced a brick wall and had no natural light in the room, which was a bit annoying and cave like but not a deal breaker. We were out early in the morning as so much to do and by the time you get in you just go asleep as your that tired so a fancier hotel would have been a waste. Breakfast was good, decent enough options and convenient. Its great being able to just nip to times square/Rockefeller etc of a night as you are so close so its no great effort.

Jovannie, also the 2 young gentlemen & the 2 young lovely ladies that work the reception desk are very friendly & helpful. They all made you feel so welcomed. Sidbid who handles the luggage was so nice & professional too.The rooms were very clean thanks to Maria from housekeeping. The breakfast was a great way to start our day & Antoni who works the breakfast area went out of his way to accommodate you in any way he could. Everyone at this hotel were outstanding in all our needs or questions. Close to Times Square which we enjoyed so much. That was a plus with location only a half block away. Definitely would recommend this hotel. Miss seeing the 2 young ladies cuz they always greeted you with a warm smile anytime we saw them including all the young gentlemen too. Thanks to everyone who works for the Broadway@Times Square for a great fun vacation & a lot of good memories.

I've stayed at this hotel several times when just in New York for a day or two with the main goal of going to the theater. It's very convenient for that due to its location, and is only one block from the subway lines that go down to Herald Square (a couple blocks from Penn Station, I arrive/go by train). The rooms have comfortable beds, are clean and well-equipped. I always ask for a room that does NOT look over the street for quiet reasons, and one away from the elevator although that tip is true for any hotel. This hotel is considerate in that they have door closers on the doors leading to the elevator foyer, unlike many hotels where they can slam. The front desk staff is polite and helpful. I don't eat breakfast so have no opinion and don't care about that. They have a coffeemaker in the room. The rooms are small, of course, but I've had smaller in the budget category (like the Paramount nearby). This hotel has extremely reasonable rates compared to any nearby hotel that I know of, sometimes by hundreds of dollars (not usually that bad, but recently I was there over Columbus Day weekend and nearby moderate hotels were charging $500 or more a night for some reason I couldn't figure and this hotel was less than $300). It's easy to walk to decent restaurants in hell's kitchen or west of Broadway. Of course it is a total zoo right around Times Square itself, I would never stay here if I weren't going to the theater as the crowds can be so bad you have trouble walking in the streets. It's just a good location for short theater trips and convenient subway access. YOu can walk east a few blocks to the buses that go up Madison to the museums or come down Fifth to return, also. The only thing I don't like about this hotel is the TV is set parallel to the bed due to the room configuration of walls/windows, which makes it difficult to watch TV easily. I don't know why they didn't just put the flat screen on the wall in front of the bed, which could solve that problem. It's currently on a stand on a piece of furniture.

This little destination is tucked away on 46th Street and is a gem for location to Times Square, Broadway, and many other places to visit. We even walked from Penn Station but wouldn't recommend that unless you're used to walking. We enjoyed their free breakfast every morning before heading out to sight see. There wasn't a great view from the 2nd story, and the rooms are small, however, we didn't stay in the room long enough for that to matter.

This hotel is a minute walk from Times Square so the location is pretty central for tourism. I shared a queen bed with a friend and while we didn't mind the smaller size of the room (quite typical for NY) the bathroom smelled VERY strongly of ammonia. I've only once before had this issue with a hotel but it was pretty bad here. My friend and I would essentially just perfume the bathroom prior to every use. Other than that, staff was nice and the room itself was clean.

Stayed here for a week in early September, with friends, for a trip to New York. Not the grandest hotel but certainly one of the friendliest and most convenient we've ever stayed in. No more than a few minutes walk from Times Square, 3 bars opposite and 2 more almost next door, what's not to like! Rooms were not huge but perfectly adequate with decent sized bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable. The continental breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day with no restrictions on coffee and toast (or donuts or bagels - or anything!). Staff were always very friendly and willing to give any advice needed. Giovanni in Reception and Antoni in the breakfast room in particular always had a smile and cheerful chat. This location meant that many places were within walking distance, such as Central Park, MoMA and Top of The Rock. The subway stations are within an easy walk and there are always cabs around Times Square. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

If you want to be in the middle of mid-town and not pay a fortune - this is a great option. Still rather spend-y (with tax my total came to $290/night), but considering the other options in the area, this isn't so bad. The breakfast options are only so-so, but the staff was very competent and helpful. They have a baggage area to store your things before/after check out. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. We stayed on an upper floor, and didn't have any problem with the noise.

It's not easy to find a clean, well-located hotel in NYC for $100. With help from Kayak and Trip Advisor, I stumbled on a last minute deal at this hotel. For the money, it was excellent. For $200, it probably isn't worth it.....but New York hotel prices are a bit insane (normally we stay in New Jersey and commute over). But this property is old, but well maintained and it worked out fine.

The front desk staff were very assistive. The rooms were tiny, ours had two queens, but was very, very tight. Is there were 4 people in the room, it would have been really rough. Rooms were decorated nicely, linens were good. The cleanliness was pretty good, but not superior. I saw a vacuum in the room when the maid came by, but my feet felt the same pebbles, etc. the bathroom door is frosted, and it appears to be months since anyone cleaned that glass. And there were the same dark hairs in the same areas of the bathroom all four nights. My companion and I both have white and blond hair. Also the biggest thing was the air conditioner could only be operated while lying on ones stomach across the bed, and the temperature varied dramatically during the night. I don't understand why the room coffee pot had styrofoam coffee cups, but downstairs they used pressed paper, which is preferable. Two of the styrofoam cups leaked and there were big messes we had to clean. Luckily we were wearing our night clothes, so we didn't get stains on our clothes.Very nice little restaurants in the same block. Very walkable to a large number of theaters.

Overall the service is good and there's always someone at the front desk who speaks spanish which was great, for my wife only speaks italian and spanish. I found everything clean and the room was very confortable.My only complaint was the breakfast buffet. I love a salty breakfast and they only offered boiled eggs, toast & butter for that mater, so I switched to sweet every other day and it was ok ( in my case Waffles with maple syrup but they also had a vareity choice of glased donuts)

What a cracking little hotel ...room beautifully clean, fridge, coffee machine and microwave x staff really helpful and friendly breakfast included (pastries, fruit, coffee, juice, yoghurt)50 metres from times square, 50 feet from a great reasonably priced pub!! XI would definately recommend

Arrived at hotel that night after to be told that had NO ROOMs available for us and another party (who arrived soon after us.) Had a confirmed reservation thru Tripadvisor. They said found us a room at another hotel for $60 less per night. Would not offer better compensation. The substitution hotel was much lower rated and instead of the reserved King, girlfriend and I had to share a full sized bed in a room that was a closet. It was literally 8X8X8 room with a TV that didn't work. Thankfully only one night and we moved to nicer hotel elsewhere. Broadway's clerk that night (Stanley) was very nice and seemed he did his best. Unfortunately, the manager next door was not understanding and essentially felt a cheaper hotel was perfectly reasonable remedy to this situation. Very unfortunate. If one can't rely on a confirmed reservation ....

Pros:Location Location Location - at times square. A few minutes walk to the metroBreakfast included in the price (although the food is very basic)Free computer access at the lobby, free use of the printer (comes handy when needing to print out boarding pass)Front desk pretty friendlyCons:A bit hard to find because of the small front entry

I stayed here for two nights in September. The hotel is RIGHT off from Times Square, and a short walk to everything else. The staff was absolutely wonderful, happy to answer questions and give suggestions. Everything in the room worked quite well, from the coffee maker to the shower head. The bed was AMAZING. Elevators worked perfectly for me. The room was very clean and you couldn't hear the noise of Times Square from the room (although you could hear it in the bathroom, weird).Definitely a hotel for those who want to do a quick turnaround trip for a good price. It really was just STEPS to Times Square and to various Subway stops.

Great location strides away from Times Square - no noise in room. King Deluxe room in need of modernisation of both decor and furniture, that said, bed comfy/linens & towels spotless. Coffee maker in room, also good hair dryer and safety deposit box. Reception staff friendly and helpful. Great buffet style continental breakfast. Tea/coffee/ice available 24/7. Value for money.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: Pros: Location is great. Bathroom was really nice. We stayed in a room with a king size bed. Bed was wonderful.Cons: Elevators are a bit slow. For my standars, the breakfast was weak but hey you get what you pay for.Overall evaluation: I would definitely book this hotel again.

If you're looking for a place that's close to Times Square and font want to spend a fortune...this is the place for you. It's literally steps away from Times Square and a nice hotel. Even though it's so close to Times Square my room was very quiet and did not have any issues with noise. Beds were very comfortable, although the rooms are a little dated. The rooms are small but it's NYC so that's not surprising. Breakfast was ok...they had a choice of waffles and pancakes both of which I found dry. They had toast and pastries and a choice of two cereals. It was handy but wasn't amazing. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and always welcomed me with a smile. Johvanni ordered me up a shuttle to the airport and let me keep my room an extra hour while I waited. I would stay here again if I'm ever back in NYC. Thanks Broadway at Times Square for a nice stay.

We had a great stay at Broadway at Times Square Hotel. The location is excellent as it is only around the corner from Times Square and is in the heart of the theater district. The staff was extremely helpful with things like directions, suggestions and storing our luggage after checkout. There are a few pubs right across the street (2 Irish, 1 English) and a 24 hour convenience store. The rooms were a little small but adequate and we didn't come to NYC to sit in our room.

Although it's right at Times Square it's far enough so you have no problem with noise.Very nice room with all the amenities. Small fridge, microwave and most important a comfortable bed. The continental breakfast is great. Staff was extremely friendly.Will definitely be a repeat customer

The Broadway at Time Square is garden-variety tourist hotel in the heart of Times Square. Check-in was quick and smooth; the lobby has two generously-sized seating areas and the 'business center' consists of two desktop computers in a corner of the lobby. There is just one elevator to serve the hotel's 9 floors but the waiting times weren't too bad. The 'fitness center' is a very small room with a couple of treadmills and elliptical trainers - no weights or other fitness equipment. If you want a decent workout you can buy a day pass for $10 to the fitness center at the Sheraton a few blocks uptown. Continental breakfast is included although I didn't take advantage of it so can't comment on the offerings or quality. The room itself is tiny, but not out of the ordinary by NYC standards for a 2- to 3-star hotel. Cleanliness was good overall but my one complaint is that the carpets were filthy and in dire need of a deep shampooing - bring flip-flops or keep your socks on! Despite a few minor shortcomings I'd stay here again and recommend it to others - during the week of the US Open I paid a rate of just $150 per night and it just doesn't get better than that in the Times Square area.

The place was difficult to find and no-one seemed to have heard of it! The lobby and reception aren't particularly welcoming, it is a very old and tired place and my room certainly didn't look anything like the on-line pictures. The water from both taps in the bathroom came out hot.There was a safe in the room but it only seemed to work by using a credit card. The breakfast was very poor, mostly bread of various kinds and too sweet cakes and pastries. There were cereals, eaten out of cardboard bowls, drinks from paper cups, everything disposable. On the plus side the bed was reasonably comfortable, there was an empty fridge and microwave which would be useful if staying a few days, and free WiFi. The location is actually fine.

. My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights, we got there like at 12 and they allowed us to check in, even though it is not until 3 pm. The room was quite small but you don't go to new york to stay on the hotel so that wasn't a problem at all. Ask for a higher level room so the noise doesn't bother u. The hotel is located in a perfect place. You get out of the hotel turn right and you are already at the heart of Times Square. 15 min walk to central park. They have breakfast included, which is very good and very convenient. They have a variety of stuff like pancakes, waffles, eggs, bagels, donuts, butter and cream cheese for the bread. They also have yogurt milk juice coffee tea , bananas apple. I loved it, plus you don't need to spend more money on breakfast cuz its already included. They have computers wifi and printers, we had to print out boarding pass and we used their printer. Also, for the check out you can leave your luggage with them, they have a little room where they put them and they give you a little card for each bag so they know which one is yours. Which is awesome because you don't have to be walking around the city with your stuff. That way you can enjoy your last hours in NY. The only thing I didn't like was last day, the guy that was in charge of the luggage room, he was nice at first but at the end he was kind of telling us stupids for using uber. He said that "in NY you don't do Uber, because of the traffic " idk how am I supposed to get to the airport, I think he said that because they can call someone to pick you up if you want to, I guess they get commission for it and he was upset cuz we used uber instead. But anyways I will definitely go back to that hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.

Perfect place to stay . It is clean and cosy . Affordable place with friendly staff. I requested to check in early . Front desk manager let me in at 13:00 pm . Safe neighborhood . I am in hospitality business. I didn't find anything negative . The price and location matched perfectly. If you are looking for luxury nice place . You should not stay here . Rooms are a little small. Instead of staying in no AC dirty hostel . It is better to stay here .

It was comfortable. Staff were friendly, great location for Times Square.Only gripe was that the breakfast room was far to well lit. Bedrooms were a little on the dark side, but that's what you get for New York. It's the closest to a premier inn you'll get in New York.

We have stayed at this hotel about 5 or 6 times and were always very satisfied. Our kingsize room had everything we needed and all the staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was very good for a continental breakfast offering much more than the usual fare.

Overall, I'd describe our 4 night experience at the Broadway at Times Square hotel as accommodating and helpful. Our reservation was booked through applecorehotels and when we arrived many hours prior to check-in (7:30am), without asking, the manager was happy to hold our luggage until our room was ready, and offered us breakfast (although we technically weren't guests yet)! The breakfast host was friendly and did a good job keeping items stocked. Breakfast included yogurt, muffins, pancakes, waffles, boiled eggs, donuts, oatmeal, tea, juice and coffee... no meat.Since the hotel was able to hold our luggage, this allowed us time to get an early start wandering the city. The subway we used most often 49th/7th was fairly easy to get to. We decided to take the train down to Staten Island to see Lady Liberty. By the time we took the ferry, stopped at the 9/11 memorial, and back to Midtown to shop at the Lego store, our room was ready by Noon... still hours earlier than expected!Upon check-in, I was able to get an additional discount using my AAA card!Our room was on the 5th floor, the doorman handled our belongings and the elevators were fairly quick. Our Deluxe King room was just spacious enough for the two of us. In room 507 there is no view, but it was quiet. Comfy bedding, coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator were the best features of the room, imo. The 2nd night I asked to change rooms and management was happy to oblige without question and moved us to room 907. Same layout, corner room, different view. We could see a bit of Times Square, the steeple of the church next door and the rooftop of a bar/restaurant. In addition, the price of the Deluxe King had gone down on their website, and I was able to take advantage of the discount. The room(s) ended up being $30-$60 per night cheaper than when I initially made my reservation. Winning!There is a 24 hour deli/grill/grocery right across the street from the hotel called Cafe Abbondanza and they have fresh foods, some grocery, and yummy made to order items that are reasonably priced. There is also seating upstairs. We shopped items for our fridge there and also at a Food Emporium on 8th. Upon check-out, the front desk was able to arrange car service to LaGuardia for a flat cash fee of $50. I think Uber would've been a little cheaper, but I didn't have a problem using their car service.Yes, I would definitely stay at this hotel again (only) if I wanted to be in the heart of it all and have a decent place to lay my head.

Finding a reasonably priced, comfortable, clean hotel with friendly staff right in the midst of the theater district is no small feat, but the Broadway at Times Square hotel delivered on all counts! I was a little concerned when I saw it was so moderately priced but am happy to say that we totally enjoyed our one night stay there. They have parking arrangements with a garage conveniently located just across the street at a discounted price so take advantage if you are driving in. I mistakenly noted only 1 guest on my reservation and the nice fellow at the desk only charged me an extra $15 instead of the usual $30 for having a second guest in the room (figured that was better than having my husband sleep in the lobby). The hotel is not opulent by any means but our room on the second floor, although lacking any view, was quiet, clean and had a nice comfortable bed. We also had a room safe in the closet, a mini fridge and microwave. Staff was friendly and although the continental breakfast they served was not spectacular, the bagels were nice and fresh and the coffee was very good. We have stayed in numerous hotels in the Times Square area over the years and have paid $100 more for a room but this hotel has been updated and was perfectly adequate for a night (or few) in the city. The location can't be beat...stone's throw from all the theaters, restaurants and bars and when you get right down to it, how much time do you really spend in your hotel room anyway!?

We stayed two nights on a quick couples trip to New York to catch a Broadway play and enjoy the city. This hotel was as close to perfectly located as possible. Less than half a block to Times Square and 4 blocks to the 42nd street subway so we could be anywhere in the city in minutes. It was a block away from the the theatres and close to food, shopping and the myriad of "entertainment" that is Times Square at night. The rooms are small but clean and the bed is comfortable. If you're looking for a large room, go spend $500/night elsewhere but if you're looking for a "home base" that's in a great location where you can get a good nights rest, this is your hotel.

The hotel is situated right on Times Square, close to all the Broadway theaters and a centrally located subway with easy access to all parts of town. The facility is clean and modernly furnished. The rooms are really small, but probably pretty typical for New York. The breakfast was decent, although the options rather limited. Overall, a great place to stay.

The Broadway at Times Square Hotel is a good spot for anyone looking for a convenient and very reasonable hotel room ($158 total) as a base to sightseeing in NYC. It is one block away from Times Square and a short walk to many theaters. It was very clean and service was prompt. The complimentary breakfast was a nice addition. Mostly pastries, fruit, yogurt and coffee. More than adequate for my family's needs. The only downside was that the elevator got stuck at one point and we walked to the 9th floor. An excellent workout! other than that, a great little hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Highly recommend.

First let me say the staff here is amazing!!!!! They were so helpful and know you by name. The room was small but very clean. Perfect for a place to sleep and shower. The location is perfect. Close but just far enough away. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!!

Hotel was very easy to reach from the airport and next to time square. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Overall the room was clean, except for a bandage floating in the toilet when we arrived. The bathtub didn't work and at night we heard a lot of music coming from outside. But not after 12pm and nothing earplugs couldn't solve.

I booked the hotel based on many positive Tripadvisor reviews and they were right! My friend was a first time visitor to NYC and I wanted her to have a memorable experience, which she did due in part to the hotel's location. It's perfect for walking to or getting the subway to all of the City's attractions. The price was surprisingly affordable, our room was clean, the continental breakfast was an added bonus, and the hotel staff is friendly and welcoming. Based on one Tripadvisor review, I requested a room on an upper floor away from the street noise of Times Square and we were immediately accommodated. This hotel is an incredible value.

Great rate for peak of summer. Location was perfect with access to Times Square, theater district, Rockefellar Center, Central Park and Bryant Park. Had a room with 2 double beds and we had a good amount of space for 4 people. Love the refillable cosmetic products (shampoo/conditioner/soap) as it is the environmentally friendly way to go to offer such amenities without damaging our earth with thousands of plastic bottles ;) We were able to check-in early which was a bonus. Only complaint was noise from roof top bar next to our room (not part of the hotel) but we recognized we were in NYC so noise is to be expected! Would stay there again for sure.

The hotel is located on 200 m from times square. The staff is very helpfull and the rooms and facilities are more then acceptable. If you want to visit NY it is 1 of the best locations, fornight out at broadway it is the top.

We went for a girls weekend. The location and price were fantastic! Walking distance to Radio City music hall, great cuban restaurant right down the street, lots of options. Staff were very friendly as well. We'd definitely stay here again!

A very nice hotel, clean & comfy and staff are very friendly and helpful. Situated within a few hundred yards are Times Square you'd be wise to hope for one of the rooms towards the back of the hotel, there are no great views from the front so nothing to lose. If you are a light sleeper the noise from The street at the front could keep you awake into the early hours. Continental Breakfast is provided, which is more than adequate and coffee is in tap 24/7.

This hotel was great. Stayed here 2 nights. The rooms are small as are most of the rooms in NYC. We did have queen beds which is unusual. Most have doubles if there are two beds. Very clean and the beds were comfortable. Great location - less than a block from Times Square. We were on the 4th floor and noise was never a problem. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our tub did not drain well the first night. Told the front desk in the morning and it was fixed when we got back later in the day. The price was much more reasonable than any of the other hotels that I checked and it includes continental breakfast. I would definitely stay here again.

Very close to times square. Discount hotel validating parking is close by, week days. You can park on the street on Sundays, if you wake up early. Breakfast is not bad. Elevator works quickly. Has an exercise room too, but no time to use it. Room is small. Do not expect views. Expensive for the size.

Stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night while up in the city for a birthday party. I paid less than $200 for a Saturday night which I thought was great. I expected a small room, which it was, but it was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were only using the room to shower and sleep so we didn't need anything fancy, just clean. Our room was ready when we arrived at 10am which I was happily surprised about. Location was great, walk outside right into Times Square, bars and restaurants right across the street along with a 24hr mini mart. I would definitely stay here again.

In general we can share the ratings and comments of previous reviews - great location, nice and friendly staff, breakfast is o.k. (even with good orange juice, eggs and yoghurt) if one accepts it is all paper/plastic plates/cups/knifes , the rooms are nice in size and clean, and one has the option of late check-out even up to 3 p.m. if one is willing to pay for it. The only problem during our stay: the noise. While it was surprisingly quiet during the weekend, it was impossible to sleep without ear plugs all other nights. The windows are single pane which give no sound insulation at all, and all night long garbage trucks were shredding demolition waste from construction and renovation work going on around. We would definitely look next time for a hotel with insulating glass windows, as five nights without sleep do not ask for a repetition (and this although we had asked in our reservation for a quiet room, while we got only a street facing room, which maybe made it worse...)

When I compared prices among hotel, this stood out as a great deal, especially considering the location. I didn't know what to expect for accomodations & servce, but we were more than pleased. Very friendly staff at check-in and the bell-man was an absolute delight. The rooms are relatively small, but fine for myself, my wife and small child. Everything was clean and functional. The wifi was one of the best I've experienced in a hotel. Breakfast included was basic but fine to get our day off to a good start. 5 minute walk to time square & broadway. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are cost-conscious and value convenient location. We slept great as the hotel is surprisingly quiet, considering it's in the heart of NYC.

This hotel is so close to Times Square. I agree with other reviewers about the friendly staff. The breakfast is a good bonus and is typical continental breakfast fare (so I'm it sure why so many others complain about it on this site). The front desk staff was very accommodating when we needed to cut our visit short.

This is definitely a no-frills location, but it was very clean, quite comfortable and the staff were very helpful and friendly. For being so close to Times Square it was surprisingly quiet. Our view from the 8th floor was a brick wall, but we were not expecting anything else! We were in town for a show and the location was absolutely perfect!! The breakfast was not fancy, but worked wonderfully for us (bagels, juice, pancakes, yogurt, fruit). Also offered free wifi and access to a printer if one needs to print boarding passes.

I paid $589 for a room for three days in June from Wednesday to Saturday. First room I was given (204) was a dungeon and they should not be charging for that room- upon request they provided 209 which was a bit better but not ok. They did check us in the morning upon arrival and thankful for that. The breakfast is not even basic by any standard. The pancakes and the waffles were frozen and you need to warn it up. The staff was friendly. I would stay in this hotel if the rooms are about $120 for New York standard. The location is awesome.

We paid only $159, so we were not expecting the fanciest hotel ever. We were pleasantly surprised by the wonderfully helpful staff. They were courteous and quick to help. They even let us extend our checkout time a bit and leave our luggage in the luggage room after we had checked out. The location was amazing- just a two minute walk to TIMES SQUARE.

10 years later still works perfectly for a visit to the Big Apple! You are just off of Times Square, which means right in the middle of everything!The rooms are small, okay, so is everywhere else, why pay extra, for somewhere else. You are in NYC, you are not in your room.Nice continental breakfast, with a man that was working hard to keep up the demand.Fitness Center, three pieces of equipment, they all work!

We spent 1 night at the hotel before heading to Long Island and coming back for 2 additional nights. The hotel is very close to Times Square which makes it extremely convenient. Our first room was on the 7th floor overlooking the adjacent church. On our 2nd visit we asked for a room on the top floor (9th) which we got. Both rooms were identical : small but clean. The best thing about them was their quietness despite the fact the hotel is so close from the noisiness of Times Square. Breakfast which comes free is excellent. I have been to half a dozen hotels when visiting NYC but this one is the best value for price paid.

A good hotel located a few meters from the famous steps in Times SquareBasic breakfast included. Nice placeThe room offers basic amenities like hair drier and cable tv. Free wifi only at the lobby but helps you save time by being disconnected from the phone a few hours.

Room small but had all the necessities expected. Very nice bathroom.Room rather noisy in evening because of proximity to bar/club.Staff very helpful at all times.Very good self service breakfast, and exceptionally friendly man on duty.

Location Location Location!! Perfect spot in Times Square and at a decent price. Very clean and everyone was very nice! Rooms are small but if you aren't planning on being in the room for very long it's perfect. Definitely would stay there again!

Stayed for three nights and it was perfect. Not luxury, for sure but made up for its simplicity in its great location just one block off of Times Square and great service. They provided a crib for baby free of charge. Breakfast was just so so- no protein except hard boiled eggs- the rest was waffles, bagels, cereal, donuts...king bed was super comfy with great pillows. Room was spotless. Everything was just what we needed for a nice stay.

The room was nice it was just very small! Great location and friendly staff! I do recommend the property! The only downside is that the window in the room was very small and very close to The next building which to me is a big fire hazard!

I had read reviews that the rooms were small. I get it...or I thought I did! We have stayed in NYC before. But this room with two double beds was SO small we couldn't roll our suitcase in the room because the foot of the bed nearly touched the desk and chair !! I called the front desk to please remove the desk! Which they did! Very happy with their service but I do not recommend this hotel if you have more than two people to a room. We had 3 the first night and then just 2 the remaining time. For us 2 it was fine but 3 and 4 would be too cramped. And my friend kept her suitcase on the half the bed and I put mine where the desk was previously!! Also...the breakfast was all carbs. Besides boiled eggs that looked sketchy. I like hot eggs and bacon and fruit. The fruit was apples and bananas. Well...we got bananas one day. No other days. Overall...I wouldn't choose this hotel again...there was also a fight in the hallway around 3am that frightened me. Screaming men n the hallway. I'm guessing security was called immediately and it was taken care of. But the walls are very thin and we could hear the man next door hacking and clearing his throat Early in the morning as well! Gross! The location is perfect for Times Square and the subway though!

If you're looking for elegance and lots of fancy amenities, this isn't the place for you. If you're looking for a fantastic location, good value, cleanliness, and a wonderfully attentive staff, here's your hotel.The hotel is located within mere blocks of all the theaters, the best restaurants, and of course Times Square. We found all the staff to be helpful and courteous. We definitely would stay here again!

This place was better than advertised. So close to Times Square, yet so quiet, clean and comfortable. Everything we were hoping for. The staff were wonderful, the continental breakfast fresh and plentiful. We were able to check in an hour early and even used their luggage storage on our last day. I've stayed in a lot of nice places and this fit the bill. Not luxury, but on the high end of 3 stars!

Perfect little hotel for a tourist. Perfect location right on times square and yet you can have a quiet night sleep, i guess it s the soundproof windows. The bed was sooooo comfortable and the room is very nice. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is okay if you re not picky; bread, pancakes, doughnuts , waffles, bagels, jams, boiled eggs, yogurts, cereals, coffee, juices and fruits.The hotel is very clean and the service is fast. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Clean rooms. Helpful staff. Close to Times Square and theaters. Breakfast available which saves time and $. Good value compared to many other hotels in the same area. Convenient, reasonably priced parking across the street.

Loved everything about this ...staff very friendly and helpful, room very comfortable and clean, location was amazing !!Great resturants very close, subway and shopping !!Parking is also available at a discount which is fantastic !!

Fantastic location just A half block away from Times Square! This hotel is a pint size, clean, and very affordable place to stay. Staff is very friendly and the free breakfast is perfect to start the day. I stayed here with my daughter and granddaughter for two nights. Although the room is small we were only in it to sleep. My go to hotel from now on.

the hotel, though is expensive, but is very conveniently located near times square and rooms are clean and well maintained. good for travellelors who want to have a decent clean hotel in vicinity of TS.

Spent one night here...location can't be beat. Half a block from Times Square. Rooms are a little small, but then again, you probably aren't here to sit in the room. Check in was easy, complimentary breakfast, and did I mention Times Square is a 1 minute walk? Found the staff pleasant and helpful. Again, this isn't the roomiest place, but if you're looking for a comfortable place to get a good night's sleep...this is it. Discounted parking just down the block is a big plus, just remember to get your ticket stamped at the hotel. And make sure you get everything you need out of the car before leaving it...they will NOT let you retrieve an item after they park it...which for us meant no camera for the WTC memorial. Hotel will also store your bags after check out to give you more time to explore.

Just came back from NYC. We expected a small room based on reviews but, felt like we were put in a closet. The room had two queen beds and a tiny bathroom. It had one window that, when you pulled the curtain back, was a wall. No refrigerator and the ice machine which was in the lobby, had very little ice. Location was perfect for Times Square. Less than a block away. Breakfast provided was cold and there as no meat. We stayed for 3 nights and paid $1000. If you don't expect much, the location may be worth it to you. We expected more ...

Great location for this small hotel with easy access to all Manhattan has to offer. It has adequate sized rooms, I expected smaller in midtown, that are very clean and updated. The free breakfast has a good selection and the staff is very helpful and friendly. We had good coverage of the free wi-fi through out the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Very friendly and helpful staff - very welcoming. Delicious continental breakfast - we didn't have to go out and pay for breakfast. Clean and tidy rooms - small, but cozy. Amazing location - just a minute walk away from Times Square. Exceptionally priced! Our favorite place to stay in NYC!!!!

Well..I was expecting a really small room since this was in midtown. It wasn't that bad. The size was ok. The location was great close to times square. The staff was friendly but overall a good experience.

Hotel was close to Times Square, very small room with no refrigerator. I have stayed in several hotels in NYC and this one was adequate for our needs. I do have to say the Sunday breakfast included the best fresh donuts I have ever had-not sure if this was special for Sunday morning or what. I enjoyed hearing the pigeons cooing outside our window. We had to open the windows because the room was very warm-quiet at night despite being so close to Times Square. The only thing that annoyed me was hearing a door slamming in the morning since our room was right next to the elevator.

This is a good hotel, not a great hotel. There are plenty of better hotels in the area, but they all cost substantially more.
