Real nice Hotel and great location-heart of NY! Yvonne was our main contact as we arrived and she was wonderful and very helpful on tour ideas, etc. She has a real nice personality and great smile. Another gentleman who wore a turban or "headpiece" was also very nice and most helpful. Sorry-I missed his name. Our baggage handler ( tall & thin") went too some lengths to get us a cab on a very busy day-much appreciated.

My fiance and I stayed here this weekend and we were amazed at the staff, room and location of this hotel! About a 1 min. walk to Time Square or a short walk to 5th Ave. We were right in the middle of it all. Surrounded by restaurants, shopping and theaters, we had a wonderful time with so much to do! The hotel was amazing...very modern, and even though the room was small, we stayed in a room with a King size bed and still had room to walk around. The room had a desk w/a chair, another chair to sit in, a dresser with a flat screen TV that could be moved around, a closet, and a full size bathroom. Breakfast was decent, with a selection of yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, several choices of cereals, oatmeal, toast, bagels, danishes, donuts, coffee, orange & apple juice, milk and tea. Staff was wonderful and very helpful. Definitely coming back!

Great location so close to Times Square and heaps of restarants. Room was comfortable yet compact. Staff very friendly and helpful while continental breakfast was more than adequate. Would stay there again.

I traveled to NYC for the second time with my partner to celebrate Christmas and New years there. The staff were very friendly and advised us very well. On NYE we wanted to go to Times Square (Literally less that 1 min walk from the hotel) but too many people gathering there since very early. We stayed in the hotel all afternoon and occasionally went down to the road which was cut off. Due to that, we saw PSY (Gangnam Style) and I can say that was the highlight of my NYE.The location was AMAZING and although the room was small, it was very clean.I honestly have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Highly recommended to anyone traveling to NYC.

We found this hotel on the internet and read all the helpful reviews which turned out to be totally accurate. Rooms are very small but also very clean. Ivonne at the front desk was awesome and so helpful and friendly! Sirus (spelling) the bell hop was incredibly cheerful as well! The continental breakfast was more than adequate with hot and cold items available. Internet and newspapers etc available in the lobby. As for cost it was one of the most reasonable I researched ($736 for two nights) but the location was within minutes of Times Square making it a very wise choice in comparison to other hotels. I wouldn't hesitate to go back again!

Best location, just half block from Times Square. Very good Breakfast, The room was confortable and the staff was very helpful. I traveled with my wife and we were just in the room at night, but the hotel seemed quite quiet which allowed us to sleep without problems

If you're looking for the perfect location this is the hotel for you! Just steps from Times Square. However, what makes this hotel so great are the employees! Jovannie Julia answered so many questions for us and booked our Hop On/Hop Off Tour of NYC. Not only did Sidibi take care of our luggage on day of departure he stood in middle of street to hail a cab for us- brave man! The rooms are nicely appointed and very clean. Continental breakfast was a plus, too. If and when we return to NYC, Broadway at Times Square will be our choice of hotels.

My boyfriend and I spent this past weekend in NYC, for a mini vacation. We booked our room about 3 weeks ago. It is truly an amazing hotel. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. The people working at the hotel were beyond friendly and helpful. They made you feel at home! I was on a medication that required it to be refrigerated and they made sure that I was taken care of. We were allowed to check in 3 hours early and then when we checked out they allowed us to store our luggage for free in their baggage claim until later that night when it was time to leave. The breakfast consisted of cereals, bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc... There was a beautiful church next door and then the heart of Times Square was literally a stone throw away. When searching for other rates, most rooms were anywhere from $500-$900 per night, we stayed for $330! I would not stay anywhere else and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!! I would love to thank the staff of this wonderful hotel for being so kind and helpful and for providing a wonderful experience for us. They made it even harder for us to leave NYC, but knowing that the Broadway @ Times Square hotel is there makes it much easier to say we will be back soon!

I booked this hotel after reading reviews posted here and comparing rates and locations. was not disappointed. we booked a room with a king size bed. the staff were very helpful and gave us a pass to avoid lines at a museum we visited. we arrived early and could have left our luggage even though our room was not ready. bed was comfy. plenty of hot water. breakfast wasn't great but was free. coffee was horrible but there was a pot in our room so we could make our own coffee or tea. parking garage right across the street. subway right around the corner. about a block from times square. would definitely stay again.

My wife and I recently spent a week at this hotel. Another hotel within the same chain was recommended to me by friends, but I found the reviews on Trip Advisor to be better for the Broadway at Times Square so booked the hotel. We were not disappointed. The hotel is clean and comfortable. We were given a decent sized room on the 9th floor. Breakfast is included. It is a continental breakfast, basic, but everything is fresh and tasty. The location of the hotel is good for those that want to be near Times Square. It is only a half block to 7th Avenue where a lot of the activity is. Most areas within Manhattan are within easy walking distance of this hotel. All staff that we met were friendly and helpful. I have to give a special mention to Giovanni at the front desk. He was the most friendly of all the staff we met. He is a true asset to this hotel. Don't hesitate in staying at this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

comparatively this hotel was terrific value. great location. wonderful staff who helped us with everything. great supplies in the room plus coffee available 24/7 which you actually need in new york. we had spent so much time looking for the right hotel in new york but we were glad we looked because we found this little gem of a hotel. we will definately stay again. the beds were do comfortable and the room was so clean. its the first time I have had complimentary breakfast in a hotel and not had to ask for something to be refilled. we would like to thank broadway hotel for a wonderful 5 days.

We stayed here for one night pre-cruise. We were on the second floor in a small (this is NYC) but comfortable room. We found the bathroom to be quite large by NYC standard. Breakfast was included with our stay with a good selection of food. The free Wifi in the room was an added bonus. The staff were very friendly and happy to answer any questions. The location was perfect - around the corner from Times Square yet very quiet. The only "con" would be the elevator. There is only one and it is very slow.

unfortunately it was a room without view so no daylight either. This was compensated by the fact that there was hardly any noise from the street. Breakfest was very basic but OK. People were friendly and always willing to answer questions and give information.

Like many have said this hotel is exactly what we needed: close to Time Square, King sized bed, reasonably priced with breakfast and free WiFi. We arrived early and were offered a room at the front which was larger or at the back which was quieter and smaller. We came prepared with our white noise machine and confidently took the street view on the second floor. The room was a good size complete with desk, chair, dresser, TV, coffee maker and King bed. The closet safe held my laptop and the bathroom was a reasonable size. Everything was crisp and clean. With the A/C and the white noise machine we weren't at all bothered by the street noise...until 4 am. That was when the garbage was picked up, by multiple companies we came to learn. Apparently owners contract nightly garbage collection. There was no sleeping through that metal on metal noise. It didn't ruin our trip and I can't say I wasn't warned but I would recommend taking a room elsewhere. I am sure the second floor was worse than other floors as well but we did enjoy the quick access with the stairs.Staff were all fabulously friendly and helpful. One other oddity is the bathroom door being made of glass. You couldn't turn on the light at night without disturbing your spouse. The homeless sleeping on the steps of the church were not an issue at all.

My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Just 1 block from Times Square, close to subway. Our room, while small, had a good sized bathroom and was very clean and recently redecorated in a modern decor. Also had complimentary breakfast and there was a good selection of food. We enjoyed our stay, would recommend it, and will definitely stay here again. Also, the price was pretty reasonable for NYC, and staff was friendly and helpful.

The hotel is located in the heart of times square very close to the the theater. Rooms very clean. Breakfast included in the rate which was excellent .Free wifi. Coffee 24 hours. Resturants very close some oh them across the street. The hotel is not too big.More over, The staff is very polite with guests. If I go to NY again I would stay in same hotel.

1/2 block from Times Square. Short walk to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, shopping & musicals. Small, but clean & fairly recently remodeled rooms. Continental breakfast. For $200+ it was in my NYC price range. Will stay here again! Never heard any street noise!

Writing this review on behalf of my mother who stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights. This was a stay for a couple in their 70's and their summary was that this is a "user friendly hotel". Very clean, somewhat dated but everything functions and in good condition. Service was excellent and everyone were helpful, nice breakfast included in price, coffee/tea/water at the lobby all day long, lobby computers with free printing, and overall good experience. But to top it all, location is amazing and the value was excellent too.Highly recommended.

Room - We ordered this hotel couple months before we got to NYC, i emailed them twice to make sure that they got our reservation and let them know that we are checking in late at night (around 11PM) becuase of our flight.When we got to the hotel, it was around 11:30PM, we were told that they have a "situation" with our room, that there is a leak in the room and they dont have any other room to give us so they sent us to spend the first night in another hotel. So we walked at night with our suitcases to another hotel. We also were told that we can come back the day after to our hotel at any time we want and the room will be ready for us. When we got back to this hotel in the morning, they said that the room is still not ready and they will hold our suitcases in the storage room meanwhile and they will transfer them to the room when it will be ready. When we came back in the evening to the hotel, our suitcases were still in the storage room. We got a king size bed as a compensation. But unfortunately in this room there was also a leak. We told them couple days after about the leak, they sent someone to fix it, it still was leaking but we ignored it.** our room was at 9 floor, window to the street but it was very quiet at night except for the constructions noise.also, there was a sign on windows in the room that says that we were not allowed to open them but after couple of nights that we slept with the windows close and woke up with headche we went to the reception and told them that its impossibe to sleep that way and they sent someone to open the windows.Food - The stayed at this hotel for 9 nights and the food was exactly the same every day.There were no cheese or bacon/pastrami. Only buns (bread), milk, egs,cereals and fruits. The buns were not fresh, i broke my knife trying to cut it.Clearance -In general it was ok but the towels were not fresh and they had some stains.

Located on 46th street just a half block from times square. Clean hotel. Small rooms, european style. Comfy but not big. Free wifi internet. Breakfast included but limited to breads and cereal. Has inroom coffee maker. I went there on business for one night and at 215 per night is sadly to say a bargain in nyc. Close to rockefeller center, broadway, times square so great location . Has a small gym workout area. my room window viewed a wall so not for the claustrophobic, haha. Staff was courteous, efficient and friendly. I would recommend this hotel

This hotel is in a great location. Our room was small, but clean and it served us well. We only stayed on night, had dinner and saw a show. The staff was courteous and the breakfast was free. They only had instant oatmeal, but it was good enough. There was a perfumey smell in the room, I think it was an attempt at air freshener. We have sensitive sinuses and it gave us a headache. Again, great location, great price. I might look for a little more luxury next time though.

We stayed on the fourth floor with a room facing the backyard. Needless to say there wasn't much to look at but it was very quiet apart from the occasional singing from the nearby church.There wasn't much light coming in to the room and a large part of the window in the bedroom was covered by an AC unit which was very close to the bed. It was uncomfortable sleeping with cold air blowing directly onto you at night. Our friends stayed in another room which had a slightly better location of the AC. The bed was very comfortable. The interior design is slightly outdated so the room did not look modern but it didn’t distract much. The bathroom was sufficient with a decent sized tub and good quality soap, shampoo and lotion.The breakfast was not exciting. There was no cooked food at all but the bread was fresh and well tasting. Fruit was in good supply. The guy working in the kitchen was working hard to keep supply. Another person who deserves a mention is the very friendly porter who was always greeting guests and was helpful at all times.There are two Apple computers with a laser printer which was quite useful since many people print out tickets etc. Just remember that any document that you download on these computers remain in the computer even after log off.Overall this is an affordable hotel by New York standards and right in the middle of the action. I can highly recommend this hotel.

The front desk housed a caring and knowledgable team. We read that the rooms were small. This is consistent with the city and hotel rates but very clean and comfortable. I've paid more at other places at Times Square and not had the super interest in our needs.

This hotel was absolutely perfect! It was in the perfect location. Just a 3 min. walk to Times Square, 6 min. walk to Rockefeller Center and a 12 min. walk to Central Park. The rooms are decent size but the furniture is rather big in the room so it makes it feel smaller. This didn't bother us (2 adults, 2 children) as we were out exploring the city and not hanging out in the hotel room. We couldn't hear the noise of the city at all in our room and the free breakfast was an added bonus. The hotel was all smoke free as well! The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. They helped us navigate around the city. The lady there was great. She gave my kids each a card that had the hotel name on it and address to put in their pocket in case they got lost, then they could show someone their card. SiDiBi, the baggage man, was the best! He was so nice to my kids. He really made my son feel great and like he had a friend. They even took a picture with him before we left. :) I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in Manhattan. The price was right for being in New York, you get free breakfast, and it is close to everything. We will definitely stay here again if we go back!

We needed a place to sleep that was clean, had breakfast and was in a great location.I couldn't have asked for a better place.The room was small, with just one queen sized bed in it, but was neat and clean and had no awful smell like many other hotels I've stayed in. The bathroom was clean also.Breakfast in the morning was delicious. There was a choice of yogurts, cereal, a variety of breads (bagels, toast etc) and sweet bakery goods as well as juice, coffee, tea and fruit.Everything was fresh and tasty and the breakfast staff were pleasant. The room was small for the amount of rooms they have in the hotel but we were never crowded and always had a place to sit and eat. No rush.The cleaning staff were incredibly friendly and polite, I had no issues with them and didn't feel like they were angry or unhappy with their positions.I will definitely be returning. This hotel is right in the middle of Times Square with several different things to do and see within walking distance. What a delight!NOTE: We did not bring a car, I know nothing about the parking but we did see a sign that said about 10$ per half hour. Then again, I wouldn't take a car to NYC even if I had to! Especially since everything is within walking distance: food, entertainment, metro, Central Park, shops.
user_location: Washington Dc, District Of Columbia, Usa

review_body: We arrived on August 5th 2013. The lady in the front desk was very friendly and exceptionally helpful. The only bad about the room we stayed in was it was very tight. It had 2 queen beds in a very small area. We did not care about that because we only came to the hotel to sleep. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom were very clean. The maids were very friendly. The breakfast area was very modern and clean. Wide variety of foods for all tastes. The coffee was really good. The location of the hotel was excellent - right in the midst of everything. The parking was $26 across the street. The staff was very helpful. No in/out privileges - only bad thing about parking. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Our experience was great at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel. The only downside is that I didn't read the fine print that the parking available down the street is discounted and not free. The garage attendants were very rude. The staff at the Broadway was excellent.

great price and location...midtown... times square, theater district, close to subway station... refurbished rooms, very clean, somewhat small (european style), but good enough for sure..very friendly and helpful staff. we would definately come back

Staff helpful especially the young lady in the mornings and the location is excellent - but this hotel is awful - the room is tiny and on the surface is clean but if you look closer it is not!!!! It smells. I cannot understand the good reviews - which was the reason I booked it - big mistake. Also do not get there shuttle it took 2 3/4 hours to get to Newark when the airbus coming in only took 50 minutes max - the driver went downtown which took at least an hour to pick up another passenger when we had been told that we would be the last pick up - it was a joke.

Within Walking distance to Times Square. Staff very helpful and very pleasant.Room small but fine for myself and a 12 year old. We were in the room only to sleep. Breakfast included a plus and free internet in the rooms also a plus.Would make a return visit

Excellent location if experiencing Broadway or mid-town NYC. Safe neighbourhood, I was travelling alone and had no problems at all. Close to Central Park and Subway also. Staff are friendly and helpful and there is a newly refurbished lobby.Only one lift which can take some time, rooms are small and in need of an update. Breakfast was good.If you are planning on exploring the city and spending little time in your room, then this is a good, cheap option.

I had a "good" stay at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel. The two negatives: (1) I showed up to check in at 10pm and the one room they had left (note: I reserved a three night stay in advance) had a leak in it, so they sent me one block away to the Night Hotel on 47th (formerly the Stay Hotel). It wasn't ideal, but I rolled with it. (2) The other negative -- the hotel really didn't offer any consolation for my inconvenience. I didn't ask, but they should have offered something. Positives: Value - much cheaper than the Marriott Marquis and the Renaissance which are right in Times Square. The Broadway hotel is just a half block off of Times Square but much less expensive. And it's a nice and clean hotel. Modern and updated but not over the top. Nice furniture in the lobby, breakfast area, and rooms. The size of my room was average, but good. A little smaller than the rooms at the hotels mentioned above, but def. larger rooms that at the Night Hotel. The free breakfast was very good for my taste--It wasn't a hot breakfast, but they had bagels, toaster, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, and fresh apples and bananas. Wi-fi was free and worked fine. The staff were friendly when spoken to, but they didn't go out of their way. There's a fair amount of construction work going on, and it woke me up around 6:30 am one morning. I had to get up anyway so it wasn't a big deal.

Broadway @ Times Square is located a half a block from Times Square. The rooms are standard NY size. Clean and comfortable. Space is well laid out. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast and free wifi were an added bonus to the reasonable rate. I would stay again.

We enjoyed our 3 night stay and really appreciated the free breakfast which got our days off to a great start. The room was clean and a decent size. We stayed in room 301 which at the front of the hotel had a lot of street noise. We got used to it after the first night, but would likely give up the room size for a quieter sleep next time. Our friends had rooms at the back of the hotel and had no noise, but their rooms were smaller. Contrary to other reports, we found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. No problems with the internet service either. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

This is a well located hotel, two minutes walk to Times Square. Room quite big but internet connection poor. Bathroom good. Staff impersonal but adequate. Breakfast facility, make your own, acceptable and clean kitchen. Overall I would stay again due to the location but would recommend that the staff be more customer friendly

Great location next to Times Square and some space in the room which is rare in the big apple in that price range.The bath and the bed are good, you toast your own bagels in the morning so it was fine for us.The only lacking thing was a refrigerator.The street has several reconstructions which is a bit annoying, but tolerable and there are homeless people sleeping at the front of the church next door if you arrive late, if you dont like it just walk accross the street and cross in front of the hotel.

This is a relatively newly renovated hotel. It is basic but it is a great place to stay. It is half a block from time square so if you want to be where the action is this is the place. The rooms are a reasonably good size with a desk and chair. The internet speed is also pretty good. Breakfast is free and basic. Boiled eggs, muffins, bagels, toast, oatmeal and of course donuts. Be prepared the halls may smell a bit. This is just because they have doors in the halls to help keep it quiet so no air ever gets into the halls. Unlike the sister hotel, hotel @ Times Square (1 block east) the smell is just in the halls and it isn't too bad. The hotel @ Times Square is the same but older and is now looking and feeling more ragged. Recommend this hotel if you like a good price and pure basics. Nothing fancy but a great spot if you are not looking for luxury.

Great hotel about half a block from Times Square with plenty of good eating places nearby. Our room, a front room 802, was a good size with king size bed, plenty of furniture, a small hanging cupboard with a room safe and a separate en-suite bathroom. Air-conditioning was a unit in the window space, a bit noisy but effective. The room was spotless. On arrival the reception staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has one lift so there was some waiting but no greater than at many other places. Breakfast was included in our tariff and was a comprehensive continental type. In summary, we would stay here again, it was moderate cost but still good value.

This is a great hotel to stay if you are going to NYC for the first time.Location is great. A few meters away from the Times Square. Rooms are tidy. I always look for hotels where I'll have no respiratory allergy to dust and/or mold, and there was no problem on this one, speccialy considering they have carpet on it.Hotel is clean, breakfest is good enough.When going back no NYC, I'll stay there for sure.

Broadway at Times Square is exactly that; half a block from Broadway and Times Square. The rooms are small but immaculately clean. The a/c works and that is no small wonder in New York in the summer. Breakfast is basic but you will find pretty much what you need to start the day. Wifi works everywhere and parking is across the street at a reasonable $22/day. Can't beat the location, however. You can easily walk everywhere and you are a block away from Restaurant Row.

Excellent hotel in a perfect location only a 2 min walk to the fabulous Times Square precinct. Hotel renovations have been completed in the front reception, lobby and dining area. Rooms are small but fine for accommodation. The breakfast is good and an excellent start to the day. Staff at the front reception were always keen to assist, very polite and welcoming.

Very clean hotel in a great location. Just a block away from Times Square, 15 minute walk to Central Park, 10 minute walk to shopping on 5th Ave. Breakfast is included...cereal, toast, bagels, donuts, fruit, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee, etc. nothing fancy but all you need to start the day. Nice and quiet rooms...so quiet we overslept! All at a good price. We will stay here on our next visit.

After reading other reviews here on TA, I booked a 2-night stay for my son and I to celebrate his 16th birthday. This hotel is modern, clean, comfortable, and in the heart of all the action! The front desk staff was more than helpful and were always happy to help point us in the right direction! The price was lower than anything else I could find in the area, and we got everything we needed for our stay, including complimentary breakfast (which I actually forgot about until we arrived). That alone can save at least $10 a person per day! Other than the location, the best thing about this hotel is that our room was basically sound proof! We heard absolutely no outside noise, neither from the street or from the hallway! I will tell everyone to stay here when in NYC!

I found this hotel for my grandmother and me on a road trip up the east coast. The location and price was such a good deal, that we didn't expect much from the room, but it was above and beyond what we imagined. Very nice, modern, and clean. I highly recommend it.

A great hotel for anyone wanting to staying near the main attractions of midtown, a few meters from several subway lines. The price is unbeatable for the location, the staff is very attentive and the breakfast is very good. The only downside is that the room has too much furniture for its size, leaving an area of ​​tiny circulation. The cleanliness of the room was also not the best, with some corners very dusty.

I am a frequent traveler to NYC for business and have tried almost every chain hotel in Times Square and frankly i am getting tired of the stupidly high prices high that they charge. First of all, do not be turned off by the small size of the hotel. Yes compared to some of the chains in Times Square it is small, but it really makes up for the size in charm and cleanliness. The staff is accomodating and helpful and you really cant beat the location. Half a block from Broadway, how can you not like that?! I was also quite pleasantly surprised by how fast the wifi was here. Faster than in some of the larger chains hotels in the area. Yes you will say that a smaller hotel will have fewer people and fewer people hitting the network, but i have stayed at another boutique hotel closer to Central Park and the wifi there was abysmal. Here it was like i was back at my home network, easily able to send a ton of emails and stream vids if i wanted too. The room was a tad larger than i had anticipated which made me that much happier. I asked for a room overlooking 46th and i got two windows, small ones, but it was still nice. The corridors are small and there is only one elevator. The key here is to ask for a lower floor room and just take the stairs. It is better for you anyway. Breakfast was what I thought it would be, no omlet stations or anything like that, but a reasonable amount of choices. There was some door slamming by other residents, but this cant be avoided anywhere you go. I did have some issues with the Lodgenet movie services, but the staff did refund the movies that did not work back to me. Bottom line, if you dont want to spend upwards of 400+ in a room you will only be sleeping in, then this is a nice choice for you. Might be a bit small for a family of four, but for a couple getting away, perfect!

This was our first time staying in NYC for a non-business related trip and it was so nice to be walking distance from the attractions! Just a quick walk to the end of the street and you're in Times Square and only a 5-10 minute leisurely walk to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, NY Public Library, or 5th avenue shopping. Super close to Hell's Kitchen and all the great restaurants too! The staff was extremely helpful and sincere and helped us secure a car service to LGA when it was time for us to check-out. Breakfast every morning was just what we needed before a day of walking around the city. Our room was always cleaned very well and the AC worked great. We had a weeks worth of luggage and we did not have any issues with space. Will definitely stay here again!

I've stayed at this hotel several times over the past 4-5 years and I'm always pleased with it. The staff are very good, the rooms are impeccably clean, and the location, although very close to Times Square is relatively quiet. And incredibly convenient. Because it's in Midtown and close to several subway lines it's very easy to get virtually anywhere. It's also easy to walk almost anywhere.The rooms are small, but very well equipped including free wifi.I'd particularly recommend this hotel for people going to NY for the first time - because it's so central it's an ideal base to explore the city from. And because of it's location it feels quite safe no matter how late at night you're getting "home".Finally, for a New York hotel with this level of service and this great a location - the price is fantastic.

The hotel was very conveniently located to theaters ,trains , restaurants.The staff were very obliging with a special mention to Jack at the front deskConsidering how close Duffy Square was in the midst of all the action, thehotel rooms were very quiet and clean.

It is really well located! Has a friendly staff and despite the tiny little room, everything was clean. Unfortunetely we had a minor situation during our stay. We are used to bring along our own towels as we are not comfortable using hotel ones and it was mistakenly taken from our room as one of the hotel's. As it is also white, I understand the confusion but differently from the hotel's ours has little colored flowers on the edge so as soon as we noticed the problem we reported it asking for help but they said that there was nothing they could do. I agree that it wouldn't be easy to find it over night but I expected at least a plan B like offering to ship it to me as soon as it was found. But it wasn't what I heard, instead just an I am sorry...

This hotel is pretty much smack-bang in the Middle of Manhattan, half a block from Times Square on West 46th St. This is the perfect location for first-time visitors to NYC, but good for everyone who wants to be in Midtown, near Times Square, 42nd, Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park, etc., and a ridable metro distance from Uptown, Downtown and even Brooklyn and Queens.The room was clean, the one slightly odd thing was that the window, instead of being shut, was open just a tiny bit but buffered by some type of rubber thing, so you had a mostly-shut window you were not allowed to open with just a barely noticeable current of air drifting in. In late May, this is totally ok, I wonder what it's like in winter though.Other than that, good room and no complaints about the size as this is NYC and it's easily big enough to put your stuff. Clean place, friendly staff, decent breakfast and a computer you can use and even print from in the lobby, plus free wifi and free coffee all day. Decent price considering the location.

i stayed in this hotel for 5 night in nyc. the location is great close to time square .around the hotel resturants,shops.room was not so large if you come with lot of baggage. staff was very nice and polite. breakfast nice.you can use coffe and tea all day. sure i will come again.

This little hotel is right near Times Square, so no taxis to theater or dining! The staff is very service-oriented and friendly, and the price is excellent for NYC. Room was quiet, comfortable and just big enough. You get breakfast with the price, and it's not bad. DO recommend.

There is nothing we can complain about for our stay here. The location is excellent especially for newtimers that want to see the main attractions. I knew it was close to Times Square but not that it was literally a 30 second walk to get there! We walked everywhere...theatre, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station...just about every place we set out to see. Check in and check out was quick and without problems. The complimentary breakfast every morning was more than sufficient and had such a great variety. They had bagels, donuts, yogurt, fruit, toast, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, juices, milk...so much more than you would expect for a free breakfast and it was so well stocked and maintained during the breakfast hours. Our room was clean and the bed was so comfortable! I would not hesitate for a second to come back here.

This hotel is a great location for walking most places around the theater district. It is on 129 W. 46th St. between 6th and 7th Ave. It is walking distance to Rockerfeller Center, Theater District, Museum of Modern Art, Grand Central Station, Times Square, 5th Ave. shopping, and much more. They have a continental breakfast that is very sufficient to get you started for the day. It is very clean and have very helpful personnel. Every time we visit NY we stay at this hotel or it's sister hotel down the block called, Hotel @ Times Square. They are Applecore Hotels. It is located at 59 W. 46th St. between 5th and 6th Ave. It is the same as the other one except it is larger. They are both great hotels. Applecore has 3 other locations. Their toll free # is, 1-800-567-7720. I highly recommend both of these hotels because of their locations.

Perfect location and excellent service combined with reasonable price. But, something is missing for a total excellence. I do not understand why "Reviews must be at least 200 characters." 13 characters to go.

Nice Boutique Hotel right in the Middel of Mid Town. Perfect Lcation, Quiet, & Very Clean! Staff Superb and very Helpful. Rooms Large enough for Comfort. Nice Basic Breakfast included. Would Highly reccommend! No Problems.

We stayed here for 5 nights in April. The location of this hotel is amazing, so close to Times Square yet you hear none of the noise. The staff on the front desk were always pleasant and helpful, the room and bathrooms were always clean, although small, and the free breakfast more than adequate to begin the day. The main negative for us was the room seemed very stuffy, even after putting the air on and there were signs saying not to open any windows. Also the only elevator was very slow at times and we would usually be happy to take the stairs except we were on the 7th floor! Otherwise this hotel was very good value for money for New York and I would probably stay again.

I stay on business and the hotel has a new and beautiful breakfast room, exercise room, lobby, and elevators! What a wonderful upgrade for a hotel in the Times Square area! Near all New York sights as it is in Midtown

Room: Small but efficient use of space. Clean. Decently decorated. Bed was comfortable and good night sleep was had.Other areas of the hotel: Reception and cafeteria areas were modern, sleek and minimal. Hallway of the second floor we stayed was surprisingly narrow and short. We heard people talking down the hallway while we were in the room but we weren't too bothered as they weren't loud. Workout room was very small (two running machines fit tightly). Staff: Friendly and casual.Breakfast: Self-serve with one helpful attendant refilling items (and to watch us behave). Plenty of bagels, breads, donuts, cereals, boiled eggs, orange & apple juice, yogurts, coffee, tea, bananas and oranges. Overall: We were happy to sleep there after a long full day. We'll probably return for a last minute theater visit. The price was on higher end for us ($255 queen size bed), but we understood that we were paying for the premium location. We were able to make the best of our short 30 hour visit. About the street: There was a church next door to the hotel which held a fantastic free recital on Saturday we arrived. The street got a little sketchy in the evening (11pm) as we walked back to the hotel but felt safe enough walking by as a pair.Extra info-1: You may feel a little cramped if you were looking to spend some time to relax in the room. It's a good place for a good night sleep after a busy day in town and a breakfast to get you started the following morning. Extra info-2: We booked through booking.com which gave us $10 off. We called the hotel to confirm our reservation just to make sure as we read some iffy reviews about booking.com. We did not have any problem.

If you want a large lobby, large rooms, high prices then don't book here. The rooms are well appointed, clean, modern but not large. Included in the price is a good continental breakfast (cereal, juice, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, bread, bagels, fruit, yogurt etc), free wifi, free use of two macs, fitness room (three machines but not much else) and reduced parking across the street. We've been to NYC many times and we generally book at one of the Applecore properties.

You can't find a hotel closer to Times Square for the price. If you're not planning to stay in your (rather small-ish) room for any amount of time, this is the best place for your money. We were in room 205, near the elevator with one queen bed. We thought the location of the room might be noisy near the elevator (no) and being so close to the business of NYC (not at all). The room was tastefully decorated and a 36" flat screen was on the dresser at the foot of our bed. Not much space around the bed but we weren't in the room much. The bathroom was carefully laid out to maximize such a small space (just a shower, no bath tub) and was quite clean. May need to ask for more towels - barely enough for two people. The lobby is modern, the breakfast area is large, with tvs and comfortable seating. Morning breakfast was vast and plentiful (bagels, toast, cereal, juices, coffee, doughnuts, fresh fruit, boiled eggs), though the lay-out causes bottlenecks with many eager tourists trying to eat and run. Seemed to be a popular place for foreigners - not much english being spoken the morning we were there but a nice diverse crowd.The hotel gladly held our luggage for the day after we checked out and the staff was quite friendly. We look forward to staying here again.

I stayed at this hotel in the end of April. The localization is very nice, is near by of almost attractions of NYC. The personal assistation was very good.The dimension of the rooms can be better but for stay 5 nights is quite sufficient .

Stayed here for 3 nights alone.Perfect location next to Times Square.Renovation works are finished now. The breakfast room has changed, is now Very modern with enough places available.Also the front desk and gym room are modernised in a positive way.I would stay here again!

Just came back from NYC and our stay ay the Broadway. Excellent as always. Very clean rooms, Renovations are wonderful. Staff Is out of this world accomadating.Helped us get a ride to the airport checked us in right away.Made sure everything was good with our room. This hotel is close to sooo... many things. Our trip couldn't have been better because they helped with everything. Our next trip we will stay with them again.

No frills hotel. Rooms were clean enough. Friendly & quick-service staff. Excellent location - cheaper compared to other hotels near times square. A lot of good restaurants nearby. Don't expect much from their free breakfast though.

Great value city centre hotel. Yards from Times Square. Staff extremely helpful and courteous. Breakfast good. Rooms small but perfectly adequate. Renovations on foyer will give hotel a welcoming feel once complete. Renovations in no way hampered our stay. Would definately stay here again.

If you're looking for any kind of home comforts, this isn't it. The decor is very modern when you walk in. Pros-Friendly helpful staffClean roomsSeconds from Times SquareClose parking Bed was comfortable Cons:"Business center" is two computers and a printer in their lobbyRooms are incredibly smallBreakfast is provided but not many options, they didn't even offer decaf coffee (except for packets of instant decaf Sanka)The "gym" is two ellipticals and a treadmill in a narrow closet-looking room. You will exercise against a wall either way. They don't even have a vending machine to get a bottle of water! But, there is a store open 24 hours across the street.The hallways are so narrow! It's definitely not wide enough for a wheelchair or a large suitcase!Overall, it was ok and for the location it was decent given what I paid. I know for NYC I got a bargain but still paid a lot and just got a small room.

Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in April. The location was great right in the middle of Times Square. The hotel was very clean and staff were friendly. We were on the third floor however the window looked out to a brick wall. Overall we had a great stay and would stay here again.

We had great stay in this hotel, everything is convenience. It is close with 5th Avenue which is the best shopping around Times Square. We stayed two nights here and felt much comfortable with their hotel staff, they were so friendly, helpful overall. They should improve two things : breakfast could offfer more choice than this moment because Asian people couldnot eat donut or cake in the morning, they prefered soup, egg than, the hotel could put noodle cup there as special care for Asian and Asia people, second improvement is printer, it must work all the times. We went to bus station late than our schedule because the printer in reception. Anyway, great hotel in NY.

If you like being amongst the hustle and bustle of times square then this place is ideal. Just a few steps to times square. We stayed in a room on the top floor at the back of the building and it was so quiet. Breakfast is just what you would expect toast, bagels, fresh fruit, doughnuts etc just help yoursel. For the bbargain price I paid, I was very satisfied. The only one slight criticism was the room was small and warm but ac worked well. As for road works outside, we didn't hear a thing and as far as I could tell most of the roads in midtown were the same. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a decent, clean base while exploring new York.

We were a bit worried when we booked this hotel as to if it would be safe for 2 girls on our own. But we were very pleasantly surprised.The staff really do all they can to make your stay safe and welcome you with a great big smile. Nothing is too much bother. Rooms are cleaned every day so they are spotless. Breakfast is free but loads of it. Its a buffet continental but lovely.The hotel is up a side street but so central to every where, plus there's a bell hop to help with your shopping and bags 24 hrs a day, and a 24 hr reception which makes you fell safe when you stroll in at 3.30 in the morning.

Stayed here for three days! Room was VERY clean, very pleased! Yvonne was a pleasure, very sweet!! The first room was a little cold and was able to switch rooms with no problem. Enjoyed staying in the front of hotel as opposed to the back. The location to Times Square is excellent and felt safe walking back to hotel. This may not be a five star hotel but I was very pleased to have chosen this room. Would stay again.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff, especially Ivonne. Nice breakfast! Only one elevator so you have to wait sometimes,theh heating system made sometimes strange noice. The room was clean and quite. Will definitely stay there again!

This was a cheap room by NY standards and it was everything we needed for our tourist visit with no negatives. We stayed for 6 nights, got an upgrade to a king bedroom and were very comfortable in a room on the 3rd floor at the back. The room was clean and everything worked, wifi was slow at times but ok. The staff were friendly and always helpful. The lobby was still being renovated but was no problem. The breakfast room renovation was complete. The free breakfast was all you needed with cereals, yoghurt, fruit, toast, yummy danish and pastries, tea and coffee. The breakfast sets you up well for the day, the room was clean and pleasant and the guy looking after it kept everything well stocked and tidy. The location is 5 star excellent, only a short walk to shows, restaurants, bars, subway, TKS booth and more. We enjoyed our stay in this small hotel and would stay there again. The Cuban restaurant a couple of doors away is great with good food, great atmosphere and live band. The Tonic Bar on 7th between about 47th and 48th is a good sports bar with varied menu, cheap prices and friendly service for a pre show dinner.

Fairly basic hotel but clean and staff all very helpful and efficient.First room on street side, building works and other noise made it impossible to sleepNo problem to move but really should not use these rooms.A bit over priced.

Recently renovated, the BTSH offers quiet reprieve from the craziness of New York's street life. While the building is old, the lobby and dining area have just been renovated. Rooms are small but clean. My room had two windows which showed the picturesque brick wall of the neighbor house with the bonus of gently cooing doves. I didn't mind. The room was quiet and you wouldn't see much anyway unless you're very high up. Upon arrival, my safe and TV didn't work. Help came quickly and with a smile. The breakfast in the morning offered refreshingly strong coffee, extra-large NY bagels and assorted pastries. It's not a huge spread - for some of us used to European breakfasts - but it's included and gets your day started. Overall, a solid value.

Clean and reasonably priced hotel with a great location only half a block from Times Square. Its an older hotel but it is clean and has been updated. The rooms are small but that's nothing new for NYC! I recommend a room on the back side of the hotel.

This was our first stay since the change in ownership (it was formerly a Comfort Inn). We found the same clean (albeit small) rooms and friendly staff. The location is perfect; only steps from Times Square but very quiet. The lobby was under construction during our stay, but looked like it will be very nice when it is done.

Great hotel, clean and comfy to say we was right in the middle of it on the 19th you didn't hear much apart from the odd cop car. New York is great I am going back to this same hotel next time.staff are very helpful and polite nothing is too much bother.

Stayed here in Dec 2012 on a very short shopping trip for 2 nights...Check in was easy n we were so happy to get a clean warm room after a lot of travelling!! Room was fair enough size for 2 of us, bed was very comfy n warm, bathroom was fine size, halfway thru shower hot water wud run out which was soo annoying on both occasions... breakfast was included which was great full and plenty there so start us off for the day...Would have no problem stayong here again, I liked it for wat we needed from a hotel :)

The location of the hotel is perfect. Overnight street parking is possible along 46th and 45th St.Room was small but it was not a problem for our 1 night stay. There is a coffeemaker in the room. Sound isolation between the rooms is good enough. Beds are comfortable. Windows could not be opened and A/C quite noisy as most of those "in window" units are. Recently renovated breakfast room is bright and clean. Breakfast has all typical selection of bagels, jams, cream cheese, cereal, oatmeal, some fruits etc. Although the hotel is not luxury and I wouldn't call it charming it is a good value compare to prices of the other hotels in the area and worth considering if your budget is limited.

Very clean, nice staff, quiet at a great location. They provide basic breakfast. Also there is a parking lot 20 ft to hotel... Lobby area was under construction when I visited, it looks like it will look good.

Great location.Clean rooms,good service.Will surely return.Although they had some work going on at the hotel lobby,it did not disturb their services or guest at that period.Was there for 7days.Broadway and theather close by.Times square close by with all the shopping areas around the hotel.

Staff was very lovely & friendly. I had room 404, the windows of which faced a wall but it was quiet. The breakfast was good enough to help start the day. The location was in walking distance or subways distance to most attractions. Overall, I enjoyed my stay.

The location of the Broadway at Time Square is great. It's within 30 yards of Time Square. Once you leave the hotel, it's a few steps and your standing infront of the TKTS booth. They were remodeling the lobby during our visit, but from what we could tell it's going to look great. I can't believe that the prices are so cheap. $100 to $140 to stay in a clean hotel in time square- WOW. The rooms are small, no thrills, but its NYC- the room is for sleeping and showering.

So many reviews were disapointed by the lobby's construction . I didnt plan on sleeping in th lobby anyway. The room was small but VERY CLEAN . Flat screen with cable, free WIFI, and spotless bathroom. Where our room was we never heard any noise and we were just around the corner from times square. If your looking for a CLEAN place to rest your head and dont care about fancy frills this place is great.

Firstly, the location of this hotel cannot be beaten for the price, its a 1 minute walk onto times square, right into the hear of a New York visitors dream. The location is something which cannot be beaten doe the price and this is what sold the hotel to me, along with the plethora of good reviews, thanks for trip advisor reviewers. The hotel itself is good, its clean and comfortable and offers a lot of plusses included in the price, Free WiFi, Free breakfast and which as much as people complained about it, is free and is just toast, bagels, doughnuts cereal and coffee and juice so it does offer a lot for very little. Price wise as I've said, it cannot be beaten for location and comfort. We were offered room 901 and while this was a great room, the problem we found was the elevator, the staff seem to use it a lot to move cleaning carts from floor to floor and they can obviously override call up, so this means a few times the lift came up to floor 7, then went straight down, so my advise to any of you would be to ask for a lower floor and like other reviewers have said, ask for a location at the back, it does get a little noisy. When we first arrived the lobby was covered in dust sheets and there were workers hammering and sawing and there was an overwhelming smell of pain thinners and dust, this was a bit of a let down, but on a positive note the breakfast room is complete and I have attached a photo. Overall this was a let down, but the hotel was still great, the price was worth, it was clean and comfortable, and it offers a lot of perks, so I think for the next time I will stay here again.

Upon arriving in the lobby.....I wondered if I had made a mistake. I depend on reviews from fellow travelers when booking new travel. The reviews for the most part were good so I took the plunge. When we arrived last Saturday.....it had been raining and we walked from Penn Station to the hotel....looking like drowned rats! We walked into the lobby and it was completely torn up under construction, temporary desk....looked rather shady. I became very concerned but the staff was very warm and welcoming, stating that the breakfast area had already been completed and they were renovating the lobby. We checked in and went up to our room. It is typical New York, small halls and tight on space, but the room was wonderful! King sized bed, full bathroom. Very Very Clean! All nicely decorated. True the view wasn't wonderful, looked at a wall and other windows, but hey this is New York City! It's a concerete jungle.....if you want a hotel view, go to the beach! For the price it is amazing! Full breakfast every morning including pastries, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt.....you just can't get any better. We came to New York a couple of years ago and were lucky enough to stay in the Mariott Times Square.....of course it was fancier....but we didn't get breakfast and paid significantly more for the room. If you are on a budget, don't hesitate - stay here! You are half a block off of the main portion of Times Square - great value and location. A couple of pubs across the street - got the Irish and Scottish covered! And you can just walk back across the street. In short, very nice hotel, great value, and welcoming staff. Great Job!

The only reason this is not a 5/5 is the fact that the lobby was under major renos and we were not aware of it when we arrived but overall it didnt really effect our stay at all. The breakfast was a great start to the day, WiFi worked really well. You are less than 100 steps away from Time Square so amazing location. The rooms were clean and comfortable although on the small side. Staff was extremely friendly. Since we arrived early and left late they were more than willing to store our luggage without a fuss. Would stay here again no questions asked. (Especially to see how nice the lobby will turn out)

We stayed at this hotel in February 2013 and they were still renovating the lounge. We got a room in the 4th floor, a bit small and quite dark, we could not manage to open the window to get some fresh air, anyhow the room was OK (the type of room you can expect in NY for this price), the bathroom was spacious and had been recently renovated, but with no window. The room looked a bit tired but was decently clean. There is only 1 elevator, so at times it gets a bit slow, anyhow it was never a problem. We had free wi-fi in the room and breakfast was included. The breakfast room had been recently renovated, it is not very big but we never had to wait for a table. It looks like a hostel breakfast, do it yourself, but we had yogurt (also light!), fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, toasts with jam and so on, for us it was great but it is not the usual international breakfast with service. The location is unbelievable if you are interested in Broadway shows! 5 minutes walk from every theatre! Great great great!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful, we were very satisfied with our stay and will definitely come back! Hopefully after renovation they will keep the prices low: we spent 1026$ for 7 nights (taxes included).

Very good hotel. Perfect stay for us. The hotel is in the best location. Only about 30 second walk from Times Square. The area looks amazing at night time. Metro and public transport are less than 3 minutes walk away. Free WiFi, free breakfast and 24/7 free coffee and tea make this a great city hotel. Perfect for a 3 day break to see New York.

Just spent four nights at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel. The lobby is undergoing major renovation, which wasn't at all inconveniencing and should be very nice once finished. The newly renovated breakfast room was contemporary and pleasant. The offerings were modest, but served as early-morning fuel: coffee, juices, milk; bagels and danishes; cereals; and boiled or precooked/rewarmed poached (?) eggs. The rooms were very clean, nicely furnished and fairly small. This is an older, quaint building, so the floors and rooms had a European feel, with only a few rooms per floor. The beds were great. The staff were all VERY friendly and accommodating, including the maids. The location, just off Times Square was incredibly convenient. It also has good restaurants up and down the block. Our room was very quiet. I will definitely want to stay here again, as long as the price stays so reasonable.

One can't argue with $109 per night for a clean, very well appointed room on a quieter street near Times Square -- ideally located for Manhattan in general. The staff is cordial and helpful. The continental breakfast is a step up from the cold-cereal-and-hard-apple variety one often finds in budget places; there are hot items, good coffee, edible fruit, and nice pastries. My two reservations: the advertised "Free Wi-Fi" didn't work at all in my room (it connects but is so slow that websites never load), and when I visited (Feb 16, 2013) the lobby was completely gutted and being noisily renovated. Would I return? Maybe. Had the Wi-Fi worked and had I been warned in advance of the renovation, yes.

We went in August 2012 for 5 nights. The location is in the heart of Times Square. A bit noisy because of a close by Cuban restaurant/bar playing music every night until 2 am. Our room also had some sort of machine outside our window that was very loud especially at night. Kind of like a loud heater or A/C. The room was smaller than we expected. But overall a room with a great location and included breakfast every morning for the price we got it in NYC you can't go wrong. It was neat and clean and staff was friendly as well. Overall a pleasant stay.

The hotel lobby was being completely refurbished and looked like a bomb site when we arrived. However the staff could not have been more apologetic or helpful. We got a room upgrade and reduced rate and to be honest our stay was not affected at all. The room was spacious and clean and towels were changed daily. There was free wi-fi access and coffee maker. But what makes this hotel amazing is its location, literally 1 minute from times square. Despite this we were never disturbed by noise. We had continental breakfast included which we had to take at a nearby hotel and amazingly we walked in unchallenged every morning, no one ever asked to see proof of our hotel. There was more than enough food and it was pleasant

Trip (Jan17-20 2013) We arrived mid afternoon following a 3k flight & $70 cab drive from the airport to find a building site !! V.disappointed that the mgmt did not think it important to advise us of this following our booking. No check-in desk, just a table. The staff were most unhelpful (apart from a lend of a phone). The manager said that although the lift was not working and there was a lot of dust about, "our rooms were in perfect working order". They offered a sister hotel a block away but would not agree to a reduction in price for all the inconvenience caused. (Frankly there was a total lack of empathy on their part, on any level! ) So this spoke volumes for the kind of management running the hotels. We left right away and found wonderful lodgings at the Ameritania up on 54th street. Honesty always goes a long way but I'm sure this is a lesson this hotel won't learn anytime soon :-(

I stayed 1 night at this hotel over the past weekend. The lobby is undergoing major renovations so it is virtually non-existent. So, that meant eating the complimentary breakfast at their sister hotel down the street. When I walked into the hotel, I was not sure I was in the right place because everything was boarded up but the woman at the front desk offered me a fabulous discount for staying to compensate for the inconvenience. I'm glad I did! The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom very clean. The TV worked well as did the phone. Free WiFi in the room was another bonus. The hotel was within walking distance to everything in the theater and fashion districts, tons of sightseeing spots, restaurants. The staff were so accommodating and friendly. Anything I asked for was given without hesitation. I would definitely return to this hotel, not only for the great service and clean rooms, but also to see how the renovations turned out!

When we arrived the lobby was a large construction site. We simply did not believe that this hotel was in use. We were told that the breakfast should be consumed in another hotel 5 minutes away.They could have emailed me and asked if it was ok with me so we could have chosen another hotel home. We took another place to stay after one night

Excellent Hotel for my trips to NYC for business. Right near Times Square.Clean and updated rooms with flat TV, pleasant staff, free breakfast room, free computer room, exercise room. Always reasonably priced! I stay there at least 4-5 times per year.

we stayed in room 301, it was awesome!!! More than i could have hoped for in New York. You are steps away from Time Square, and within walking distance from any sights you want to see. The staff was great, breakfast was awesome. We have not one complaint with this hotel. Some people are hard to please, no matter where they are.

This hotel was such a bargain. It was almost hard to believe that we got the price that we did for such a great location! The hotel is only a block off of Times Square--Right in middle of all of the Times Square activity. Super easy access to Broadway Plays. The check in desk was friendly. Breakfast was the same everyday, but excellent. Fresh bagels and doughnuts each morning as well as other items.

We moved from a small queen bed room (quietest but smallest) on L6 to a large one on L2 facing 46th St (too noisy from street and plumbing to get decent sleep). Our final move was to a medium-sized room on L5 in the back of the building but this too had loud heater noises - as we were sick of moving rooms though and didn't want to trouble the reception staff further we stuck with this room but be warned if you're a light sleeper, you may just need to stick with a smaller room - in hindsight, we would've stuck with our tiny first room as I'm a light sleeper. The only other recommendation is for the hotel to put in more bath towel railings or at least somewhere to hang a hand towel.

Arrived and check in was seamless with very friendly staff. You can tell immediately that this is an average hotel. However it was cheap for the area so did not expect anything fancy. Rooms were small but clean and adequate. We stayed in the double room with two small children. It was a place to put your head down but not much else.Breakfast was a bit of a scrummage with a lack of seating. The food itself was basic but again adequate. Self service meant you could get in and out quickly in your own time. Staff very friendly and eager to help with any queries.Would stay there again and recommend to others who want to visit NY on a budget and want to be near right in times sq.

Been looking at hotel rates in NY for about 3-4 months before we actually came to NY - and the prices of the other hotels are shocking! I knew NY was expensive, and coming from Australia where everything is expensive, I thought I wouldn't get any wallet shock from hotel rates. This was our first trip to NY, and since we only had 3 nights and 2 days to spend here, we wanted to stay in a hotel that was close to a lot of things but won't break the bank. Broadway at Times Square was just that - average hotel at a perfect location. The location didn't disappoint us - it was about a 1-2 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel itself was average - very small lobby, breakfast room and bedroom. But for the price we paid ($290/night for 3 adults and 1 kid, vs $450++ for other hotels in the same area), this was a good deal. Breakfast was also included in the price - buffet selection which had waffles, fruit danish bread, sausage, bagels, loaf bread, yogurt, fruits, fried eggs and unlimited coffee for the whole day. It was an average selection and quality was so-so, but still a great plus for the price we paid.The room itself had two double beds, and a reasonable sized bathroom. The room was quite small, there was about 0.25m distance between the beds and the walls, and about 1m distance between the two beds. It was quite a challenge fitting all our luggages and ourselves in the room. I would have preferred a bigger room, but again, we weren't really there to lounge around in the room. The room came with free wifi and cable tv.The concierge was very helpful, he gave us maps and was able to book us on the hop in hop off Greyhound tour. He also booked us for our trip to JFK, which was about an hour trip from the hotel. Overall, a good value hotel if you're not looking for the perks, and just want a decent hotel in a great location.

Fantastic hotel, great service from the staff! Very helpful about where to go and how to get around the city. Facilities available were good, free in room Wi-Fi and free breakfast. Although, room was VERY small, and the walls were paper thin so you could hear people in the hallway and they could hear you inside your room. I will stay here again as the room is really only a place to lay your head at night.

Our family of 4 stayed for a few nights recently in 2 rooms at Broadway. Fantastic location right near Times Square and Broadway shows. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Shame the dining area renovations weren't finished as the room was cramped at breakfast. Air conditioning in the rooms is not adjustable so our nights were too hot to sleep comfortably. Overall though a good value for money stay in a budget hotel.

Was in NY after superstorm SANDY. All accomodations are either fully booked or quoted at exorbitant inflated prices due to native new yorker also chasing after rooms as their own houses were destroyed by the storm. Was to spend 4 nights in NY. Went to the APPLECORE group of hotels website, only have 2 rooms at this hotel. Arrived at La guardia airport. There was a public bus that will drop you off at a subway station. From there the train will take you to BROADWAY station where it is a 10 mins walk to the hotel. Situated around walking distance to Broadway, fifth Avenue shopping area as well as rows of restaurant, supermarket. the location is superb.The room is small which should be expected, but could accomodate my family of 4. All applecore group hotels comes with free WIFI and free buffet breakfast. There is even a business office which have free computer and printer for those who need to print out their flight or hotel bookings itinerary. The price of the room should be more reasonable if not for the storm as my friends who stayed in the hotel a month earlier paid 40% less than ours.

Perfect hotel. Book this and spend your money on the attractions NY has to offer. We booked a 5 night stay, perfect for us and their nightly rate doesnt break the bank. Free WiFi and breakfast, comfortable beds, is clean, friendly staff and best of all, the location is unbeatable. If you want times square, you got it!! We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends. New York is unbelievably expensive, but this hotel has gotten it right with what it has on offer, without over charging their customers.

Brilliant location between Times Square and Rockefeller centre in midtown manhattan. Free wifi, computers and printer available for guests. The rooms are clean and well equipped with tea/coffee machines and docking units for iPhones. Only criticism is the breakfast room - it can be too small for the number of guests and can also get hot. Overall excellent place to stop in NYC with an unbeatable location

This is one of our favorite hotels. The staff are absolutely wonderful.A centrally located hotel, very friendly, the staff really exceed all expectations and nothing is too much trouble for them. Thanks guys.  Our last trip was however spoiled a bit by someone who described themselves as the manager, a lady by the name of Rajn Rikh. The hotel is strictly non-smoking, fair enough. Standing outside as requested while it is pouring with rain, this woman appears and starts screaming at us. We finally asked her who she was as she had given no clue and were informed that she was the manager. I would have thought that, as a woman in that position, the first thing to do is to present oneself and ask politely if you could move a little further to the side of the building, not just start screaming at people who may or may not be guests!!.. We were informed later that this is quite normal behavior for her, so maybe she should attend a people course or choose another vocation. SHE IS ABSOLUTELY NOT MANAGER MATERIAL WHEN SHE TREATS HOTEL GUESTS THIS WAY.

Best thing you could ever have if you're budget-conscious but at the same time looking for a nice and clean room in downtown Manhattan. Perfect if your main purpose is shopping and seeing Broadway shows because you can go back to the hotel anytime to drop your shopping bags or take a nap or a quick shower. Hotel staff are friendly too. Breakfast is definitely more than ok. Museums are far but there's the subway anyway. Just one bad experience though, the Airlink shuttle (not owned but recommended by the hotel) came late and I almost missed my flight back home. A friendly reminder to the shuttle company might help.

This hotel was a nice surprise. In that it was near Time Square, inexpensive, clean, wonderful friendly staff, parking near by, comfortable bed, updated bathroom with fluffy towels, breakfast and a quiet and descent size room. I will return. All I wanted was something nice to sleep at night.

We slept rather well on a soft bed. If not for the church bell next door and the construction project two doors away, we probably would have slept in. The desk put us in the back so it would be quieter. It is Times Square people; it is not going to be quiet. And this hotel is right next to Times Square; the half-price ticket booth is at the end of the block; our theatres were very nearby. The multinational staff here is nice. The room was small, but nicely renovated. Our biggest problem was the heat. There was some problem with how it is adjusted, since there are no thermostats for individual rooms. We actually turned on the window unit AC to cool off. The breakfast was adequate, but there was not enough seating; it looks like they are preparing a new room for that. Oh, and when the deak tells you that the parking garage (a GREAT discount) is right across the street, don't believe them. It is half a block before you get to the hotel. It was entertaining to watch me back the car up to it in order to avoid going through all the trouble of getting around the block near Times Square. We'd probably book this hotel again (decent price), but I can't tell you it is more than average. It seemed very good for the price in comparison to what was available in the area, for sure.

After reading all the reviews, we didn't hesitate to book the Broadway at Times Square. We were very happy with our stay. For anyone looking for glitz or glamour, or spacious rooms suitable for a group, this is NOT your place. It is a small, clean, comfortable place that feels like a little European hostelry, with its small lobby and tiny lift. You stay here for the friendliness, the cleanliness, and the convenience, and brag about getting a very reasonable deal, not about staying in a la-di-da accommmodation!Staff at reception were very friendly. When we called late at night to ask for extra pillows, a member of staff arrived within minutes!Our room at the back of the hotel was very quiet and we were happy about that. And I cannot begin to tell you how well organized it was. In order to fit a king bed into a small space, someone went to a lot of trouble to figure out how to arrange the furniture. The console under the television is more than adequate for a couple medium- to large-sized pieces of luggage, and the drawers are deep and held all our clothes. There is a desk and there is a small closet. The bathroom has a low, deep sill and you could sit down on it if you needed to, or store toiletries on it. The only suggestion I might make is that there be an additional towel bar, as we couldn't easily hang up our damp towels unless we slung them over the shower rod, which only puts them in the way of your travel partner when he/she is ready to take a shower. If you have some sort of over-the-door hook or hanging clip you can stash in your suitcase, pending the installation of extra towel bars, that might do the trick.Please note that if you are traveling with someone else, and one of you might need to go into the bathroom and turn on the light while the other is sleeping, you should be aware that the bathroom door has a long frosted/reeded glass insert, and the bathroom light will shine through it. This could bother a light sleeper. I love the glass, but was glad I had my sleep mask with me.As to the water temperature - you might have to run the water for awhile but it will get hot.Breakfast was fine; personally I would like to have some more healthful selections, such as plain yogurt, rather than the sweet/fruity type; and some unsweetened cereal choices; but I realize my preferences might not be shared by most guests. I was well able to manage with what was offered, and appreciate that the meal is available free of charge.The location was unbeatable for us. We will definitely stay here again!

Its located around the corner from times square. The hotel is nothing much to shout about. The lobby staff were not really that helpful. the lift can fit about 2 bags and two small sized people. the corridors and rooms were small too. quite a bit of cramp. the air condition was about 2 inches above the bed and was blowing right into me. Nothing much to say about the breakfast, muffins, toast, eggs and drinks.But the location is great though. so if you dont mind the hotel go for it. its a 3star for location.

After two weeks of searching for the perfect hotel room (no bedbug reports, close to Times Square and the Theatre District and close enough to my sister, who would be staying at the New York Hilton) I finally decided on this hotel. This was the first trip that I planned from start to finish (my husband usually handles the trip planning) and I wanted to make sure everything ran smoothly. I read through dozens of reviews on Trip Advisor and received a lot of useful information that helped with my decision. I read many horror stories about travelers reserving rooms with various hotel chains through third party sites only to find that their reservation was lost or the hotel was overbooked after arriving at the hotel. With that in mind, I reserved my room by calling the hotel's reservations line instead of booking my stay online. The reservationist was very helpful, answered all of my questions and immediately sent the confirmation email to me. They told me to bring my AAA card for a 5% discount and to call the day before checkin if I wanted to request a particular room. The week before my trip, they sent another confirmation/reminder email of the date of my check in.The day before my trip, I called to request a room facing 46th Street and they handled it without a problem. Checkin went smoothly the following day and the hotel honored the AAA discount. Once we entered our room, I followed the advice of other reviewers and immediately checked the room for signs of bed bugs. I didn't find any. The room was clean, cozy and perfect for my son and me. The bed was comfortable and my son and I slept very well every night.The staff was friendly and made us feel welcome. Breakfast is served from 6:30 until 10:30 am and there was always lots of food. The hotel offered cereal, waffles, eggs, sausage, danishes, doughnuts, yogurt, bread for toasting and fruit. They also offered tea, coffee, apple and orange juice. There was more than enough food to fill our bellies so I was very pleased. The hotel is located half a block from Times Square and is within walking distance from the Theatre District, Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center. At night we did notice that there were a few homeless people sleeping on the steps of the church next door to the hotel. This might bother some travelers but we always felt safe in the area, even at night. Whenever we entered the hotel, the staff greeted us with smiles. It was a very warm environment.I really enjoyed my stay at the Broadway @ Times Square Hotel and will definitely stay in this hotel on my next visit to Manhattan.

This is a reasonably-priced hotel with a great location, just steps away from Times Square. The rooms are relatively large with comfortable beds.Wi-fi connection is good and more importantly, it's FREE of charge. The breakfast room, although quite small, is clean with good food selection. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends!

I chose the hotels after reading its reviews over here and never regretted my choice. It was located right on the main broadway and timesquare attractions! although I think it was a little too expensive for me but i attribute that to the peak halloween and tourist season. my room costed me a total of $353 for one night (including tax)!well, i stayed there for a night. the staff at reception were friendly and warm, probably indian. they checked us in and a support staff took our enormous number of bags upstairs, the only elevator for the hotel, was a little old and slow and took long to come. The lobby was also small but clean and presentable. there were desktops and printer for use.the corridors were a bit congested but it was ok.the room was small but cozy and had all the necessities, washroom was clean with a good supply of towels and other stuff.we were going to niagara falls the next day for 2 days but didn't want to take the luggage, the hotel staff was so cooperative to keep our luggage FREE of cost and just gave us tags to collect them after coming back.wifi was free toothe breakfast served was also very reasonable.our overall stay was great and i would totally recommend this place and you are literally staying right at broadway!!kudos
