A good hotel with a great location,convenient to restaurants, the theater and the subway.Rooms are clean and well-kept. And all of the staff is kind and helpful. The breakfast area is small but food is good and plentiful.I have my third stay there coming up soon.

my husband and my daughter and myself stayed in this hotel and we were all very happy with it, We were a litlle concerned with the lack of room in the bedroom as we had two double beds and fthree large and two small cases but there was a large wardrobe where we stored three of them so it worked out quite well. The staff at reception were great as was the cleaners and breakfast server, the breakfast room was clean at all times although quite small but they are renovating at the moment. This hotel was also very quiet, clean and comfortable, we would certainly stay there again as it is so close to everything and not too expensive compared to some of the other hotels in the area!!!!

we have stayd at the hotel 5 nights. Great location - near everyting! time square, 5th eve., broadway, resturants, bars, shopping.The subway is just 3-4 minutes from the hotel.The rooms are big and clean.The staff is very nice and helpful.The breakfast is a little bit poor and there is not eunogh tables for all the guests.Although' we defenitly will come back.

Hi. Good hotel, silence and location. But Be CAREFUL when you give them your credit card in the front desk for the deposit in case of any damage. They create a phisical voucher which of course show all the information of the credit card. I was there since november 1st to 5th. When I checked my credit card statement I was shocked. They charged it with 900 dollars of orders through Internet. This is the moment I´m still trying to get my money back with my Bank. Thanks.

After reading some reviews, I was concerned about room size, but both the room and the bathroom were more than adequate, and, yes, spotlessly clean. I was also concerned about street noise, but even being half a block from Time Square, there was none. The hotel is small but well-kept, renovated but maintaining a fifty's look. Hotel staff efficient and amiable. All in all, a very nice stay. Will probably return when in New York. Location is great!

This hotel is spotless clean!!!!! Very friendly front desk staff and bellman were terrific! Yes, rooms are small but the bathroom was large enough to move around in to get ready. Breakfast area clean and a nice perk. I would give $this hotel a 5 star but I can't... The beds we had were well slept in. They need to buy new beds. they are sagging and you can see it when bed is made. But the location was perfect... 2 blocks maybe to Times Square... When I come back to New York I will be staying here!!! Also, it was safe and the bellman made us feel like we were home... Can't remember his name but tall man who always laughed at me and my gal pal I was there with..

Before I begin, let me state that I have stayed in many hotels and have never been anywhere like here before.I stayed here with my partner, sisters and parents for 8 nights, in 3 different rooms.We each paid the same and got completely different sizing rooms.Upon arriving, the front desk said hello and within the first sentence asked us to pay upfront for all rooms. We found it to be a bit rude, but proceeded to pay and then went up to our rooms.We now knew why....The extremely small & stuffy room but was clean (which was at least ONE good thing about this hotel). We then decided to unpack and go to bed. Our heating started spitting out gas or something so we called up Maintenance. He 'fixed' the problem and went away. It didnt stop for the next 2 hours. It was SO loud so we called them up AGAIN. We tried to ask the maintenance man what was going on, but he couldn't speak English, so they just moved us to another room.The breakfast was cereals, stale doughnuts and juice - I wouldn't bother eating there at all. Go across the street to the cafe deli shop which is open 24 hours.The rooms have paper thin walls, and can hear everything next door. When next door opened their door, our door shook and sounded like someone was trying to come into our room. I even heard someone going to the bathroom one night!!!One morning we were heading down stairs to go out and put the 'do not disturb' sign on our door. We ran into the maid on the way out, and she asked if we wanted our room serviced. We said no thank you and went out. When we got downstairs I forgot something in my room and my partner went up stairs to get it... He finds the maid at our door with it open?!?!?! I found that disgusting & very rude. Glad he got up there when he did in case she stole anything.The days we didnt get our room serviced, the maids got VERY angry and rude. They were very pushy. I know that is their job, but Im not letting people in my room who I don't trust.One day she asked if we we're leaving and then started cheering in the elevator. She was SO rude!!!The LIFT/ELEVATOR - slowest lift in NYC. There were broken tiles which my sister tripped on. And you would think that it would have a sensor if someone was getting in, the door wouldn't close on them? I started to walk into the elevator and instead of opening back up, it rushed towards me and closed, and have a terrible bruise on my leg.The staff are very rude and unprofessional, and not friendly at ALL.On the last day that we were here, we found out they charged us an extra $5000 on our card, on top of what we already paid!!!!!!!! They said the computer automatically charged it and would try and fix it soon. How many other people has this happened too????The ONE thing I liked about this hotel was the location, but PLEASE pay a little bit extra and go somewhere nice and professional.I was so excited to stay here from the great reviews, but NEVER, EVER EVER AGAIN.We have been extremely disappointed with our stay in NYC and cannot wait to go home.

We were also caught in Hurricane Sandy, but outside of the city by 250 miles. Had to make a reservation because the airports had closed. When NYC closed we could not make it into the city and thus could not make the reservation. We notified the hotel. Were told that the manager also did not make it into the city. They charged the reservation fee of nearly $200, and will not refund it, even though the circumstances were totally out of our control...and their's as well. I find them totally cold and heartless.

I arrived at 1 am from a long flight and they had given my room away even though I had a confirmed reservation. They wanted to put me in one of their other properties down on 23rd St. which was not convenient for me as my 7 am meeting the next morning was on 52nd. I ended up at the EconoLodge - certainly not what I booked. I will never book with these people again. They didn't seem to care that I had a confirmed reservation. They just filled the hotel with whoever showed up. Sucks to arrive and find that you don't have a room and nearly every other hotel in the area is sold out.

We ended up having an extended stay at this Hotel due to Hurricane Sandy -the staff were fantastic - extended our booking without a problem and really looked after us. The Hotel rooms are very comfortable, of a decent size and a bathroom with a tub. The Queen size bed is exceptionally comfy and afforded hubby and I really good sleep quality. Location wise, you could not ask for better - Times Square is a short walk away as are all the Broadway Theatres and 5th and 6th Avenue. Excellent Restaurants in the area - there is a great irish Pub across the road from the Hotel which provides top quality food and entertainment and is open till very late to cater for the night owls. Also nearby is a 24 Hr Deli which makes the most delicious sandwiches - if you have the midnight munchies this is the place to go. The Hotel provides free internet service and all rooms have WiFi. We would definitely stay here again and are happy to recommend the Hotel to fellow travellers looking for a good deal.

We recently stayed at this property for 6 nights. It truly lived up to our expectations based on previous reviews. Right in the heart of the Times Square area, it is very close to some good places to eat, the subway as well as some icons such as Top of the Rock and Central Station. Once we understood how the system worked we were very quickly able to head up and down town without any problems from this location. An older hotel, it still is very comfortable and we were happy to return there each evening. Our quiet room on the third floor was small but very clean. Whilst we had a window it faced looked down upon a very narrow alley, but we were hardly there so it did not matter. As far as price was concerned especially as it included breakfast, it could not be beaten. The staff at reception were very helpful and always very friendly.

This is not a big, glitzy showplace. It is a warm, comfortable place to stay while in New York. Literally (and truly) a mere hundred steps from the center of the world....Times Square. In the midst of the theater district (150 steps more or less to the TKS kiosk). Subway connections for up and downtown are within a block and a half. Next door to St. Mary the Virgin (Episcopal). And the rooms are more than adequate. The beds are really comfortable. The showers are hot. The staff members are friendly and helpful. The breakfast (6:30 to 10:00 AM) is more than adequate to see you on your way. We have stayed there a dozen times. And we shall return.

We stayed six nights with our 7 year old daughter . When we arrived we were greeted with a warm and friendly welcome. The hotel is a older hotel in a good location 1/2 block from times square and 3 blocks from the rockerfeller in the other direction. whilst the rooms were compact we were comfortable with large tv with various channels (mainly Disney for my daughter ) , iron , coffee machine , ipod docking station , nintendo , in room safeWe had a room at the back which did not have a view but was very quite.The breakfast room was small although they are increasing it in size soon . The breakfast itself was basic but adequate bagels , waffles , toast , eggs , sausage patty.The lift was slow as mentioned by others but not that badAcross the road was a 24hr store for snacks , drinks etc The hotel arranged a taxi back to kennedy for a flat $60For the price , location and facilities we think this hotel is perfect and would highly recommendand will use on our next visit to nyc

This was our first time in New York so was a little apprehensive about being in a safe area near to all the major sites but we needn't have worried,the hotel was about a one minute walk away from times square.It was clean and tidy with an excellent choice of food for breakfast the staff were all friendly and let us keep our bags in a safe place for several hours after we checked out.If every we were to come back to NY this would be our first choice.

Stayed six nights and everything promised was as advertised, clean, comfortable rooms, friendly staff, breakfast was good. Wifi was good, on 3 rd floor, the noise levels were low.We would return here, the location is excellent. Organized a flat fare ride to LGA. Herd to fault.Deli / food store across the road was handy. Close to Carmine's Italian restaurant, it was great. Havana Central bar / restaurant is close by and has $1.00 Empenadas on Tuesday from 4 -7pm.

This was our second time to New York City and this time we wanted something that would be a little bit closer to everything and accommodate four people. This is one of the only hotels in New York City that allows up to four people in one room, most will only allow up to three people.Well the location of the hotel is fantastic. It is just mere seconds away from the heart of Times Square and because there was four of us this was the best price for what we needed.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were not big but not too small either, just enough room for us all, it was what we expected it to be for a New York hotel.Each morning there was complimentary breakfast which had a great range of food. It definitely filled us up. It was great having that to start us off each morning. Tea and coffee were available all day long, so when we had come back from our adventures we could easily pick up a hot drink without having to buy one from a store. There was always a man standing in the lobby greeting everyone who walked in and helping them if they needed it.Our only concern while we were there was the elevator. It has a limit of five people at one time and as there was four of us there could only be room for one more person each time we used it. One day we were on our way to the lobby and two other people got in and then it the doors closed and it got stuck half way down. We only had to wait for about three minutes before one of the staff opened the door for us. They do have one sign stating that there is a limit of five people but if the elevator is full no one can see it because it isn't that big. My only suggestion would be is to put a bigger sign on the outside of each level so people can read it before they enter. We used the stairs from then on.The day we were leaving the staff organized a car service to pick us up for a flat fee, which was great.We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for a week in October. Having looked around and compared to other hotels in this area, this hotel provides great value for dollar. It isn't exactly cheap but nothing is in NYC. You'll have to adjust your expectations of a $300 per night hotel.Clean, nicely furnished. Rooms are a bit small but not as small as I had expected. Really accommodating staff. Helpful, cheerful. Some rooms at the front of the hotel are noisy but air conditioning provides a white noise that blocks out the other street sounds. Bed was too soft for our tastes. Breakfast was just OK and the breakfast room was always hot. They are, however, expanding this area and the lobby and improvements will be most welcome. Half lock. Of Times Square - well located, if that's the area you want to be in. Would use this hotel again if we were to return to New York.

At the first night we got small room with windows to big wallafter i talk with the front desk they change my room to better and larger room but a little noisy.the staff are very helpfulOverall not bad choice

Just stayed a few days at this nice 'boutique' hotel in the center of it all. Just a few steps from Times Square and our favorite theaters. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would absolutely stay here again.

This hotel is in the center of it all. Now I'll be honest we did so much in the city that besides sleeping and breakfast, we did not really spend a lot of time in the hotel. But the breakfast was good and the staff was nice. I do think the room could have been cleaner. But really you can not beat the location!

This hotel located just off Times Sq is perfect location for theatre buffs being right in the heart of the show district but quiet at night due to the windows facing inward to the adjacent building. Rooms are tiny but very well appointed. Breakfast is offered by an outside caterer and not that inspiring, paper plates and coffee/tea in a paper cup was average. Would definately stay here again.

We are all very happy how wonderful the service and very closed to time square about 2 minutes closed to everything. The room are very clean and clean bed and we were totally amazed. We sure will be coming back to this hotel.

This hotel has a truly excellent location -a 1 minute walk from Times Square and about 7-8 minutes away from the Rockefeller Center. It ıs located at about a 1 hour distance from JFK Airport and about 40 minutes from Laguardia. But its not only about the location: the hotel offers free internet usage in the lobby and a very good breakfast. The rooms, while typically NYC small, are comfortable and well-decorated. You have a coffee maker in the room and a largish TV with all major channels.But for me what stood out about this hotel was the staff-they were genuinely welcoming and helpful at all times (not always the case in NYC hotels). Ivonne and Juan on the reception desk were outstanding in terms of the level of assistance and interest they gave us. Some minor complaints: there is only one elevator (bear that in mind when checking out and at breakfast) . The breakfast room does get very, very crowded at times and is not air-conditioned. As far as I understood it, gradual redecoration and remodelling is ongoing around the hotel and so hoperfully these minor issues will be dealt with.Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel enough.Ifully intend to stay there again.

We certainly thought this hotel was well located and the staff were helpful and informative. All hotels in Manhattan are expensive and this was the one drawback but nowhere is going to offer a bargain.

Just returned from three days in the Big Apple. The Broadway at Times Square was the perfect spot for us.Just one block from Times Square, two blocks from the subway and short walking distance from theatres and good restaurants.Our room was clean, the bed comfortable and the free breakfast was more than adequate for a quick start to the day.Our AAA discount made it all the better.We will return.

Easy to find; so convenient to Times Square/Broadway! Arrived early(before noon) hoping to just be able to stow our luggage until check-in only to find our room was ready! Clean, comfortable and quiet room (6th floor). Very pleasant and helpful staff. Good breakfast offering. Definitely will be our choice when we return to NYC!

Great location and great price! However when we went to our room, it was being painted....so back down the elevator with all of our luggage we went. Waited about an hour in total in the very hot lobby to get a new room. New room had been painted earlier that day and paint was still sticky to the touch and the bathroom smelled terrible. Back down to the desk where we asked to speak to the manager. Rajini, the manager, was not very nice. We were only looking for a bit of good customer service so we could feel better about our stay. She made excuses, argued with us and was defensive and ultimately agreed she would rather lose our business than to make up our inconvienence in any way. Very poor customer service and had it not been for Jack, the concierge, we most certainly would have gone down the street to the Doubletree and paid more. Thank you Jack! You deserve a raise and/or promotion because you truly understand customer service. The room was small but cute and all we really needed for our short stay in NYC. This hotel could do very well under better management.

Room was way to small for 2 double beds. We had 4 people splitting the room and at times had to climb over the bed to get around. One morning woke up to no running water. Coffee maker didn't work and I asked them to fix or swap out with a good one. They did nothing. Phone in the room couldn't dial down to the front desk. Don't recommend this hotel at all.

We spend just one night but this is for the moment the best place we find in Manhattan! This hotel is near to time square. The room was very clean, and a bathroom inside, very clean too. Tv, video game... Even if you don't spend a lot of time in a room when you're visiting new York! Very good experience and best price: 280$ for 4 persons.

My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a "girls-get-away" in July and found this place to be a gem. The proximity to Times Square was amazing as it was literally just"around the corner." The bed was comfortable, the room was small but it is manageable with 2 people, breakfast was filling with plenty of choices for a light breakfast. The breakfast area is small and accommodates about 5 or 6 tables that seats 2-4 people per table. We usually had a quick breakfast and out of the hotel by 8a.m. We used our room just to sleep!Our room faced the street and my friend brought earplugs for herself and I did try wearing her extra pair but they always fell out so invariably I slept soundly without any earplugs . Tolerance to noise level is all personal. We both slept quite well with or without earplugs.I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff are friendly, hotel is good value for being so close to Times Square and it is very clean. I will not hesitate to return to this hotel in the future.

This was our first trip to New York, and we were really pleased we picked the Broadway @ Times Square Hotel! We were upgraded to a kingsize room when we arrived and it was comfortable and clean -- and we had no problems with noise. The hotel is in a great location, right next to Times Square and close to subway stations to get up or downtown easily. Breakfast was good -- although the dining room was small we never had to wait for a table, and the food was just right to keep us going til lunchtime! The hotel was very welcoming and we would recommend it to friends.

My suggestion - if you're looking for a GREAT hotel 1/2 a block from Times Square, be prepared to pay thru the nose... but if you're willing to accept an ADEQUATE hotel that close, then this is the choice for you! Rooms were clean... breakfast (included w/our deal) was surprising good including breakfast sausage, eggs, cereals, yogurt, fruit, etc... and the location - AWESOME!!! We came to the Big Apple for Broadway, and did it big-time!

The stay was quite good. Rooms are clean, though small. Beds are comfortable. The Breakfast room is an impertinence. It has maybe 30 square meters with 6 tables,meach serving 4. That is way too small for a hotel with more than 10 levels. It was always crowded and we had to wait for a table. The food was also not good at all, except for some apples and bananas. We skipped breakfast after our second day. The location is more than perfect! Only 100meters from Times Square! Staff was very friendly!

This hotel is about 50 meters from from Times Square (in between 6th and 7th Ave on 46th Street. It is a small little hotel with one tiny elevator with equally tiny but cozy rooms. We wouldn't have wanted anything bigger as we had no intention of spending a lot of time in the room.Our room faced an alleyway and as a result we could not hear a thing from the outside world. It was almost as though we were in a small little town with absolutely nothing going on at night rather than in the 'city that never sleeps'. The rooms were very clean and were maintained this way thoughout our stay. Linens, towels, soaps etc were replenished daily. Staff were unbelievably helpful, friendly, and accomodating. It might have been the best service that we have ever had staying in a hotel. Food was a bit of another story as the quality and variety was quite low. Although it was a free continental breakfast so I guess beggers can't be choosers! It was edible but not the type of food that you would expect from Bobby Flay's restaurant. Parking was a bit of a nuissance as it was at a location that was down the street (the opposite direction of the one way that we had already come down). The rate was reasonable considering it's downtown NYC. Make sure to ask if there is going to be a festival on the street the day that you intend to leave. We almost had to kill time until the end of the festival since the vendors were blocking the exit to the garage, however a very nice group of young guys agreed to move their stuff for us. Overall, an absolutely great experience and would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a central location that has good value, clean and safe.

This place is very centrally located, yes the rooms are small - but you're in NYC why are you staying in your room all the time?! Also has the slowest lift in Manhattan. Breakfast should be avoided at all costs. It's wildly overpriced and probably all bought from the local 7/11. The hotel claims a gym - this is not the case. They offer you a tiny room in a sister hotel a block away that has a treadmill and cross trainer. Not a gym by any standards. Stay here for the location, clean and perfectly formed rooms only.

Perfectly located near Times Square, about 100 meters, nevertheless very quiet. Nicely decorated and clean rooms with comfortable beds, a desk, a wardrobe and a cabinet. Modern and clean bath room. Breakfast included, simple but good. Very friendly staff. It was expensive, but reasonable for New York.

Great location, near Times Square. Clean, well kept rooms, with good beds. Modern bathrooms, also well maintained. Pleasant, helpful staff. Self-serve breakfast included. Rooms are small, but that's Manhattan unless you spend much more. We've stayed here several times. No problems.

I will always recommend this hotel for those looking for reasonably priced accommodation in Midtown near Times Square. The hotel room we stayed in was a bit small (just like some of the other accommodation in New York City) but you don't mind the narrow rooms for the price that you pay and the great service. You also get free breakfast (I would suggest going early as there is not enough tables when it gets busy). Overall a pleasant stay and very friendly staff, always able to assist. Note when going back to the JFK airport the hotel has a preferred Taxi for $45 and you welcome to tip him.

We checked into the hotel 5 hours early and were pleasantly surprised to find our room was ready. The room was very clean, modern, much better and more spacious than we expected. Considering its proximity to Times Square we were happy to find that it was not too noisy. The breakfast was great (bagels with cream cheese - yum!). We came down a little too late one morning, and the staff still invited us to help ourselves to breakfast. The toiletries in the bathroom were lovely, and the bed was so comfy. It was really close to the Rockefeller Centre, Radio City hall, and lots of other attractions. Bad points- If we let the door close too quickly on our way in or out of the room, the cover of the air conditioner/radiator would fall onto the floor and it was a little irritating putting it back on each time. Also, the elevator is really small, only fitting 5 people. Once, there were 6 people and the lift broke down. We found it was often quicker to walk up to the 4th floor than to wait for the lift.TIPS - we had the best biriyani (Indian rice and meat dish) at a food van near the hotel, on the corner of 46th St, west of 6th Ave.Must try if you like indian food.

I'll start off with the bad. A few days before check-in, they already charged us the deposit for one night's stay. Upon check-in, I should have looked more closely at the bill I signed because the guy at the desk charged us for the full amount--thereby overcharging us for one night. Later that night, after checking my bank account (which I am OCD about doing during travel), I came down to the desk and politely explained it to the new guy at the desk--not the same as the one during check-in. I think he said he was the "night manager." At any rate, he was super nice, immediately saw the problem, admitted the mistake. But then explained that, since it was the weekend, and the charge wouldn't go through for another few business days anyway, there was nothing he could do, but it would be fixed at check-out. He said this was a common occurrence, and that he had a whole stack of rooms that needed to be fixed in this way.And it WAS fixed at check-out. So the over charge was never taken out of my "actual" balance, it was just on "hold." But I still spent the entire trip just a little anxious about having less in my "available" balance than I should. All's well that ends well, sure. But come on, guys. How hard would it be to just not make this mistake to begin with?Okay, now on to the good! Fabulous location, as everyone has said. And again, great, attentive staff (with the exception of the guy at the desk when we checked in--he was nice, just should have double-checked what he was charging!). Our hair dryer practically exploded the second morning, and we flagged down the housekeeping lady in the hallway. She was super nice and got us a new one which we were able to use while we waited for the maintenance guy to come install it (and he did speedily!).Small room, but who cares? I'll take the super comfortable, giant bed over more walking space. (Hey, I slept on a guy's couch my first visit to NYC, so this was living, as far as I was concerned. A real bed! Our own bathroom!) Nice giant TV, nice view of the alleyway (again--if you want a parkside view, go the Plaza, kids). Good closet space, plenty of dresser drawers. I also didn't think the shower stall was as small as TripAdvisor had prepped me to believe. (First trip to NYC? Showered in an old-timey tub next to an open window in Brooklyn. Again, this is the life!) Fabulous free breakfast with superb donut variety in the morning. Also sausage, toast, cereal, juice, McDonald's-quality "scrambled eggs," and if you looked carefully in the little fridge: actual, hard-boiled eggs! Score!Altogether, a great hotel with really only a small speed bump, even if it was a completely avoidable speed bump. I would go again--just make sure they charge me the right amount at check-in!

Spent a couple of nights here while catching a show and a ballgame. The rooms are tiny, and have just enough space to maneuver around the bed to get to the bathroom, but the bed was comfy, and the room quite clean. Equivalent rooms anywhere outside of NYC would sell for $65, but this IS New York. Our room (507) was away from the street which meant absolutely no view, but the typical 24-hour street noise wasn't an issue either if you are a light sleeper.The Hotel is very convenient (500 ft) to Times Square, and [expensive] parking is directly across the street. There's also a church next door at which you can repent if your behavior falls out of favor during your visit. Free breakfasts consisting of eggs, sausage, waffles, OJ, coffee, cereal, bagels, danish and fruit are available each AM.

I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Broadway at TImes Square Hotel. The staff and doormen were all very friendly and helpful! Thank you so much! At all times there was a smile and good service, no matter how busy they were. This is very special. The room was very clean and functional. Also rooms are modern and renovated. Very small room though, no where really to put a suitcase, but I managed. I felt at home here and the airconditioning had no nasty smells. Of course the window type air con is noisy so it had to be turned off at night in order to sleep. The room did not get too hot, as was well insulated. Room was quiet too. I was at the back, so I had no view to speak of. Maybe ask for a front room.This hotel has a free breakfast so it get my 5 stars of excellence! Book this hotel, you will not be disappointed! Thank you to the helpful staff! I will come again.

Stayed at this awesome hotel conveniently located just off Times Square. Hotel was comfortable and clean. The air conditioner was a very much appreciated and the continental breakfast was an added bonus.Would recommend this hotel

I had booked at the The Hotel at Times Square of the same chain, which was cheaper, but they didn't have any water in the building, so after complaining I was moved to this one for the same price. The room was very small; it had windows that couldn't be opened and the view was a brick wall at about one meter away. The room was extremely hot but if you turned the air conditioner on the noise made it impossible to sleep. Even if you turned it off, you got noises from the other rooms (such as the toilet or the shower). They promised an iphone/ipod deck but it was for older, prehistorical versions of ipods, so it couldn't be used. The safe in the room was not working and they had to repaired it. Everything else was OK. Location was good, breakfast was simple but OK, there is a working business center and the staff was friendly and polite and helpful.

Out the door, and approximately 100m (if not less) to Times Square.. From the hotel, we also walked to Grand Central Station, Empire State Building, and even to Central Park.Rooms are slightly small, but very neat. Staff are very friendly and helpful - We went to Miami for three nights, and the hotel staff were more than willing to keep our suitcase of gifts that we bought, for us to collect on our return for one last night in NYC.Great place if you don't mind a small room.

Room was small but clean, the bathroom was a good size for New Yor. air con was great, the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a nice selection but get there earlier so as to not miss out. Had free wifi in room good speed didnt drop out. Location is fantastic the buzz of times square is a 2min walk up the street!

Just behind Time's Square so lots of places to eat and drink. Lovely staff who were happy to keep our luggage until 3pm after checkout as we had a tour and were incredibly helpful in ordering a shuttlebus to Newark airport. Clean and great location.

You can't beat the location if you're in town to do the tourist thing. Just steps away from Times Square and numerous subway entrances. The rooms were small and pricey, but that's New York. Breakfast was fantastic and the staff were really genuine and helpful. A great start to our trip to the states.

I was looking for a hotel for my teenage granddaughter and me, and came upon this hotel. It is a find...a small hotel (formerly Comfort Inn, I'm told) in Times Sq....easy walking distance to everything an aspiring theatre student could hope to see. The room was comfortable, the staff very accommodating, the price very reasonable (under $200 per night) AND it included a great buffet breakfast (not just bagels and cream cheese, but hardboiled eggs, yogurt, toast, sausage, fruit, cereal...you get the picture.). We shall go again and recommend it to our friends.

Good location. Room is small but clean and comfortable. Well worth the price. Nice staff. breakfast is good if unspectacular. Will get you going for the day. TV worked fine. Those problems seem to have been sorted. Only concern, faded lipstick stains on the in-room styrofoam coffee cups.

My wife and I have stayed in Manhattan on many occasions, but this time decided to try out the Broadway @ Times Square based on the favorable reviews in TripAdvisor. TripAdvisor is our bible when making hotel selections, but this time we feel that the rating was much too high.Broadway @ Times Square does have some redeeming factors. Its location is awesome. If you turn right out of the lobby you are only 1/2 block away from Times Square. However, it is also situated right next door to a shelter, so you have to pass by homeless people sleeping in the streets. Although NYC is heavily patrolled by police officers, it is a bit of a concern. Also, the hotel is surrounded by many restaurants, so when they place their garbage out the next morning it does tend to reek, especially since we were there during a hot spell.The rooms are exceptionally small, even by Manhattan standards. There was only one spot for a suitcase, so the other had to lie on the floor. The room was so small that the TV had to be placed on the wall to the left of the bed, so watching TV was uncomfortable. The wall in front of the bed had a spot that was not wide enough to place a flat screen TV because the air conditioner was one side and the door to the washroom was on the other.The cleaning staff were very good. They changed the sheets and provided towels every day. The one and only elevator is microsized and tends to take a long time to serve 9 floors. The stairwells are equally narrow. There is only one ice machine in the hotel, and it is located in the lower level. The breakfast room is right off the main lobby. It too is tiny. The breakfast fare includes cereal, donuts, hard boiled eggs, over easy eggs and sausages, as well bread, fruits, coffee, tea and juices. The sausages were horrid, the over easy eggs are pre-made and are chewy to eat. We bit into an apple and found it soft and brown.The hotel staff were nice, but their nerves were getting a little frayed since the air conditioning in the lobby had malfunctioned the whole time we were there.Don't get us wrong ..... the hotel is clean and situated close to Broadway. That alone makes it a suitable choice. We just don't agree that it is rated properly. We have stayed at much better places with lower ratings.

This was my first trip to NYC and I spent hours researching for the best location V's best price and this is the place! Literally no more than 300 meters from TGI Fridays its in the heart of where to need to be. We walked to Central Park (8mins) - Macy's (8mins) - 5th Ave (5mins) we even went a bit crazy one day and walked to Little Italy (60mins with coffee break) The breakfast was nice and incase you miss it like we did a few times there are plenty of places to grab something. Front desk was helpful and helped us with the subway stops and waited for us to check-in as we arrived at 1am (we rang beforehand to let them know our flight was delayed).Only minor down side was the a/c was loud and not having a refrigerator but there is an ice machine so that was good.Oh and after all the reviews I expected the smallest of smallest rooms but really not that bad. We utilized the draws by placing our clothes in there and storing the suitcases in the safe cupboard so that helped. We were there for a week from July 20th 2012.Fab location and would return!

I would highly recommend this place. I stayed here one night in August and it was perfect. The room was spotless, just big enough, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Didn't notice any street noise but did hear a couple of people come in at 2am (it was a Saturday night though, so I think you'd get that anywhere). It was really really close to Times Square, shopping and food. Couldn't recommend more highly. The price is really good considering its location - I did a huge check looking for a good deal and picked this one on rating, value and location. I was just thankful it was so clean too!

The number one perk of the Broadway at Times Square is its location. Located 30 seconds from Times Square's epicentre, the hotel is a great value for what it offers. We were transferred here after the Ramada East Side, one of its partner hotels, ran out of rooms and chose to honour our reservation at this hotel. The rooms are very small yet comfortable and clean, with a closet to store suitcases. Breakfast is included, which is a huge plus as it saves you both the time and money of getting breakfast in New York. Highly recommended option for a stay near Times Square.

My boyfriend and I recently stayed 4 nights at this hotel for our very first trip to NYC. We are more than satisfied! First of all, the bed was very comfortable (I'm pregnant so it was very important to me). We also got a free upgrade to a King size room (for the price of a Queen size room) which was nice! The room was larger than I expected (for a NYC hotel) and very clean. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. The breakfast included was great and had a lot of diversity (donuts, cereals, fruits, bagels, yogurts, juice, coffee etc) which I liked. One thing : our room was facing the street so it was a little bit noisy in the middle of the night.The location of this hotel is just perfect, being just a block away from Times Square ! So almost all the attractions were very near. We will definitely consider this hotel for our future trip to NYC!

My two granddaughters and I stayed one night and were very satisfied with the service, the cleanliness and the breakfast. We arrived early and was able to check-in at noon instead of waiting for 3:00pm. Our room was adequate and enough room for the 3 of us. The location was perfect; we were able to walk to all the attractions. We will be staying here again for our future visits.

Our room was quiet (at the back of the hotel) despite being close to Times square and the staff could not have been friendlier. We were also able to leave luggage with them for a whole day after we checked out which was helpful. There are definitely cheaper options but this was a good compromise between price and location.

Stayed here most recently for two nights in July 2012. This was my third stay at the hotel in the last three years and will always be my first choice when visiting NYCNot sure why the hotel has been re-branded (on previous vists it was a "Comfort Inn") but standards and VALUE FOR MONEY remain as good as everLess than half a block from Times Square, a quiet room (except for the aircon!) and all the facilities you would expect from a mid range hotel. Excellent complimentary breakfastSimilar hotels in this locality are all charging double the rates on offer here. I will be back!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We found the hotel very clean and quiet, especially considering how close it is to Times Square! It's out the door and 1/2 block down. Also within a close walk to subways, Rockefeller center, Bryant Park, etc. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hot breakfast was a great start to the day. We'll be back!!

This was our first trip to New York City and used Trip Advisor to assist us in finding a hotel. This hotel was everything we could have asked for... reasonable price, clean rooms, outstanding location as just a block from Times Square and friendly hotel staff. The rooms were a little small but who stays long in their room when in New York City? We never heard the outside noise from the streets or noise from the other rooms. Rooms had a window air conditioner which maybe blocked the noise but we liked it. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

So close to Times Square, it was a blessing and a curse! Great to walk out the door and be in Times Square straight away, close to the metro, broadway etc, but as its a city that never sleeps, it gets noisy when you want to sleep! I had a near top window floor but with the outside noisy and noisy a/c (it gets really hot), makes it difficult to sleep around 2-3am. Otherwise hotel clean and decent for its location.... Oh and take the train to airport if you leave in peak hour! Shuttle bus got stuck in Manhatten for like an hour trying to get out!
Very good location; staff was ok; breakfast was ok; price is high; room very small,but cleanAltogether we'd recommend it

The price and location is great. We were close to resturants we wanted, the theater we were going to near TImes Square. For our very short stay we can overlook the tv reception being non existent. The room was clean but on the small side. I would consider this hotel again.

Staying for our second time in NYC, my kids and I wanted to try a different hotel from last time. Like you, I went to trip advisor to look for well rated hotels with good prices. Last time,. we stayed at a nice hotel that was one subway stop from Times Square. This time, I chose to be closer to the action, even though some people complain about the noise level when you stay so close to the activities. Broadway at Times Square is located less than a block from Times Square, and I was VERY happy about our decision to stay at this hotel.Before I continue about the location, let me describe the hotel. The lobby had a nice sitting area with a window view. The breakfast area up front as well, with about 5 tables available. The breakfast had many options to please many people: yogurt, eggs, frozen waffles to heat, sausage patties, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, donuts, fresh fruit, and assorted danishes along with milk, coffee, apple juice, and orange juice. The donuts were replentished throughout the morning, which was nice. There was an attendant waiting to take trash, help with questions, etc. Very nice breakfast experience.As to the room...I know NYC rooms are small. We had a room with 2 doubles. Our room was at the end of a short hall on the second floor. We used the stairs most of the time, though the elevator was fast enough if necessary. And a smart feature, they said that there is only one double room on each floor, and because families usually book those rooms, they placed those rooms at the back of the hotel, so it is less noisy. To me, that is a planning team using their brains!The beds took up 87% of the room, but they were a good size! There was a night stand between the beds, a desk with a chair, a dresser, and a wall mounted flat screen TV. The bathroom was VERY roomy, which surprised me. There was a window sill in our bathroom which was large enough to place a small suitcase. Also, there was a closet with plenty of room to put out a suitcase, and a rack to hang clothes. The bath/shower combo had a good shower head, and the water was always as warm as I wanted it to be. And I have to add, I really liked the lighting in the room and bathroom. Some hotels don't have a central light in the room, but this one did, along with other lamps. The bathroom and room were clean and everything was as well placed as it could be! Because of the size of the furniture, you did have to turn a little to get into the bathroom. However, we LOVED the beds, so I was fine with sacrificing a little space to have a great bed. They were very comfortable and made for a good night's sleep. I only have a couple of complaints about the room, but they are small. First of all, the television was not getting many stations, and the stations they did get were fuzzy. When I asked management, they said they had lost good reception when construction started on a building nearby. They had already had a hotel wired for cable the week prior, but it had not been activated yet. My other complaint was about the location of the air conditioner in the room. It blew across the head of the bed, which made for VERY cool nights. The way the room was laid out, there really wasn't a way to put the air conditioner in a different location. I talked it over with the management, and they said with CORE coming in to redesign the hotel, they would make a note to look at that. Some nice features I haven't mentioned....The business office downstairs has easy computer access for internet, printing, etc, at no cost. The wireless internet in the hotel worked great, no complications, and the fact that it was free was a WONDERFUL bonus. I did not use the fitness room, but it appeared to have a couple of treadmills and bicycles. I can't say enough how pleased I was with the quality of this hotel for the price. I'm sure that the quality and service of this hotel are matched only by hotels that are much higher priced. The hotel staff was INCREDIBLE. They gave directions, answered questions, offered to arrange car services, just anything I needed, they were ready to help. My last comments about the location, I really enjoyed being so close to Times Square. It was also just a short walk to Rockefeller Center, Harold's Square, just SO many great places to shop, eat, and sightsee within a short walk. Though there are other hotels I could choose for my next visit to NYC, I can't imagine why I would look any further than the Broadway at Times Square. I know you will LOVE it, but just make sure they have a room for me when I need one!

...and am already looking foward to returning! This hotel has the nicest staff and cleanest common areas I have ever seen. Our room, although tiny, was very well-appointed and comfortable. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay near Times Square. Literally, it is located about four storefronts from THE "square".  The only drawback is the elevator. There's only one and it cannot hold more than five people at a time (or else it stops!). It moves quite slowly, and even slower during peak times. Our room was on the 3rd floor and we used the stairs more than the elevator.  Very quiet, very safe, very nice place!!!!

I was looking for an affordable hotel in Midtown Manhattan. When I saw all of the excellent ratings of this hotel compared with similarly priced hotels, I booked a room immediately, and I wasn't disappointed. Visiting NYC with my daughter looking at a college, so we just needed a room. Our room was very clean and the decor was up to date, we usually stay at Marriott properties and my daughter thought this was better than some of the Marriotts we have stayed in. If I stayed again, I would request a lower floor. We were on the 9th floor and the elevator is very slow and only holds 5 people. There is not much view from your window, but all you have to do is step outside and look over to Times Square, nearly across from the Marriott Marquis (where we have also stayed.) I would stay here again the next time I come to NYC. No complaints for the price and location. It is not the Marquis, but doesn't charge Marriott Marquis prices either.
Hotel is in fantastic location, 1/2 block from Times Square. Spotlessly clean. Decent breakfast included! Compared to other hotels close by, a real bargain

I hesitate to write a review because this little place was such a hidden jewel. Our room was small (to be expected in NYC) but clean and the bed very comfortable. The price for the location couldn't be beat. The only downside was one elevator to serve the hotel but that was a minor inconvenience. The complimentary breakfast was a bonus and the staff were very courteous. The hotel has a luggage storage room for use if arrive before or are leaving after check out which was very convenient. Would highly recommend this hotel.
Rooms were small and nothing special but locaiton was perferct. Price was good versus other hotels. Use window AC units that are loud.

This hotel was within walking distance of theaters, shopping, restaurants, and subway stations. It was clean, and the breakfast was decent, although it was the same things every day. Thank goodness we were only on the 3rd floor, because we used the stairs 90% of the time, as the housekeepers & cart or porter with luggage is maximum capacity. It was also pretty slow, as it is an old building. Sometimes the sink and tub would clog. (Occasionally solved by flushing the toilet-go figure). This hotel also has a car service to transport you to the airport at a reasonable price. Just make arrangements a few days before with the front desk.

Great location, and a really neat little [single] room.Nicely furnished throughout.Turn left and you've got a great choice of restaurants and stores; turn right and you're on Times Square within a minute.Can't wait to stay here next time (in a double room).

Apple Core has done a great job with this previous Choice Hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, great location, just steps from most theaters. Small room to be expected, but very clean- some bulky furniture issues, but 4 of us managed just fine-who's in their room much in NYC?

This was our first visit to New York City and to be so handily placed to Times Square was something we valued. Our room was comfortable and clean, wi-fi quite reliable, and the reception staff friendly and responsive when we had some issues with our in-room valuables safe. Given the great location and the price, we expected the room to be small, but as we were constantly on the go taking in the sights we spent very little time there and so it was no issue. The complimentary breakfast was an added bonus, and although the breakfast room was small, we had no real problem finding a table each day. I'd happily recommend it to other tourists wanting a very handy base for sight-seeing.

Yes rooms are small. Our room (500) had no view but was very quiet. A big bonus in NYC. I would have liked air conditioning to be a little quieter but it worked well. Excellent (for the price ie free) breakfast though a bit crowded. I understand they are planning to enlarge the breakfast room. Only real negative was the TV. Free high speed internet and free morning breakfast are two features almost non-existent in other NYC hotels. A nice flat screen set with horrible limited reception. We were there for the shows not tv. Saw 6 shows in 4 days, most within easy walking distance. TKTS booth is a block away. Would definitely return.

Upon arrival we were greeted by a very frendliy reception and in particular Jovannie he could not do enough for us from beginning to when we left he was outstanding. I travel and stay in hotels most weeks and this has it all, great location 2 minute walk to Broadway but surprisingly quiet rooms. Our room was clean and well equiped and everything works in the room. Breakfast was good hot and cold options and plenty of it. Stairs and lifts safe and well light. We used the luggage storage facility very handy and no problem. I would go back tomorrow we stayed for 4 nights perfect for getting anywhere you what too.

I stayed at the Broadway @ Times Square Hotel with my 10 year old for 6 nights. I asked for a quiet room when I booked and we were given the quietest room ever - we could not hear a sound except for church bells ringing in the distance and on one morning a pigeon that decided to perch itself on the outside window ledge next to the air conditioner! It was hard to believe we were so close to Times Square - we were on the 2nd floor in a room towards the back of the hotel so surrounded by thick brick walls. The room was suitable for our needs - whilst smallish (but all NY hotel rooms are small) we had enough room for our bags and space to walk around. Our housekeeper kept our room exceptionally clean and lovely even with all our stuff around the room. She lovingly placed my daughters stuffed toys at the head of the beautifully made bed. The only issue with the room was the airconditioner - it was very noisy when turned on - if you wanted it on during the night it might be problem - we didnt need it at night so it wasnt a problem for us. The bathroom was perfect - spotlessly clean, beautiful hot water with good even temperature control and good even pressure from the shower.The service from all staff and at all times was friendly, prompt and informative. They fixed the noisey fan in the bathroom even before I told the staff about it. The breakfast room staff was attentive to keeping pastry/bread/cereals always available and coffee full and freshly brewed. The room was always clean when we arrived for breakfast. We loved the complimentary breakfast (inparticular the pastries) - kept us going until lunchtime. The free Wi_Fi was excellent all the time - never any connection issues - completely reliable and fast and free!!It was the best location for Broadway musicals, Central Park, shopping (5th Ave), galleries and museums. We walked everywhere including home from shows at 10:30pm -people were everywhere. Restaurants & deli salad bars were cloase and subway stations were a few minutes walk away.This hotel contributed to a fantastic New York experience. It is amazing value for its location and for the amenities and service that it provides. I highly recommend it and would love stay again.

I had one night in nyc, and was travelling alone. The Broadway was perfect: small, clean room; great desk staff; and literally meters from the heart of times square. I wouldn't bring a large family or expect glamour or glitz, but to see a show, enjoy the sights, and explore midtown I cannot imagine a better option for the cost.

My friend and I were visiting NYC for the weekend. We just needed a room Thursday night and would be staying with a friend the rest of the weekend. For us this hotel was perfect, but it might not be for everyone:Short version: Great for travelers with premium on location/cleanliness/safety who just need a place to sleep and stash the suitcase. Moderately nice furnishings but that's personal taste, mostly.tldr:1) Location. It's very closed to theaters. We wanted to be close to theaters. Very, very convenient location wise if that's where you're going to spend your time. Also, not too far from other major New York attractions. 2) Room: Nice clean room. I didn't notice any problems for us HOWEVER it's very small and cramped and maneuvering to the bathroom between the bed and the desk could be an issue for someone with mobility problems. 3) Amenities: No problem with the internet for us. Breakfast was basic continental- nothing fancy. Lobby and other community areas were tiny so there may not be room for you, but you can take the breakfast back to your room, I suppose.4) elevator. we were on the 2nd floor so this wasn't an issue, but it seemed quite slow.

My daughter and I wanted to be close to the Theatre District but didn't want to spend a fortune on the room since that wasn't what we were going to NYC for. This hotel was perfect for our purpose. The location is great - just half a block from Times Square and surrounded by the Theatre District. The hotel was clean, the staff was pleasant, the breakfast was typical and decent enough and the room small but big enough. My only complaint was the air conditioner was set low back in a window knook thus the air was channeled more directly in front of the a/c and it wasn't able to cool the whole room as easily. In order for the person on the other side of the room to feel cool enough, the person sleeping on the side right in front of the a/c froze. Of course it was extremely humid & warm over Memorial Day and that might have had something to do with how well the window unit worked.Over all, Broadway at Times Square Hotel served our purpose well.

The Broadway at Times Square Hotel is the perfect hotel if you are planning on hitting the Broadway shows; the location is excellent. It is one block off from Times Square! The rooms were clean, although there were no windows in our room. We stayed in a room with two double beds and getting through to the well-sized bathroom was a bit of a challenge with four people. However, they had a good sized closet, nice clean room, comfortable beds, and the staff was extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful. There was a complimentary breakfast every morning, and it did the trick. I will definitely choose this hotel again next time I visit NYC.

We decided to stay here after reading such positive reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. This hotel is in a wonderful location and gives great value for money. The rooms are small, the views from the windows are not great, but everything is neat and clean. Our room was well appointed with a comfy bed, flat screen tv and modern decor. The bathroom was an adequate size. Breakfast was unexectedly good, with a reasonable selection of cereals, yoghurt, breads, bagels, hot dishes and fresh fruit. Tea and coffee are available 24 hours in the lobby.The staff were lovely. We arrived late at night, after a long flight from Bucharest. Due to noise from street construction, the receptionist immediately upgraded us to a superior room in a quiet location. We slept very well and recovered from our jet lag in no time!This is a reasonably priced hotel in an expensive city. We recommend it to others and would happily stay here again.

Positives:1. Excellent location: Located half a block from Times Square. TKTS ticket booth is right around the corner, where you can purchase discounted same day performance Broadway show tickets at 40 - 50% off. Also, close to tour bus starting points. Within walking distance of major Manhattan sites such as Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, etc. 2. Continental breakfast was included at no additional charge. We were offered the usual continental fare, plus sausage and fried eggs.3. Friendly, helpful staff.4. Room was clean and well appointed. Negatives:1. Room was small and cramped. 2. Our room faced a brick wall, so it contained very little natural outside light. 3. No refrigerator in room.Overall: Combination of location, price, nice staff, and good condition of rooms make this a quality option. Highly recommend.

Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. The location is fantastic - just around the corner from Times Square. The room was small with a view of a brick wall. However it had everything you could possibly need. The shower was very good, the room was clean and the bathroom was a good size. It also had free wifi which is a great plus. The breakfast was included and was good - more than adequate.

I have to say I wasn't sure I wanted to book a hotel that once was a Comfort Inn. But the price was very good considering NYC hotel costs. Turns out it was ideal for our weekend stay. Less than a block from Times Square, 4 blocks from Rock Center, Radio City, great shopping. The hotel itself is clean with super comfy beds in a "not as small as some" room. If there was a downside (and these did not bother us), the continental breakfast room is super small, the elevator really slow. No restaurant but with NYC having over 7000 you can certainly find places to eat, even on the same block. Staff is helpful and friendly. This little gem is across from a few theaters, a few doors down from a restaurant with good drinks and service. All in all another great NYC weekend for us! Try this hotel that bears no resemblance to previous Comfort Inns I have known.

For me, safety, cleanliness and price are the 3 most important things when it comes to finding a good hotel, and this one gets all those 3 things right! I just stayed there for 4 nights, and had a good time. It is a great location right in the middle of it all; I always felt safe; and the AC unit drowns out any possible street noise, so I slept very soundly. The room was tiny, but honestly when visiting NYC, you are usually just in your room to sleep so that was fine with me. Same goes with the bathroom--small but offered everything I needed. My 2 complaints are about the electronic amenities: 1, Yes, there is flat screen tv, however, we only got about 5 channels and all of them were blurry and mostly unwatchable. 2, there is no WiFi, even though the website and the hotel will tell you there is. Trust me, there isn't. I brought my laptop and everything, and I was even willing to purchase WiFi had it not been free. But it isn't offered at all because the free WiFi is always "down" according to the front desk. It's not down, it just never works. False advertising. Fortunately, the other perks of the hotel made up for that fact, and I just went to Starbucks when I wanted to access the Internet. I probably won't stay there again because of that, but that's just because I like to have Internet access.

We booked a King Room and got confirmation for it. Requested a specific type of room. Called a couple days before arrival at hotel to confirm and told them we would be arriving later in the afternoon. They confirmed King room requested.Imagine the disappointment to find they had given the exact room we did not want - queen size, window looking directly onto wall, tv on side of bed.Result - had to spend first 24 hours in New York living out of suitcase until we were able to move rooms.Found this very unprofessional. The hotel should understand the repercussions for their guests caused by such occurrences.

Excellent location with awesome staff always on hand to help you out. Good continental breakfast. Rooms on small side but clean and have all that you need. Was warm in room and air con noisy so did not have on at night may be worth checking in the room when you check in but would not effect our stay. First class service from Yvonne and sideibi and all other front desk.

Service at the hotel was great from the moment we checked in. We received a free room upgrade not to mention that the hotel is located in the perfect spot right on Time Square. The free morning breakfast was better than we expected and everyone was very nice. They took care of our luggage after check out while we enjoyed the last few hours of our trip in the city. Thank you so much!

My review is more or less like other reviews that praises location, spacious rooms, and the free phone calls. The only con for me was that I had to go around the block twice trying to find the old name (Comfort Inn) till I,..u know the rest I guess.

I have stayed at most of the Apple Core hotels and like the others, the Broadway is conveniently located, reasonably priced, clean, and comfortable. This one is perfectly located for a theater trip. It's right around the corner from the TKTS booth where you can buy discounted tickets to a variety of hit musicals and plays. If you walk east, you're just a few blocks from Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center. Be prepared for a very small room and bathroom. This is NYC and every square foot counts, but you will not spend much time in your room with so much to do nearby. We were out late pretty much every night and slept in (we got an inside room so it stayed dark and there was no street noise). There is only one elevator, so you might want to get a room on a lower floor. Internet is free, bed was comfortable, and water pressure in shower was great. It's not fancy, but if you want to have a fabulous time in NYC and not spend a fortune, this is the place for you.Note that the restaurants in Times Square are pretty pricey. Venture a few blocks away and try some of the local diners and delis for reasonably priced, tasty food. We've already booked our room for Christmas. You simply cannot beat this location and price. Thank you Apple Core for making trips to NYC affordable and enjoyable!

excellent location, good value for your money. Don't go to the Brazilian Restaurant next door, food taste terrible and drinks are over charged. Trhere are many good eating places around the area. Hotel front desk staff are very helpful if you ask for information.

Right in the heart of Times Square yet set back just enough to get a good nights sleep!The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was certainly a bonus and, although I just had my normal cereal, there was a varied choice of hot and cold food for the bigger appetite.My room was comfortable, very clean, and plenty of storage. Also was impressed with the safe in the room which saved the hassle of carrying valuables around.All in all a very good time was had and I will certainly visit again.

The location of the hotel was great, really close to Times Square! And the staff was wonderful, they were nice and always ready to help.On the other hand, rooms were small and the breakfast was not nice, the was too artificial. Plus, the breakfast room was tiny, there wasn't enough space for all guests. But what bothered me the most was the cab service to the airport. I used it twice as not everybody in my family was leaving at the same time and I had completely different experiences. The first time I had a nice driver that posed no problems at all. But the second one was rude (he dropped my suitcase on the ground before putting it on the trunk) and also tried to charge extras for the ride. When I told him that I had paid part of the amount to the hotel (something the hotel requests when you book a cab), he told me that I did not have to pay anything to the hotel and I would have to pay the full amount in cash to him. As I refused to pay and said that I would call the hotel to discuss about this he used an ethnic slur and left.Although this person was not an employee of the hotel, the cab company was referred to me by the hotel and everything was arranged by the reception desk, so I think that the hotel is partly responsible and that they should be more careful when choosing their partners.

I booked this hotel in Oct for a May trip. Because I am not familiar with the area I asked for a room with a view. I was told that some of the rooms had great views and you could even see Times Square. A few days before our trip I called the hotel to inquire about something unrelated and was told that the hotel has no views except neighboring roof tops. I was so disappointed but we kept the reservation because it was too late to change the reservation and we were only sleeping there.In all honesty, this hotel is the perfect location. It is within a block or two of Times Square, lots of restaurants, lots of shops and the theatres. We walked to everything. The hotel was nice and the rooms were a little small. Honestly we had a room in the "03" stack and we were satisfied. The beds were very comfortable, appeared clean and the bathroom was actually pretty big. (for NYC that is)The breakfast was okay- yogurt, fruit, toast, bagels, cereal, frozen waffles etc. The area was clean with a few tables and chairs. Overall it was an average hotel and I would stay there again for the location

I stayed in May with my wife and 5 year old daughter. Wow. What a deal. Location is excellent and room was just enough to make the trip a great one. In room 508, we were in the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. My daughter even caught a mid day nap between the Statue of Liberty and the Lion King. Staff was friendly and breakfast was perfect. Cable tv seemed not to work but we didn't use the tv at all. If you're on vacation and want to get around NYC, this is a great option. I'll stay again for sure before I even look elsewhere.

This is not the Ritz -- but it IS a small, very friendly, reasonable hotel exactly where I want to be: half a block east of Times Square. My room on the 4th floor looked out on an air shaft -- meaning very, very quiet (apart from the pigeons). The sole elevator holds just five people, so sometimes slow to arrive (and unpleasant for strollers) -- but from the 4th floor, a quick walk down the stairs. The included breakfast is like a Hampton Inn but with better coffee. All the front desk staff are very pleasant and helpful, but a special thanks to Julio and Giovanni. I've been coming to New York for 20 years to go to the theater, and this is by far the best hotel overalll -- for the price -- I've ever stayed in. I'll be back.

The big plus for this hotel is that it is only a few steps from Times Square and a reasonable price for NYC. It was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. We had a faulty safe in our room and we were moved to a nearby room without any problem. The breakfast was was very good and included some hot items such as eggs and sausage patties.

location- as it says- times square. you are next to evrything, you can enjoy by walking to everywhere, if its to the central park, rockefeller building, shopping, shows or you can use the subway just around the corner. the hotel is very clean, free and good wifi accessall over, free calls in the usa, very nice and helpful stuff, we needed to do late check out and it wasn't a problem, you can also leave your bags in the luggage room.they can receive packages for you from ebay etc' while you are staying there.free offee / tea all day. they gives discount vouchers to most of the attractions in ny. we stayed the first night in the 4th floor and for the next day they moved us for a better room on the 7th floor.i recommend this hotel with no second thoughts.

The best part of this hotel is certainly the location, however, that is not the only good part. The staff was very friendly when we checked in, always smiled and said hello whenever we came and went, and was eager to assist us with storing our luggage or getting a taxi when we checked out. The room was a great size for NYC and was very clean and comfortable. It certainly was not very luxurious but perfectly suited our needs and had clearly been recently updated. The elevator was a bit slow and rickety, but in an older building I think this is to be expected. I felt very safe during my stay as there was always someone at the front desk, no matter what time we returned to the hotel. We did not take advantage of the breakfast either morning, but I did appreciate the free hot tea in the lobby as I had a bit of a cold during our stay. The free WiFi in the room was also very convenient. The location is amazing, less than a block away from Times Square. We were in NYC to see a play and were only a 5 minute walk from the theatre. Overall, I think that this hotel offers a great value for the money and I would stay there again as well as recommend this hotel to others.

Our stay could not have been better. All the staff were very accommodating. We are afforded an early check-in and a late checkout. The room was very clean. The mattress was most comfortable and the pillows were plentiful. The breakfast had everything needed to get a quick start on the day. The proximity to Times Square was ideal.

Good-valued hotel just off Broadway. Room was on the small side, which was no big deal, since the bed was huge and very comfortable. The AC was rather noisy, but once you shut the radiator off from its full blast, there wasn't much need for it. Nice clean bathroom. TV reception was a bit shaky, but the free WiFi more than made up for this. The smallish breakfast room got rather crowded at times, but the selection offered (bagels, toast, cereal, yoghurt, coffee, juice, eggs, fresh fruit) was enough to keep you going until lunch. All in all a pleasant experience, and the location can't be beaten.

The room was pleasant and the breakfast just fine. But it is the location that makes this hotel remarkable. You step out the door, and TImes Square (and the TKTS booth) is a half block away. I just hope they don't go crazy with the pricing and make this hotel out-of-range for us regular non-business travelers.

This place had the important things I look for in a hotel completely right - excellent location, nice bed and sheets and a good shower. In addition there was free wi-fi which was a great bonus, it was also surprising quiet to outside noise.Minus points - very noisy air con (you definitely couldnt have it on all night), we were in room 909 which had a view of a wall and an office window which was about 3 metres away! Far too much furniture in the room, rooms were small (but managable) but it could have been so much better if they got ride of a couple of pieces of furniture. There was a lovely girl who checked us in and out but all the other staff weren't friendly at all - really surprised about that. Breakfast was ok, but really there are so many great places to eat why would you have an average breakfast?I would recomend it for location, bed and the shower.

This hotel has changed its name since our last visit - but it is still the same excellent quality hotel. Once again this hotel is an amazing find - . As close to the heart of times square as you can get, with good service, very good accomodation and at a reasonable price for New York. What has improved is that the breakfast is better - the hot option of hamburgers and fried eggs is a nice touch. The breakfast room is small but we were told they are going to make a bigger area out back. This place will be top of our list of places to stay when we next visit.

The hall/entrance of the hotel is very poor, it looks like a very cheap pension, which is a pity because our room was okay in size and decoration.Very bad was the fact that the name of the hotel has changed, it's not "Comfort Inn Hotel" anymore, now it's "Broadway @ Times Square Hotel", so we couldn´t find the hotel. The taxi driver was very helpful, phoned the hotel twice until we finally found the place. Please pay attention to this fact.
Great location. Staff were very helpful. Only complaint is the room was so warm and had to leave the air-con on which was fairly noisey. But for location it is perfect. Highly recommend it.

If you are a theater aficionado then this a location that can't be beat! Clean rooms, nice staff, and reasonably priced! Broadway at Times Square Hotel used to be a Comfort Inn. We have stayed here 3 times, and I am leaving a review as the they have left the franchise and are now 3 or 4 hotels in the NYC area under the Apple Core hotels. They are updating the lobby of the hotel soon, so if you do choose to stay you might want to call, and check to see how much noise you might encounter. Our last visit was last year, and the desk clerk greeted my husband by name...that's great customer service.The hotel is clean and less than block from Times square, and the TKTS Discount Ticket Booths for Broadway and Off Broadway shows. The rooms are small, but clean. I really don't care too much about the size as we don't spend any time in the room anyway, but the bathrooms are decent size. We had a king bed, but truthfully the room we had was not family friendly. It worked for 2 people, but no room for a crib or to move around the bed. The pillows are my only complaint....small and no support! Beds are very comfortable.Not big breakfast people, we grabbed a bagel and coffee in the morning, but they do serve a breakfast buffet with the room price, but it's nothing fancy. Head towards 6th ave away from Times Square to eat cheaply.You can walk to Times Square in less than a minute, and to any Broadway theater in less than 5 minutes. Restaurant row is a 10-15 minute walk, and 10-15 minutes depending on the crowds on the sidewalks you can get to Macys in Heralds Square to shop floor after floor. There are many small restaurants on 6th for quick inexpensive meals, and 46th has many quaint taverns to visit. Havana Central is just a few steps away with good cuban food and the mojitos are the best! 4-7pm is happy hour M-F and Mojitos and other drinks are half price!Blue Fin Bar and Restaurant is fabulous less than 5 minutes away in Times Square. Just across from the Blue Fin is TKTS Discount Ticket Booths for Broadway and Off Broadway. You can get in line for half price or discounted theater tickets, and the line moves quickly so don't get discouraged if the line is long. There is a Catholic church next door, and the sounds of the bells ringing occasionally were the only noise we ever heard, and it was not loud or bothersome. *free WiFi Internet access*Computer room & free printing of boarding passes or faxing*free phone calls nation wide*nice fitness center*safe in room*iron & board*coffee maker*hair dryer*personal shampoo, soap and lotion

I went to New York for a short trip with my new family, hoping for a great adventure and worried about what all might go wrong. This hotel was just right - the price was among the lowest, the location made things easy, the wifi worked, the rooms were small but with comfortable beds. There were six of us, so we got two rooms with two double beds each - rooms 308 and 408. Their location was at the very back of the hotel, and very quiet. The only outside noise we ever hear inside the rooms were the church bells from next door, which were not too early. We walked easily to Rockefeller Center and all over Times Square, and used the 42nd St. subway station which made for an exciting walk. The hotel staff were very kind and friendly. This trip was an important first for us in so many ways that I was so happy and just plain relieved that we had a good place to stay where the people treated us well.The breakfast was popular with the girls because they offered donuts with chocolate icing and sprinkles, besides the usual danishes and breads. The breakfast space was small but not painfully so, and some people would eat on the chairs in the little lobby. The elevator was slow and there is only one but we were walking everywhere all the time anyway.What we needed from a hotel on this trip was exactly what we got - a friendly comfortable place to rest and reload between our adventures in the big city.
nice location, room clean (small but confortable). The breakfast is terrible.Good for single and couple

This hotel for the money was a fantastic deal. It is located 1 block off of Broadway and Times Square. Complimentary breakfast, free internet and workout room. Staff very helpful.
