Stayed in room 903 in a king size bed. Room was located not on street side so it was a quiet nights sleep. Had a window with nice view. If you are going to NY City to be out and about this location can't be beat. Will definitely stay here again.

Our 1st time to NYC. We loved the location of this place,so close to Time's Square&Rockefeller Plaza.Clean,friendly.decorated nicely.The people at the front desks were very nice&informable. Geovonni&Sammie. Were 2 of many.They were always cleaning the food room where you eat. The guys were so great about brining our luggage in&out especially since you had to park your car&leave it for your length of stay,but it was the cheapest rate to leave your car there since you got a discount for being at the hotel. Like $28.00 a day instead $48.00 or something like that.Very nice hot&cold selections for breakfast. We walked straight up to Rockefeller Plaza/Studio 1-A every morning in time to catch live taping of the Today Show with time to spare.Only complaint was tv went out our 2nd day there they said due to theyre direct tv. We had to go from Thursday to Saturday&the rest of the hotel had to wait until Monday they said until they switched back to cable. They gave us a free-movie,but couldn't hear it. It was a &17.00 movie.(Tinker,Tailor,Spy. There wasn't too many to pick from) I picked the room,because Iam disabled with pain&need to rest my back so it was a pain not having a tv. Also the cell-phone calls always dropped in the room. The hotel is nice,but like almost everything else it's wedged in between other buildings. I would of like a discount on the 3-nights we stayed with out the tv that was one thing I looked forward to. Only tv we saw was at the Today show.. I'll have to make the call to the manager I was told our last day to do about it. So other than that. It was great.Used to be The Comfort Inn At Time's Square.

Overall, a very nice hotel. Excellent location to Times Square, which is 1/2 a block away. I always felt safe, so worries. The lady from housekeeping was very sweet, and was always smiling. We stayed in room 708, which did not have a view and very dirty windows on the outside, but hey, it is NYC. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

We stayed here for 5 nights and were very happy with this hotel. The room, while a bit small, was comfortable. What we valued most was the prime location and the surprisingly reasonable price. Breakfast was average. We will stay here again when we return to NYC.

The location was just perfect! Steps from Times Square, great restaurants (some very good ones across the street!) and the center for excitement. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby was very pretty. The elevator held no more than 5 people (think European elevator) and the wait was long during top peak times. There was a business center and an exercise room. The rooms were very small. The desk chair was almost impossible to use because of lack of space between the desk and bed. There was an oversized cabinet on the opposite side of the room that used to house a minibar that was now empty and the doors could not be opened because of the bed. That is where the tv was located so you had to look at it sideways from the bed. The room was clean. There was no street noise in our room but noise from doors in the hallway and people talking. There was a breakfast served downstairs.

We were very happy with our stay the Broadway at Times Square hotel. The rooms and bath were nicely updated. I would recommend this for even longer stays. Although the room itself was small the bath was spacious and it had a nice big closet to store your bags out of the way. One complaint from my husband was that the TV was not at the foot of our bed, it was off to the side. We stayed for only one night on the 9th floor so it was very quiet, no one above us.The breakfast was quiet satisfactory as well, especially since it was included in the price.

My boyfriend and me stayed two nights in this hotel. Overall our experiences were positive: our room was clean and surprisingly silent, equipped with coffee/tea machine. The WiFi connection was reasonable and there was a "business center" where you could print boarding passes, tickets, etc. We had to stay an additional night in NYC, unfortunately this hotel didn't have any available rooms, but they allowed us to stay there and use their facilities (dining area, printer) until we could go and check in in another hotel. And when we checked in to that other hotel (which was basically just across the Times Square and where the price was almost double), that's when we really started to appreciate the Broadway@Times Square - smelly hallways, paper-thin walls so noise from the street and also from the neighboring room, far from perfect cleanliness.Next time I need to travel to NYC I will definitively try to stay at Broadway@Times Square Hotel.

Excellent hotel. Very clean and VERY friendly! Free wifi throughout hotel with 2 lobby pcs with printer free of charge. Free continental breakfast. 1 minute walk to Times Square! Tons of restaurants! Cheap eats everywhere. O'Briens Irish Pub directly across with a great baclony with outdoor seating! Minar Indian accross the street too! Just around the corner is Cranberry Cafe, open 24 hours with Hamburgers, sandwiches, all for under $6! This hotel also has fitness center and you can hear the church bells from next door! Will definitely stay again!

I booked here for a last minute business trip through bookit.com. Base rate was $135/night plus taxes and fees for a total of $165/night. For a last minute trip and a Times Square location, that's a good deal if the hotel is decent, and it was.The room was small and efficient as expected for this price. It was a bit dark which made it seem smaller. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The steam heat was pumping out and needed to be turned down, but it's better than freezing! The closet was small, but there was plenty of bureau space. 32" lcd tv worked well, the iHome iPod clock player was a bonus, individual led reading lamps on the head board was a nice touch and the work desk had power in easy reach.There was no view from the rooms unless you were right in the front or right in the rear. The benefit was that it was quiet until the bells on the church next door started to ring at 7:45am.WiFi access was free and there was complimentary breakfast each morning. I didn't partake in the breakfast due to schedule, but I checked it out and they had a good spread of fruits, yogurt, muffins, waffles, etc (continental plus) that would satisfy most people's quick breakfast requirements.If you aren't going to spend a lot of time in your room lounging, then this would be a great hotel to consider.

We stayed as a couple for 3 nights. It is a Queen bed room. Room size is smallish with 2 side table, a writing table and a chest table with TV. They should have removed the writing table to make more room for luggage. Nevertheless, there is just enough space for a trolley bag and a 2ft x 3ft luggage which is good enough for us. Bathroom is basic, clean with strong cold/hot shower without dental kit. Windows in our room facing a wall. Location is fantastic, just 3 min walk to Time Square. The front desk staff is not friendly nor courteous at all. Also for some reason throughout the night, you can hear sounds of someone hitting a steel bar 'ting ting ting...' on and off which may be disturbing for light sleeper. Other than that, it is a comfortable and affordable accommodation around Time Square.

We had to be in this area and didn't want to spend a fortune in accommodation, so we got a room in this hotel. We were traveling with a baby and even though at first they told us they didn't have cots when we got there they gave us a crib (safe, sturdy, perfect).On the positive side, the location was very good (just a few meters from Times Square) and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Also they offer free wireless which is not always the case and I really appreciated.On the negative side, the room was quite noisy ... despite the fact that we were on the 9th floor (I can't imagine what the rooms on the first floor must be like). Breakfast was not very good either. But overall, I'd say if you bring earplugs this is definitely a very good choice!

arrived and was upgraded to king size room, staff quick to answer or help with any questions. great location, so close to times square handy for all the restaurants - definitely a tourist spot but was why we were there. adaquate breakfast, quiet hotel with all facilities we needed, loved free wifi. an older hotel but very clean. did notice the occasional church bell ring but not in sleeping hours so did not bother us and could not hear if tv was on. great value for price and being nyc and all, would definitely stay again. staff arranged car service for us on the day we left which was great as car was waiting for us when we returned to pick up bags, removed alot of stress for us. thank you for a great stay, eased our nerves about being in a big city.
Average,Generic,Dated, European pakage deal hotel.Good Location is its best quality

perfect location very close to Times Square.and all theaters The King room is roomy enough for a couple. No charge for any US calls(continental US)is definitely something no other chain has.I like their continental breakfast but not enough room for all on a weekend. The was no heat control in the room which affected my sleep.it was too warm for me. I should have asked the front desk but didn't.

Stayed two nights at this little gem of a hotel in mid-February. Can’t beat the location. Walk out the door to your right and you are half a block from Times Square; turn left and you are just a few minutes from Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and Radio City. I felt safe coming and going at all hours of the day and night. The room, while very small (which is the norm for NYC), was clean and comfortable. Bed was quite comfortable. The breakfast room is small but the offerings more than adequate – bagels, toast, donuts, cereal, yogurt, sausage patties & eggs, fruit juices. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

I booked this hotel for 1 week for my parents. The location was great (just off Times Square) and right in the heart of everything but at the same time quiet. Good choice of places to eat around the hotel too. The room was small but that didn't really bother them. Not a lot of natural light in the room but this was understandable being a skyscraper. The people on reception were hardworking and friendly (except for one guy). There was an ATM in the hotel, vending machine for soft drinks, ice maker in the lobby, breakfast room which was buffet (6.30 - 10). Breakfast room was a little small. Variety of cereals, breads, rolls, cakes, yoghurt, fresh fruit, waffles, bagels etc. Tea and coffee available all day long. Breakfast room was clean and well maintained and staff were very friendly.

I recently stayed here with family. We were pleased with the hotel, which offered a decent value in a very good location. The rooms were clean and comfortable for 4 adults (two queen beds). No frills, but none were expected. Good base camp for exploring the city.

Good clean hotel 2minutes from times square we paid 900 pounds for 4 nights in december a little expensive for the hotel but it was clean.rooms are small me and my husband 2 kids we stayed on the 8th floor lift never a problem for us breakfast was ok to start you off the staff was nice no problems.

The location of the hotel is unbeatable being situated at little brazil street and times square, madamme tussauds, planet hollywood etc all just a short walk away. It was our first visit to NYC hence we selected this hotel. Food locations aplenty and subway stations highly accessible.There is a complimentary continental breakfast every morning which I find very useful as we did not had to look for other breakfast spots instead could simply have breakfast and get ready for sightseeing in the big city. Boiling water source is also readily available with coffee/tea/milk etc.Room for improvements are definitely the elevator which many have already pointed out is painstakingly slow especially if you are on a higher level floor and possibly any safety risks associated with it which I feel is of high importance. The price I felt was also a tad high relative to the size of the room, leaving very little space to manoeuvre around the room. The front of desks staff are rotated whereby some were very friendly others indifferent.In summary, if you new to NYC and would like a highly accessible location this hotel is recommended. If you are a seasoned visitor and know your way about the city perhaps you could be adventurous and try others from the lower manhattan neighbourhoods.

Great place to stay with Times Square just at the end of the street and yet far enough away to get a good nights sleep.The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the price was good value.Breakfast room is very tight most of the time with a need to queue for a table at peak times. The family bedroom was clean but very small and we needed to be very creative with luggage being stowed on windowsills in bathroom and bedroom as there was no where else to accomodate it.Would definitely stay there again, as it's so convenient and friendly

The rooms were good but the person at the front desk was not that helpful. The parking was very expensive. Of course very nice location close to time square and food in the NYC area. I stayed there for my friend's bday and was overall a good experience.
What a gem of a hotel in Times square. Staff are fantastic, the rooms are very clean and its close to the main husstle&bussle without it getting in your way. Would recommend to anyone.

We are big fans of boutique hotels, especially those in the Comfort Inn family. This quaint and charming property just down from Times Square in the Big Apple is no exception.A tiny, but well furnished and neatly arranged room, looks out on NYC rooftops. You can see the flashing of the monster lights from Times Square off to the left. But neither the lights nor the sound from the bustling city below are an issue. You will have a sound sleep here in a large queen-sized bed with a comfort-top mattress and soft pillows. The room feels cozy; it is extremely clean, and the staff keeps it clean.There is a small closet complete with an ironing board and iron. The bathroom is tiny, but it does the trick. And the shower is pleasant with plenty of hot water.Lots and lots of electrical connections and the Internet is FAST and FREE. The FREE breakfast is simple, but offers a little something for everyone from pastries to protein. The elevator is so tiny and so slow that it grows on you. Gives you time to make up jokes as it ascends. The staff is extremely friendly and security is always at the front door. There is a handsome Irish pub directly across the street.The hotel is amazingly well situated...close to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, David Letterman's theatre, Times Square, the Fashion District, dozens of theaters (a few minutes walk away), and the subway. Price is more than fair...we booked through Priceline. Would we stay here again? Yes, again and again and again.

As is typical with a lot of the older hotels in downtown NYC this hotel has steps at the entrance. There is no other way into the building. They do offer a portable ramp but it is so steep that to use it would be hazardous and dangerous. The staff is most helpful and tries to accommodate as best they can. But if you are in a wheelchair I would go elsewhere.

This was our second stay: this is a nice, clean hotel with an excellent staff. The rooms are on the small side, but I've been in smaller rooms than this in NYC. There is only one little elevator, and it is very slow.I had two problems with our mid-January stay of four nights, unfortunately. The room was uncomfortably warm! I called the front desk about it, and apparently, there is no way to adjust the (steam?) heat in the rooms. I had to run the window air conditioner full-time, and it didn't work well. They sent a maintenance man to address the situation while we were out and about, and whatever he did to the ineffective old A/C unit made the temperature passable, but just barely. His help kept us from changing hotels, which I had already begun looking into. Sorry, but I need to be able to have some control of the temperature when I need to sleep.The other problem was out of the hotel's control. After late nights, we were awakened at 7:00 am by very loud noise in the street by a workers strike at the hotel across the street. They blew loud whistles, clanged huge bells, and shouted continually. Sleeping was impossible, but again, the staff was helpless here.All in all, it added up to a less than perfect experience at what could be a really nice little place. Still, Yvonne at the front desk was wonderful, and did everything in her power to be helpful. But if you can't sleep in a hot room, you might want to look elsewhere.

New linens, flat-screen TVs, nice big breakfast. For the price, this is a great option. Literally a 1-minute walk from Times Square. Very friendly staff. We stayed in the winter, and the radiator was a little loud, but kept us warm all night. Pretty small room, but it's NY, for goodness sake. Bathroom was actually surprisingly big enough. I will definitely stay there again.

We spent one night here with my family and the people there were very cordial and helpful. We only stayed one night but the rooms were nice, clean, small but that is NYC. Great location we walked and took the subways to get around. There is a parking garage right across the street. They had. A continental breakfast, which included waffles, biscuits and gravy, and the regular stuff. The hotel staff kept our luggage while we were out and about, no charge.

This is my 2nd stay at this hotel. Love the location - one block from just about everything and Times Square. Room was ready and very clean. We stayed on 9th floor and my only complaint is elevator is kinda slow. I'd rather stay on 4th or below so I could use stairs. Breakfast is very good with eggs' sausage, bagels, doughnuts and 24 hour coffee. U r half mile from Penn station for Amtrak and we hoped on subway and were at ground zero in half hour. Definitely stay again

The comfort Inn was a real surprise to us. Booked because of location and price. Small but very comfortable rooms. Suggest rooms in back of hotel because of busy street out front. Great location, friendly staff, nice continental breakfast. What more could you ask for.

My boyfriend and I stayed here the week of thanksgiving, and I have nothing bad to say really, yes the room was small but hey who sits in there hotel room in NYC?! The shower was really powerful and the bathroom was clean, there wasn't a view but we were out in the city and didn't wanna stare out of a window anyway!! The breakfast was included and had so much choice, we were really pleased with it, and to top it off we walked literally 30 seconds and were in times square! The staff were all friendly and we would defiantly stay here again!!

I was scheptical when we arrived but pleasently surprised at how wonderful this hotel was. It is 2 blocks out of Time Sq, and 1 block from public transit trains. It is just far enough out of the way to get some escape from the crowds and honking horns. the hotel is clean and the room was amazingly large for NYC. The breakfast really made the deal. The price is a steal for NY. I would definatly stay again and again.

First trip ever to NYC with my wife and four kids. Stayed at the Comfort Inn, Times Square from 12/15 to 12/20/2011. Location was ideal. Short walk to Bryant Park, MOMA, Rockfeller Center, The Lion King at the Minskoff and easy access to three main subway stations. We took the subway everywhere: 911 Memorial, Ferry to Ellis Island and Liberty Island, Museum of Natural History, Central Park, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Chinatown and Little Italy. It was easy, cheap and safe. Everyone was helpful and polite. Highly recommend you buy the CITYPASS for $59 before you go...it is such a GREAT deal. Learn about it online. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast evey morning was average but adequate. The only problem we had was the WiFi was out during our stay. There is only one elevator which was inconvenient only during peak traffic. The rooms with king beds were plenty big and only $229.00 per night. Nothing fancy but warm, clean and good service...besides who stays in their room when visiting the City that never Sleeps???? We will be back.

We stayed here at the beginning of November and were happy with the hotel. The continental breakfast was a great way to save a little money. Yes, the breakfast room was small and crowded but we were always able to find a table. The rooms are small but very clean and our room was quite quiet, no complaints. The location was amazing! SO close to times square, madison avenue and you can even walk to Central Park. We booked a queen sized room for our 4 nights but when we checked in there were no queen sized rooms available so they gave us a complimentary upgrade, for the night, to a king sized room. We complained to the manager about having to move rooms the next day and as it turns out they let us stay in the king sized room and didn't charge us anymore. This was a great find and a decent price for being just a few second walk away from times square

Room was compact- but it was as I expected. We were only there to rest up for the next adventure. Clean bathroom. Only complaint is a/c unit is rather loud, but after a couple nights you don't notice it. Breakfast is adequate with limited seating. Was the elevator slow? Yes, but so what- does an added minute really matter? We don't even have elevators in our town. We would stay again in a New York minute.

We stayed here in June for my daughter's grad trip. The hotel is close to everything and the price is great. The hotel is an older hotel and the rooms are small and the hallways and elevators are small so if you are claustrophibic then it might not be the place for you but it was very clean and the staff was super nice. The free breakfast also might be a plus for those trying to save a little money.

Stayed in the hotel for 4D/3N. Staffs were courteous and helpful especially the guy who manned the breakfast station. Location is very good, very near the 47/50th St subway (B,D,F,M) and 42nd-Times Square (for the other lines). Room is a bit small but fine. Restroom is clean. Tip: Comfort Inn website would show 2 prices, if you are sure with your travel dates, choose the non-refundable option to get lower price.Good value for the price. Will recommend to friends.

Good clean rooms yes a little small for 4 people but it was clean which is more important bed,s are comfortable ,bathrooms clean staff friendley,lift was never a problem and breakfast was ok just 20 seconds to times square would I stay there again yes I would not a bad price compared to other hotels in times square thank u very much for makeing our stay trouble free Belinda Liam england Q

If you are looking for a hotel close to Times Square and multiple subway lines for a great price, then this is the hotel for you. The rooms are very small, but they are clean. The staff is polite and helpful. Our only issues were the elevator and the AC unit. One day the elevator stopped working, which wasn't a huge deal because there are only 5 or so floors. We went in June and the lobby was absolutely freezing, but the AC in the room unfortunately couldn't keep up with the high humidity. So are room was a little warm, but by no means miserable. Overall, you can't beat the value for an NYC hotel that is actually close to things. If you are a Choice Privileges member (all you have to do is sign up) and book in advance on their site you get a pretty good discount.

Stayed 4 nights and have to say that the hotel was well placed for broadway. The room itself had no view and was extremely hot even in dec. We had no heating on but the wall beside the bathroom was very hot! Not sure what this would be like in the summer. In line with other reviewers this is a small room with no view whatsoever. Never but in such an odd hotel room before. Bed extremely comfortable. The hotel in keeping with all NYC hotels is well overpriced and the taxes added to the bill rediculous.This will be our last visit to NYC as its now priced itself out of our budget.Clean hotel staff very good.

This is right in the heart of Times Square, perfect location and great value for the location. The room was nice but really small and didn't have a fridge, which is a problem if you like to eat a lot on vacations as we do. There is no place for leftovers and you end up throwing out a lot of food. The hotel in general was small but service was good and it was clean. I would stay there again.

Nice hotel close to the Time Square and Chelsea action. Very reasonably priced for what you get. Staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions. Highly recommend if you're not on a Waldorf-Astoria budget.

My wife and I stayed here the weekend after Thanksgiving. The location is great a block from Times Square and there is a lot of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel was clean, the service was friendly, but the room was tiny even by New York standards and the view outside was lacking. We both found the bed to be uncomfortable and small. Overall an average hotel.

I really liked this hotel. Very close to times square (about 50m) and also close to several other attractions (theaters, rockefeller center, 5th avenue, etc), restaurants, stores, etc. I mean, it is really a great location. The hotel is also good, rooms are comfortable, but dont have a minibar. Rooms are also small, but not tiny. Free internet is great, and the hotel also provides 2 computers to be used, including printers which was very helpful. There is also a fitness room, which i didnt use. Breakfast is ok, not very good if compared to the hotels in Brazil, but it is not bad, including coffee, milk, eggs, sausages, donuts, bread, cereal, juices, etc. Always the same options. It is a great value for the money, although i dont consider it cheap. Staff is also very friendly and helpful. Therefore, i recommend.

My husband and I stayed here for four nights during our first trip to NYC and were definitely not disappointed. After much research on places to stay, we landed on this spot. At first glance it seemed affordable, liked the location, and there were NO reports of bed bugs anywhere to be found.After staying here, it was more than worth the value. The hotel was what it stated to be: a boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square. We got in much earlier than expected and the hotel staff had no problem checking us in early, which was a huge bonus. They also were willing to hold our luggage the day we left while we finished up seeing the sights. The hotel rooms were small, but that's to be expected of NYC and a boutique hotel. Plus we didn't stay in NYC to stay in our hotel room. So if you plan on staying in your whole trip, don't stay here, you'll be very disappointed. Our only chief complaint was that the room got very hot at night. We couldn't open the window and weren't sure how to operate the air conditioner. We probably could have had it fixed, but didn't bother. The elevator was a bit of a pain as it's slow and can only fit 5 people but there never was an instance where we had to wait that long... if you're in that big of a hurry take the stairs. The free Wi-Fi was great, definitely came in use when we wanted to find our next adventure and yes the breakfast wasn't fantastic but it did the job. My husband and I were satisfied with bagels, yogurt, fruit, and coffee... it was better than just cereal or nothing at all. The location was fabulous, what totally sells us on coming back! We loved being so close to Time Square and be able to walk everywhere. We walked to the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Central Park (just to name a few) It was perfect for us, plus there was a subway station right by the hotel (about a block away) which was easy to find and use to get other places. We'd definitely stay here again, the hotel was perfect for a non-stop sightseeing (do everything you can in NYC) kind-of vacation.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn in Times Square from 10/26-10/30. The hotel had small rooms but that is the norm in New York. However, this hotel was conveniently located, and the hotel was clean and the service staff was awesome. The staff was extremely nice and we had a good continental breakfast every morning. The only disadvantage was the elevator was extremely small and didn't allow for more than five people at a time. This location was only a few blocks from Times Square and from other shopping areas. I would definitely stay there again.

Very convenient location--so much right outside your door! A few blocks one direction is Times Square, and a few there other way is Rockefellar Center. Breakfast was standard Comfort Inn fare, but with New York bagels. I would stay here again.

My husband and I stayed here for the weekend to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and we would definitely stay here again because of price, hotel service and location. We had a room with a queen bed and although it was a small room, it was very clean (which was more important to us). The elevator was a little slow but we never had any trouble getting on or off when we wanted (and we were on the 8th floor). The hotel staff (especially Giovanni) was very helpful and friendly. He gave advice on the best routes to take, getting us a car ordered on our last day for our trip to the airport, and they held our luggage for us after we had checked out. In fact, all the staff that we encountered were helpful and very nice. The free breakfast was plenty for us before we started out each day. The location was excellent. We walked everywhere we went except when we went downtown towards Tribeca/Soho and then we took a subway. This hotel sits between Times Square and the 5th Avenue/Rockefeller Center/Radio City Music Hall areas so it is very easy to walk to everything. Even though we were close to Times Square it was very quiet at night.

3 adults and 1 child shared a 2double bed room and even though the room is small (normal for Manhattan) it worked out well...decent breakfast...good service etc. No problems getting the one elevator and we were on 7th floor. Great location..what else is there to say!

Stayed here with my g/f back in May 2010.Pros: Great location right by Times Square (which is what we wanted), Good size rooms (by NY standards!), Fantastic service (by ALL the staff), close to subway stops, Quite nights sleep (even tho so close to Times Square), excellent value for money (for NY).Cons: Breakfast is quite poor (didnt bother us, as we mainy like eating out, thats the point, right!), Bathrooms could do with some updating, not particularly modern (but we dont care, we prefer comfort!).Overall, this is a lovely hotel in a great location with a great price to match. Would consider staying here again if visiting NY again in the future, which, I hope to!

In September my wife and I spent 4 nights in New York City. The hotel room itself was quite small. However the location to Central Park, Lincoln Center , etc was within easy walking distance . The room was clean and maintained every day. Breakfast was typical hotel fare but it is free.. Staff was helpful and friendly

We're in Manhattan every Fall, at least. Last year, stayed at Apple Core's The Hotel at Times Square on W 46th. And it was very good - check out my review. This year we tried to go one better ... closer to Times Square and less cost.Nailed it!Another Apple Core property, on W 46th, but half a block from Times Square. And a few bucks cheaper per night! We ended up paying $269 plus taxes. You can't beat that! (The 'deal' at the hotel blocked by the conference I was attending was $400)Friendly, friendly, friendly staff. Helpful and accommodating. Did I say friendly? Tiny room, but, hey ... bigger than most rooms we've enjoyed in Paris! Had all you could need incl flat screen TV with lots of channels, so what more can you ask for the price?And a great deal on parking right across the street! Breakfast included. Free WiFi. Business centre including a printer. You can't do better than this unless you're looking for luxe - and willing to pay for it!Five stars for sure!I know where we're staying next time we're in Manhattan!

Thank you Mrs. Rajna and Mr.Rodriquez and Mr. Sidibi and Mr. Antoni and all the housekeeping staff for making our stay very pleasant. The hotel is located just a block away from Times Square. Go sightseeing, see the shows, go shopping. Everything is just a stones throw away. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Good value for money. We will return.

My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Times Square in Oct. 2010. It was a very nice hotel AND a great location. Near everything. People were nice and continental breakfast was included. Rooms were small, but acceptable. We would stay here again. 182dja

OK, the rooms were small and the breakfast was nothing special. Take that out of the mix and the stay was 5 star. Usually 5 star is reserved for high end but this met all of our requirements and was in the $300/night range. Our friends stayed at the Ritz and paid $1300 per night. Although not the Ritz this place was perfectly situated in NYC one block off of Times Sq. We are walkers and found it easy to get around town on foot. From the financial dist with the "Occupiers", to Ground Zero and the rebuilding of the Tower area and on up to Central Park and Fifth Ave shopping. This was the perfect location for us. The doorman, and I'm sorry I didn't get his name, was the kindest most helpful we've ever come accross. Front desk and Breakfast Bar attendant were above average and tried to make our stay special, which it was. We got off the plane and to the hotel at 8am. When asked if they would store our bags until the 3pm check in they said "we have a room right now, if you like" (Wow!) They even will call a car to take you to LaGuardia for a flat fee ($45). We were there in 45 minutes but it could have been longer depending on traffic. The driver knew all the back/uncongested streets. There also was a restaurant two doors down that was helpful for the two days it rained. I'll definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends. I almost forgot, it is a very, very clean hotel which is most important for my reviews. As you can see, I liked it alot and hope you all have the same experience.

My spouse and I recently needed to be in New York for 2 evenings prior to embarking on a cruise departing from the Red Hook Cruise Terminal in Brooklyn. Our desires were to be located near Times Square, in a non-smoking property, paying a rate which we deemed to be budget-friendly given the overall inherently expensive nature of our trip. Late October tends to be a difficult time of year for securing good values in midtown Manhattan, however we felt we had done just that by being eligible for the AAA rate. Comfort Inn Times Square manages to be in the "center of it all", and "off the beaten path" at the same time.As light-sleepers, we had requested a high floor, and that is just what we got. (In fact, had our room had a king bed, which is what we had reserved, instead of the queen bed we received, we would have listed the overall rating of this property as 5 stars, instead of 4). Our room was on the highest floor of the hotel - the 9th - toward the rear, facing east. There was no view, but blissfully there was no street-noise, which along with being a 100% non-smoking hotel, are our greatest priorities. The room was large enough, particularly with the decent-sized closet, that we had sufficient space to move about, without our cruise luggage being in the way. The queen bed was comfortable. The bathroom size was fine, and adequately ventilated. We did not find that housekeeping noise was a problem.There is just one elevator, and on one of the 2 mornings we experienced rather long wait times, as we competed with the housekeepers who needed to move their large carts up and down. This isn't a complaint, but I thought I'd mention this, as potential guests who are unfamiliar with New York should be aware that it's normal for older buildings to have just one elevator to accommodate several floors, and to expect to wait a prolonged time if situated on an upper floor. People with limited mobility should take note, as well as others who may object to taking the stairs, and perhaps ask for rooms on lower floors.Breakfast was abundant and varied, which is always welcomed. Every member of the staff with whom we interacted was pleasant and helpful. We would be happy to stay here again, should we desire to come to New York for the theater, and will recommend Comfort Inn Times Square to our families and friends.
Clean, comfortable, good service, great price and EXCELLENT location. Free breakfast. Will stay here again - for sure!

I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn, Times Square in NYC and even though the hotel room was small with 2 dbl beds, the staff and amenities more than compensated for this. The doorman Sibidi is fantastic from his winning smile, information and generous nature, the cleanliness of the hotel, the front desk staff, all were top notch. The location was perfect, right in the midst of all the best places and things to do; we walked everywhere! The staff assisted us with directions, deals and luggage. They are an excellent team and this hotel is definitely worth your time and money. Excellent value for the money!

I've given this hotel a 3 star as it is fit for purpose for a short stay, however I wouldn't like to stay here for longer than 2 nights max.The location is very good and is a key selling point of the hotel. The staff was average, nothing special but they fulfilled their duties courteously.The rooms are tiny, barely room to move and the beds were hard. The room smelled of dampness too, however from what I saw, it was clean.A significant amount of noise in the morning from Housekeeping; throwing things around and talking loudly. I felt this was unacceptable. I was also awoken several times by the noisey elevators, however most rooms are close to the elevators, so expect a little amount of noise. Breakfast is served downstairs and is typically included in the rate.Bathroom was fine but lacked ventilation, causing significant overheating in the room.In the summer months, the rooms would be far too hot for my liking.We stayed here for one night and were charged £180 a night, about 290 USD. Way overpriced for what it is and we found 1 night was long enough.Nothing particularly unpleasant about the hotel, however nothing to write home about.Probably wouldn't stay here again.

I stayed several nights at this hotel and was very pleased. Check in was quick and my room was ready even though I was there early in the day. The room was a decent size for NYC. Nothing really fancy, but a very comfortable bed and pillows. It was very clean and the bathroom was a good size in general. Aboslutely no view other than a brick wall, but that meant for a quiet night. The doors do slam and I did hear a few in my hall close late at night, but the heating/cooling unit gave a nice gentle hum that helped drown that out. The hotel is really only about a half a block from the subway and the north end of Times Square. Great location on a fairly quiet street. Also the staff was very helpful in getting a taxi or giving help to those who needed it. They also store luggage free of charge which not all do.Breakfast was better than I expected as I thought it would be a simple continental breakfast. They had eggs, sausage, bagels, bread, cereal, donuts, fresh fruit and a variety of drinks available. I ate there every morning.Compared to the other hotels that were easily $100-200+ a night, this was a great place. I'd definitely stay there again.
Only a few minutes from all of the best places in New York City.. you won't find anywhere else with this location at this price.

I stayed at this hotel for 1 week in September 2011, and although an old establishment it was clean, staff were most helpful and courteous, and free internet and breakfast included was an added bonus. Also tea and coffee available all day in breakfast room.Rooms are small but I was travelling on my own and suited my needs. Bathroom was a decent size and shower was above bath. Plenty of towels and complimentary toiletries replenished daily.The only fault I had with this hotel was no small refrigerator available in room and I had medication to keep refrigerated. There was only 1 ice machine in service and that was in the basement and my room was on the 7th floor. Only 1 elevator serviced this hotel.Price for this top location was reasonable and not sure if I would recommend this hotel as it was my first time in New York and have not compared it to any others.

The hotel is in a great spot, a 1 minute walk to Times Square. The breakfast was ok, not great, not bad. The room was tiny but that's to be expected, like one of the other posters on here said , it's not that clean if you look close, well they were right, so I just didn't look close, but let's just say it was obvious that the bed skirt and spread was not washed in a bit. I would stay there again because of the great location, wifi also worked great!

My husband and I were on our first trip to NYC and chose the Comfort Inn. It's got a great location, about a block from all the action of Times Square, but without the noise. Our room was very small, but at least it was clean and very quiet. The air conditioning worked very well in our room. We had no problems sleeping due to the noise or being too hot. If you want a hotel with a view, however, this is not it! There was a brick wall to look at outside! It didn't matter to us, though, because we weren't in the room very much. The staff was very friendly and helpful and always greeted us with smile whenever we walked in the hotel and when we got out of the elevator, etc. The breakfast was good - eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc. It was a good way to start the day. It was also very close to some really good pubs and restaurants. We never had to walk far to get something to eat. We went to two Broadway plays and walked there both nights. Maybe 6 blocks at the most. We had a great trip to New York City and would visit again and stay at the Comfort Inn.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 days and I have no complaints. Considering how expensive hotels are in this area, this one proved to be a great bargain.It is located only a short walk away from Times Square yet on a quiet street. Acts as a great base to explore midtown Manhattan on foot and close enough to subways to take you to other parts of the island easily.The room was small but clean and nicely decorated, with a good sized closet, dresser and a desk. Not much a view but we didn’t come to NYC to stay in the room anyway. The front desk staff were very nice and the complimentary breakfast gave us all that we needed to get our day started (bread, eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereal, pastries). Yes the breakfast room is small but we never had an issue finding a table.My only complaint is that the elevator is dreadfully slow. We ended up using the stairs a lot as it wasn’t worth wasting time waiting for the elevator to arrive.

Friendly woman at front desk at checkout, decent free breakfast buffet, okay-sized bedroom, very nice flatscreen TV, good hot shower, good quality mattress. That's the good stuff.As I always do in NYC, I checked for signs of bedbugs under the mattress, and there was a large amount of human hair on the boxspring along the headboard, like it hasn't seen a vaccum in a long time.The worst: Noisy noisy noisy noisy in-window air conditioner that unavoidably blows straight onto the bed. The fan knob had no effect, and It was full blast all the time.Overall it was a recipe for a sleepness night, but I managed to position a chair and a stack of pillows to block the freezing jet of air, and used earplugs to block the sound.It was a hot night, and the windows are unopenable.I didn't complain, and just managed to get by as a single business traveler. However, if I was traveling with my wife or son, it would have been absolutely unacceptable.

In selecting a budget-level hotel for a quick overnight visit on a weekend that seemed to command high hotel rates, I chose between staying near the train station and staying near the Broadway show we would see. I picked the latter. I knew it would not be as fun as staying in some neighborhoods, but we were looking for speed and value this time around.While this Comfort Inn is just a block off of Times Square, etc. and all that madness - the Naked Cowboy seems to never age - I had one of the best sleeps I've ever had after returning at midnight from said show. We were on the fourth floor with a "no view" window facing two brick walls and it was absolutely silent (and dark because of the walls). I guess room choice really does make a difference. Room is NYC small but I've stayed in smaller here, actually - there was space in this one for a chair and a desk. The bed was comfortable, HBO on the TV though we didn't watch it much, a clean and workable bathroom with hair dryer, tissues, shampoo, soap, We did use the safe to store our valuables. It's in a very large closet with light, which would be nice for stowing suitcases if you were staying for several days.The staff was kept busy as there were a number of senior citizens staying who seemed to need extensive help with directions, and foreign tourists. I do greatly appreciate we were able to get a room when we checked in early. Breakfast consisted of waffles, bagels, cereal, fried egg patties, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, raw fruit, coffee and juice - plenty of choice for me though I guess it would get old every day. Cramped and crowded in the breakfast room so we ate in our room. And yes, the elevator is verrrrrrrrry slow.Overall, this is a fine budget hotel, but keep the word budget in mind. If you want something a little nicer or in a more interesting neighborhood, scan the sales in advance.

Although this hotel is ok I would recommend staying somewhere else. We stayed a week earlier at the Distrikt Hotel (which is not far away from this one and only a little bit more expensive but much better). The location of the Comfort Inn is right on Times Square which made staying here a very noisy, crowded experience. Although Times Square is good to visit once, you don’t really want to be staying here when you are confronted with hundreds of tourists trying to cram into a very small area. Our room was on the street side which meant being woken constantly by the goings on down below.The rooms are small (expected for New York) but are pretty basic and could use a refresh with the furnishings looking pretty tired. The staff were always very friendly and helpful which made the stay here that much better. They were able to assist us in a number of ways and were only too happy to do so. We had breakfast included in our rate however we only ate here once over the four nights we were there. It was very basic continental style fare however, the dining room only fits about 4 people in it at any one time which meant that the first morning we were there, guests were standing around or spilling out into the reception area eating their breakfast. This isn’t a bad hotel; I just think there are much better options to choose from in New York for the price.

Staying anywhere in Manhattan is not cheap however when one wishes to combine value for money with convenience, the Comfort Inn Times Square is an excellent option to consider.The location is just 2 minutes from Times Square and is yet on a quiet street. It is an excellent base from which to explore NYC, and it found it particularly convenient in the evenings when returning from a show, as Theater Row is within easy walking distance and thus no need for a taxi. The police presence in the city (partly I imagine due to the 9/11 anniversary) was also especially noticeable, and I felt completely safe at all times.The hotel itself is pretty much as described on its website, there is a standard continental breakfast from 6:30 am to 10:00 am. On offer are breads, rolls, waffles, fruits, cereal, yoghurt, egg, tea, coffee, juices etc. I found it perfectly adequate to start the day. The breakfast room itself is small - I counted just seven (7) tables, however at least for the first hour of service, there was plenty of room available.The room was bigger than I imagined and everything worked! Most importantly, there is an in-room safe and at least for a solo traveler, plenty of storage space. There was also a very useful NYC guidebook in the room (not to be removed) and in addition, the hotel themselves also provided a very useful guide to their amenities and polices as well as a lot of other general information about NYC - attractions, theaters, transportation etc.Not that you would be inclined to spend much time indoors, but there is a large Plasma-Screen T.V with something like 35 T.V Channels included, 2 in Spanish and the remainder in English - covering all the big networks - News, Movies, Sport etc. There is also a pay-per-view option. The rooms also have an FM Radio beside the bed which includes an iPod dock, and a reading light which I always like.There is no 'room with a view' as others have commented, and the room pretty much looked out onto a shaft/brick wall, however again and as for most people, I did not find this an issue considering the minimal amount of time you will spend in your room.The en-suite facilities were also fine, perfect water pressure from the shower nozzle and temperate control excellent. Housekeeping of a very high standard with facecloths, towels, and complimentary toiletries (shampoo and shower gel/moisturizer) replenished daily. On two occasions though, I returned to the room at around 1pm to take a break between points in my itinerary and at that point of the day, the room was not yet serviced. However, this is not a issue I would regard as in any way significant. The shower tray was also very small, and really only had enough space on which to put the free toiletries provided - which then kept falling off. I would have appreciated a bigger tray or a rack.I found that I did not have cause to interact a lot with staff as I really did not have any problems here - however from the front desk staff to the bellman, I found them all to be courteous, pleasant, and professional. In addition to the breakfast room on the ground floor, there is also a fitness center and business center, both of which are accessed using your key card. There is a printer in the business center and access was never a problem. The business center has 2 PC terminals and comfortable chairs. The lobby itself is very small and perhaps useful only when one is awaiting a taxi. Ivonne at reception called a taxi for me on departure and made several follow-up phones to ensure it was on its way and that I would be on time for international check-in.I would just have two minor issues - one with the in-room Air Conditioning as I found you could either have it switched on at full velocity or not at all - there seemed to be no 'medium' option. Secondly, the elevator must be the slowest I have ever encountered and so often frequently decided to take the stairs, again this is not a significant problem but it may slow some people with lots of luggage.Overall, I was very impressed with the value, service, and location on offer here and would heartily recommend it as an ideal and convenient base for a stay in Manhattan.
Great Hotel,Best location in the heart of Times Square!!! Great rooms and great service!!!

We have stayed here many times - the rooms are small (of course) and most look into a vent shaft (which means they're quiet) but clean and well appointed. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Standard continental breakfast is free and contributes to the overall value. Parking is across the street and there is a discount as a guest. Perfect location for shopping/theatre and galleries.

We stayed at this hotel for one night. the room was typically small and the radio/ipod player didn't work. The room was extremely clean though. The manager on duty seemed a little out of his element when we were advised we could pay with a combination of cash and credit card. Everything worked out fine until the next morning. We were supposed to get a $50 room (Incidentals charge) returned and the desk manager was an out of control Alpha Dog who had no communication or listening skills. We tried to explain what the night manager had told us our $50 incidental charge would be refunded upon check out but because apparently he didn't know what he was doing, the receipt did not indicate we paid the charge. This desk manager was hearing none of it. There was an embarassing screaming match between us and a long line of people waiting. - all for a $50 incidental charge! We asked if there was a place to go to privately discuss the matter but were denied. It was the most embarassing check out I have ever encountered. Never again - N-E-V-E-R!Welcome to New York - NOW GO HOME!
This hotel is hidden a couple of blocks off of Times Square which makes it within walking distance of lots of things to do and see.
In the heart of NYC Times Square, convenient to Theater District, Rockefeller Plaza. Quite comfortable and very friendly & accommodating staff!

We found the lodging here quite by accident. The price was reasonable, the rooms were clean and fairly spacious (for NYC). The hallways were a bit difficult to maneuver in with luggage, but Victor, the bellman, was the nicest well-mannered young man, who helped us with our luggage, and got us set up in our room. The front desk help was also friendly. With the great location, we found this to be a reasonably-priced, comfortable and convenient hotel.

This hotel was the worst point of our trip. We thogth we payed for something better. An the only good that have this hotel is the great situation, very near Times Square.When I went the hotel was full, and shared areas were not enough for many people: the dinning room is ridiculous and the lobby also and when you would want to leave free a table for the people waiting in the door, you cannot stay on the sofas in the lobby because they were full of people.The food also was very bad.The staff wasn't helpful. We went to this hotel because it says that they have free internet access. But the signal doesn't arrive to all places. When I went to claim the girl in the front desk said that the signal was the same in all the rooms (????) and when I say that it was not true she started to get angry with me. Our room was very noisy because of the car traffic. But it not was the worst...

My family and I stayed at the Comfort Inn mid August - it was an excellent choice. The hotel was super clean and well located just off Times Square. The staff was helpful when needed and the morning breakfast was convenient. For us, the most important thing is staying somewhere clean and like many know, NY can be iffy at times. The Comfort Inn is very clean, and not just the lobby. All hotels in NYC have small rooms, and this one is no exception but we're used to making things work so it didn't bother us at all. We slept well every night. The only issue we had was the air conditioner - it was very good, but the only option seemed to be off or high. It was very strong, especially for the people sleeping right next to it. But, we covered it with some towels to reduce the impact, and that worked fine. All in all, the hotel was a great choice. Would stay here again anytime.

I first reviewed this hotel after my first stay there, 2 years ago. It's become my hotel of choice for NYC, especially being a most of the time solo traveler there. I've stayed there 6 times (including my most recent stay, of Aug 11th-15th 2011) since my initial stay there, and will keep coming back! It's the first hotel I check for all my solo NYC trips! It hasn't changed since my first stay there. The staff is very friendly, some even recognize me by now, and the rooms are very clean and have standard amenities. I've stayed in both king and queen bed rooms, and both have been fine. This most recent stay I was in room 703. It's always very quiet and I never have problems sleeping in this hotel. In all my stays, I've never had a view of the street, it's always the back, so not much of a view, but it's quiet. I always get a good rate with AAA, but you have to show your card at check in, or they won't give it to you. I was there on some very hot days, and it always felt wonderful to step inside the hotel and feel the cool air conditioning! The hotel is remodeling their entranceway a little currently, to make it handicap accessible, but they weren't working during my stay, so there was no noise from it. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, I'll keep coming back!

We stayed the weekend here in August 2011. The rooms are really clean and nicely updated. All rooms in this price range in NYC will be small, but there was plenty of space for us to navigate the room and put all of our stuff, and the bathroom was actually quite spacious. The A/C isn't the best but we were comfortable enough to sleep. There is no view from this hotel - you will look out the window to a brick wall. That didn't bother us at all since we were barely in our hotel anyway. The location is fantastic - literally steps to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, the subway and so much more. Breakfast was standard but such a nice perk to save a few dollars in the mornings. They also have a luggage room and will happily hold your luggage all day when you check out so you can wander the city. Awesome! Staff was helpful and polite, no issues checking in or checking out. We parked at the garage across the street and it was around $35/day. Totally happy with this hotel and can't wait to go back!

I have stayed to that hotel twice during my visits to NYC. It's very clean hotel, the service is excellent and it's in the best place to times square. So close to times square and the price is very good.It is very clean hotel, it has wifi everywhere and the breakfast is satisfying.I would definitely go to that hotel again.

The room was small but this was expected and no big deal, who's going to spend a lot of time in the room anyway? Room was clean (and tidied up every day). The only problem was that someone was very obviously smoking in their room/bathroom because our bathroom was filled with cigarette smell/smoke all the time. This was supposed to be a non-smoking hotel and I *hate* the smell. The air conditioning unit was very loud (and not very effective), it's a good thing we were so tired after touring the city.The elevator was horribly slow and should really be replaced if at all possible, we ended up taking the stairs to the 8th floor (walking was faster!).Breakfast was minimal but OK. I would have liked some meats and/or sliced cheese in addition to the cream cheese and butter that were offered.Price was high, but I guess that was expected being on Manhattan. Location was great, although wading through the tourists on Times square made walking one block take about the same time as walking 3 in normal conditions.Overall, nothing spectacular, but wouldn't mind visiting again.

I booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews that I read on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The location is excellent, just a few minutes walk to Times Square, yet on a quiet street. There were plenty of bars and restaurants closeby and many of the sights were within walking distance. The subway station is closeby also. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was basic by European standards ( rolls, juice, yogurt, fruit and disposable cutlery etc was provided ) but was enough to set us up for the day. The room was a reasonable size, big enough for a couple. The air conditioning worked well and there was an iron and ironing board in the room which was a bonus. There was no tea making facility in the room, just an coffee maker but tea was available in the lobby 24 hours a day. Overall I was delighted with this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

We loved everything about this hotel. The location was beyond excellent. The gentleman that worked the night audit shift was extremely pleasant at check in. He was very informative about the area. Excellent customer service!!! Too bad I didn't get his name (black man). The room was super clean!!! Too bad they only had employee rate available for 1 night, otherwise we would stay here the entire stay. We ended moving to another Comfort Inn a few blocks away, but that's another review.

When we booked this hotel , we didn't have high expectations. We had looked at reviews, which were favorable, but did not expect it to be as good as it was.  We arrived and we were greeted at the door by a pleasent door man. He helped us with our bags, but what we noticed the most was his rapport with guests as they were leaving and entering the hotel. We arrived early and they held our bags until our rooms were ready. We had 2 rooms booked and they accommodated us by putting the rooms next to each other. Yes, the elevator is slow and small. But it almost adds to the ambiance of the hotel. It is an old building, but the rooms were very nice. The location is the best, most priceless part of this hotel. 2 minutes to times square!!! 10 minute walk to 30 Rock! / Rockefeller Center!!! 20 minute walk to Central Park!! 25 minutes or so to Empire State. If you don't mind a walk, everything is in the area!!  Pleasent and helpful front desk staff. Cleaning staff was very nice and cleaned room well most days ( we were there a full week ). Breakfast was good. Toast, bagels, fruit, juice, coffee, cereal. It is a continental breakfast that will get you started. No hot eggs, bacon or fresh pancakes. But still good. Breakfast host was great and kept everything clean and stocked. One down side is that the hotel is on a side street where there is one ways / no turns, so getting a cab is sometimes easy as there are 2 or 3 hotels on street and difficult at other times as no cab wants to be on a road less travelled. but main roads at end of either end of block. All around great place to stay, a half block off times square. Excellent staff. Great value for your money!!! We would stay there again, as long as price stays competative

Pleasantly surprised with this location. While it is located less than a block from Times Square, I was expecting to have a closet of a room but actually ended up being pleasantly surprised with the size of the room, the quietness of the hotel, and decent service. Don't get me wrong - this is no Plaza Hotel.

What a lovely place! You feel like you are in the middle of everything and yet it is so quiet! Good breakfast, friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms! Next time we are in NYC, we will book this hotel for sure!

Would definately stay here again. Staff were friendly, room had free wifi, comfortable bed, free continental breakfast, good value for money. We couldn't fault it. Asides from a small room but its right near times square so what do you expect......

I have stayed at this property twice this summer (SVA dorm is right down the street) and I think it is time for some upgrades - bedspreads has spots that the laundry hadn't gotten out, elevator floor needs work, etc. The rooms are postage stamp tiny but functional, they even squeeze a mini-fridge in. Pricing is high for what you get but it is NYC and there aren't many alternatives in the area. If I was a tourist I would probably choose to stay in another part of the city. That being said, the staff is really friendly and helpful. The area is full of bars so the street is pretty busy at all hours. Subway is right down the block and there are restaurants close by. If you walk out to Delancy Street it is easy to hail a cab.

This is a small hotel in the heart of New York City, half a block away from Times Squares. The rooms are not big, but not too small. My room was in the back of the building in the second floor, with a window facing the wall of the neighbor building. If you must have natural light in your room, this is not the room for you. I found my room very clean and comfortable, with a fair bathroom. Free wireless internet access and free national telephone calls are definitely a plus. By the heat of New York’s summer, air conditioning was ok. The big TV set was in the right side of the right side of the bed, what seemed to me a very unusual position to watch TV, but that was not a problem for me.The hotel has a small fitness room, an business center with two computers and a printing for the guests (with no extra charge) and the complimentary breakfast is served in a small room (which is crowded, depending on the hour you go there). No fancy breakfast, but all the basic stuff one needs to leave the hotel without starving: coffee, milk, yogurt, juice, bread, donuts, apples, bananas, oranges and cereal.A highlight of the hotel is its staff. Every staff member (reception desk, cleaning lady, bell man) was nice and helpful, which is not always what one finds in a city like New York. If you are looking for a non expensive hotel in the heart of the city with a friendly service, do not hesitate in picking this one.

We stayed here for 5 nights and couldn't be happier we had picked this hotel. Yes the room is small and the washroom is tiny but the location is unbeatable for the pirce we pay. It's just around 5 mins walk to Times Square! We also walked to the see the show Wicked which is a bit far but not too bad afterall. The room is very clean and the bed is comfortable too. The only cons is the air conditioner which is quite loud. Customer service is exceptional, the bell person not only helped us with our luggages after we checked out but also running up and down the street to help us catch a taxi to the airport. It's A bit hard to get taxi in front of the hotel because the hotel is on a side street, actually our taxi driver from the airport could not find this hotel even with the complete address (i think he lied since he doesnt want to drive into the one way side street, oh well that's NY I guess...) we end up walking a few blocks to get to the hotel. Will definitely stay here again wgen we visit to NY again.

Stayed there for 2 nights. Could not wish for a better location! The room was small but I think that is to be expected in Manhattan unless one is willing to pay a great price. Anyway the room only needs to be comfortable and clean for overnight rest. And that is was. It was very comfortable and quiet even though only a few meters from the hectic Times Square. The room and bathroom had all I needed and they were very clean. The breakfast was sufficient and practical. The staff were friendly and helpful. Having walked around plenty I did not see a more convinient hotel. The subway, buses, tours, shows and tourism information center are all around the corner. And it was good value.I would not hesitate to return to this hotel and would recommend it to people I know.
Room was small, but very clean and quiet. Perfect location for NYC site-seeing. The front desk staff were very helpful with directions, tickets, and suggestions. A great bargain for a limited budget!

Everything about this hotel was great from before check-in, when I called to verify things, to check in, to check out. The let me check in 2 hours early, room was great and clean, I didn't think it was as small as people were describing. The front desk was great, I think her name was Yvone, she was wonderful! The bell guy got me a cab every time I needed it, I am so looking forward to going back to NY and I will definitely stay here again. This place was close to everything in Times Square and conveniently for all my needs. Oh and the free internet was great. Thank you for a great stay Comfort Inn!!!
Location was great, staff was wonderful and very helpful. Rooms are small but very well maintained. Breakfast was also very good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

The hotel was well-located near Times Square, and a very good value. There was wireless in the room and the breakfasts were fine. During peak times (check-in and check-out) the small, single elevator was inadequate for people and luggage.

While the room was clean and had been renovated, it was tiny. Unfortunately the carpet outside the room needs replacing, it was old, dirty and it smelled. The lift was incredibly slow lift due to its age. The air conditioner was so noisy we felt like we were in a plane and didn't seem to cool the room down at all. We had no hot water one morning which was not very pleasant, and our toilet blocked up. To be fair, the toilet was fixed immediately. The breakfast was basic and included in the room price. It was a very central location in Times Square. The desk staff were nice and welcoming. While the internet was free it was very difficult to actually get access and when you could, it was so slow. Overall I think that New York in general is overpriced and their accommodation is no different.

I stayed for 4 nights end of June. Hotel location is unbeatable, just half a block from Times Square, and 1 1/2 blocks from subway, super convenient. From La Guardia I bought a Metro card for $10.51 at Hudson newsstand, and with it I took bus 60 then change (ask bus driver) to take the subway and exit Rockefeller Plaza-47th St (I believe it was the red line 1-2-3). Hotel was 1 1/2 blocks away.Staff at front desk was extremely nice, friendly and helpful, particularly Jovannie and Yvonne. Room was clean and decent for NY size. My room faced a brick wall so no noise complaints, I was on the 3rd floor. Breakfast was decent, again for the hotel rating – fruits, cereal, yogurt, eggs, toasts, etc. The sitting area was busy most of the time so people would take their plates to the lobby or to the room (I did).Please do NOT use the deli across the street – made that mistake one late night – food was horrible. For some light lunch go to Europa, a chain restaurant, which has fresh salads made on the spot as well as sandwiches and pastas. I had pasta with chicken and veggies made on the spot for $7.50 or so. Food was very good. The closest to the hotel was 2 blocks away on the corner of 46th and 5th. Internet service is very slow. Go to Starbucks 2 blocks away – Broadway & 47 – much faster. Or if you need a quiet environment take your laptop to the NY public library on 5th Ave, about 6 blocks away. Their service is super fast and free – just beware that they close early (6pm).Highly recommend this hotel.

we came to NY for a family celebration in midtown and this hotel was perfect for what we needed. although the room was small it was nice to have 2 queen beds instead of 2 double beds. slept 2 adults and 2 children perfectly. couldnt ask for a better location. continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful. hotel provides a parking discount for the garage across the street. didn't hear any noise from the street. a terrific value for what we paid. would recommend this hotel to anyone.

This hotel is in the perfect location. You could not get any better. It was clean and the staff was great. I also had a discount for an association membership so the cost was amazing for that location. The rooms are tiny, but they all are in NYC and it's not like you spend much time in your room when you're there. The breakfast is a nice bonus since NYC is not a cheap destination. It does get a little crowded in there, but still good. Most importantly, the hotel was very CLEAN. I am very picky about the cleanliness of any hotel and have stayed at much more expensive hotels that were not as clean as this place. The room could've been a little cooler, but keeping the air on pretty much took care of that. It was just a little stuffy until we cooled it down each day when we got back. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

While we were exploring the city, the maid(s) came into our room to clean like we expected. when we returned nothing seemed to be out of place, well, nothing that we would consider to be out of place, our bags were messy, but we did NOT think anything of it. One of the girls had placed her bag up high cause there wasnt much room. on our final night there, while gathering out belongings, we realized that there were earphones missing. we searched the room and could not find them. when we went back on the bus, we noticed that the earphones that belonged to one of the girls was wrapped around SOMEONE ELSES ipod. the maid(s) who had cleaned the room, had stoled the earphones and wrapped someone else's around the ipod! I should add that we saw many of the employees hanging out in the room next door to us, sitting and lying down on the bed. pretty sure one was the manager! watch out for the employee traffic infront of your door!

This hotel is so conveniently located. It also has some very nice, though somewhat small, rooms just yards from Broadway. It is quiet and the staff met my every expectation. I highly recommend this hotel.

We spent 2 nights at the Comfort Inn Times Square prior to a cruise in June. We found this location to be central to all of our sightseeing needs. It is within walking distance to all the attractions in the Times Square area and close to the subway station to venture out into other areas of town. The room was small, as we expected, but it was clean and the beds were comfy so we have zero complaints. The breakfast was decent ... cereals, fruits, hard boiled eggs, donuts, coffee. We loved being able to grab a quick bite in the morning before heading off for the day. It saved us time and money by not having to find a place to eat.The staff was exceptionally friendly and went above and beyond with assisting us with directions, etc. Also, if you are cruising out of Manhattan, this hotel is very close to the pier.If I were to return to NYC, I wouldn't hesitate to stay in this hotel again!
It's not new or fancy, but it is wonderful in every other way: Good location, clean, quiet, comfortable, excellent staff, and lots of complimentary amenities.

Stayed 7 nights in June with my son to see Broadway shows. Location just far enough away from the Broadway commotion to seem like a peaceful refuge. Our room was 2nd floor facing the street - not ideal - and yet the noise was very minimal and not a problem at all, especially with the window A/C unit running. Room was clean and maintained daily. The staff was all very courteous. Breakfast was very basic, but yogurt, fruit & bagels is all we needed anyway. Free wi-fi connection had no problems, though I would have preferred to be able to plug into the wall. There was a plug but it did not work. (Always nervous about public wi-fi) Nearby subway options made seeing the town very easy. If you need to be in the heart of Times Square, this is an excellent choice!

For some this hotel may be too close to Times Square BUT ....-NOT if you like being a block from the TKTS half-price broadway shows Times Square ticket booth. There are few (lower priced) hotel locations where one person go to TKTS around 5 PM when the lines are short while the other one is getting ready back at the room!!!-NOT if you like walking out the door Sunday morning and in a few minutes riding an open top Grey Line tour bus to the south end. Traffic is off on Sunday which makes it a great way to ride the bus and get oriented.-not if you like being and easy (but crowded walk) to the theaters AND restaurant rowThe hotel is only about 8 floors and has only one elevator so it is small by NY standards. Our king-bed room was just fine. The staff was ALWAYS helpful!!!Surprisingly: there is only one small elevator (but if that is a problem for someone they probably ought not to travel)As for Times Square crowds; go to 6th street and skip em.

What a wonderful surprise - a quiet hotel room right in the the middle of Times Square and the theatre district. The room is small - but not as small as others we have had in the area. We had a computer area with office chair, a second chair, a small dresser, & full size bed with two nightstands. We also had a regular size closet with iron and ironing board. Bathroom was small, with very limited counter space, but again not as small as other hotels in this area. Towels were small and thin. Biggest surprise was the quiet - we were on the ninth floor and even with two windows the room was quiet. The window unit A/C did provide some "white noise", but there was no noise coming from other rooms either. Staff was very nice and polite throughout our stay.Breakfast was minimal - mostly donuts, cereal and fruit. Compared to other Comfort Inns I would only rate the breakfast as fair. I was a little surprised at the tip "bowl", but the attendant was very good about keeping things stocked.
Great hotel close to Times Square. Small but comfy room. Very easy to book at hotels website. Quick checkin/checkout. Nice value.
Great location, nice and clean hotel, buig rooms, pleasent staff, free internet in the loby, free breakfast (bagels, cereals, yoghurt...) . Warmly recomend it!

We picked the hotel based on the reviews that were posted. It is hard to add to the nice comment's already posted but we stayed in the hotel in room 702 for 4 night's. It's one block from Time's Square and all of the action that is non stop. The room was OK size wise for us it is as big as almost all hotel's in Europe. We took the bus from the airport to Grand Central and walked to the hotel. Mistake, it was to hot and to far. And the cost was $26.00 we took a cab back and the cost was $35.00 + $5.00 tip. I hate to think how bad the Subway would have been but the hotel is close to several metro line's.. Breakfast was above avg for the price of free!! Drinks, donut, bread, waffle,bagel, jam, yogurt,boiled egg's, cereal,banana,& apple,. This must be a nice place to stay the guy in 805 said he had lived there 43 year's and he is paying the same amount that he started with $200 a month. If you need info about the area he knows the neighborhood. Cost just over $1000 all N.Y.C. tax inc. for 4 night's. That's a good value for this location in New York.

We have stayed here before and were happy with the accommodations then as we were this time. Location is outstanding - just where we wanted to be. Of course it's older, and the rooms are very small, but for the amount we spent it was well worth it. This is not a flea bag hotel, it has recently been updated, is extremely clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, and we had absolutely no problems. We arrived hours early and they held our bags until our room was ready, as they did the day we checked out since we weren't leaving until evening. The front desk reception and bellhop service was always helpful and hailed cabs for us in the pouring rain.
