The day we left it was raining and we had checked out that morning, but they went out and stood in the middle of the street until a cab finally agreed to take us to the airport (for some reason the cabs don't like to do that in the early evening I guess, but thankfully the hotel staff helped us with that).The maid service was really outstanding too - not what you would expect from a budget type hotel.Other amenities used were the free wi fi and the computers downstairs to print out boarding passes. Some complain about breakfasts, well, I for one don't expect much with places like this so can't complain, I'm not much of a breakfast person anyway. It is the same stuff you get at all inexpensive hotels, I would have been surprised if it were anything else - don't understand why some people complain, I thought it was fine. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel and will definitely stay here again the next time in NY.

Less than a block from Times Square, this hotel has very narrow frontage , but a very nice lobby. Our room had only one window which opened onto an air shaft, but let in some light in the morning. It was clean; the service was friendly and helpful; and we walked nearly everywhere we wanted to go - theatres, shopping, sightseeing and eating. Despite this and the proximity to all the action, our room was quiet when we wanted to sleep.

Excellent hotel experience. The hotel was very clean and is in a great location. The staff was friendly and helpful. Jack Singh was working while we were there and he is especially nice. They serve a nice breakfast.

First off I stayed at this hotel from June 6th - June 8th. Staff were friendly and helpful. The LCD tv and iPod dock was a nice touch. The had a special cover on bed to prevent bed bugs which was a worry for me with a lot of reports in NY. The best and worst thing is location. To explain best is because it's near a lot of places like time square but worst because the actual street is scary walking after dark because of the bars. Also the hall when you get off the elevator is very small. And it is nice you can check in under 21 I'm 20 and a lot of hotels would not allow me to stay. Overall this is a great hotel for it's location and value.

Stayed June 6Th-June 8th. Cost about $300 A night. Stayed in room 202. I love the fact they have LCD screen tv and iPod dock. The best thing and Worst thing is location. Best is because I was about a 2 min walk to timesquare and worst thing is because the actual street the hotel is on has a lot of bars and can be scary to walk down after Dark. Staff friendly and helpful the hallway a little small. The room was clean and I believe had bedbug proof beds meaning the beds CAN'T get bedbugs because there was somekind of nylon wrap around matteress this is GOOD because I was worried with reports in NY...Overall I would stay again plus you can check in if your under 21 which is VERY rare only found like 3 hotels in New York

We took the red eye and came in at 10am. Check in is not until 3pm but the receptionist Ivonne was very nice, friendly and accommodating and gave us our room since it was available then. We didnt have to wait! The complimentary breakfast was good and the person helping there was extremely nice. It is in the heart of times square. Nice hotel= worth every penny

All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Employee Jack Singh at the front desk was especially friendly and helpful and knew us by name. Every request we had he took care of. Nice touch!! Great location!! Extremely clean hotel. Very comfortable beds. Rooms were normal size for NY standards and had no street noise. We stayed in a room that ended in 8. The only negative and this is not a big negative was the elevator was a bit slow but expected that since had read the reviews before choosing this hotel. Would choose this hotel again and will recommend to anyone going to NYC.

We had booked this hotel for 3 days when we had visited New york as tourists.It does not have the best of the appearances from outside but you would get all the amenities and services you need from a hotel.The rooms are smaller but have clean sheets on the bed and clean bathroom.Free internet/wifi and breakfast were a part of our tariff .However the best part of the experience was to be able to walk a few steps to be found amongst the crowd on Times Square.In fact all the places of attraction were very close to the hotel.One more point to mention is that the hotel staff agreed to keep our luggage for 3 days even after we had checked out of the hotel.Would book this hotel if I go back to NY .

We traveled to NYC for a friend's weekend to get away and enjoyed our stay. I had one minor problem when we checked in. The attendant had us booked for a Queen room rather than the King i had booked. She understood, since i had the confirmation page, and immediately fixed that so it was no problem at all.The rooms are what you would expect in NYC. They're small, but more than enough room for the time we spent in the room since we were out and about most of the days. They were all clean and updated. Hallways are small, so do not bring much to carry. But the convenience of parking almost directly across the street for $26/day was great! Employees at the hotel were all polite and welcoming, along with the employees at the parking garage too. The location of the hotel to the city is great. Knowing we were a half block from Times Square made everything that much more enjoyable, since we could stop by the room quickly to drop things off or change for dinner. The breakfast space is just small, but a free breakfast is always nice. I plan on making a trip back in a few months and will be booking here again.

Stayed 4 nights in rainy May. Great location in the times square and theatre district. Good value for New York and staff was fairly pleasant. Couple of snags, though. We never got the room phone to work, very weak WIFI in the room, noisy air-conditioning unit, and high street-noise (5th floor street-facing room).

We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, after reading bad reviews of the standard of the hotels in New York, I would definitely reccommend it to anyone looking to stay near times square. Very short walk to times square and not too far from central park, plenty of places to eat and things to do. Free wifi was a big plus and the rooms were very clean and modern.

This was our second visit to the Comfort Inn Times Square and we were very happy with our stay again. Location is just a minute or two from Times Square and can't be beat. Rooms are small but perfectly adequate for a short stay. Free breakfast is great although the breakfast room is a little small. We took a Bahamas cruise from New York and the hotel was a short cab ride to the Manhattan Cruise Ship Terminal. Will stay here again and again!

We arrived early but they had a room available to checked us straight in with complimentary cookies! the hotel is in an excellent location 5 minutes from times square. The customer service is brilliant, and tea and coffee is available in the lobby all day as well as your complimentary breakfast.

The hotel was just yards from Times Square but was quiet, only 9 floors high so not long to wait for the lift. room was a reasonable size especially for the centre of Manhatten. Near all the attractions, Bed was so comfy you could not fail to sleep, although the aircon was quite noisy it may bother some people. Bedding and towels all lovely and clean and regularly changed. Complimentary breakfast was really good and was served from 7am to 10am and there were never any shortages no matter what time you went in, the breakfast room is not very big and some days you had to wait but it was only a couple of minutes as everyone wanted to get out into the city. Staff pleasant and overall good value for a city centre I had no complaints at all and the location is absolutely brilliant with everything you need on the doorstep including a couple of bars and restaurants almost next door.

Great place to stay. Wonderful location, close to Times Square yet very quiet. Pretty good breakfast. Staff was very helpful. Room was small but comfortable and very clean. Most comfortable bed I've had in a hotel in a while! Price was great- would definitely stay here again. Felt safe walking to and from the hotel late at night.

We loved our stay at the Comfort Inn Times Square for our first overnight experience in the big apple. The location was awesome. We were a half a block and only a few minute walk from the center of Times Square. We were able to walk most places around time square and had no problem getting a cab by walking either direction to one of the avenues. Within a short walk there is all kinds of food and stores for any needs while we stayed there. The hotel was an older hotel and was basic. The room (and entire hotel) was not huge but adequate for our needs. Overall the place was clean. The hotel had a little age and some aspects did show this age. If you are looking for a nice place to stay while in NYC, are on a budget, and don't mind some small rough edges, stay here. If you are looking for a luxury or boutique hotel where everything is perfect, modern, and new, you should probably go somewhere else.The staff was friendly and had no issues with the staff. The breakfast was a basic continental breakfast but it was adequate to get us going in the morning. We would stay in this hotel again when we go back to NYC. For the price that we paid, I don't think we could find anything better.

My wife and I spent 6 nights at this hotel and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone wanting a comfortable base at a budget price. It is literally a 1 minute walk to the heart of Times Square. That said where our room was situated we did not find it too noisy - much less so than we expected. The photographs on the hotel website accurately refelcted our room which was well furnished, comfortable and warm. The staff were helpful, the free business centre meant we were able to check in online for our return flight. Breakfast, included in the price was adequate, though the dining room is small. We hope to return in the not too distant future.

The room was immaculate, personnel were friendly and helpful with information, basic breakfast included with plenty of choices, very reasonable cost for the location right off Times Square. I felt safe to walk to and from the theater as there was casual police presence in the area. It was a few doors from the Visitor Center and close to a major subway entrance. I will stay there again I'm sure.

I've stayed in this hotel before and it's always worked out well (great location & clean), but on our most recent trip, it was fantastic! Not sure if it's had some renovations since our last trip, but it was super clean and the room seemed more spacious than we remembered (ask for a room that ends in 7, e.g., 407, 807 - that might have had something to do with it). Granted, still small, but relatively spacoius by Manhattan standards in this price range. The staff were friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was decent. Yes, the elevator is small and slow and the hallways are narrow, but it's an older building. Overall, I'd say the best hotel in this price range in the Times Square area.

The hotel's location could not be better - a few minutes from Times Square and the Rockerfeller Centre and close to several subway stations, but remarkably quiet. There are plenty of good restaurants close-by, particularly on 9th Avenue, a 10 minute walk away, and Little Brazil just up West 46th. The staff are courteous and helpful while the rooms are reasonably large and well equipped - large plasma screen TVs, comfortable beds and good bathrooms. The breakfast is a good way to start the day - cereals, yoghurt, beigels, do-nuts - though the small breakfast-room can get crowded at peak times. Given the relatively low cost of the rooms, I cannot imagine better value for money in such a brilliant location right at the centre of everything New York has to offer.

i had booked this trip a while ago and was given a fare price only for tha rate to drop and month or so later and w/o any issue was given the lower price,, check in a breeze, staff over the top nice and knowledgeable,,room clean clean,, and most imp bed bug covers,,,on bed,,,room is small but adequate... great location,, at times square but not on busy street... parking is right across the street discounted by the hotel..breakfast looked good but i was in a rush so didnt part take,, but everyone seemed to enjoy,,only two minor issues 1, 1 small elevator, and ice machine in basement,, not scary looking basement just in the basement..would definatly stay here again if i was going anywhere in the the times square area..

A great affordable hotel, seems very reasonably priced for the area (and I did a LOT of research before booking anything, as found that even finding an enquite on a budget in NYC can be difficult). Located just off the mayhem that is Times Square but our room was at the back and was so dark and quiet we actually had trouble getting up! Clean rooms, friendly staff and lots of handy pubs and eateries in the same street and immediate area. Walk to all the theatres on Broadway, free internet, room perfectly adeqaute size (not huge but with good storage) and in room safe which was great to have. No guest laundry, which sadly seems typical these days. Street felt safe and being near Times Square there are always people around. You are a few blocks easy stroll to Central Park (maybe 10 minutes) and are located between 6th and 7th Aves, so very close to the 5th Avenue shopping. Easy walking to most midtown attractions (Rockefeller Centre, Empire State, Macys) and transport. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel has all the comfort you need, and is half block from times square and one from Rockefeller Center. All the major atractions and shops of new york can be reached by foot, short walk. Staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are nice, bathroom too. Free wi-fi internet, which nowadays i consider a must. The only thing that is negative is the elevator, that is very slow. It become bothersome if your room is on the upper floors and the hotel is full.

We stayed here two nights in April of 2010. The room was TINY, but most rooms in the city are for that price! We parked across the street at a public lot where we made reservations. It was nice to have the lot right there! The hotel was under construction, so there was some stuff all over. The staff was okay. The hotel was in a good place and easy to walk/take the subway to see the city. I would stay here again!

We really enjoyed staying for a week at the hotel - the whole staff was very receptive and very willing to help. The room was very clean and comfortable and breakfast had some good options and it was included in the price charged!The hotel is located near 3 subway stations, which can get you virtually anywhere in Manhattan in less than 30 mins. Times Square is a few steps away but you don't hear its noise when you're in your room - just perfect! We were very satisfied with the price charged and the consequent service offered and we already recommended your hotel to a friend traveling to NY in May!

The hotel was less than a block from Times Square with lots of bars, eateries etc very close. Room was small, but very clean. Lobby was also small, but again was clean and felt safe. Continental breakfast was included and was standard fare, but was fresh. Employees were very nice and helpful. Only minor issue is street noise late at night, but you have to expect that being so close to Times Square and several bars nearby. Would definately stay here again.
very close to times square and very cheap. I think it is the cheapest one around times square. just walk within 8 minutes to reach times square. The subway are also very close.
Excellent base to visit NY. Incredible Staff. Free High Speed Internet. Good breakfast.

Hotel is very close to Times Square - just 1/2 block away. Area is very convenient. Room was quite small but that's typical for New York. The room was excellent overall - very clean, comfortable bed, nice furniture. It was great having wi-fi internet access. Continental breakfast was decent. The prices for hotel stay per night was bargain compared to other hotels and worth every cent. The staff was very courteous and very helpful. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to New York.

What a great place to stay! We paid $121.49 for a queen bed (AAA rate) and were literally 1/2 block (1 minute walk) from Times Square. The bed, pillows, and sheets seemed brand new and very comfortable. Every single staff person was so pleasant and helpful, and very quick. We asked for a towel and they beat us up to the room! I've never tipped anyone at the breakfast areas at hotels but I was tempted to here--the worker was so friendly and ran back to replenish the pastries when he saw me eyeing them. Yes, the room is quite small but that didn't matter at all about 2 minutes after we got into the room. Everything was laid out nicely and it worked. The room was a bit too warm but it was better than freezing. We used the parking garage across the street which offers a discount rate for Comfort Inn customers. The hotel let us keep our bags in the hotel after we checked out so we could still explore the city on foot.

Booked this hotel mainly because of the bargain price through the applecorehotel website. Had reservations about it because it seemed so cheap compared with other hotels. But, wow, what a place!Location- perfect. Less than a minute's walk to times sqaure, 2 mins to nearest metro.Breakfast- fabulous! Delicious coffee, juices, belgian waffles with syrup, doghnuts, cereal, toast, bagels with cream cheese, fruit, yoghurt & boiled eggs! It was fantastic and really set you up for the day ahead!Rooms- compact but big enough for all your needs! The bed is the comfiest bed i have ever slept in, seriously! One person commented that the rooms were cold, we found our 8th floor room very toasty! In fact, we even used the air con at one point!The rooms have a huge flat screen tv, phone, free wi-fi, hairdryer & coffee maker.Finaly, what makes this hotel perfect are the staff. They are all so friendly, always smiling to say hello as you enter. We will most definately be staying at this fabulous hotel again! see you all soon! love from scotland (room 804, 11th-15th feb!).

This place has it all, no kidding. Steps away from Time Square and an easy walk to many other NYC must sees. Rooms are efficient and surprisingly quiet for the location. Best of all is the staff, very friendly and willing to help with whatever is needed. We will be back often.
This hotel is steps from Times Square yet our room was quiet! I found that to be kind of amazing. Very clean, nice spacious bathroom, flat screen t.v., nice bed, pleasant staff.two thumbs up.

You couldn't get a better location at this price! Very nice hotel. The room was a bit on the small side but didn't present any problem for us. The bed also seemed small for a Queen bed. The hotel was very clean and breakfast was good with plenty to eat. Tea & coffee was available 24 hours in the breakfast room and coffee making was available in the room. Free Wifii was availale too. Surprisingly, it wasn't noisy although you could hear the plumbing from the room next door. The only negative was that the room was too hot - but this seems to be a problem in most hotelsduring the winter months.

My partnetr and I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn Times Square to celebrate our 4 years together. The location is so close to everything. We walked out the front entrance and the next street over is right where the ball drops in Times Square. The hotel was very clean and looked like it had just been remodeled. The room was a good size for NYC and the bathroom was very roomy. There was also a free breakfast every morning, fitness room, business center and tons of brochures. We went to 4 shows while in NYC and also did the City Sights All Around Town tour. We were so close to everything, it was amazing. The last we stayed we stayed in NJ and went back and forth via NJ Transit. While that option worked out great and helped save some money, the chance to go back to the hotel for a few hours this time to rest was a great benefit. With the rate I got through Choice Privileges we only paid about $20 more a night then when we stayed in NJ. Overall the location, cleanliness and amenities in the hotel made out weekend amazing and allowed us to enjoy every minute to its fullest. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.
Perfect location for a short trip to NY, complimentary breakfast, free Wi-Fi, clean room and the bath, fair price (relatively to NY center), AAA discount.

Stayed here for a weekend trip to NYC. Was not disappointed. The hotel is located one block from Macy's. You are in walking distance to the heart of Times Square, The Empire State Building, Broadway, but it is a lot quieter. The staff, especially Matt and Victor were pleasant and very helpful. The hotel is clean, a great value, and the continental breakfast includes eggs and waffles as well as fresh fruit. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Would definitely go back.
Excellent location one block from Times Square. Rooms are tiny, but clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Free breakfast included.

First location...1/2 block from Time Square. Can't get any better than this! This place is within walking distance to nearly every Broadway Musical, many sights, etc. And if it is beyond walking distance, City Sights pickup locations are nearby.Secondly, the hotel was spotless. Very clean and presentable. Rooms were immaculate and hallways and commons area were always clean. The staff was very friendly and eager to help. The rooms are small, but comfortable. After all, you aren't in NYC to spend the entire time in your room. The bed was very comfortable and the outside noise was non-existent. They served a continental breakfast which we didn't partake in so I'm not certain how that was. Although if you have a chance, eat dinner at Rosie O'Grady's which is just a door or 2 down from this hotel. It was a great place for dinner. Lunch was OK, but dinner was excellent...go for the petit filet. Great value! Speaking of value, the cost of the hotel is in line with what you receive in NYC. We were there to watch the Ball drop so the night before and the night after New Years Eve were economical, but NYE night was double the normal price. I'm sure this was typical of all hotels in NYC that night.We always felt safe at and around our hotel. Never a concern with any issues. My wife and I walked everywhere during our 3 day stay in NYC. Coming in from LaGuardia Airport (LGA), a taxi charged us right at $40 for the tolls/fare. On our return trip to LGA, we asked the front desk to order us a taxi for the morning of departure and they actually have a private car service they recommended. It was a nice, clean vehicle, w/ a nice, clean driver. They charged $45, which included tolls as well. A shade more expensive, but a less stressful trip compared to the taxi ride.You can't go wrong with this hotel. You will love it all!

I stayed 4 nights in this hotel with a group of high school students. I would stay here again in a New York minute. The best example of the helpfulness of the staff was during breakfast when the attendant looked as me and asked how long we were staying. He said he wanted to make sure he got enough donuts for the kids because they seemed to like them. The hotel has a European feel to it. The rooms are small BUT they are immaculately clean. All this an a block from Times Square! Stay here.

Loved hotel/staff/location.... BUT would NOT stay again and NEVER recommend due to "OWNERS" unfair 24hr No Show /Cancellation policy with "NO EXCEPTIONS". So if you have a medical emergency, death, weather problems, etc. you will be charged a fee regardless...basically no reason is good enough. I was charged $307.56 and i know the hotel was not even at Full capacity. I was suppose to stay 12/27 till 12/31 but due to NYC freak snowstorm airports were closed so i was detoured unable to get into NYC to check into hotel till 12/28. I even called twice on 12/27 to update hotel about my status but to them it was already past 24hr notice so it didnt matter and i was still charged. It is so disappointing that this hotel would make money that way off their customers.

The rooms are not big, but are very clean and with confortable beds/sheets and shower. Good complimetary breakfast (coffee, corn flakes, fresh bananas and apples, orange juice, pastry and toasts).Free wireless internet in the rooms and free business center at the lobby.Free phone calls within USA. Free newspaper. Most of the attractions located at walking distances. If you are looking for a confortable place to crash between city-tours, shoppings, museums and theaters, you might consider staying at this hotel.

The only things that I might change about this hotel was the size of the breakfast area. It was so crowded that there were no tables. I would also change the location of the ice machine...being a femaie and going to the basement to get ice, doesn't seem safe. Check in was easy, really friendly front desk staff. Great business center and nice exercise facility. Loved the IHome Ipod system and flat screen tvs. Although there was no view from our room (view of brick building), it really was conducive to a great night sleep in a very comfortable bed. We will definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend to other travels staying in NYC who want a great hotel in an even better location.

I arrived late for check-in (although I did advise hotel when I booked my room) and everything seemed fine and dandy until I entered "my room". TV is on, garbage bins full of trash. Bed wasn't made. Dirty towels. It was as if somebody else was actually staying in that room. So I immediately went down the front desk and asked for a room change since there seemed to be a mistake. The front desk guy was very helpful and immediately switched me over to one of the upper floor rooms. This time it was clean and good. Room is very small, but it's just fine with me since I'm alone anyhow. Wide screen TV, ironing board, safety deposit box and nice mattress bed. I wasn't really able to enjoy the continental breakfast because not much variety with the bread available so I ate at Applebies. Still, nothing can beat the value + location combined, just a few paces away from Times Square. So all in all still a good experience.

The location is fantastic! You can walk, take the subway, bus or taxi anywhere. You can be in Times Square in seconds. We can't say enough about the location. The breakfast was very good (plenty for us!!) The rooms may be small but served our purpose and closet was huge!! I felt very safe staying here. Will def. stay again!!

We came to NYC to go to the Macy's Parade and picked this hotel from comments on Tripadvisor. What a great choice!! The staff was so friendly. Let me say... Stanlee rocks!!!. The room was small, but we were ok with that for the price. The location to everything was great. So close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, you name it. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again!!!

This hotel is in such a great location, just a short block away from times square. The rooms are small (but what isnt in New York City), the perfect size for two people. We were able to walk to all the major attractions except to battery park for the statue of liberty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York City! The hotel also offers a free breakfast, which is a nice start to a full day of sightseeing.

I love this hotel! Small hotel lying 7 minutes walk from Times Square and Macys'. Really nice, quiet and clean rooms. Great service. Only problem is that the breakfast room is too small, so it can sometimes be hard to get a seat. But you can allways take your food to your room.

We came to see the Macy's Parade, and picked this hotel from comments on tripadvisor. Could not have made a better choice. Entire staff helpful, friendly and very competent. Very close to theaters, Times Square, subway and not long walk to Central Park. The best part: for the Thanksgiving Parade 46th Street is closed to only hotel guests and local foot traffic. So half a block from the front door you have a perfect view of the parade at 7th and 46th. We went down about 30 minutes after the parade started, and were about 3 rows back in a fairly small crowd.
This was a perfect place to stay for our first trip to NYC. The hotel was clean and comfortable, location was perfect and the service was excellent. We will definitely stay here again.

Stayed one night. Check-in went good, and room was ready when I arrived. Room was nicely furnished and very clean. Bathroom had a great shower. The location of the hotel was also good. Near subway, and all the broadway theaters. Would recommend this hotel. Free breakfast, but I didn't have it, had to check out early.

Location quite good, walking distance Times Square and Grand Central Station. Very small room but it was clean and really quiet with good heat or AC. Bonus that the bed was really comfortable. Staff helpful. We didn't have the breakfast as preferred the Westway diner round the corner for a typical US feast (come out of Hotel, turn right, turn left at junction). Only concern was no locking device on door at night. Only gripe was slow and inadequate lift.

Superb position with subway, buses, shops within yards.Not ostentatious, it does not have porters, bell-boys and other superficial staff requiring tips as soon as a taxi arrives. Simply kind and friendly desk staff. There is a concierge if required. Quite frankly, with Penn Station with easy access to main airport with a simple train change at Jamaica, or airport bus services from only yards away from hotel, costly taxi services are superfluous.This hotel is on 20 floors, with four rooms per floor. The rooms are modern, with lovely bathrooms, large screen TV, and every facility that you could require. The rooms are perhaps rather small, but believe me, are excellent value. I stayed on floor eleven, but never had to wait more than a minute or so for a lift (elevator).Breakfast was a pleasure, with an adequate continental breakfast. A choice of coffees, juices, fruit, boiled eggs, a diversity of breads, jams (marmalade etc.), lovely cakes.If the breakfast room gets very busy, and it is rather small, it constitutes no problem as it is possible to take a tray up to the room.Adjacent shops and restaurants are very near at hand if you require anything for the room, such as milk or sandwiches.I will certainly stay at this very pleasant central establishment with its friendly kind staff and excellent value for money facilities when I next pass through New York on the way to members of my family who live on Long Island.

The hotel is half block away from Times Square and within walking distance of so much. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Contenental breakfast just average. A big plus and not advertised unless you contact the hotel or its owner group reservation dept. is a 10% discount for seniors.

Very clean, well-decorated room in an absolutely great location. As with most Manhattan hotels, the room was pretty small, but big enough for the two of us. The bathroom was actually very spacious, with an excellent shower. The room rates are shockingly high in this part of town, especially for a small-town westerner like me. But, the rates were over $100 less at this quiet gem than for adjacent, more hectic hotels. There was only one small elevator, but since there are only 8 floors the waits were not too long. Don't expect a view. Our view was a slit which barely let in daylight. Great for sleeping, though. Hotels often claim to be 'one block from such and such' when in reality they are pretty far. This place is literally a block from Times Square. You exit the hotel, turn right, walk past St. Mary's Episcopal Church and boom - there you are in Times Square, right across from the Marriott Marquis. This hotel would be an excellent alternative for those attending one of the myriad conferences at the Marriott. Unlike the conference hotels, this one includes a decent free breakfast.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and would definately recommend it. The service was super. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and very knowledgable. The location of the hotel was perfect for our trip to NY, right around the corner from Times Square. The breakfast buffett was a great start to the day! We'll definately come back.

This is the third time I have stayed at the Comfort Inn at 129 West 46th Street. I mention the address because I have seen if referred to comfort inn midtown and comfort inn time square! and I see some pictures posted from the one on 35th! Anyway, this hotel and the staff are wonderful. Rooms are updated and clean, beds are comfortable, we were on the fifth floor with a front window and the noise was minimal and only a block from the center of time square!!! thanks again to the great staff.

We spent 3 nights here before embarking on a cruise and it was so wonderfully located for sightseeing and theatre. Also, the staff were incredibly helpful (getting us free drinks at a restaurant nearby) and the room was comfortable and quiet with enough room (which is hard to find in NYC) all for $220 a night. Definitely would recommend it for a nice stay in NYC.

Stayed here, 2nd time in NYC. Hotel like most in NYC basic but clean and tidy. Staff very helpful & friendly, and complimentary breakfast (continental) was really good. Staye d on 4th floor - located in garment district, was bit noisy with horns etc but thats NYC! Recommeded as a central base (rockerfeller centre about 15 min walk / empire state 15 mins). Close to everything. Good value for money. 5 mins from Madison Square Gardens and Macys.

I stayed here for one night ... I spent weeks trying to find a place that was reviewed well, not a ridiculous amount of money, and with NO bed bugs!! Finally decided on this place, and I was nervous. It was cheaper than most places in NYC ... and I was nervous it would be obvious why when I got there. Totally pleasantly surprised. Room was small (it was a Queen Single) but that was fine ... it's NYC, and I was alone. The room was clean, and nicely updated. TV had a good selection of channels. The bed was comfy. And I felt like the hotel was nice and quiet (thought I always where ear plugs to bed). My only complaint would be the location of the AC. It was pretty hot when I was there, and I had the AC on the whole time. When I was laying in bed watching tv, it was blowing right on me ... The placement would have made more sense in the other window in the room.Besides that, the lobby was nice, all people at the desk where friendly and helpful. Check in/out was a breeze, and I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to others!

This is a lovely, affordable hotel. It offers bed and breakfast. Our room was small (501) but tastefully decorated with a large flat screen TV and a bath as well as a shower. It was kept spotless by the housekeeper, with frequent changes of linen and clean towels every day.The one thing I would grumble about was nothing to do with the hotel really, it was quite noisy during the night with frequent horns and sirens. I know its New York but it was annoying when you were trying to sleep! Having said that I would stay again in an instant.

Okay the Rooms are small (but very clean), outside is a mess (but very close to Times Square). This hotel worked very well for us. Free breakfast was a great start to the day. The Wi-fi worked a treat (also free). The rooms are small but clean. You are coming to New York to see the city - not the room. If this is your attitude well this will be your hotel. Only tip: Get to breakfast area early - it gets crowded. If you get caught - just take the elevator up one level to the foyer and eat there. Also the organise a shuttle through hotel back to the airport - worked a treat.

so it's not very clean or spectacular even though the price is deceiving, it's still the comfort inn. i suppose it's my fault i waited to late to get a hotel bc for the same price a few months earlier we could have gotten into the waldorf. but i paid all this money over $300 a night and it was a comfort inn and the worst comfort inn i've ever stayed at. ive been to several of them throughout america and they've been pretty decent and good value for what you pay, clean, nice facilities and staff but none of this was true for the one in NYC. we also paid for/requested a king size bed but got two full size beds and they wouldn't change it. and they had the smallest weirdest pillows to sleep on which made it awkward to sleep, they were half the size of a standard pillow! location is decent but try to book farther in advance for a better hotel, bc if you're going to do new york, do it right.

We stayed for 5 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. Couldn't get over how close it was to the very centre of Times Square, just 70 metres away. Check in was quick, our room was smallish, but clean and comfortable. A basic airconditioner was in the room, not sure how efficient it would be in the middle of summer though. Bathroom was very large. Coffee machine was provided in the room and you could also help yourself at any time to tea and coffee in the breakfast room. A very good free continental breakfast was provided with cereal, fruit, pastries, toast and yoghurt. Make sure you tip the attendant though.The hotel was close to public transport which we used all the time. There's also a tiny gym with treadmill which you really don't need, just walk everywhere whilst in New York! Free internet was also available in a small business centre in the lobby. All in all, a great place to stay whilst visiting the Big Apple

Rooms were comfortable, service was quick, had a 24/7 business center (that could print but couldn't scan, but behind the front desk had a fax), had free wifi, had an exercise room with treadmills, continental breakfast was included, staffers were knowledgeable and helpful. Being that it is 2 blocks down from Time Square central, the noise did carry late at night but nothing too obnoxious and nothing we couldn't sleep through.

My husband and I just stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean. The bed was amazingly comfortable. We slept so good here. There was no noise from the neighboring rooms. The room is not spacious by any means, but was plenty big enough for the two of us. The breakfast was bagels, toast, boiled eggs, yogurt, donuts, cereal, juice and coffee. It was enough to get us going each day. The hotel offers coupons for many of the touristy things, so be sure to check when you get there. We missed out on savings when we didn't find out about them until late in day 2. This hotel's main point is the location. It is just down the street from Times Square and not too far from subway and bus stops. Parking is just across the street but will cost $26/day. Be sure to get everything out of your car that you want because they take your car up in an elevator and you can't go back to it. They will bring it back down if you need something, but it isn't convenient and takes time. I can't wait to go back to NY and stay here again!

Checked in for two days and and had a wonderful stay. Staff was pleasant and helpful and food and shopping was a block away, with the subway just a few more. Good price considering the location. Parking located right across, about $23.00 per day when we checked in, which is not part of the cost.

Great location, great staff and very good price! Cozy hotel and very friendly staff. Free local and interstate phone calls and free wifi. For the price u pay the hotel is great. The location is in the middle of everything without the noise. Rooms were small and a little dark but that seems standard for new York. There's so much to do that u won't b spending much time in ur room anyway. Breakfast wasn't the best, but still pretty descent!

This was my husband's and my first time in NYC and we couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel. It is just a block off of Times Square so the location was perfect. Each staff member we encountered was unfailingly pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was more than adequate, the room comfortable, and the premises clean and well maintained. Our only very minor complaint was the outdated computers that didn't always work well. They let us store our luggage after check-out time until later in the day when we had to catch our bus to the Newark Airport.
Fantastic location in a friendly atmosphere with excellent service. No noise at all from outside or inside. My wife and I stayed 4 nights and would return in a heartbeat!

Don't want to repeat the others: in a nutshell very clean, good free breakfast, fantastic location, nice staff, close reduced parking: excellent. Don't have any qualms that this is too good to be true: it's exactly as everyone else has said! Yes, the room was small (for family of four VERY small) but location (everything in NYC) can't be beat. If you are picky the business centre is very slow (but free in room internet more than makes up) and workers were working on the fire excape outside welding and banging at 7:00. I agree completely about the cleanliness (first rate) and speed of room cleaning (came back for something at 10:30 one morning after leaving at 9:00 and it was completely done. Please patronize this establishment!

Wow, now I know why this hotel gets the high ratings on Trip Advisor. It was way above my expectations for a two-star hotel. Although the room was small....everything was new and immaculate; carpet, furniture, bedding, large flat screen TV. If you want to be very near the action in Times Square at a relatively moderate price, this is for you. Service from the staff was A+. Our room was quiet, no street noise at all.

In every way, this hotel exceeded our expectations. During our 3 night stay, our group of seven enjoyed a great daily breakfast, easy access to Broadway shows, tours and shopping & we felt totally safe and cared for. Thank you Comfort Inn Times Square. We WILL return! Written by a happy family from Virginia.

I chose the Comfort Inn because it get very decent reviews. Overall the hotel was very good, except the aircondition as a bit noisy. The location is excellent on a quiet street but just a block or so from Times Square. It is a very good hotel for a couple, but not necessarily if you have children.. the breakfast room was a bit small and the food okay. You could get free coffee all day and all night. There are lots of places to eat around Times Square, so there is no real need for a restaurant in the hotel.Overall my friend and I were very satisfied with the hotel.

Just spent a week in this hotel with my wife and 2 young daughters (11 & 9) and will be recommending it to family/ friends and also staying here again when I next visit NYC. The hotel's location is its standout feature - in West 46th street it's literally yards away from Broadway/Times Square and is just one block away from the Rockefeller Centre. Close to a subway station and 2 minutes from 5th Avenue/ St Patrick's Cathedral & Radio City Music Hall this hotel really couldn't have been situated anywhere more convenient for all the big attractions. The hotel was clean, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly - especially the porter and Anthoni (from Poland) who worked in the breakfast area. The room was more than big enough for the 4 of us and being located on the 8th floor and at the back of the hotel we could not hear any noise from the streets below. The bathroom was basic but adequate. The eat what you like buffet style continental breakfast was a sure-fire winner - the choice was excellent cereals, yoghurts, fruit, bagels, doughnuts, toast, fruit juices, tea, coffee etc basically anything you wanted and as much as you wanted - definitely sets you up for the day ahead. Downsides - none at all - having read previous reviews yes there may only be one lift in the hotel but our longest wait was 2/3 mins and we were on the 8th floor (there are 9 floors) - but when you're on holiday who is rushing, and yes you may have to wait on a table for breakfast (our longest wait was <5 minutes) but for the centre of Midtown Manhattan this was a perfect choice at a perfect price. Great wee hotel.

We've slept in Comfort Inn Midtown Times Square 8 nights. We loved the hotel and the staff. The continental breakfast is satisfatory and you don't need more. It's 2 minutes from Times Square, TKTS... Great! The room wasn't that small, the bathroom is comfortable. We've stayed at the room 900 . when a made the reservation, I asked for a room at the 6th floor or above and away from the street to avoid the street noise and they gave me the perfect room. The weather was very hot 35C and the air conditioner wasn't that good and just on the latest days we discovered that we had to close the bathroom door so the temperature would be cooler. Instead, we definitely recommend this hotel!!!

We stayed for 8 nights. Friendly check-in, workers very knowledgeable and helpful. Our king room was small but we knew that. Flat screen tv. Bathroom worked well. Maid service daily. Continental breakfast each morning with lots of choices. Coffee 24/7 as well as a coffee maker in the room. 5 minute walk to Times Square. Close to subway trains.

Great place to stay and the staff was so very friendly..Our room was located on the side of the building at night you did not hear a peep of noise..so very surprised due to the fact that we where just steps away from times square. I have already recommended this hotel to my family and friends..again i say....EXCELLENT STAY!

This is a great location in New York City. We traveled by Mega Bus which dropped us off around 34th street and walked to the hotel (about a 30 min walk) Since we were early 8:30 they stored our luggage and we were on our way. When we returned we requested a room away from the noise and traffic and the hotel delivered. We heard no noise from anyone which truly amazed us. The rooms are small, but recently remodeled with flat screen tv. The window air conditioner was adequate but not freezing. My only complaint is one small elevator for the whole hotel. Sometimes it took awhile for the elevator to come especially since we were on the top floor. The convenience of the subway within a couple blocks and food close by makes this an excellent place to stay while visiting NY city.

This hotel had a great location and the price was very reasonable. The room was small probably 9 x 9 but immaculate. The breakfast was adequate with plenty of food and tables. The staff was friendly and very helpful. This was not a typical budget hotel. It was better. I would recommend and would stay there again if ever in the city. They will also hold your bags if you arrive early or need to leave the city late.

We spent about 10 nights over Christmas and NYE and for the price and location, this cannot be beat!! The rooms were warm and cozy, clean and quiet. Our room faced out onto the street but we hardly heard any noises besides the few police cars and fire engines. The bed was so comfortable and absolutely nothing went wrong during our stay. The location is probably the best thing about this hotel - which especially helped us for 3am pizza to help us with our jetlag! When we were tired or cold or wanted to drop shopping off, it was so convenient. The Irish pub across the road had a yummy chicken pie and great live music. I couldn't think of anywhere better to stay in NY!

Have just got back from our first visit to NY city and found this a good place to stay. I chose it based upon previous TA reviews and they were right! We had just flown in from Vegas and so the rooms seemed small in comparison (don't take too much luggage!) but this is apparently the norm in NY. The hotel is close to Times Square and handy for Restaurant Row just a short walk away. The whole area is swarming with police and so felt very safe. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and were happy to store our luggage after we checked out so that we could make the most of our last few hours before our flight home.

I stayed at this hotel over Memorial Day weekend for a mother/daughter trip to NYC. I had read a lot of good things about it, so I was optimistic. I didn't disappoint! I had read to request a higher room to assure the floor was quiet. They gave us a room on the top floor that faced the front of the building. Our room was 902 and it sat in the corner, which gave us a lot more space. It was clean and roomy and the beds were great. The continental breakfast in the morning is great - just enough to get you going. The staff was super friendly and were always available to answer questions and give suggestions. The location can't be beat - just blocks from everything NYC has to offer. I highly recommend this hotel!

This was an excellent little gem. The shower was smaller, but large bathroom. HUGE flat screen tv and very comfortable. Staff was friendly. I would stay here every time I go to new york and recommend it to anyone. Note to the owners/staff: keep up the great stay and continue to update the hotel as time changes, this will be a great asset! (Side note: no views :( but you'll be out walking the streets anyways!) Paid $139 a night around St. Patty's day.

The hotel is in a great location. Keep in mind it is a Comfort Inn. Rooms are a bit small, but lets face it, your in mid town, and for the price you are getting a pretty good room for it. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Was the perfect place to stay for our first trip to the Big Apple. The heart of Times Square is right outside the door. The hotel itself had everything we could ask for; clean rooms, a great breakfast in the morning, and free wireless! I didn't find the room too small at all, as complained about a lot of NY hotels. We also accidentally left a suit in the room wardrobe - and management fedex'd it to us across to our hotel on the West Coast!!There are a few homeless people around during the nighttime, but we never encountered any problems - and never felt unsafe. Was the perfect base for the NY tourist!

Stayed here for 4 nights in April, lovely hotel small and comfortable. Room has everything you need, good sized bathroom and comfy bed and so quiet, didnt hear any sound at night time. Breakfast was great every morning, really good to set up for the busy day ahead. Less than one min from Times Square. No complaints at all about this hotel, great price too for the location

I was worried about the hotel but Trip gave good reviews and they have only failed me once in 7 years.....Dont stay here if you want a few...not going to happen...this is a clean room,wonderful beds, and our view was of 2 brick walls..BUT it is 2 mins to Times Square...A 5 min walk to Grand Central and to all major bus lines... we wanted to see the city and we did by taking the bus and then walking thru the neighbor hoods....I am a wonderful travel expert...so please e mail me at mijuroot@yahoo.com for any info...we left NY to Cooperstown, Gettysburg, and then to Wdc...Rented a car in NY returned to WDC..

Our stay was very enjoyable. The location was great with lots of restaurants in the area and we were soooo close to Times Square. Everything was at our fingertips. Bus tours started and stopped very close to the hotel plus we were within walking distance of a lot of attractions. The complimentary breakfast in the mornings saved us a fortune and gave us a great start to our day. The rooms are a little small but very clean and efficient. The best of all was the staff. They were so friendly and helpful. From the front desk, breakfast room staff, housekeeping and lobby staff. They always had a smile and we felt like we knew them by the end of the trip and they really cared if we were enjoying ourselves. I would highly recommend and I will definitely stay again.

The Comfort Inn Midtown was one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Yes the rooms are on the small side but they are well thought out and make good use of space. And what hotel rooms in New York aren't small? We couldn't hear any traffic from our room on the 7th floor or noise from other rooms. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the complimentary breakfast was great as I hate having to get up and go out looking for somewhere to have breakfast. The free WiFi was great for us to use our laptop in our room and we were even able to use the business centre computers to confirm our flight and print off tickets, with no charge. The location was central to everything in Times Square and the subway. I got a great deal online about 6 weeks before we left for our trip so keep an eye on their website for special offers. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

We usually stay at mid level types of hotels when going to NYC and they have been hit or miss. This is certainly a hotel that I would not hesitate to stay again. Great location (1/2 block from Times Square). Small room but we've come to expect that in NYC. I need to complement the front desk clerk (sorry, I forgot his name) as he was extremely friendly and helpful. Nice continental breakfast. I should mention that the hotel validates for discounted parking at the lot across the street (just prior to the hotel).

We stayed at the hotel during easter vacation. The best thing about booking in this hotel is of course its location that is the famous and buzzing Times Square! Rooms are clean and fairly quiet, towels are changed every day and the breakfast although basic is a boon to hungry and exhausted travelers! Opt for the rooms of the upper floors or the back side rooms as street noise may be frustrating sometimes! The staff although in general terms is helpful could be a little bit more friendly! Nevertheless, I think that 200 Euros per night for this hotel is not a cheap price. Of course the problem of overpriced hotels is the rule as far as the Manhattan hotels are concerned and it is not the problem of this particular hotel.

This hotel had everything we were looking for: location, location, location!! We were steps to Times Square and subways and just a few blocks to Rockefeller Center. The room was also modern and clean. The bedding and mattress was first rate. My only complaint was that the breakfast room was extremely hot. So much so that we just grabbed a banana and split. :) Also in-room safe was large enough to fit my widescreen laptop.

Just 1/2 block from Times Square, the location of this hotel couldn't be better. From the bellman to the maid, to the desk clerks, everyone made us feel right at home here. They always appear to love their work and we were always greeted politely and with a friendly smile. Breakfast consisted of fresh baked goods, boiled eggs, sweet & unsweetened cereals, fruits, juice, yogurt, and coffee. The computer room had two computers connected to high speed internet. At least one was almost always available.Our room over-looked 46th Street. If you need a quieter room, ask for a higher floor; bring foam earplugs if you are sensitive to noise as Midtown Manhattan is by nature noisy.

Looking for a great value hotel and great location then Comfort Inn Midtown Manhattan fits the bill! We have just returned from a week long break to New York and were very happy with our hotel choice. The only downside was that it was a little noisy but that's New York!In all other respects this was a superb choice for those who don't want to spend a fortune on accommodation.

I can't find any fault with this hotel at all. The location was perfect, less than a block from the heart of Times Square, but far enough down the side street to be quiet. I mean, we were on the 2nd floor and heard next to nothing. The room is small, I mean it is New York. But the price was right, $179 with my AAA discount. The service was great, very clean room, prompt response when I requested more towels. The breakfast is very basic, but it'll get you through to lunch and it's FREE. I would stay here again.
Staff was very helpful and friendly; other guests were also friendly; warm atmosphere

My husband and I live just outside the city and decided to stay here for 2 nights for a kid free weekend. The hotel was in the heart of Times Square. As others have said, the rooms are small, but clean and comfortable with blackout curtains, which was key in helping us have restful nights. The staff was attentive. The breakfast was a normal continental, and while the dining room was small, we had no problems getting a table. We parked in the garage across the street for 2 nights and received a discount from the hotel. All in all, it was a great value and we would stay again and highly recommend it to others. Just an FYI, if you have kids who like to take a bath, there are no tubs, just showers.

My wife and I stayed at this Comfort Inn on a trip to NY to visit grandkids and take in a broadway musical. I decided to try this location from good reviews on TripAdvisor and they were correct. It was difficult to believe this place exists just off Times Square ! When we walked in, the desk guy immediately gave us another discount( AAA). I had already reserved a room online using AAA and was, obviously, very happy to save even more. The room was on the small side( all are in NY) but very clean, comfortable and even had a small coffee pot in the room. Negatives: tiny old elevator( somewhat picky criticism) and some noise overnight from outside( we had a room right in front overlooking the street)  We will be staying there again without a doubt. Lastly, complimentary breakfast ! think of that...at a hotel in New York right off Times Square !

Just steps from Times Square, we found this hotel excellent value for Manhattan. I have stayed in hotels on business at twice the cost in New York, and frankly prefer this place. Our room was very small, but if you are spending much time in your room you are missing the fun in New York. Everything was clean and comfortable, and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is also a convenient 24-hour deli right across the street for late-night snacks. We will stay here again.

Pros:- location: less than a block from Times Square- nice room and bathroom- breakfast (rare in NYC hotels)- free usage of computer which was nice since we did not bring our laptops- great valueCons:- we experienced problems with the heating (which must be one of the only thing that was not renovated), however the staff was quick to provide a supplementary electric heater- limited seating area for breakfast

I have just returned from New York City. and had a wonderful stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown.Staff is very very friendly and helpful for everything you need.Location is wonderful.Rooms are a little bit small but who needs big rooms in NYC???The most important...clean, quite and comfortable.I really recommend!

My partner his parents and myself stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from the 19th February - 26th February. Manager Rajni is very friendly and secured us some great rooms on the 9th floor which were most appreciated, also the front desk lady Ivonne was very welcoming. The rooms are quite large for being in NYC. Really nice bathrooms. The room had everything you could need, Large LCD TV with plenty of channels, Safety Deposit Box, Desk & Chair, Two phones, Coffee & Tea maker, Ironing board, hairdryer, plenty of towels etc. The bed was so comfy and large, with nice fresh linens, the housekeeping do a very good job to keep the place clean as it was spotless. The breakfast room was always fully stocked of cereal, bread, bagels, doughnuts,yogurts,fresh fruit, etc plenty to keep you going, the guys in there do a good job of keeping everything freshly stocked and cleaned. The luggage room attendant was a genuinely friendly happy person, definately the type you trust to leave your bags with, I didnt catch his name but he was a tall african-american guy he is a credit to the hotel. The only person who i never saw a smile from was a guy named Garry i'm not sure what his job role was he just stood there looking sad, maybe he had problems at the time to make him be like that but it was pretty noticeable he didnt enjoy his job.The hotel's business centre was a great bonus, very handy being able to print off your boarding passes etc for free. Free WiFi was also appreciated and had full signal.This hotel is good value, excellent location, great staff, and I would 100% stay here again and recommend to people. I'll upload photos shortly.

We stayed here during the blizzard of 2010 and it was great. The rooms were small but clean and the location was excellent. We were one block from Time Square, 3 blocks to Radio City. We were able to walk to shows and resturants even though the rain/snows came down. The elevator is small and slow, but we were in leisure mode so it made little difference. On the seventh floor we had little street noise to bother us. We would stay again even though the room was small.

This was my best NY stay, the hotel is very confortable, afordable and nearby everything. I stayed in a room with window but there was almost no noise during the night. Very good if you want to enjoy the city.

I stayed here in November 2009, had a wonderful experience and wrote about it here. My return trip in January was no different. Friendly faces all around -- the front desk sees thousands of guests, but they remembered me. Gave me the room I asked for. The 12" of snow didn't damped anyone's spirits there and the front steps were always clear. I was impressed that the gentleman making repairs to a toilet struck up a conversation with me in the elevator as did another gentleman who was on the housecleaning staff. The bellman always had a smile and welcoming word.As I was heading out at 9 am on the day of the snowstorm, an obviously weary traveler covered in snow was standing at the front desk thanking them for allowing him to check in early. Just another example of their flexibility and service offered genuinely with rooms at a reasonable price in a marvelous location.

I stayed at the Comfort Inn between Feb 5 and 11. Room 301 - a room with a view!! I second every word that Clark67 has said below.This was my second stay at the hotel, the previous had been exactly two years ago. This time it was even better. I booked directly via the Apple Core hotels website and got a great deal of $110 per night befor taxes. I chose a Queen Room for single occupancy. Room 301 actually offered a view of West 46th St and I was overlooking the entrance for the Muse Hotel.On the first morning I reported a draught and this was dealt with quickly and efficiently. For me these rooms are not too hot, but then I hate to be cold.Although I did not have a problem with getting a table at breakfast I am an early riser, what I did see was several people, sole travellers like myself, offer up seats at their table or offer for people to move chairs. I also saw people taking food upstairs. OK maybe it's not the place for a lingering breakfast but then thats not what I'm there for.I can also understand why people complain about the size of the room, perhaps it would be a little tight for a couple not used to being together 24/7 but I have stayed in much smaller rooms in NYC.Due to the fact that a school group from France were staying there the business centre with 24 hour access to the internet via 2 PC was sometimes busy but then hey it's free. Go back later. There was always paper available in the printer for printing out maps and directions.Housekeeping staff were always very friendly and when I made the strange request for some plastic bags to put inside my boots to keep my feet dry in the blizzard they said what a great idea and gave me plenty of bags.Basically this is a no frills, I've got better things to spend my money on than the decor and fine dining hotel that would suit a savvy shopaholic who enjoys seeing as many Broadway shows as possible when in NYC travelling on their own.

Tripadvisor reviews may sometimes lead you to mistakes commonly made by travelers who organize their trips in a hurry - or in extremely good fait,or in the easiest way. That's the case, in my opinion, of the so may good reviews on this hotel you may find here.New York is a wonderful city, but many attractions/hotels/restaurants are overrated, such as the Comfort Inn Midtown. In the case of this hotel, I don't know what pleases people so much. It's a basic, tight, claustrophobic lodging, with nice (not more than that) staff (even if you consider you're in NYC). Breakfast is ridiculously simple, in a (again) tight, claustrophobic room. The good thing is the location, if you want to be near Times Square. If not, just pass. The price is too expensive, even for NYC patterns, mainly if you consider other options in town.Although it was not my hotel experience, I wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend to my friends.

Wonderful place for me to stay alone. Loved the size and location. Front desk staff and breakfast room staff very helpful and accommodating. I would call this "high end no-frills" and just right for this trip. Felt very safe and liked proximity to theatres, restaurants, public transportation. Rooms small, very clean and HOT! Tiny but accessible business center. Only cardio in fitness room.

My husband and I had a few days off before Xmas and decided to go to NYC for 2 days. We chose the Comfort Inn Midtown because we had stayed there in 1996 and had found it very convenient although a bit cramped. We arrived at the hotel about 9:30 AM after riding the Chinatown bus up from Richmond, VA - I could write a book on that experience - with the hope that we could leave our bags there until we could check-in later that day. The first thing I noticed was that the lobby looked totally different from what I remembered. As Ivonne told us at check-in, the hotel had been remodeled twice since our last stay! She then told us that if we could wait about 30 minutes , she could have our room ready for us and to please help ourselves to the Continental breakfast!! By 10 AM we were checked into our room. Although there was no view, the room was large by New York standards, very clean and had a very European feel to it. We were able to catch a much needed nap and then headed out to see the sights. The hotel is within 3 blocks of Radio City, Rockefeller Center and Times Square and about 1 .5 blocks to the subway.We had a wonderful time and want to extend special thanks to Ivonne, whose hospitality and professionalism made our stay exceptional.

I have spent the last year working in new york city and have spent many nights in many different hotels. I had to spend two nights in New York this past week and after reading the reviews for the Comfort Inn Midtown, I booked a room. I spent one evening in this hotel and chose to spend my second evening at another. I found several dark hairs in the bed suggesting that the sheets had not been cleaned, then later found the same coloured hairs on the towels in the bathroom. The room did not appear to have been vacuumed or dusted at all. I phoned reception upon seeing the hairs and was offered a room change or to have my sheets changed. I opted for a sheet change so I could witness clean sheets being put on the bed and they sent someone up very quickly. However in the midst of making my bed the employee promptly left to attend to baggage downstairs in the lobby. Perhaps they were under staffed that evening, I don't know. Either way, I think that for $150 a night I am at least entitled to clean linens. The room was also very small (although which is not uncommon for New York) and the doors are paper thin. I could hear every person who walked by my room. If you're just looking for a place to rest your head for an evening or two, then it does the job, but I'd recommend you bring your own towel.

Pros: Front desk personnel very helpful, room very clean, bathroom clean, clean linens and towels. Very good price and location.Cons: Room small, and over heated. NO VIEW of anything from most rooms. Breakfast room too small and overheated. Too much Styrofoam used for breakfast items.

Stayed here 23rd-28th January 2010 12th Floor - Room 1203 - Customer Service﻿ was Excellent A1 Value for money was also Excellent A1 Location Awesome A1+ 28th Morning it was snowingAll in all 100% Quality..

our first visit to NY , visiting our daughter who has been there for 5 months, grat location, very comfortable bed, plenty of hot water, staff were very friendly and efficient, had a room at the back on 4th floor, quiet , as mentioned buy others lift can be slow

Just did an overnight to visit MOMA and meet family for dinner and go to Javits Center Boat show the following day on our way back to NJ. It is a small hotel with small rooms but renovated and CLEAN. Friendly staff and good location for restaurants, theater. Would definitely stay here again!
Good place to stay if you have plans in New York City.Great place to rest your feet between shopping and sightseeing. Good sleep at night.

Super quiet even though its just a block from Times Square. And I've stayed in much smaller hotel rooms than this in NYC--for a much higher price! Only bother is that breakfast room (there is a free DIY breakfast) isn't big enough to accomodate everyone trying to dine.

You get what you pay for. This is a good balance between price and location. The staff were courteous and pretty helpful. I definitely took advantage of the free breakfast though i ate each less each day - the smart people got food and ate in the lobby as it was less crowded.My room was really noisy, there was some weird banging noise from some nearby machine. It interrupted my sleep. Also ask for a room NOT near the elevator as I could hear it from my room. The walls are pretty thin, but its NYC there's noise everywhere so just get used to it. The room interior is OK - kinda chocolate themed 80s decor. The bed was OK. The comforter was a bit scratchy. I liked it how there was a coffee maker in my room. Overall the experience was fine and I loved being in the middle of everything - just don't expect too much from the hotel itself.

We arrived at Comfort Inn Midtown at 10 AM with a reservation for 2 nights. We were planning to store our luggage, but they went ahead and checked us in. We even caught the tail end of breakfast! The room was warm but not uncomfortably so on a bitter cold weekend. Everything was neat and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful.The location is fantastic for walking around midtown. Subway access 4 blocks north or south. Be careful when following Broadway or 7th Ave because they cross right there at 46th St and it's confusing

We stayed at this hotel from 29th - 4th. Although it doesnt look much from the outside, it was ideal. Free breakfast was included, which was continental style, and free coffee and tea all day, which may not sound much but when its cold outside was a massive bonus!The staff were very friendly and helpful, and this is in an ideal location - close enough to walk, but far enough away that its not noisy. The rooms were always well maintained and warmIf your after a nice place to stay, with not too many frills, Id definately recommend this to anyone

We stayed from Dec 28th through the 30th and arrived via Penn Station. We could have walked but it was really cold outside so we took a cab to the hotel. It cost $9 due to traffic but we got there in about 10 minutes. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside but once we walked in it was very nice. The front desk was pleasant and our room was ready (at 2pm). The elevator is small and slow but did work. We ended up in room 307 so we just took the stairs most the time. The room was small but cozy and very clean. The TV and lights all worked perfect and the bathroom was nice. There was a very noticeble cold draft in our room though. We ended up closing the curtains tight and putting a trash can against them to keep the draft blocked out. The frosted glass door of the bathroom didn't bother us at all. The continental breakfast was very good and they had 24 hrs coffee/tea which was always stocked. The location is just fantastic and you are right around the corner from Times Square. We walked to see Jersey Boys on 52nd street and Wicked on 51st. The walk was about 15 minutes but we weren't really hurrying along. We also walked to Rockefeller Center, the ice skating rink, Radio City Music Hall, the Hard Rock Cafe and could have walked to Penn Station. We ate dinner at The Long Room and the steak was good with reasonable prices. I also heard the steak/BBQ at Virgils on 44th street between 6th &7th ave was very good. It was packed and we couldn't get in there. Overall - very nice stay.

We stayed here for 1 night after Christmas, but before New Years. For $297 (we had discount from the Entertainment Book, so it actually cost us only $277) you cannot beat this Times Square location. Any other decent hotel in the area is way more expensive. We arrived a little early, and the front desk attendant, who was very busy but still courteous and patient, told us he'd have our room ready in 30 minutes. He then offered us some tea and coffee from the breakfast room. I could not even finish my tea because our room was ready in about 15 minutes! The hotel is clean and the employees actually care about the guests and want to do a good job. The bellman referred us to an excellent pizza place for lunch and that made us very happy! Our room was situated so that we could not hear all the noise from Times Square, so it was very quite. The hallways are narrow, but we are skinny so it wasn't a problem. The room was small, but that is to be expected in NYC. Our only complaint is that you can hear everything in the hallway from the room. The walls are quite thin and we were awoken a few times by slamming doors. Overall, this is an excellent hotel with excellent staff! We highly recommend it!

My husband and I booked a rather last minute trip to NY. It was our first time to the city so we wanted to be central. The reviews on Trip Advisor rated this hotel very high and they were correct. It was half a block off of Times Square right in the heart of Midtown. There is a great Irish Pub accross the street that we ate and drank at a few times through our trip. We enjoyed the restaurants on Restaurant Row and would reccomend the Galaxy Dinner for breakfast to everyone. The hotel itself is very clean, the elevator is slow so we would often take the stairs down. The rooms are good, the bed was comfortable, the in-room safe was nice to have and the free breakfast was nice just for the apple and banana we would pick up and take with us for our day. We walked everywhere and found most places without too much trouble. The subway was easy to navigate through as were the streets. We would definately come back to NY, but we probably wouldn't stay here again, only because we have seen Midtown and the next trip we would want to explore the Village a bit more extensively.

We made plans for a last-minute trip to NYC to celebrate our anniversary, with little hope of finding a hotel for less than $500 a night. We couldn't have done any better if we had planned months in advance! If you are used to European-style hotels, you will have absolutely no problem with this hotel. Small lobby, elevator (only one) and rooms, but incredible location a half-block off Times Square. Best of all, even for a Saturday night stay in Christmas season, we paid less than $350. The room was very clean and well appointed, even had a large flat-screen TV. Our room (#800) faced the side of the adjacent building and was very quiet. The only noise we noticed was the constant slamming of the room door of one of our neighbors. There are only ten rooms per floor, so not much hall traffic. There are lots of restaurants in the area, and it is easy walking distance to theatre district, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and 5th Avenue. The closest subway stop is two blocks away. The hotel offers a basic continental breakfast which was fine for us. I recommend taking your food up to your room (use ice bucket tray from your room as no take-away trays available) as the dining area has only about 5 tables. The only complaints I have are matters of personal preference. The bath towels were scratchy and a bit thin, and the bed pillows too soft for my liking. The rooms are heated by radiators, which made our room a bit stuffy. You aren't supposed to open the windows, so the only venilation was using the fan on the A/C window unit, which was a bit loud. We plan to return to NYC often since it is very convenient for us to go from DC, and we will definitely stay here again!

Excellent little hotel downtown, quiet (except for the pigeons at windows), clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast, within walking distance of Broadway nightlife and shopping. I would definitely stay there again, though with additional taxes the price ended up rather high.

This hotel had everything I needed for a quick (two-night) business trip:* Free Wi-Fi (which worked flawlessly)* Clean, quiet and comfortable room* Up-to-date furnishings (no worn-out floral bedspreads!)* Good lighting and plenty of counter space in the bathroom* Fitness room with a choice of a few cardio machines* Free and well-stocked breakfast* Very friendly staff* Free business center with two computers and printer (which I used)* Great location -- convenient to Times Square and surrounding locationsHere's a tip -- I almost didn't find this hotel because I was using Expedia to search for two rooms, and it didn't come up in the listings. I think that's because the Comfort Inn system only lets you book one room at a time. In the future I'll search for single rooms...

I stayed in the recently opened Comfort Inn 343 West 44th Street New York, this hotel is 1 block from the middle of Times Square. Situated in very quiet street with a couple of bars and restaurants opposite. This was an excellent location and the hotel was spotless, service on front desk was quick and very polite! Breakfast was included in the price and consisted of make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, bagels, croissants, danish pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurs, coffee, orange & apple juice, all as much as you want to eat, the staff just refill when it gets low! Rooms were nicely decorated and very comfortable, 40inch flat screen tv at end of the bed and very warm in the room. Will definately be staying at this hotel again when i return to New York.

What a pleasant find! The room and bathroom were c-l-e-a-n. The mattress was new and very comfortable. The included breakfast was good, convenient and unlimited. The front desk staff was great! There was discounted parking in the garage directly across the street. All of this a block away from Times Square! You just can't beat it.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the parade last week. The location is great, the staff was very friendly, and the rooms were clean. Yes, the rooms are small, but who wants to stay in the room all the time when you're in New York City?! I would highly recommend this hotel.
