Free internet access, free breakfast, you can't find a better bargain in midtown. I booked the hotel on the phone and received a lower rate than the online rate, then received another 10% off when we checked in! Stay here! (and be sure to have a bagel at breakfast...they are the best!)

This hotel was so much better than I expected! Clean, quiet (that's rare for NY, especially Times Sq), friendly staff, comfortable bed. We will definitely be back to this cute little hotel.Thank you for a great weekend in NY, Comfort Inn!

Situated half a block from Times Square this place is a gem. Well priced for the area and upon arrival we were informed that there would be another 10% reduction. Rooms are a good size and the king size beds are so comfortable. Breakfast is included which consisted of toast, bagels, muffins, danishes, cereals, yoghurt fruit and drinks. Always in plentiful supply with a staff member ensuring everything was clean. Only issue with this hotel is that their is no concierge however staff were very helpful.

Stayed here in October with my 15 year old daughter. It is a few steps from Times Square. A perfect location. I was worried about our safety in a big city like NYC (a woman and a young girl) but never felt uneasy at all walking the short distance from Times Square to the hotel even at 11pm. Checking in with Stanlee was very quick and he was extremely friendly (even though it was 1a.m.). Our room was a little on the small size and the view from the window was of a brick wall. I called Stanlee straight away and asked if there was another room, but it was Saturday night and they were fully booked. He did make a note that we should be re-roomed the next morning for the remaining 3 nights of our trip. Next morning, true to their word we were swiftly re-roomed by Rodriguez. Excellent service and the new room was front facing and almost twice the size of the first room. Brilliant!!The breakfast room was always busy, with people often sharing a table, but where else in New York do you get a free breakfast? We only shared a table one morning out of the 4 that we were there and on our last morning we got our breakfast bagels, donut/pastries and a coffee and took it to our room to have.The room was very clean and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. If I go to New York again this hotel will be my first choice, without a doubt!!Over the road from the hotel is John's Shaghai. We got a take-away to eat in our room from there one evening. The food was excellent. Next door to John's Shanghai there is a grocery shop and we got our drinks from there.The hotel is perfectly located for you to choose whether you are going to eat out or on the hoof.I had to check in online for my return flights and this was no problem with the free internet access at the hotel. check in complete in 10 minutes. This saved us a lot of trouble at the airport as our flight was overbooked and if I hadn't done this, we may have been put on the next flight instead!!!!My tip to all air travellers is to CHECK IN ONLINE!!! We flew with Virgin Atlantic, but I know that it is common practice for lots of airlines to overbook flights and even though I had booked our seats, if you don't check in online your seats can be booked by someone else!!! I learnt this lesson on the way out to NYC and this made checking in 1hour longer than it would otherwise have been if we had checked in online.

Although the rates are steals given this hotel's unbeatable location (literally a one minute walk to Times Sq and the Rockefeller center), this shouldn't mask the fact that this is not a great place. The lobby and breakfast room smelled terrible throughout the stay and the breakfast spread is frankly a joke. The fitness center on the gound floor is far too cramped, though given the size of the hotel itself (tiny) it 's not too bad. Where this place really goes wrong is the rooms. As far as I'm aware most of the rooms are extremely small, which would be fine if the hotel hadn't tried to cram all the furnishings for a room twice these sizes into them. Huge body-length mirrors are hung in unfortunate places, cabinets can't be opened due to proximity to beds... you're basically forced to walk sideways to get from the bed to the bathroom. That said, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and given the fact that most rooms face away from the busy 46th St, they're also quiet. Decent place, good value, but for even better value stay at the nearby sister property, the Hotel at Times Square.

The staff at this hotel is very accommodating and helpful. The hotel is in a great location. The room we stayed in was small but nice. It was on the second floor and close to the street so it was pretty noisy. If you are a light sleeper you should request a room in the rear of the hotel away from the street. This property offers free wireless internet and has a business center that is also available at no charge. If you are going to the city to see a show in the theater district this is an excellent place to stay.

Selected this hotel based on good reviews, price just under $200 and closeness to the theater district. In addition, Times Square is a fun area, close to restaurants and shopping and convenient to the subway. Although restaurant row is 8th Ave., my son and I found that 9th Ave. has tons of less expensive and just as good dining. The cab trip to the hotel from Laguardia Airport was $27 plus $4 toll plus tip. The hotel itself was very comfortable and the staff very helpful. I was able to use the computer and printer in the business room most times when I wanted or had a short wait. Although it is a large hotel, the elevator was not slow or full. Check in and out was quick. The breakfast room staff was very good and kept the orange juice and coffee etc. flowing. A big plus is that the coffee in the breakfast room is available fresh all day! No need to use the in-room pot. The room also has it's own ironing board and iron and a hair dryer that works. The plus of the rooms is that they provide four comfy pillows per bed and the mattresses are good-not extra firm or too soft. We asked for a two bed room, which I later learned are all in a row on each floor and do not have a view of the street. The window is high anyway so it wasn't important and the location was very quiet. We were on the 6th floor and heard no traffic or neighbors.The only negatives we found was that the door to the bathroom was mostly glass and you could see through it! Amazing, huh?! We had brought a garment bag for wedding clothes and there was a hook over the door on the bathroom side that we could hang it and cover the glass. Otherwise no privacy in the bathroom-beware! Also, like most places, they could use an upgrade in toilet paper and tissue. I did like the design with the sink and mirror in the bathroom and not in the sleeping area.I would definately stay here again to be able to walk to the theater and dinner. The savings over comparable hotels is probably $50 a day. Great find!

This is a modest hotel, but if you'd rather spend your money on sightseeing, good food, entertainment and shopping than a room, then stay at the Comfort Inn. I was a bit nervous that it would be a bit dodgey given its low cost in comparison to other New York hotels, but I was wrong. The hotel is spotlessly clean, our room (and bed) was very comfortable, the staff were helpful and most pleasant, the free breakfast was basic but there was plenty of it and the location for first time New York tourists couldn't be better. It was terrific to be so close to Time Square, to the hop on/hop off buses, Broadway shows, the subway and the fabulous restaurants in Restaurant Row among other things. There were two computers for guest use which was also very helpful.This is not a glamorous hotel, but if you're being 'careful' about your spending money, then you couldn't go past the Comfort Inn Midtown. We stayed in a more expensive hotel on the 2nd half of our trip, but to be honest, if we're ever able to return to New York again, I'd certainly be happy to stay here.

We had been to Manhattan before, and we recommend this hotel for the value and location. The rooms are the same size as the high-priced Times Square places (all of which are small), plus you save money by eating your breakfast right at the hotel before starting your day. You are two blocks off Times Square, and about 5 blocks from major theaters, and three blocks from the 1 Train (subway) to downtown (to catch Ellis Island Ferry). It's a no-brainer to recommend this one to friends. You easily save $100 a night by staying here, plus the breakfast money saved. No bellman or concierge, but who really needs them anyway?

We read many positive reviews of this hotel, but it was even better than expected. Check-in was quick and efficient. We had room #906 with a king size bed. Though small, it was comfortable and very nicely decorated. There was a small desk with a chair, bedside tables, and a larger unit that included the television. The best thing was the bed - one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in; I wanted to take it home with me. A minor irritation was that the flat screen TV was mounted to the side of the bed, not the best position for viewing. The bathroom was clean and had everything we needed. The location of the hotel is excellent- one block from Times Square and about 3 blocks to the subway. Yet 46th Street itself is quiet and noise was not an issue at all. There are several restaurants within one block, along with two deli's. We enjoyed St Andrew's Pub and Restaurant, right across the street. The continental breakfast at the hotel has the usual items, toast and bagels, a couple of cereals, pastries, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. Everything was fresh and the breakfast attendant kept everything clean and stocked. The only drawback is that the breakfast room could use more tables - I suspect there is simply no room to expand. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Comfort Inn Midtown is a gem! Comfortable beds, with everything you need in the room. But lets face it, who wants to stay in your room when you are in NY. Right off times square this is the perfect location to get anywhere. The area is safe and the staff helpful. A particular mention to the guy that checked me in. Originally from India, he had fun having a go at me about our not so successful aussie cricket team. It was nice to discuss something so familiar. A car was organised by front desk to take me to the airport. $55 tips, tolls everything. Free internet and fitness centre and continental breakfast make it the best place to stay.

This was the highlight of our trip. We expected an old room in an old hotel, but found a very modern room, great service and a perfect location.We were within a 2 minute walk to Times Square, and another 2 to the Subway, restaurants galore and dozens of shops. It is very obvious that the hotel had a professional refurbishment not long ago, and it works. The hotel feels old world classy downstairs, and the rooms comfortable and contemporary.We can't recommend this hotel enough, pick this one, you won't be disappointed.

This was my first visit to New York. The location of the hotel allowed us to visit the Opera House, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Cloisters. The hotel is right off Broadway, 2 blocks from Time Square. Travelling by subway was easy thanks to the superb and friendly advice of the personnel at the hotel. They allowed us to store our luggage the day we checked out for several hours and also the following week when we returned from a second part of our trip, when we had a 6 hour stop over in NY. The rooms were very quiet, very clean, nicely decorated and the beds were oh SO comfortable. Thank you Comfort Inn for making my first visit such a wonderful memory!!

My husband & I spent 4 nights at this hotel while sightseeing with friends. Having been in NYC several times and paying twice the price at other hotels, this was a very pleasant surprise! Great Times Square location! While the rooms are not large, they are adequate and nicely appointed. Everything was very, very clean. The staff was quite friendly & helpful. A basic breakfast was included (that's an additional savings). I was also pleased with the car service they booked for us. It was only $5 more than the cramped cab we rode in from JFK to the hotel. I'll definitely book this hotel for future visits.

We paid $135/night during the height of the tourist season for this newly renovated room a block off of Times Square. The rooms are small, but very comfortable. If possible, request an 01 or 02 room - they're on the corner and quite a bit larger. I highly recommend this hotel, and it will be my go-to hotel for all future NYC stays.

I've stayed in NYC many times and have paid triple for hotels that did not even come close to the value and convenience of the Comfort Inn Midtown. Rooms were spotless, continental breakfast was included (bagels, toast, cereals, yogurt, fruit), the business centre didn't charge for internet access or printing of boarding passes, the location was fantastic especially for seeing theatre, and the staff were helpful and courteous. I asked for a room that didn't face the street so my window was basically facing a brick wall but it was the first time that I have heard absolutely no street noise in a NYC hotel! It was so quiet and great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

I have traveled to NYC many times in the last couple decades and this may have been the best deal for a hotel I have seen. It's spotless, located in the center of everything, close to several subway stops and the rooms are sized nice.The staff was also VERY nice. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to someone looking for a great price and a nice room.

This hotel was $140/night which is basically cheap by NYC standards unless you want to stay in a crackhouse like the Madison Hotel. It was a small room but had everything you needed, even a flat screen t.v. which is just for show since everyone knows when you're visiting NYC you're hardly going to be in your room! However, having said that, you want to stay somewhere that is comfortable after a long day of wandering the island. The staff were nice, there is a free internet room, and they kept my luggage for me no problem while I had already checked out but wanted to walk around a bit more before I moved on to my next destination. It is a great location, 2 min walk to Broadway Ave. and near Bryant Park. The only thing was the bathroom door wouldn't close fully but luckily I was with my boyfriend so that didn't matter too much!

My bf and I stayed her in mid-May 2009 and had a wonderful time. The hotel was in a perfect location (few blocks from Time Square and Rockefeller Center) and provided all the things that we needed. Our room had it's own safe which was very nice to have. The room was relatively quiet with it's location and the general noise from the city. It was nice not to have to walk far for a main subway station. We spent most of our time walking around and the hotel was easy to come back to once we were familiar with the area. We would stay here again the next time we're in NY. The staff was VERY nice and pleasant to deal with.

Stayed for 1 night as a Stopover at the end of our vacation to save some money. We were very impressed with the staff they were all so friendly and helpful. The room was small ( we had stayed in another NYC hotel the previous week which was larger but way more expensive) but it was immaculate, very clean, soft towels and comfy bed.The location was a winner for us, the Scottish Bar across the road was pretty nice and we went to The View Bar at the Top of The Marriot Hotel for the cocktails, buffet and to experience a revolving bar/restaurant. Times Square is at the end of the block but we found the hotel to be quiet. Would stay again if on a short break.

We spent five days at this hotel for vacation. The room was small for the three of us, but that was expected; otherwise, it was clean and very quiet for NY City. Location is outstanding with theaters and subway stations all very close. Staff was friendly and helpful. Also provided is a free basic continental breakfast (in a small room) and exercise facility. The rate (for Manhattan) was very good and we would definitely consider this hotel for a NY stay again.
Excellent hotel, nice people view, since the bellboys to the boy's breakfast. I recommend for sure.
Our stay was for 2 days and the Comfort Inn was perfect! Location was great, the room was newly remodeled with attention to comfort and very clean. Price? For all that is offered it is a steal!

My daughter and I stayed three nights. We were in NY to enjoy the theatre. This hotel is in a perfect location for that (1/2 a block from Times Square). Our room was small (not unexpected), but we had all the space we needed. The room was well-appointed, spotlessly clean and quiet (2nd floor away from the street). The bathroom was also clean and functional. I liked the business center and the continental breakfast was convenient. Wouldn't hesitate to book again. Staff were helpful and knowledgeable.

I stayed there for a 3 day weekend in mid Sept. It was my first time at this hotel and I was very pleased with my entire stay. The check-in went smoothly and the staff was professional. The rooms are somewhat on the small side ... but I had a king size bed and a big screen tv in the room. My room did not face the street and it was extremely quiet. It is very convenient to Times Square. I go to NY about once a year to see plays and usually stay at other comparably priced hotels in the area (Milford Plaza, Hotel Edison etc.). This was a much nicer hotel and only about a 5 minute walk to Times Square. I will definitely stay there again.

Indeed, this is a great location-a block from Times Square, close to good restaurants and the theater district. The rooms are small, but some more expensive hotels have much smaller rooms. Don't expect many frills or great views, but the staff was friendly and helpful, the beds were comfortable (pillowtop), and room was very clean. We weren't asked to write a review, but we decided this will be our hotel of choice for future trips. It is an unbeatable value for the location.

We stayed in this hotel during the 9/4 - 9/7 weekend. I would say all the hotel staff we encountered were very friendly. The hotel room is not fancy but very clean and comfortable. The location is great, close to Rockfeller Center and Times Square. All subway lines are accessible within two blocks. I would suggest bringing ear plugs when you visit New York in all cases, it really helps you to get a good sleep no matter you get front side or back side rooms. In Midtown New York there is no true "quiet" rooms, beleive me. Breakfast was good too. I really recommend this hotel. Unless you are looking for style, this a great choice.

I won't repeat what other reviewers have said -- this place does have a good location, great rooms, etc.But two things.1) When we checked in, they handed us a welcome package that included a note to "Write a review on tripadvisor if we enjoy our stay". So some of the reviewers have been pointed by the hotel to come here. Just keep that in mind.2) Like another reviewer said below, we had a problem with a $15 extra surcharge. I had made my reservation, then updated it. When we checked in, the woman behind the desk could only see the original reservation. She then wanted to charge us the rack rate + $15 extra (not our discounted rate). Thankfully, I had a hard copy of our reservation right with me. When she saw it, she corrected it and we got our initial rate. It was corrected right away, but the incident struck me as really odd, despite us enjoying our stay. So my advice: PRINT OUT YOUR RESERVATION and DOUBLECHECK it if you stay here.

Just got back from Labor weekend trip to NYC. Always stayed on New Jersey side before as hotels are cheaper for price and amenities. However, this time wanted to stay in mid-town to be closer to the city excitement. The hotel is in nice location and convenient to subway - the orange line was right around the corner and the different subway lines options a few blocks to 42 and Time Square. The Top of the Rock was 3 minutes walking distance away - same with the top end of Times Square. I was very surprised about how easier it was to get to hotel from JFK airport. I just hopped the Air Train to Jamaica station and then took the LIRR which took about 25 minutes to reach Penn Station. It is about 20 minute walk from Penn Station to hotel or you can just take a taxi or take the subway to Times Square which is one stop north. As for the hotel itself, it is clean and seemed to be remodeled a few years back. The staff was nice and helpful - room was ready upon arrival around 11 am. The only issue is the noise from the street. There are some pubs across the street which get loud at night so I had to run the AC window unit to drown out the street noise. But over all I liked the hotel and would stay again next visit to NYC. And the hotel had free wi-fi in the rooms - so I could use my iPhone to check LIRR and Subway schedules.

From check in to check out, our experience was wonderful. Ivonne, at the front desk was so cheerful and welcoming. The gentlemen who assisted us and handled our luggage were great as well. the room was immaculate and breakfast was great. We also enjoyed the fact that we were able to store our luggage after we checked out. we will stay there next time for sure!

I reserved the room through Apple Core Hotels. While the location is good for theater events and the rooms are decent, customer service is terrible. My room was reserved in my name with my credit card - in my maiden name. My husband was able to check in, no questions asked. When I attempted to check in they refused to give me a key until his return, changed the rate, and proceeded to quote corporate policy - all for a $15 dollar increase. I walked out to wait for my husband and when we both re-entered a woman was talking to the employee. All she was interested in was getting us to initial the $15 increase. I sent an online complaint to their corporate site and the the GM answered my complaint in a manner that indicated where the employee gets his arrogance and ignorance. Guess what...it was the woman. This GM did not bother to introduce herself or ask us any questions that night. All she wanted just our initials. In addition, my husband asked this same employee for directions to the theater. An 'I don't know' would have sufficed. He sent us two avenues and four blocks out of our way. The theater was literally around the corner from the hotel. We lost 20 minutes and had to rush back to make it before the 8:00 PM start.Don't bother! There are plenty of great hotels at a low price in the area.

My wife and I stayed at his hotel Aug 26-30. We found it clean, comfortable and quiet. As many others have posted, the hotel has a great location. We found all the staff to be helpful and friendley. Would stay there again without question.

If I could describe this hotel in one word, it would be quaint. I recently came back from a very pleasant 3 night stay. I actually booked this hotel months ago, cancelled when I found a better rate, then re-booked it when their rate became the best one. I got an excellent AAA rate booked through the hotel's website. I arrived early, and my room wasn't ready, he told me to check back at 12 and it would be ready, even though check in time wasn't until 3. He let me store my bags and use the business center as there was something I really needed to check. The breakfast room is open from 7:30-10:30, it was open when I arrived, but I didn't use it until the following morning. I didn't come back until later on in the afternoon, when I was checked in and given room 809, 1 queen bed as I was traveling by myself. The room was small, but quaint and charming. It was clean, and quiet, as it was on the backside of the building, my view was a wall and windows on another building. It suited all my needs just fine. Nice flat screen TV, comfortable bed, desk, decent size bathroom and closet. I had no complaints, it was perfect for me. The free wireless internet was a great amenity, and worked perfectly, I never lost the signal once. My only complaint about the room was the wake up call line always seemed to be busy, so I had to use the alarm to wake up, not a big deal though. It was a really nice alarm clock with an Ipod docking station. The hotel is small not just in rooms, but in size overall. The hallways are narrow and there's only one elevator (which I had no problems with). The front desk staff were all nice and helpful. The breakfast room, it didn't have many tables, but had a good selection of food, like cereal, yogurt, donuts, waffles, bagels, toast, coffee, juice, milk, and fruit. I always took my food back up to my room to eat, I also saw some people eating there's in the lobby. The business center has two computers and is open 24 hrs, as is the fitness center, but I didn't use that. There's two vending machines in the lobby, and the ice machine is in the basement, which is kind of creepy if your down there by yourself! There was a check in/out and flight check in self service kiosk in the lobby, I tried to get my boarding pass on it and it didn't work, but maybe it was just my airline, I don't know. I went into the business center and printed it off for no charge. The hotel's location is perfect, Times Square is only a minute's walk to the right, and the subway is a few minutes away. There always seemed to be cabs available out front, and there's restauraunts nearby. It's also a close walk/subway ride away to all attractions. I am glad I changed my reservation back to this hotel, as I had no regrets. I will definitely stay here again, I actually may change my reservation here for my next NYC trip in October. The price was great, but if you use the AAA rate, you do have to show your card at check in for them to give you the rate, there's a sign at th desk noting this, same for AARP rates I noticed. I'll definitely be back, and would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was a great stay!

We stayed for three nights and enjoyed every moment of our stay. Yes the room was very small but it had all we needed. It was clean, comfortable and best of all, super close to everything. Just a short walk to Broadway, Restaurants, Parks and every thing that makes New York the exciting place that it is known for. We were quickly greeted with a friendly, smiling staff upon check in and the smiles continued throughout our entire stay.The breakfast area is small but has enough choices to please everyone. It is a continental breakfast. Again, let me mention that the room is very small but who goes to NYC to hang out in their hotel room? We have absolutely no complaints about this hotel or their staff and will without a doubt stay again. Except that next time, we will stay more nights. I highly recommend this hotel for it's value, comfort, convenience, cleanliness and friendly, helpful staff.

When you book a hotel online and arrive with a printed confirmation, do you have confidence that the hotel will honor that? Don't be so sure if you make your reservations via Choice Hotels!I chose this hotel carefully after reading many reviews. It was a special occasion coming to NYC to celebrate my wife's birthday. We arrived at 11 PM exited and even planned a late dinner after check-in in a nice nearby restaurant.However the reception person printed a registration form with rates about $50 higher per night. When I showed him my printed confirmation letter which showed the original rates, he said there's nothing he can do and "either sign the form withe higher rates or you cannot check in". We asked him to first get the room and then sort this out but he refused and even suggested that if we don't like those rates maybe look for another hotel, which I thought was outrageous! He then tried to call Choice Hotels. It took some 20 minutes of waiting to talk to them, and amazingly they declined my rates too! After finally talking with Choice Hotels supervisor, it turned out that my rates were raised "because I called them to ask for a room facing the back-side" to avoid street noise. Needless to say - they never mentioned it would change the rate, and the hotel does not charge any extra for that anyway. It was after midnight when we finally checked in after giving up and agreeing to sign the registration form. We were nervous and frustrated and had to dine in a fast food place since the restaurant already closed. The matter was settled only the following day, when Choice hotels customer service called me, admitted their mistake, reset the rates and said they'll even discount one of the nights to compensate me. It was unbelievable that when we finally checked out, that additional discount was forgotten! (we did not bother to fix that)The hotel management claimed it was all Choice Hotel's fault. I thought that the guy at the reception should have honored our letter, check us in and then sort this out instead of offering us to look elsewhere.Last - the hotel and room was very nice. Too bad it was overshadowed by the Check in experience.

We stayed here for a week. It was a wonderful stay, good continental breakfast, clean rooms, and it stays less then a square from Times Square, you can go to many attractions by foot (Central Park, Macys, Rockfeller Center, St. Patrick Cathedral, 5th Av, Park Ave., Apple, Broadway, HB...), but if you preffer there are subway and bus station nearby. We'll certantly be staying here whenever we visit the city.

Upon arrival at Noon our room was already ready. The hotel was small and the room was tiny but I expected that. For the price the location couldn't be beat. The room and hotel were very clean. Parking was in a garage diagonally across the street and when stamped by the Comfort Inn cost only $23 for 24 hours. I'd highly recommend this hotel. Also, I'm very noise conscious and I found the hotel to be very quiet.

We recently stayed at the Comfort Inn on 46th. It is very close to time square and many broadway shows and many restaurants. The location is great. The rooms were small but very clean. The breakfast was an added plus.
Room is very good. Great location, half block to main Times Square. Easy access to subway. simple breakfast (1 fruit, cereal, milk, yogurt, bread. that's it)

Stayed here 21 til 25 July. This is the 2nd time I have stayed here since March and it has not disappointed me at all. I originally chose to stay here due to the excellent reviews on this site. I got a great rate of $149.99 falling to $129.99 and with free breakfast and free wi-fi this is such a fantastic price in the most central of locations. I agree with the reviewer who said the speed was above average as I had been in LA just before and the free wi-fi I got there was very slow. While I could not complain about my room last time this time it was even better as it was just set out more to my liking. The tv was facing the bed instead of being to the side of it and I had a shower cubicle instead of a bath/shower combi. They had very modern furnishing and it did appear like it had been newly renovated. It was serviced each day regardless of the time I left the room. Every member of staff I encountered were great and went out of their way. I am so glad I found this hotel as it has made it more affordable to come more often.It may not be the most modern of buildings from the outside but do not let that stop you. The St Andrews Restaurant and Bar opposite serves great food and the service was excellent. Loved the chinese food at John Shanghai just opposite and down slightly. Had a fantastic time and this will be my hotel of choice when in New York.

I rely heavily on TA for my travel plans; and, I will have to say that the positive reviews of this hotel were accurate. This was my first visit to NYC; and, the location is fantastic if you come to NYC to explore. There is a nearby Metro station and bus stops. We crammed alot in a few short days; so, the comfortable, clean, and quiet room we got made sleep instantaneous (I took a TA reviewer's advice and asked for a room in the back of the hotel...our room faced the back of the lovely church next door). Two reasonably priced nearby restaurants I recommend are: "Utsav" (very good Indian food) and "Amarone" (Italian...we went here before going to a Broadway show and loved it).

My husband and I visited New York City for the first time at the end of July - I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel. The rooms were not very big was it was more than sufficient seeing that I didn't go to New York City to stay in the room. We were given a room in the back of the hotel - it was very quiet but absolutely no view. Would I stay at this hotel again - definitely yes. It was very close to Time Square and a lot of the attractions were in walking distance.

Staying in Times Square doesn't have to cost a fortune. This newly renovated hotel is just steps away, includes a very decent continental breakfast and the rooms, while not that large, are very clean, up-to-date and comfortable. We'll be staying here whenever we visit the city.

We stayed here for two nights in July 2009. Unlike most NYC hotels, this one was quiet and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room size would have been small anywhere besides Manhattan, but everything was so conveniently arranged that we were very comfortable. Nice bedside reading lamps and iPod compatible radio. Plus the wireless Internet signal was much stronger than most hotels. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and apparently fairly recently refurbished. Nice free breakfast. And you couldn't beat the location if you want to be near Times Square. Plus the price was extremely reasonable. I've already recommended this hotel to several friends. If you stay here, check out O'Briens Irish Pub across the street and Connolly's around the corner on 45th.

I agree with the other posts. This is a great value in an excellent location. Times Square is around the corner. Restaurant Row is a block away on the other side of Times Square. Many theaters are close. NBC and Radio City are two blocks away. This is just a great central location. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was very small but recently renovated. Breakfast was simple, but it was all we needed. I would certainly stay here again.

All of the previous reviews are right - this is a great hotel value on a street right off of Times Square. Rooms are small, as expected in NYC, but they are beautifully furnished - really a notch better than you would expect from a Comfort Inn. Staff is friendly and goes out of their way to help you. The fellow in the breakfast room was especially helpful. And free breakfast in NYC is a great perk! Both the room and the public areas were extremely clean, too. This place is such a bargain for tourists and theatergoers alike.

From the moment I checked in, I could tell that this hotel was going to be good. Clean, fresh looking lobby area, friendly staff and an effecient check in process.The negative points: Rooms were a bit darkElevator is a bit slowThe street outside smeels a bit sometimesShower is loud.Those are the only negative points I can think of, positives:Spacious roomsFree WifiGreat locationNice breakfast24 hour business centreIn room safesFree phone calls within USAModern furnishingsVery comfy bedsGood air conditioningRooms serviced daily- clean towels etc.Overall an excellent hotel that I look forward to staying at again. I really couldn't fault the whole stay apart from a minor incident at check-out but thats not worth mentioning.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any of my friends!
This place totally exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and furnishings were all very nice. Location was awesome. I would stay here again.

We just got back today from NYC and stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from 06/03 -06/08. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were small, but in NYC I was expecting that. We asked for the largest room we could get away from the street and they obliged. I slept well, but did notice you have to be very careful with the doors because they slam easily . There was only 1 elevator, but we only chose to walk down the stairs once and that was only because I was scared I might be late for the Lion King. I wasn't. The staff was excellent and they were always asking us if we needed anything when we came downstairs. The breakfast was great. It was fruit, cold cereals, toast., danish, bagels, toaster waffles, boiled eggs, ect. I wish they had a microwave though. I do not like cold boiled eggs. I loved the whole wheat toast! The breakfast room is small, but I would always go up to a table that had 1 or 2 sitting at it and ask to sit down, so the wait was never long. All and all we will stay here again. It has LOCATION,. LOCATION, LOCATION right in Times Square and close to subway. I am glad we chose it!Staff directed us to Rosie O' Grady's and we ate there twiceOne of the greatest amenities they offer is that they will homd your suitcase until your room is ready, so we were able to go into Times Square while they readied our room!

We stayed in this property back in March 2009 for total of 5 nights and we were delighted with our stay. No wonder they have so many good reviews - it's truely a great choice of hotel when in Manhattan (Times Sq area). What we didn't like in the hotel was: 1. the rooms are really tiny - especially those not facing the street but this is not unusual in NYC hotels. The window we had was kinda fake cause it was facing the wall of another building, there was almost no daylight in the room due to that and it was very hot, but again it was also quiet. Also, you can't even open the window and have to rely on the airconditioning. 2. The A/C is very noisy and not great - sort of like too powerfull, it was soon very cold and "windy" in the room once it was on. But iit might be a good thing when the summer's hot... 3. Staying there is not the cheapest - but you pay for the area. We also found a great deal on hotels own website - they had a way better deal than all major hotel booking sites so definitely check it out! And now the things we liked and made our stay so pleasant: 1. the rooms & bathrooms are spotless clean, the cleaning staff are doing a great job! 2. we also enjoyed free continental breakfast - again the staff in the breakfast room are very efficient, very nice and helpfull, the place is clean, food is great - good choice (yogurts, juices, tea & coffee, waffles, bagles, pastries, donuts, fresh fruit etc.) & always very fresh & yummy. the tea & coffee is there all day long and you can take a cup to your room in the afternoon etc. 3. location is great - 2 mins from times sq, you can walk everywhere, to all major attractions, shops, sightseeing double-deckers etc. There's also plenty of good and not so expensive restaurants and bars (e.g. 2 Irish bars just opposite hotel), good quality take-aways etc. 4. There's also a tiny business centre (PCs, fax, printers, internet) at the hotel and it's all free of charge - e.g. we always travel with a laptop (free wifi) but we leave the printer at home;) - if you need to print your broadway tickets or other confirmations - you can do it for free in this hotel. very convenient I have to say if you're booking your attractions online and last minute. 5. They also have iPod docking stations in rooms - well done! wasn't expecting this and was delighted:) All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it. In our case there were a lot more advantages than disadvantages - I only mentioned them to give you a fair review:) Would definitely go back there!

Stayed at this hotel after finding it here on Trip Advisor. It was clean, convenient and well priced. Less than a block from Times Square. Great breakfast; great staff; very clean and great value for the money.

We stayed here twice in May, and it is a great place to stay, just around the corner from Times Square but in a quiet and safe street. Sure, the rooms are small, but they are clean, well appointed and modern. We stayed in king rooms, and I would recommend the rooms facing the street as they are larger and lighter. There is a little noise in the street facing room, mainly early in the morning when the gargage trucks go by, but most of the time it is not a problem. There is a flatscreen TV in the room, coffee and tea making facilities, plenty of drawer space, and the bed is very comfortable. Wifi is free in the rooms and throughout the hotel, and also a computer room with 2 printers for guest use which is great for those travelling without laptops. The breakfast is great, cereal, toast, a range of pastries and bagels, waffles, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, juice and coffee. Coffee and Tea is available in the breakfast room throughout the day. As others have commented, the breakfast room is small, but we never had to wait long for a table and most days didn't have to wait long at all. The staff member working in the breakfast room is very friendly, makes sure the food is replenished regularly and keeps the area clean. We found all the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful, and they will securely store your luggage if you have a late flight etc. The location here is fantastic, and while the rooms may be small, it is New York and value for money this is a great hotel. Highly recommend !

I've been looking through Trip Advisor and elsewhere for affordable Manhattan hotels for our upcoming long weekend in New York City, and I think I finally realized that one can't improve on near-perfection. That's why my choice will be, for the fourth time in five years, this comfy, well-priced (for New York!) hotel in the best location in the City! The rooms are clean, comfortable, and attractive, and the staff is very attentive, (and like other reviewers mentioned, the same staff members seem to be there every year, including the gentleman who mans the busy breakfast area and is very attentive to his job.) We find you just can't beat the location, price, and free breakfast. My husband loves to get up early every morning and run around the corner to Rockefeller Center to see the Today Show. We've walked easily to Broadway shows, seen the Naked Cowboy on Times Square a couple of hundred yards away, and dined at the excellent restaurants in the area (great Italian restaurant across the street and the Scottish Saint Andrews Pub with affordable dinners and wonderful atmosphere around the corner.) We've easily caught the nearby subway to Central Park, the Village, and Battery Park. It has always been home away from home for us, and we truly appreciate this great little hotel.

It is a bit risky choosing an inexpensive hotel in a good location in NYC. The Comfort Inn Midtown was a real winner for us. First of all, location was perfect - a half block off of Times Square. Next best thing was the friendly and very helpful staff. How pleasant it was to NOT see signs of frustrated, tired empolyees. They all went out of their way to offer help - especially "Sidibi" the bellhop. The rooms were crisp & clean and nicely furnished. Not all rooms were spacious like ours. We at first were assigned to a rather small room toward the back part of the hotel. We simply asked if there was another room with more space or a window view. They said there was (a handicap room), but that it was not yet ready. We gladly waited (sightseeing on Times Square). We were given room 602 with 2 windows with a view. Four days later 602 was needed for a handicap person and we gladly moved to 802. They actually moved all our things for us to the new room so that we could be on our way . Both rooms were spcaious and comfortable with lots of closet & drawer space. But keep in mind - this is New York where space is at a premium. About the only complaint we had was that the dining area was too small. But the food was good. So yes I would definitely go back to this hotel - and ask for a front room facing the street. We did not have any street noise the whole week we were there.

At $175/nt using AAA this must be the best bargain in Manhattan! Rooms are tastefully updated, with desk, flat screen TV and nice lighting. We had room 500, view of a brick wall but very quiet. Rest of family had street facing rooms, 501 & 601, that were larger but also had street noise. Nice continental breakfast, fruit, yogurt, bagels, pastries, toaster waffles, juice, and coffee in a small room, but we took our coffee to the nicely appointed lobby. Two computers for internet. The staff are very helpful and courteous. Only 1 block to Times Square, and theater district. Multiple subway stops nearby-get a map from the front desk.Try the Grey Line bus tours when the feet wear out. Lots of restaurant on W. 46th. Try the Havanna Club a few doors down.
Extremly good vbalue for money...good breakfast and very courteous staff

Stayed here about 16 months ago. The same lady who worked the front desk last time was still there and remembered me. Also the man who takes care of the continental breakfast area was there from 16 months ago. The fact that both employees were still there speaks well for the hotel in my opinion. Make sure you ask for a room NOT facing the street as it can be very noisy in the middle of the night otherwise. Rooms in the rear of the hotel are quiet though. I would reccommend this hotel for the excellent location and clean comfortable rooms. Rate I booked one month before trip was $189 a night. Two days before I left I checked on-line and the rate had dropped to $149 a night and I called and they adjusted the rate for me no problem.

My teenage daughter and I make a yearly trip to NYC to shop and see Broadway shows and for the past 3 years we have stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown! The location is wonderful, rooms are comfy and quiet and service is great! My only complaint is the frosted bathroom doors and we fix that problem by getting brochures from the lobby and taping them to the door for privacy!! A great hotel for a great price!

excellent location, the staff is impeccable, I strongly recommend, when you return to NY I will be in the same hotel, so need to repair the elevator and it does not have air conditioning and e very slow, with regard to the rooms and bathrooms are good and very clean and spotless

Just returned May 2 with teenage son. This was the perfect place. Just as good as hotels that charge 2 or 3x more. Room updated and clean. Bed very comfy. Absolutely no problems. Everything very close within walking distance. When returning to New York will stay at this hotel. Jovannie at the front desk very helpful and pleasant. In fact all staff very friendly. Like someone said before a hidden gem in the middle of New York.

Just can't beat the location, one a half block from the center of Times Square. Very comfortable older hotel. Breakfast was good, clean and its the spot. I can't say enough about the staff - they were terrific.

We stayed four days in hotel. We were surprised how near is Times Square! We had even a breakfast included in price of acommodation, what is not usually for hotels in NYC. The room was very quite. The staff were very helpfull and kind. We would definietly recommend this hotel and we will probably come back one day in the most beautifull town in world, of course in this hotel!!!:-)

We have just returned from NYC and staying in Times Square. This our second visit to this hotel. We had a mini family reunion here and all 8 of us were very pleased with everything about this hotel. The staff in fantastic! Helpful in many ways, 4 or five of the same people as 2 yrs ago, nice to see a familar face. Continal B-Fast is nice bagels, donuts, cereal and fruit. Location is GREAT! Staff had our room clean everytime we got back from seeing the city. Gave great recommendations for eating and directions. All the staff we encountered here made our stay perfect. RonP

i stayed in the comfort inn for 6 nights 14th-20th april staff were great rooms cleaned and fresh towels every day close to everything just a few minutes to times square would deff stay here again would recommend to anyone looking for a clean comfortable hotel in the centre of new york

We were looking for a comfortable, affordable, conveniently located, clean hotel. Comfort Inn Midtown turned out to be all that we had hoped. The location 1 block from Times Square was amazing, but the hotel itself seemed enough off the beaten path to not be hectic or loud. Sure there was some traffic noise, but you're in a big city. The hotel has 70 rooms or so on 9 compact floors -central elevator separates the floor into 2 wings with 5 or 6 rooms per wing. Nice features - clean, comfortable bed, continental breakfast, friendly, helpful staff, access to free wireless in room and printer accessibility in small business center. Would definitely stay there again.

We have stayed a the Comfort Inn for 4 nights. Last time we were in the Casablanca and we got some serious pampering there, so we were prepared to be slightly disappointed. We were dead wrong. While not at the same level of comfort than the Casablanca, we got:PROS:1) Top notch Service, always with a smile. Geovanni (not spelled like this, but you know who you are) spent almost an hour solving a problem we had with the airline. Thanks from Ignacio (Argentina).2) Great, clean and big (for NYC standards) room, the most comfortable bed I've ever experienced at a hotel (and I've stayed at a LOT of them), great LCD TV, clean and decently sized bathroom, hot water at all times. 3) Decent continental buffet breakfast, you get coffee, tea, milk, danish, pastries, bagels, cream cheese, jam, butter, orange and apple juice, 3 types of cereals, yogurts, apples and bananas.4) Location, location, location, 1 block to broadway, 2 block to Times Sq. Great.5) Beautiful "old school" lobby.6) Free local and long distance calls (within the US) from your room. Free Wi-Fi.7) Some amenities we didn't have the chance to use but were available: 24 hour open gym, clean and with 3-4 new machines (we got plenty of exercise walking around); office center, and very cheap (again, for NYC standards) parking.(MINOR) CONS:1) The glass door at the bathroom can be a nuisance.2) The heating system can get noisy at times.3) Some renovations were undergoing and the entire facade was covered in scaffolds. Guess it will take some weeks for them to come off.4) Breakfast lounge can be packed and you would have to wait for your turn to sit and have your breakfast. Be there early!All in all, you can't beat it for the price. It gets a thumbs up from me. Enjoy!

If I ever return to New York City, this is were I will stay! The room was bigger than I imagined, everything was new and it had the best TV I've ever had in a hotel room (though we didn't use it much). I think it was about a size 40" or bigger flat-screen TV. For you iPod owners, the room also has an iHome instead of a cheap clock radio, NICE! There are plenty of electrical plugs everywhere and FREE Wi-Fi. If you wake up early enough (we didn't) there's free continental breakfast provided downstairs and free newspaper. The hotel has a small but FREE gym that provides water and towels.We had a king size bed that I miss to this day, SO comfortable!Service was, for the most part, excellent except for at check-in the Asian guy that helped us had accidentally overcharged our credit card for close to 10 times the amount he was supposed to and didn't tell us. Halfway through our vacation we discovered a few thousand dollars were charged instead of a few hundred and we were in a panic! We thought we were in New York without any money. After talking with the bank all was settled but it was still 30 minutes of stress that could have been avoided. After a deep sigh of relief, all was forgiven and our vacation continued.The bathroom door is as see-through as a foggy window! We didn't mind it except whenever I had to, you know, sit down. I would do this with the lights off to have as much privacy as possible. If you're not comfortable with the people you're staying with this bathroom door is gonna be tough times for you. I also wished the hotel provided conditioner, all they had was shampoo.The room can get pretty warm so expect to run that cooler at night.Location, Location, Location!!!!Located between Times Square and Rockefeller Center it is PERFECT! Right in the middle of the city and close to everything. Across the street is the St. Andrews Pub, we fell in love with this place and we usually went there before bed every night. Conner is the bartender there, he's a nice guy and gives great service.My only complaints were:-the credit card "woops" which I'm sure won't happen again.-the room gets warm-the bathroom door being see-through-the Dasani Water machine in the lobby is tricky-no conditioner-Bathroom sink water.. the Cold is freezing the Hot is clear lava

For the price, this was a perfect place to stay. I took my 2 teen sons for a springbreak trip to visit the city. I love the location! Several different options of subways nearby. Close enough to Time Square but not too close. Felt very safe. Rooms were quiet. Elevator was slow, but it's an old building with a small elevator. We walked up the three flights of stairs whenever we could. Free internet to check HOPSTOP.com for directions. The rooms are small but I've stayed in smaller. All udated and clean. Beds must be new because they were comfortable! Staff was 100% friendly and helpful.

I concur with previous reviewer. Clean, comfortable room. Great mid-week rates considering location---1/2 block from Times Square. Hotel is not much to look at from exterior, but inside looks fresh. We requested room away from street. No view to speak of but it was quiet. Staff was very courteous. Check booking rates frequently as they fluctuate widely. Parking for guests across the street was also less than many other hotels at $23/day. I would stay here again.

My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown last weekend and had a great stay. The check in was quick and friendly, the room was spotless (room 806) with a king size bed, small but efficient and clean modern washroom with shower. The bed and linens were better than I expected, the room was quiet, and the window opened. There was not much of a view, but because the hotel is right beside a church, it was very quiet. The parking was $23/day, which is a great find, and the room was an even better deal. Phoning the hotel directly, with CAA we paid $139/nt right on Times Square! I was worried with such a bargain, but it worked out fabulously(and I am one of those travellers who goes on Tripadvisor and puts the worst reviews first....if I see bugs or hair I'm outta there!). I will guaranteed stay there again. The rooms are not fancy, but they are clean, modern, flat screen tv's and a simple breakfast which gets you through the morning to that great lunch in Greenwich or LIttle Italy!The staff was equally great. No problems wtih check in, no billing issues, and when we had problems with our in room safe, they arranged to put our stuff behind the front desk securely while waiting for the serviceguy to arrive from somewhere in the building. So no delay in our touring! When we returned, it was all fixed and we picked up our things from the front desk with no problems.I highly reccommend the Comfort Inn Midtown!
great deal rooms clean and efficient--small but who cares in nyc--staff friendly--breakfast very good--computer in lobby---fantastic location and cheap parking--will stay here everytime im in nyc

My friend and i stayed here for 5 nights and it was our first time in NYC. The location was great. A few minutes from Times Square and just several more to Rockerfella Centre. It was at the heart of it all.We had the room with a King size bed which made the room a bit cramped but that was minor. The bed was comfy, the toilet was clean and newly renovated i think.We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast too. For a complimentary meal, the selection was good. The guy taking care of the area is a nice fellow, making sure the food is topped up. He's always there to greet you :)The business centre has free internet and a printer with free printing which came in handy when we needed to print online tickets to attractions etc.We had a nice and enjoyable experience. Thanks Comfort Inn =)

I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for two nights early in March with my teenage daughter. If you demand Four Seasons type amenities stop reading now. However, if you are looking for a clean, safe, very well located room, that includes a light breakfast, in Manhattan for, get this, $135.00/night, then your search is over. I won't stay in a dump, or in a place where I feel unsafe, and I can't believe the value for money here. I would much rather stay in a simple room and buy my own luxury toiletries with the money I've saved! Oh, and did I mention the free wireless internet? Our two bedded room had a, shall we say, European standard of space. In other words, it was the smallest room I've ever stayed in in this country. It also seemed a bit drab at first glance because there was no natural light in the room; even though the room faced front the window was taken up by the climate control system. Upon closer examination however, everything in the room was newish, in excellent repair, and perfectly clean. The bathroom was also clean and modern. I am a big city resident, so I wasn't bothered by outside noise, but have to admit that the plumbing from other rooms was a bit annoying, but bearable. The location is terrific on 46th Street between 6th and 7th...Broadway and theatreland one block to the right, 5th Avenue and shopping one block to the left, restaurants everywhere. The staff seemed friendly, although I had no reason to ask for their help. One tip, it you book using a AAA or AARP discount, make sure you have your card with you! I carry mine routinely, but have never actually been asked for it at check-in but was here.  Minor quibbles aside, I would absolutely stay here again. At prices like this I will be able to visit NYC more often!

My teenaged daughter and I have enjoyed a three night stay in February at this hotel for the past three years. We like seeing the same friendly and accomodating staff members year after year. We arrived quite early from the airport (8:30ish) and the desk staff said a room would be ready around 11:00, and offered us breakfast and held our bags till we returned from a walk. (They will hold your bags after check-out, too, until you are ready for transportation to airport.) The room is very comfortable and clean. We shared a king-sized bed, and room size is comfortable for two people. Bedding is nice. Bathroom is clean. Towels were a little scratchy. Complimentary continental breakfast is a real plus; food is good and the service person is very attentive. We love the location-close to theaters, shopping & the subway. We visit in February because the rates are lower; we have lots of fun despite the cold. We feel safe here. It is about 1/2 block down 46th St. from Times Square. Entrance is well lit and there's always someone at the front desk. I would heartily recommend this hotel, and hope to visit again.

Location and VALUE is as good as it gets for those headed to Broadway shows. Short walk away from subway stations, restaurants, Broadway, and Central Park is totally walkable. Staff is super friendly and accomodating, and the rooms though small (of course they are -- it's Manhattan!!) are clean and elegant with all the expected amenities including a nice flat-screen TV. Beds are comfy, bathroom has a full bathtub. Included breakfast is great for a continental breakfast, though you might want to grab coffee down the street. Location is decently quiet, excellent for that area of Manhattan. Definitely, definitely would come back here and highly recommend to all friends.The perfect hotel for couples and groups of friends on tight budgets, but not wanting to sacrifice on comfort or lifestyle.jt

We stayed in a one bedroom room for 6 nights in February 2009. We were located on the 5th floor.Positives• The location of this hotel is awesome. I think this Comfort Inn should be renamed to the Times Square Comfort Inn instead of Midtown because Time Square was just at the end of our street. • Hotel offered free wireless therefore could connect from your room (given you have your own laptop). The wireless speed was really quick too. They also provided a business centre area available 24hrs and could use their pc’s for internet and printer for printing.• Rooms were cleaned everyday although I don’t think sheets were changed every day. • We had a closet in our room which was a bonus, we utilised this space to store our luggage. • Safe was available in room • An ipod docking station was also available so we could play tunes but we mostly used it to recharge our iphone• Free breakfast was included with stay. Comfort Inn provided different types of breads, pastries and cereal as well as coffee and juices.• There was a small gym area which was accessible 24hrs. There was a treadmill, bike and stepper but their equipment and was old.• There was a group of kids staying next door and were mucking around the hall way knocking on each other’s door. We called and complained to the front desk and believe they resolved issue as noise and children ceased slamming doors soon after.• Room was very quiet could not hear street noise.• Flat screen tv with cable was available• The staff and service we experience was very good. During our stay we also experienced (at different times) a broken smoke alarm which kept beeping every couple of seconds and we managed to block our toilet as well. Each time concierge was more than willing to assist us and resolved the issues seamlessly. • The cost of Comfort Inn Time Square was a lot cheaper than other hotels in the area definitely value for money staying here. Negatives• Rooms are small but everyone who has stayed here and posted past reviews we’ve read has mentioned that so it was no surprised. • Room needs a revamp of modern sleek furniture to utilise the limited space more effectively. We had a big wooden dressing table and a big wooden side table in our room which we didn’t use. Changing linen and curtains wouldn’t hurt either.• Room lighting was a dull probably cause of the colour of the walls and lack of natural lighting available. There was a small window in our room which gave us the view of a brick wall.• Room walls are pretty thin can hear neighbour’s music, but then again we did have teenagers next door who liked to play music at 1am when it should be dead quiet.• Radiator needs updating. When on it makes a whistling noise when it is heating or cooling which would wake my husband up at night. When we turned it up it would be too hot once we turned it down it took forever to a point we would turn on the aircon.• Elevators were slow and could only fit probably 4-5 people at a timeI’d stay at Comfort Inn again because of its prime location to Times Square and the competitive cost.

I hadn't visited NYC since before having my kids. My oldest was about to turn 13 and had always wanted to try shopping on 5th Avenue so I decided to take the plunge. Was a bit nervous about navigating the city so I chose this hotel, right around the corner from Times Sq and within a 15 min. walk from Penn Station where we would be arriving.We showed up at noon, long before the official check-in time, and the front desk allowed us to go right up to our room. They also stored our bags for a few hours after we checked out on our last day. Everything was clean. The room was a bit cramped with 2 double beds but we were comfortable. All of the staff were friendly and professional.I can't say enough about how convenient the location was. We walked to the Gershwin Theatre to see Wicked, which I highly recommend. Very clever story, fabulous special effects. Also within a few blocks, we went shopping up and down 5th and 6th Avenues, visited St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Rockefeller Center, M&M World, the Plaza Hotel lobby, and more. Plenty of fast food and family style restaurants all around, and lots of foot traffic so I felt safe each time we went out somewhere.This hotel is reliable and a good value. I don't think we could have found a better deal, for our needs.

Ok, so bearing in mind that this is midtown New York City - and a few minutes walk from all those attractions - and also that I paid less than 120 bucks a night, this hotel is a bit of a wonder.I was in NYC alone, and on business and I was SICK. So I really didn't want to be anywhere dodgy or uncomfortable, but couldn't afford to pay to be anywhere plush. My main concern was cleanliness and security and I was very satisfied on both counts. The decor was actually really nice and I appreciated the widescreen television and the desk with free national calls, free internet and coffee maker. The fact that they must have done a refurb recently was great; no yucky carpet stains, grubby headboard or smelly bedcover. I have certainly been in supposedly posher chain hotels that have been way scruffier and pokier (hello Hilton!) . The bathroom wasn't quite as nice as the bedroom, but still acceptably clean, if not brand new. Bit of a smell of disinfectant, but perfectly ok.Noise was a slight issue; I am very sensitive to noise but was pleased to have a room away from the front of the building and therefore quiet. The only problem was another guest's tv - not my neighbour, but someone down the corridor! It was on soooo loudly...but luckily not for long, or I would have complained. The heating isn't ideal - it was a little clanky, but not enough to bother me - but the room did heat up too much in the night. Not unbearably and I'd rather have that than too cold in January. Breakfast was good value - lots of it, bagels, cereal, juice, pastries. The guys on reception were friendly and efficient and there was a free luggage store on check out which I used.My only major gripe was a smell of cigars/strong cigarettes that I smelt twice at around 5am in my room. I don't think it was anyone on my floor, but I wondered if the smoke was coming in from a lower floor or the alleyway...? It was a mystery. Once again, luckily for me the smell passed within minutes. Maybe it was a ghost?All in all, if I wanted to be so near to Times Square again and couldn't afford to splash out, I would definitely stay here another time. For the money, you can't beat it.

I stayed at the Comfort Inn on 46th Street for one week last August (2008) and was very happy with my choice! The hotel is PERFECTLY positioned. You are right at Times Square and in walking distance to The Rock, Radio City, Broadway ... and the rest is a few minutes on the subway. The rooms were very clean and the staff were excellent and very helpful from the front desk to the very nice cleaning staff and concierge. My room had it's own air con, which you did need in summer and it wasn't too noisy. A light breakfast is included every morning and it was great to have that handy. They have a small gym (not that you will want to look at it after all the walking you'll do around the city - take comfortable shoes!!!!!!) and they also have computers handy for you to check email/internet, free and that was very handy. I would definitely stay here again. I found them very hard to beat for price and as I was travelling alone, it was nice that they had a 24 hr desk, I felt safe at all times. Highly recommend them for those with a moderate budget that want clean rooms and somewhere well positioned.

I and my wife stayed at the Comfort Inn in the winter of 2009 and it was definitely a good choice.The accommodations are small and simple but very clean and comfortable. The location is great, at the heart of times square and close to several subway stations. The staff is friendly, the complimentary breakfast is quite monotonous but honest and the free wi fi internet works fine.As other reviewer have already written, I didn`t like the glass bathroom door and the heat in the room that made us to turn on the A/C in the middle of winter. I also miss the ice machine at the room floor, since it was only available at the basement.Thanks to the location, price, breakfast and Internet, I totally recommend this hotel. The cost/ benefit for New York City is very good. But don't ask for the Queen bedroom. It is very small!

Girlfriends and I returned for our 3rd year for our Broadway weekend and were not disappointed. Friendly staff put us all on the 9th floor in our various individual and shared rooms. Still clean and up to date. We stumbled down to the breakfast room in the am for coffee, tea, juice, fruit, bagels, yogurt or cereal until about 10 am. Same staff for all 3 years and that is something itself! The newly refurbished building, complete with flat screen TVs, wireless access, 2 communal computers with printer, and fitness room is in good shape.I can never figure out why this is the Comfort Inn Midtown as it is a half block from the TKTS park off Times Square, when the Comfort Inn Times Square is nowhere near Times Square. Easy walk to everywhere from 46th Street between Broadway and 6th Avenue. I walked from Penn Station up 6th in about 20 minutes with my wheelie suitcase. It was also easy to go 2 blocks to the subway at Times Square to take the shuttle over to Grand Central and transfer to the line going up the East Side. Taxis are easy to come by in the neighborhood.My only things to improve would be the heat - so warm we didn't use the blankets as it seemed silly to turn on the AC when it was 10 degrees out. Not crazy about the frosted glass bathroom doors and the oversized bureau in the doubles and the one pokey elevator. But for the price, cleanliness and location, it can't be beat, (and we have tried ) so we keep coming back.

My daughter and I just returned from 14 nights at the Comfort Inn and we thought it was fabulous. We were very close to Times Square and it was a 5 minute walk to lots of theatres. Being centrally located we walked most places, including Central Park, the Met, Museum of Natural History, Empire State Building Madison Square Garden etc. The bed was comfortable and the room was bigger than you would expect a New York room to be. It was also very clean, with towels changed daily. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. They couldn't do enough for us. The breakfast each morning was good as well. I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough and would definitely stay there again.

This was my third trip to New York and the best Hotel i have stayed in to-date. The Hotel is only seconds away from Time Square so its location couldn't be better. On arrival at 2.30pm, the room was ready and the staff were very prompt and friendly, also giving us advice on the following night New Years Eve. The room was spotless clean as was the bathroom. The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels etc provided. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room size was adequate and bigger than some of the other hotels in New York. It also had a wall mounted flat screen TV. The breakfast provided was a nice touch and the staff member for breakfast was extremely polite and helpful. If a particular flavor of item wasn't on display he got it immediately. There was free internet provided and a small gym on the ground floor. The hotel was also reasonable priced for the time of year and location. I will definitely stay here on my next visit.

The Hotel has an great location, everyone was really kind to us, the size of the room is not so small as lots of reviews, we have a early check-inn and late check-out with no problem and everyone really tried to give all the help and informations we need.... I strongly recommend this hotel.....

I booked this Hotel using my points with Choice Privileges for one of the coldest weekends of the year ending in 2008 (Zero*), the Hotel was in the PERFECT location in NYC, the room was very comfortable, very warm, and up to date, especially the bathroom for the wife. You will not be disappointed with your stay at this Hotel and yes I will return to this Hotel for further trips to NY City in the future.

Myself and 3 others went to New York on December 3rd, and could not believe how close to Time Square our hotel was when we arrived. We had two rooms booked, one was to the side of the hotel and the other was onto the street at the front of the hotel. Our room was very quiet at night but alas the bigger room which was to the front was not, but if you shopped like we did you slept at night regardless. The staff at the hotel where very helpfull and even let us have our room till 1pm on the day of check out. The hotel was clean and there was a breakfast room in the moring where you could have a bagel or cereal and you could get tea or coffee all day here as well. Would have no problem recommending this hotel to others.

My friends & I have stayed here several times. It is centrally located and very convenient. We were very pleased to find the rooms have recently been renovated. It was very warm in the room, as the front desk controls the heat. No problem - we put on the AC and we got very comfortable. The one and only downfall to the renovations is that they put a glass door on the bathroom. Although it is frosted, you can still see through it. But even worse is that when you are with three other people and you have a whold day planned, someone has to get into the shower very early. As soon as you put the light on in the bathroom the whole room lights up!!! I have to say that was a stupid move on the hotels planning. But that was our only complaint. And I'll guarantee that we'll probably stay there next year. Can't wait!!!

There's a reason the Comfort Inn Midtown in NYC rates number 37 out of 400 hotels rated on TripAdvisor, and that's location. It's just one block from Times Square, close to Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral, and about ten blocks from Sak's Fifth Avenue and Macy's at Herald Square. My wife and I stayed here for the third time in four years and found it to be consistently clean and orderly. If a king sized bed is ok with you, book one instead of a room with two beds. We've found room rates to be more for two beds (presumably because guests will try to sleep more than two people in two beds). The free breakfast has no frills and gets boring after a few days. There's free Internet off from the lobby to check your e-mail or surf. Our only complaint this visit was the excessive heat in our room. Seems foolish to have to run the window air conditioner in the middle of winter, during a time when we're all trying to conserve energy.

We stayed in the Comfort Inn Midtown at the start of December 2008 having decided to book here after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. When we arrived at the hotel I didnt realise how close we actually were to Times Square but we would never have known it once we were inside the hotel and had checked into our 7th floor room. The staff were great and check-in a breeze, the room was amazingly quiet and had everything we needed, it had a flat screen tv, built-in wardrobe, free safe, tea & coffee making facilities and I loved the heated floor in the bathroom :-) We have both stayed in Hilton hotels in the UK where the rooms didnt even come close to the standard and cleanliness of our room at the Comfort Inn Midtown. We were both more than happy with our accomodation.Also, the location cannot be beaten, you are literally a few steps away from Times Square and all the major tourist sites are within walking distance, Central Park, Madison Sqaure Garden, Empire State Building etc and there is a great Irish Bar opposite the Hotel!!We would both definately stay at this hotel again, thank-you AppleCore Hotels for making our first stay in New York City so memorable for all the right reasons!!

We stayed at the Midtown Comfort Inn from 11/29/08 to 12/2/08. Overall, the hotel is clean, comfortable and has a great location. There were two issues that came up during our stay....the elevator and the check-in process.  Our room was located on the 4th floor (there are a total of 9 floors) and the elevator was only functional part of the time. For us, this was not a major problem...since we are relatively fit and travel with carry-on size baggage. However, for guests with mobility issues or large luggage, this could be quite a problem..there are a lot of stairs and it is a narrow stairway.  Next, The check-in process was time consuming and rather involved. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30pm (knowing that check-in was at 3pm), and asked if it was possible to check-in or else be able to store our bags until we could check in. The man at the desk stated that our room was not ready, but that we could certainly store our luggage in a secure storage room, and that our room would be ready at 3pm. Not a problem. We stored our bags, proceeded to walk around Times Square, and returned to the hotel about 2:45 to get off our feet. Much to our surprise, the lobby was full...all the seats in the lobby were occupied with guests waiting to check-in and the only place to sit was in the adjoining breakfast room. Needless to say, we were told that our room was still not ready....along with all the other people waiting. We sat down and waited until 3pm. Precisely at 3pm, everyone lined up (at least a dozen people) and waited to go through the check-in process. The man who had been at the desk during our intial arrival was there, along with one other gentleman, apparently a reservationist that had just recently started his shift. The original reservationist started to help a guest and seemed totally incapable of helping her...she was apparently checking in using "Rewards Points" and he told the lady that she would have to come back later and see the other reservationist. This original reservationist then proceeded to go in the back room, get his jacket and was leaving because his shift was now over. The remaining reservationist did an admirable job of getting us checked in and was left to deal with all of the guests....by himself. It then became clear to everyone standing in line that the reason the original reservationist (who went off-duty) told everyone their room wasn't ready was because he didn't want to check them in...he wanted to leave it to the reservationist with the next shift. It appeared that he didn't want to do his job - or simply didn't know how. In any case, it was a poor representation for the Comfort Inn. I should point out that it was just this one original reservationist that seemed to do a poor job, he had no aptitude for customer service and genuinely seemed disinterested in the "comfort" of the hotel guests. I sincerely doubt that the rooms weren't ready, because the cleaning staff did an amazing job. They were very thorough and efficient. For example, we had left our room at one point around 10:30am and returned less than a half hour later to retrieve an additional guide book and the room had already been cleaned.  Due to the location, clean room, comfortable bed, and wireless internet access, we will likely give this hotel another chance. We travel frequently to the city and have stayed at a variety of locations.
