We have stayed at the Novotel and had very good experiences - they seem to have a higher level of service, with slightly higher prices. But, if the Comfort Inn Midtown is able to improve the staff (at least the one bad reservationist) and fix the elevator...then we will certainly be happy to stay there again.

After much searching on Trip Advisor, decided on this one based on price, location and reviews. Although the room was small, it was fully renovated and everything brand new. Amazingly there was no noise, even though this is just 1 block from Times Sq. My room was located at the side-back with no view at all, but the quiet more than made up for that. The complimentary breakfast was adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. Free internet was a much appreciated bonus! Recommend if prices still remain low, for NY standards. I know this review is a year late, but I am looking to return and thought I had already done a review.

This hotel is small and nondiscript from the street entrance. The doorman was very helpful, the lobby and rooms are small and clean. The breakfast buffet is limited but well taken care of by the friendly staff, so the area was neat and the food was fresh. There were problems with the heating system while I was there - the NY temp was in the 60's, the hotel heat was on and the AC in the room couldn't cool the temperature. The manager was accomodating and was able to give me a room on a higher floor which was a little cooler. The next day, the heat in the entire hotel was turned off, so it was much more comfortable. Overall, it suited my needs for a room to sleep at a reasonable price.

November 16, 2008Our hotel Comfort Inn Midtown Hotel was just off Time Square it was close to the subway. We had everything we needed and we spent most of our time looking at New York City. I would stay there again. The breakfast was a cold breakfast, they had hard boiled eggs you could warm in the microwave. Toast, rolls, cereal, banana's and other good things that were healthy. This opinion was written by a tripadvisor member.

My husband and I needed a relatively inexpensive hotel for one night in the city. It was perfect for us! Clean rooms, friendly staff, free continental breakfast. There was also a computer available for internet use and Wi-Fi access in the room. The room itself was a little small, but fine for one night. I think my only complaint is that you could not open the windows (there were signs on them saying not to open), so it was pretty stuffy. There was an air conditioner, but that didn't help the lack of fresh air. Overall, we plan on staying here again!

I've just returned with my wife from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn, Midtown, Manhattan and it was a wonderful experience-helping in no small way to making our first trip to the Big Apple a most enjoyable occasion. In the past we've come back from a city break and reviewed our accomodation together and the consensus would always be it was OK but.......! But there were no "buts" about this hotel. It is literally yards from Times Square and the first comment we got from the taxi driver that brought us from JFK airport was that our hotel was in a very central location. It was spotlessly clean, the room was an adequate size, very comfortable bed, flat screen TV, extremely quiet considering we were so close to Times Square, the staff were warm, friendly and most helpful and welcoming, the buffet breakfast was substantial and really set us up for the days walking and exploring of this wonderful city. To sum up I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to be right in the heart of the action and don't want to spend their time travelling in and out of the city. I was really delighted with my choice.Sean, Ireland.

The comfort inn midtown is a good hotel, and worked well for our stay in July. The rooms are comfortable and well designed. The location, so long as you want to be slap-bang in the middle of the bright and flashy part of town, is excellent. (If quiet tree-lined avenues are more your thing, look elsewhere - this hotel is right off times square).Do bear in mind that this is a budget hotel meaning that the service is basic, the air conditioner is noisy and though the rooms are excellent, the rest of the hotel decor is a wee bit shabby. That's fine so long as you're happy with budget.One warning - when heading to the airport, the female receptionist may offer to arrange transport for you for $50. We accepted this offer, even though it was $5 more than a yellow cab. However, when we got to the Airport, we were charged $60. A real shame, as we didn't expect to be taken for a ride by the hotel staff. Politely decline and hail a cab instead.

This was the best hotel I found while in New York. It's prices are comparably cheap; it's location is great and close to the metro and theater district; its rooms are great; it had complimentary breakfast and free baggage checking. I really appreciated all of these things when trying to stay in other hotels that were cheaper but a 1+ hour metro commute or that were not up to the same standards of rooms and service.

Comfort Inn Midtown is a jewel! The exterior is deceiving. The lobby & breakfast room are small but quite adequate. The staff at the hotel, especially a female reservation attendant, the bellman and the breakfast room attendant are all first-class. They were all so helpful during our stay. We appreciated the extra attention we received, especially since we were first time visitors to NYC. The room we had was small but beautifully decorated and very clean. Of course, we were only there to rest in the afternoon & to sleep at night. We enjoyed being able to make free long distance phone calls to our family & friends from our room. The choice of breakfast foods was exceptional, we were quite pleased. The location is wonderful-if you are able to walk, the theaters are close by, NBC studios, Times Square, we even walked back from the Empire State Bldg.!! We would definitely stay at Comfort Inn again if we go back to NYC. We thought the price was a bit much, however it is NYC!Steve & BevRogersville, MO

Excellent budget hotel, great location, friendly staff, small room (but you get what you pay for and in NY there is so much to do you don't spend much time in your room anyway!) Would def stay there again, its so close to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue etc, its ideal for a short break, ad the beds were very comfy too.

There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. Great location - right at Times Square in the middle of everything. Friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast every morning. Saved us lots of money. The room seemed to be recently re-done -- everything was clean and attractive - we even had a flat screen t.v. The room however was small - but typical for NYC. Bathroom also quite nice and clean. I can't complain about anything. Excellent value. You really don't need to stay in a big large and expensive hotel. They even have a little gym set up off the lobby, plus internet service in the lobby area. Totally an excellent hotel - just small. I would absolutely stay there again and again. Just be aware of one thing ... when we booked at the front desk our return transportation to Newark Airport .... they over-charged us about 6 dollars each on the shuttle. I guess that's how they make a couple of extra dollars for their service. We should have done it ourselves directly with Supershuttle. Supershuttle charges $19.00, and we paid the hotel $25.00 each. Oh well.. you live and learn.

Went to New York in July 2008, it was my first time in New York and I also got engaged. Everything about the trip was fantastic and this certainly included the hotel. It's the best possible location in Manhatten, very central for everything. The room we had was spotless, roomy and with very efficient air conditioning. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. And compared to the prices of New York hotels it was excellent value. As a bit of a stickler this is unusual for me to say but I really couldn't fault it and when I return to New York it's a no brainer where I'm going to stay!

We just stayed at this Hotel 10/10/08-10/11/08. We found it last minute (the night before our get away). We went into NYC to see a show for my daughter's 16th birthday (4 females, 2 adults, 2 children on this trip) and as it turned out it was just a hop, skip and jump away from our hotel. We felt very safe at this location. We were so pleasantly pleased with our stay here. Newly renovated hotel, when we walked into our room it was very clean!!! It was like brand new. The only thing I would complain about, was that they didn't offer conditioner with the shampoo, only lotion. Beds were so comfortable. The staff was very friendly and you are close to everything! There is also a continental breakfast offered here too (the area is a little small in that room, but to get a quick eat before you head out was great). There is a parking garage across the street that charges you $23 with validation from the hotel. My car was cared for, no problems at all and I was very nervous about that. We were also nervous about a lot of the hotel reviews that we checked out online, but this met our needs 100%. Really, how much time do you spend in the room anyhow? I recommend this hotel to everyone! I will definitely stay here again on our next overnight/vacation in the city. No need to be nervous, this is definitely a hotel to stay at for the price, we couldn't beat it. I also have to stress, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, it was awesome to be so close to everything. I would have included pictures but my camera wasn't working well. No need to hesitate on booking reservation here. Also, they have a luggage room you could keep your bags in if you have extended stay past the check out time.

arrived appx. 5:30pm by cab. Was greeted by doorman who brought our bags in from the street. EZ and friendly check in and bellman escorted us and baggage upstairs to our room. I had difficulty connecting to high speed internet ( very big deal to me), and went to the desk for help. Desk attendent was very helpful, gave me some literature to assist... I went back to the room and was able to connect. Good, strong signal. Nice size room with work desk and dresser with drawers.. My wife especially appreciated being able to use the drawers for storage space. Nice size Bathroom with tub/shower... VERY Hot water. Plenty of space to lay out shaving kit and all the wife's 'girl stuff ' . Nice plazma TV ( 36" ? ) with cable. Good reception and working remote. ( another big deal to me ). We had trouble working the in-room coffee maker, called the desk and they brought us a new one. Good maid service throughout our stay even as late as 12noon when we slept in. One small elevator, but it seemed just fine... Never waited more than a few minutes. Had trouble getting internet to connect the last day, called the desk and attendant brought an ethernet cable, and I connected immediately. Asked the desk for a suggestion on pizza delivery, and they provided a flyer... The desk directed delivery man up to the room.. So happy, I shared a couple slices with nite desk clerk ( female)... I think she was shocked.. she offered to pay for the slices, and I told her I didn't want to waste and was happy to share. .. A little noisy on the street with garbage pickup, but surely not the hotel's fault.. Thick curtains kept out the unwanted sun in the morning.EZ check out and desk clerk made a call to get a car to the airport. Attendent took the bags out to the car. Ride cost about $10 more than the cab ride in, but very nice roomy SUV, friendly driver, took some short-cuts and we were there with loads of time to spare. Did not make it to the free breakfasts.Location was great, steps away to Times Square action, great Irish pub accross the street ( ate there twice ). Very attentive and friendly staff, as good of price as expected for the location... Very pleased.... Will definately stay at this location again

Our first New York experience was made memorable by the attentive staff at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Jovanne was most accommodating when we checked in and was a welcome face on our 5-day stay. The room and general condition of the property was excellent and the morning breakfast was more than adequate to get you moving in the morning. Above all the location was fantastic. We would definitely stay there again.

My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel in September 2008. The staff was very friendly (especially Jovanni) and efficient. We paid about $250 a night - much better than most other hotels in the area. The room was very nicely decorated and clean. It is small. Our room had a queen size bed, night table, small desk and dresser with just enough room to walk around the bed. Window air conditioner was adequate for the time of year we were there. No view from our room. Small bathroom with shower only. Nice flat screen TV, clock radio with Ipod docking, free wifi internet and business centre, free US phone calls.Free breakfast was a plus. Fruit, coffee, cappucino, juice, yogurt, cereals, pastries, toast, boiled eggs. The breakfast room is small but we were always able to get a table.Hotel is one block from Times Square so location is excellent.If you go be sure to have a meal at Virgil's BBQ on 44th St. - terrific pulled pork sandwiches and fries! Also recommend doing "Top of the Rock" day and night time.As mentioned in a previous post the hotel gives guests the TripAdvisor web address so reviews can be posted. I have no problem with this. Other hotels should do the same.

This is a great hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the heart of New York as it is situated a couple of minutes walk from Time Square.Because the hotel is quite small, the staff were really friendly and the service better than most 5 star hotels I have stayed in.The rooms looked like they had been recently refurbished and were clean and well maintained and continental breakfast was included in the rate. This really is a great base to explore New York for a few days.

Have just stayed at this hotel with 3 friends. We had two rooms, both of which were very clean, quiet, recently decorated and very comfortable. As expected in New York, room sizes are not huge but they are perfectly adequate and have all the facilities you may want. Location is superb - we walked most of the time during the day and had no trouble hailing taxis outside at night. Buffet breakfast is plentiful, and sets you up for a good day shopping, sight seeing etc. The best thing of all however is the staff - they could not do enough to help and earned their tips many times over. Would definitely go back and would highly recommend to others.

The hotel staff was great...Everyone was pleasant and always willing to help. The breakfast was great too! The rooms were clean and just the right size for two people. The location was the best--- in the middle of Times Square. I would certainly stay there again whenever I visit New York City.-Laurie

Currently staying there and thought I would write a quick review.Location - Superb its just off 46th and 7th next to Rosie o Gradys so nice and close to all the actionValue - $230 a night so goodRooms - TINY but clean and shower is fine. You will be hard pushed to swing a cat but hey your not in NY to do that. Beds nice and comfyNoise Level - Superb, Its on 46th so not a main road hence the normal NY dinn doesnt come in the "tiny" windows

Chose this hotel after reading the other reviews, and found them to be pretty accurate. As for a review that claimed it was good for singles, I would have to disagree. My husband and I both stayed in a queen size room and found it to be quite adequate. We did not have a problem with space and were able to move around freely. We requested a room with a view other than the brick wall posted in other reviews, at check-in were pleased to see that our request was granted! Staff were friendly and accommodating.It was also nice to have the continental breakfast available, this is not common in NYC.Again, our room was spacious (by NYC standards), updated, and clean. We also did not have any issues with the elevator as some of the other quests have mentioned.The only negative that we had was the window air conditioner, it did have a bad odor to it, maybe it is time to clean the filters!Would recommend this hotel to anyone that needs a reasonably priced clean room!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently. The service from the staff was exceptional! We checked out on the day of a major festival which closed off the street in front of the hotel and for many surrounding streets as well. We needed a cab to the airport but none could reach the hotel. The manager on duty - Giovanni - made some calls, arranged a ride for us and then the bellman transported our luggage through the crowds (several thousands of people) to Broadway which was nearby and got us in our ride. This was exceptional service which only capped a completely enjoyable stay at this hotel. We will not hesitate to stay here gain.

I was also just there as a solo from August 25-29. I got extremely lucky (I think I may have gotten the last room available when I checked in), but even though I was a solo they gave me a room with 2 double beds - which the bellman said was one of the "big" rooms. This greatly added to my personal space to have the extra bed to pile my stuff, but the room was still a very tight squeeze - the foot of the bed is so close to the tv desk that you have to scoot sideways to get by. I'm sure the double room I reserved would have been unbelievably small.I had also requested a quiet room, and the room overlooked the back alley and the backs of other buildings. I heard almost no street noise. The only noise was some bells that clanged every morning at 7:30 am, which to me was the perfect time to get up anyway (I think they were from the church next door).That said, my experience was fantastic. The staff is great - everyone greets you with a smile and hello, answers any questions, is very helpful. The whole place is very clean. Breakfast is adequate. And the location is beyond compare - half a block to Times Square in one direction, close to several different subway lines. I felt safe at all times.Now, some people I think have been disappointed because they see all these 5 star ratings so they think it is a 5 star hotel - it is not - but it IS a 5 star VALUE...the 5 stars here on TA come from answering the question "Rate your overall experience" - and to most of us, it was 5 star. I will also post one of the few negatives here - my a/c unit was very noisy, so I couldn't run it all the time. I would turn it on for a short period, it cooled off the room quickly, and then I would shut it off. It might be a problem if the weather is very hot for your entire stay, for me it was not. And one great positive that I didn't expect and didn't know about until I checked in - free US phone calls! Anywhere! I called my husband and daughter on the west coast several times a day, made and cancelled many local reservations, and was charged not one cent for telephone charges! What a great bonus that was!Someone a few posts down said they were asked to write a good review on TA, and therefore the ratings are skewed. NO ONE asked me make mention of the hotel to anyone, this review is written purely based on my personal experience.I know this hotel can be more expensive at different times of the year (I was lucky and got a $197 AAA rate in August), but New York is a very expensive hotel city. I was completely happy with my stay.

My wife and I stayed 6 nights at this hotel and we chose it for the price and location. Accommodation in New York is generally expensive, but we thought that this hotel was well priced and it's location is great being right on Times Square and Broadway.The room we had was a bit small, but adeqaute. The bed was comfortable and there was a new 40" LCD TV in the room. The hotel provides free wireless and networked internet access which was very handy. One thing that bugged us though with the room was the airconditioner was a bit noisy and our room had a view of the wall of the building next door which was about 2 metres away.Staff were helpful and the breakfast that is served in the moring is really quite good with a selection of cerials, bagels, fruit, yoghurt, toast, juice and coffee.If visiting NYC again, we would definitley stay there again.

I was very impressed with this hotel. The location on W46th at Broadway was an amazing location to everything in midtown. The beds were clean and comfortable, with an Ipod docking station and flat screen TV. The room, however, is small and may cause challenges for two people in the room. But for one person, I loved the compactness of the room. No tub in the bathroom, only a shower. Nice size closet, but had to pull the curtains out of the way to open the door. Like I said, compact, but sufficient. Good breakfast room with cereal, fruit and yogurt, bagels which is great with me. The staff was friendly and helpful and seemed really concerned about my needs. I would definitely stay here again if traveling alone to NYC again.

I just recently stayed with my mom at the hotel for a few days and we had a very plesant stay. The hotel rooms were extremly clean. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean as well and the shower was not one of those overpowering showers that hurt when they blast the water. Anything you need or any questions you have can be answered by the friendly staff (especially Ivonne!). There is a great breakfast every morning with: bagels, doughnuts, cereal, yougurt, etc. and coffe and tea are available all day long. The location is perfect everything is just a step out the door!

My wife and I stayed 2 nights to attend a Broadway play on each night. Hotel was very clean and staff was courteous and helpful. Room was small but comfortable and quiet. The location was excellent for those who like to sightsee. Times Square at one end of the block and Madison Avenue on the other. There is an excellent little deli to the right as you exit the hotel. Majority of what we came to see was within walking distance. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a room at a reasonable price convenient to Broadway and attractions.

My husband had a business trip in NY and my 10 year old daughter and I tagged along. We were sight seeing most of the days by ourselves and the location of this hotel could not have been better! The staff was very helpful and the hotel room was quiet. We never felt uncomfortable in any way and were very close to the shows we went to see. We would definitely stay there again!

We visited NYC for the first time in July, 2008, and knew we wanted to stay in Times Square. We researched many, many hotels to find something nice but for a nice price also as hotels are very expensive. The Comfort Inn Midtown received great reviews not only from TripAdvisor.com but also from other travel websites and the rate was great- $202, which was actually the cheapest for a Times Square hotel so we decided to give it a try. We LOVED it and would highly recommend it to others. The hotel location was perfect; when you leave the hotel you turn right and after walking not even 1/2 a block you're in Times Square. It's also very close to subway stations and you're within walking distance to all of the theaters. The hotel was very clean and looked great- they've done some recent upgrades and decorating. We were concerned that the room would be very small but it was just fine. Housekeeping was great also. One of the biggest perks was the free continental breakfast b/c food in NYC is very expensive and my husband can eat a lot! Another perk was there were 2 computers with a printer to use on the main floor so on the night before our departure we were able to log in to our airline to check in and print our boarding passes for free for our flight home. We had no complaints throughout our 4 night stay. We loved NYC and can't wait to visit again and when we do we'll stay here again.

After reading several reviews we picked this hotel. We didn't want to spend a fortune since we wouldn't be in the hotel a lot, but we wanted a hotel close to Times Square. We just returned from New York today, and I felt I needed to write a review to add to the already positive comments. I would definitely stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown again. It is only a block off of Times Square. It was very clean and updated. It has a daily continental breakfast. It is much cheaper than the other hotels in the area. The staff is very friendly and attentive.The rooms are small, but we spent very little time in the room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Very nice hotel and close to Times Square. Some walking distance to Penn Station though I would stay at this place again.

My teenage daughter and I enjoyed our stay in New York but probably would not stay here again. If you want to save money and want to be close to the theatres and crowds at Times Square and only need a place to sleep and eat breakfast then consider this hotel. The room was nicely decorated and reasonably clean with the exception of the windows. Absolutely filthy on the outside. I guess with all the pigeons there must not seem much point? There wasn't much to see but still not very nice. Plumbing upstairs makes noise which was tolerable when we were awake but at 4:46am was a bit much. Since the rooms are quite small you sleep near the door and can hear people talking in the hallways. Light sleepers should run the a/c as it helps mask the other sounds. Staff were generally polite; however, one desk clerk wasn't very friendly and when a street person (several sleep next door at the church) followed me in asking for $ he didn't even ask him to leave! Continental breakfast was pretty good and we never had to wait long for a seat. Don't bother taking the elevator down unless you absolutely have to; usually much faster to walk, even from the ninth floor. Two free computers in the lobby were a bonus.

Loved Comfort Inn - Midtown!!My husband and I just returned from New York City for our first visit there. After much research on TripAdvisor and recommendations from co-workers I decided to reserve here. Everyone is correct in what they write. The front staff and doorman are are very helpful, courteous. We arrived at 8:00 a.m. and they were kind enough to let us change and store our luggage until our room was available. They even invited us to go into the continental breakfast room!!! The food in this room is great and the man in charge is so helpful and friendly. Our room was just the right size, the bathroom perfect for a couple and a flatscreen TV - but hey - how long do you stay in your room when in NYC! The room was very very clean. One day we had a problem with the air conditioner and a very nice Polish man came up and fixed it during the day - he even popped by around 5:00 before he left for the day to make sure it was working! I could not believe how close we were to Times Square and Broadway!!! Night and day everything was within walking distance. If I ever went back to New York again I would definitely stay here.

It's hard to find a pleasant hotel in NYC for a reasonable price - this Comfort Inn fits the bill. It is recently remodeled /redecorated. The rooms are tiny (but normal size by NYC standards) but beautiful, the location is a very safe area a block from Times Square. Like the rest of the Choice Hotels chain, this is a hotel managed for frequent travellers - you won't find bellhops, mini-bars, or room service - just fast checkin/checkout, a really clean, comfortable room at a great price, fast, free wireless.(Book through the hotel web site in advance, use AARP or AAA for best prices...) I dont' think you'll find a better value anywhere in that area.

We stayed here for 6 nights on our first trip to New York and really enjoyed it. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to a King room on arrival and although space was limited the room had everything we needed including a large flat screen TV. One oddity with the room was that we stayed here in January so it was obviously very cold outside, however our room was always very hot - meaning we needed the air conditioner on everytime we were in it.The free breakfast at the hotel was a plus and included bagels, doughnuts and cereals. The location is probably the best thing about this hotel as it is about 100 metres from Time Square and convenient for most of the big attractions. I also liked that we were able to walk here from Penn Station after getting the train from Newark airport. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel as it offered excellent value for money in a great location.

Our first trip to New York and this hotel was great. Great location in Times Square and Broadway, but was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpfull and the price much less than other hotels. We highly recomend this hotel.

we just got back from NY jul 20 2008. This place was great. Right when we arrived Amir took our bags and showed me the parking garage across the street. He took my wife and our stuff upstairs and got us settled. The desk staff were helpfull about telling us where to go and get thngs. Anthoni in the breakfast room keeps things clean and tidy as well as keeping all the food filled up. As soon as someone is leaving he is right there cleaning the table for the next person. breakfast had juices, cereals, bagels,toast, yogurt, coffee. everything you need to start your day. the location was about 100 meters from Times Square so you could wander down there in 2 minutes to see it every night. Basically i would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone.. great place to stay.jdmississauga, ontario

First of all, I would warn fellow travelers to take the reviews with a grain of salt, since guests at this hotel are requested to submit favorable reviews of the hotel to tripadvisor. (The hotel hands out hotel info sheets and the suggestion to submit a favorable review to trip advisor is included on the sheet.) So I feel there really is some bias here. If you JUST want a place to sleep for the night, this place fits the bill fine, but I found there were a lot of little things that bothered me. First, the room was tiny. Just enough room to walk around the bed and the desk. The bathroom was small too (had a shower stall, but no tub), but manageable for one person. The window faced a brick wall (literally a few inches away) and therefore got virtually no natural sunlight in the morning. Made it hard to wake up! The hallways outside the rooms were very narrow. There was an air conditioner in the room, and it went as cold as 64 degrees, but that was barely cold enough. It would have been nice to get it colder when I was working out. They provide shampoo, but not conditioner. Again, not a huge deal (it's easy enough to stop by Duane Reed), but when you realize this in the morning when getting up, it's not great.

We happened to pick the Comfort Inn Midtown, 129 West 46th St. last October 2007 and were so happy with it, that we stayed there again over the Independence Day holiday 2008. They have continued to upgrade their hotel (which already looked excellent in October). It's close to the theatre-district for theatre-goers (just off of Rockefeller Plaza). It's got a 24 business and fitness center: wireless internet access, exercise room, ability to print Boarding Pass for business travelers and anyone. All the rooms have plasma TV. Free and delicious breakfast with an excellent variety of food and beverages. The room was perfect. The service was excellent, efficient, friendly, and everyone went out of their way to be helpful. The price was right (with a 10% discount if you show your AAA or AARP card upon arrival). Air-conditioning/heat can be adjusted. Whenever we go to NY, we LOVE to stay at this hotel. It's close to everything. At our last stay in July, we surprised at the many improvements to what we considered to be an already great hotel. It was one of the first smoke-free hotels in NY. It's along Restaurant Row. The already helpful and courteous staff was very good about holding our luggage until we had to go to Newark. The gentleman at the desk showed us how to print our Boarding Pass the night we were leaving - and got a very helpful driver to take us to Newark that night. He, and all the staff, were very kind and helpful, as always. There's no charge for New York state calls & toll-free calls. Each room has coffee makers with coffee & tea, an alarm clock radio that's MP3 compatible, and a reduced rate parking. Complimentary continental breakfast (with microwave) is from 7am-10am with plenty of tasty food (best granola we've ever eaten). Besides the usual phone with voicemail and hair dryers, it has computers/copiers/fax machines 24 hrs/day, cable with movies on demand. The rooms are very pleasant-looking, comfortable, and you don't hear any noise down the hall or next door. We consider this to be a first rate hotel and have recommended it to everyone going to NY. It's part of the Apple Core Hotels, so if you don't want to be off of the Theatre district, they have other locations, too. It was GREAT! We wholeheartedly and enthusiastically recommend it.

I am not sure what I can say that has not already been said! You just can not imagine the feeling I had, coming into New York City after being in the air and airports for over 12 hours, on a dark rainy night for the first time. Planning a 7 day stay, with reservations at a place with a rate almost too good to be true, I just had a sinking feeling.I was so pleased when the gentleman at the front desk was so helpful, and then the bell man who took our bags to our room was equally as pleasant. (By then it was midnight, and we were 4 hours late.) I just held my breath when he opened the door to our room, I was really expecting the worst, and telling myself to be satisfied as long as there are no bugs!And then! The room was small as noted in some of the previous reviews, but we had everything we needed in just the right place. And to top it off the room had been completely re-done from the shower to the very comfortable bed, and had what appeared to be new linens, carpet, paint, even a flat screen television.I felt the breakfast was more than adequate, and the gentleman in charge there was equally as pleasant. Each morning was a selection of cereals, fruits, donuts, bagels, toast, yogurts, juices, coffee, and even Cappuccino.Our room was cleaned everyday whatever time we seemed to get back to our room, almost like someone was watching us leave and then got right down to the business of getting it ready for our next night.The location could not have been better as we realized the first morning when we started to find our way around. It is close to everything from Times Square to Rockefeller Center, We even walked to Central Park and the Empire State Building.And, I also think there is something to be said about management who cares enough to watch the comments on TripAdvisor, and reply to any problems there may have been during a stay. I just hope we are able to visit this hotel again in the near future, and find it the way it was on our first trip. With the caring attitude we saw, I really think we will. Now the rate, that may be another issue!

We've just spent four nights in the Comfort Inn Midtown. We chose this location based on the favorable reviews in TripAdvisor; we were not disappointed. We found the hotel to be an excellent location - one block to Times Square, two blocks to Rockefeller Center, easy walking distance to the subway and theaters. The hotel is on a semi-quiet street just off of of Time Square. Our room included a very comfortable king sized bed and a flat screen TV; the room was smallish but how much time do you spend in your room? The bathroom was nice sized. We enjoyed the complmentary breakfast (cereals, fruits, juices, rolls); the breakfast room was cramped but ,hey, its a free meal! We've read that the one elevator was slow - that seems to be true; we had a room on the 2nd floor and just used the stairs. The hotel does not have a concierge, so, bring your own maps and visitors information. The desk staff did arrange a town car for transportation to Newark Airport. We were very satisfied with our stay and will use the hotel again.

Great location; extremely convenient near Times Square; rooms where cozy, clean, and pretty nice for NYC. The staff was professional. The breakfast food was no better; no worse then you'd find anywhere in the US. There was some street noise but I guess that comes with the territory. Subway was close. So long as they don't up their rates; this is the good deal. I would definitely stay there again.

Booked via [--] - they appeared to have the best Internet rates. Availability and prices changes regularly on their website so check in regularly.Room was smaller than I expected - just enough to lay 2 medium size suitacase on the floor next to TV and still walk around the bed single file - bit was clean. Free continental breakfast in smaller room and wireless Internet provided. We were a bit spoilt having stayed at much bigger and luxurious Grand Hyatt and Westin Times Square the previous 7 nights - however, if you want somewhere to sleep and save monies for shopping, then Comfort Inn Midtown provides clean and safe option.Location was good in "Little Brazil" street (46th) just off Broadway and in quiet street.

We just returned from a 5 day stay in NYC and this hotel was the best! We couldn't think of anything we'd change except maybe a little larger elevator. Room was plenty big enough, clean, updated, and quiet. The staff was excellent and friendly. If you are looking for anything more, then you had better be willing to pay more. The location was perfect for our needs. If and when we return we will for sure stay there.

My husband and I recenty stayed here for the 2nd time and I really feel like we've found our NY "home away from home". Our room was spotless and you can tell had been updated recently, with a nice flat screen tv. There was enough room and it was quiet. We used the safe in the room and we also enjoy the continental breakfast with cereal, pasteries, fruit, coffee, tea,, juice, yogurt, etc. Also, the location cannot be beat! Everyone at the desk was helpful. We just really feel at home here and love that it is so clean, good location and breakfast.The price cannot be beat in Manhattan!

I stayed at this hotel in April 2008 and I really liked it. Of course the location is fabulous. It's a block from Times Square and around the corner from Rockefeller Square. If you don't know your way around the city, the location of the hotel makes it easy to see some of the biggest tour attractions without having to figure out the subway system. I don't know if it was just because it was in NYC, but it was a lot fancier than any Comfort Inn I'd ever stayed in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They literally carried in our bags the moment we stepped out of the cab and the desk clerk even allowed us to check in 4 hours early. The room was clean and not as small as I expected after reading some reviews here on Trip Advisor. I shared a room with a girlfriend and we were both able to move around comfortably. The bed was large and comfortable. I only had two complaints and I wouldn't even call them complaints. There is only one elevator and it's really slow. Also, the room we were in had a weird bathroom door. The middle of the bathroom door was frosted glass so whenever one of us had to use the bathroom, the other person would have to move to the other side of the room to give them some privacy. Those are minor issues, though and didn't affect my stay or feelings about the hotel. Overall, I had a pleasant experience and will be staying at this hotel again when I return to NYC in August.
Excellent value for the money. Relatively (!) quiet street very near Times Square. Helpful staff and pleasant and nicely sized room. Much nicer than your average Comfort Inn.

Stayed at The Comfort Inn Midtown over Memorial Day weekend. As it was our first visit to NYC we didnt really know to expect. I must say we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We arrived well before the 3:00 pm check in time expecting to have to wait to check in, but our room was ready and they let us in. The staff was friendly and helpful, everything was new and modern, tastefully decorated, comfortable bed, nice sized dresser and closet (with a safe), flat screen TV, plus numerous other "little things" that made it very comfortable. The rooms are cozy , we used the dresser for our clothes and tucked our suitcases away in a corner leaving plenty of room for 2 people. The wall mounted A/C worked good we just ran it all day so when we returned at night the room was nice a cool and it stayed that way all night.Only 1 elevator that can be a little slow, but we were on the 3rd floor so we used the stairs most of time anyway.The location is awesome, turn right out of the entrance and Times Square is about a 100 yard walk.Just a great place all around, with great rates to go along with it!!

Simply put, I was looking for a cheap hotel in NYC which was affordable and got a WHOLE lot more.I only had 2 nights to spend in mid town Manhattan and did a lot of researching on the web for somewhere cheap but good. This place was GREAT.The location was perfect being only 100 metres or so from times square. It was a really easy walk to most Broadway theatres. I was able to walk to Central Park (although it is a 30+ minute walk).Since times square was always busy I never really felt I was walking in a quiet strange part of NY alone even though I was by myself.The hotel is better than nice. Very well appointed rooms with LCD TVs, clean bathrooms and very good wireless and wired internet access (with 1.5 Mbps up AND down speeds for those of you technically minded).The room was small but I was only in my room to sleep.The service at the front desk was suburb (especially Jiovanni).There is a small place called cafe @ times square a couple of doors down and it is a great place to grab some food for at a reasonable price ($4 for a burger and fries compared with TGI Fridays which was charging $17+ for the same thing a couple of doors down).This part of 46th St is also known as little Brazil and there are a few South American inspired restaurants on the street.My only complaint was that the air-conditioning was at the same level as the bed. When I turned it on it was continually blowing directly on my face. If I turned it off the room got too warm.So I highly recommend it to anyone looking a clean and safe place to stay while in NYC.I will definitely stay there again if I find myself fortunate enough to be in town again.

This is my 2nd year staying at this hotel. The renovations are complete and the hotel and staff are marvelous. We are so not from NYC, but love the atmosphere and this hotel really caters to our needs for directions, customer service, and a relaxful stay. I cant wait to return next year. The basic amenities that come with the room like free interent, gym, and continential breakfast also are key reasons why I continue to book this hotel when I go to NYC. I highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent hotel - room was modern, comfortable and absolutely spotless. The location is excellent, literally 30 seconds from Time Square and I found the staff helpful and friendly at all times.The room was a decent size and was plenty enough space for 2 people. Free and fast wireless connection with a business center on the ground floor which you could use for printing. Very good attention to detail :) I would have no hesitation in returning or recommending. Thanks!

I did a lot of research before booking our hotel, both on AAA and Trip Advisor. I cannot say enough about this hotel!We paid just over $200 a night. I would suggest you book as far in advance as possible because one lady we met at breakfast paid $300 a night for the same room! The front desk was very friendly and helpful. When they found out we were on our honeymoon, they upgraded us to a king-size room at no additional charge! They gave us a great map of the city and offered to give advice on restaurants, places to see, etc... We took them up on their offer and went to a delicious little coffee/sandwhich shop a block away.The room was extremely clean, the bed and pillows were nice and soft (not like the cardboard beds I've slept on in some hotels), and you could tell it had been remodeled recently. We just had one bag, but there wasn't a lot of extra room to spread it out and have the ironing board set up. It wasn't a big deal because we really weren't in the room that much. The breakfast had a great selection - from bagels and cream cheese, to donuts and cappucino, to granola and yogurt. They also have a small area with two computers and free internet, so we were able to check into our flight online before going to the airport.The location could not have been more perfect or centrally located. We were able to walk nearly everywhere, Central Park, Greenwich Village, and Madison Square Park to name a few. The best part was that we were only one block away from the theater where we went to see a Broadway play.If we ever return to NYC (and I'm sure we will!), we will definitely stay here again.

This hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. Just around the corner from Times Square. The street is more on the quiet side later in the evening, not many cars, if any, that came through. Across the street is an Irish Pub, next door is a church, and down the street towards Broadway is a Brazilian restaurant. There were also a couple of souvenir shops a few doors down, also towards Broadway. The hotel was clean, the hotel staff were friendly, the Continental breakfast was ok. We were surprised that there was a tip basket though. We've never had to tip for Continental breakfasts before. The free internet was great although at times we had to wait to use the internet as there was only two computers. There is also a fitness room, which looked nice, but we never used it. Complimentary newspapers were put out in the morning. The elevator does go all the way up to the 9th floor despite another guest reviewer that stated it only went up to the 8th floor. Our room was extremely small, but if you don't mind getting a little cozy with your loved one then it’s no problem! The bed was really comfortable and there was also a large flat screen TV in the room. The only negative things I would say was that the room was BOILING hot. The heater was never on but somehow the room was BOILING hot all the time. It appeared that in the walls was where the heat was coming from. When we touched the bathroom wall it was very warm. At night we would have to turn the a/c on even if it was cold outside so that we would be able to sleep comfortably. Another negative thing was that the phone, only worked by pushing the speaker button. Apparently it was a new phone and the hotel staff did not know how it worked through the hand set.Despite all this, the hotel was well worth the stay and we will definitely be staying here again should we ever come back to New York City.

6 of us were here from the UK for 4 nights in May 2008. 2 of us had stayed at the hotel about 3 years ago. Have tried since then to get a room for other visits, but it was always fully booked. No wonder - hotel has since been refurbished and is better than ever. Rooms and facilities were great and you cannot fault the location. Same staff from our last visit and they are as friendly as ever and the breakfast is very good. Would like write a poor review, as I may not be able to get a room for future visits, but that wouldn't be fair as the staff/hotel definitely deserve all the good words said about them!!!

There are literally hundreds and hundreds of hotel options to choose from in NYC. Different star ratings, different locations, different customer service and very different pricing. So how does the Comfort Inn rate in these categories? Absolutely superb in all of them. My wife and I recently stayed 5 x nights and apon check-in were told that we had been upgraded to a king size just renovated room....sweet! Ipod docking, flat screen, good size bathroom with strong hot running water, free wireless (very fast), desk, wardrobe and a humongous king size bed. Luggage space was perhaps a little bit tight, but not a problem. Decent views. It was 802 if anyone wants to reserve it. The location is excellent...down a reasonably quiet street just seconds away from the utter madness of Times Square. There are plenty of restaurants on the street such as Chinese, Italian and a great deli so no probs for quick food options. Many of the main attractions are accessible by foot. Some can take up to 30/40 mins walking, but because theres so much going on around you, you dont even realise you've walked for that long. The underground is easy to use and takes you everywhere. The staff must be commended for there customer service, friendliness and professionalism. From front desk, housekeeping and the porters, all the staff made us feel welcome at all times, something that is most welcomed from big days out touring the city. For a small hotel, with good service, good values and good prices, this is an absolute winner for New York City.We toured at least 8 hours a day checking out the sights, and feel we barley touched the sides of NYC! A big shout out for Sidibi the bellman, Anthony the breakfast guy and Ivonne the receptionist.

Two of us spent one week at the hotel, 1/2 a block from Times Square and the Theatre district. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was small but adequate, clean and met our needs. We booked ahead online and got great rates. This hotel has everything one needs - and is small and cozy. Free email, hot showers, breakfast, good advice and directions. We will try to use this as our Hotel in NewYork in the future. It's location is perfect! Well done! Thankyou for a good experience.

I was a late addition to a multi-party trip to NYC, and the private hotel where everyone else was staying was booked. So I went on google and searched for hotels nearby and then hit TripAdvisor for the reviews. Comfort Inn Midtown was the only hotel I could not find a single bad review for. Even among the $600+ per night hotels, they all had at least one or two recent bad reviews. Not Comfort Inn Midtown. So I rolled the dice. This was my first trip to NYC, and I was more than a little nervous. I could not have been more pleased. The room was fantastic. Had PLENTY OF SPACE! Hot water for every shower. Almost no noise from the street. No sounds from other rooms. The continental b'fast in the morning is great. Free business center where I was able to make copies of a white paper for meetings and print my boarding passses for return trip home (all FREE). The front desk arranged a $25 shuttle to return to the airport (It cost me $60 to get into town from the airport (Laguardia) WITHOUT the asst. of the hotel.) The hotel is at 6th Ave. and 46th. This is 2 quick blocks from Times Square and a half block from the (summer) Saturday street vendor fair on 6th Ave. It was just a few walking blocks from 30 Rockefeller Plaza (think NBC). Great little English pub across the street. Walking distance to MOMA and Bryant Park and so much more!Very safe, very clean, professional courteous staff. I can't say enough, except I will definitely go back to this hotel. If I had to reach for a negative, I would say that from around 8:30 a.m. to noon, the FREE wireless internet in the room had spotty reception. Other than that, I can't think of a single complaint. Book this hotel! You won't regret it.

We spent 5 nights at this hotel from 10-15 May 2008. Excellent location - hotel is small, comfortable (brilliant bed), well refurbished bedroom and bathroom (good shower), very clean, staff friendly, approachable and helpful (especialy Sandip on Reception). Continental breakfast very good (cereals, fruit, yoghurt, juices, tea, coffees, toast, waffles, pastries and gorgeous iced doughnuts!) included in booking. Theatres are a few minutes' walk away, as is ticket booth for shows (half price tickets), Times Sq a minute away yet street is quite quiet. Macys, Rockerfella Centre, 5th Ave all within walking distance. We would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

We were very happy with our stay at the Comfort Inn. The people were very friendly. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located close to the theater district. A great location. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that is coming to NYC. We will definitely stay here again.

Went to the city with 2 other couples for a Broadway show. Arrived a the hotel before check-in, but rooms were ready for us. Daytime desk clerk extremely accommodating, friendly & very helpful (night-time clerk quite the opposite). Rooms were extremely clean, comfortable beds, looks recently renovated. You absolutely cannot beat the location - easy access anything you need (food, transportation, shopping, theater). Will definitely be staying there again!

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April. It was a fantastic stay!The rooms are small, but certainly big enough for 2 with cozy bedding and a modern clean bathroom.Our room faced the street and there was some noise as well as that of water running from above when folks were showering.The staff were friendly and knowledgeable although they could have used more than 1 person at check in time on the front desk.The breakfast was more than adequate. The hotel and the rooms were very clean and the location is unbeatable for the price.Would definitely stay again.

WONDERFUL LOCATION. Great Price, literally you are about 30 yards down the street from all of the hustle and bustle of Times Square.Very close to all of the places that you want to see and go to in downtown New York City.The room is small, but so is every other room in New York. Why pay hundreds more for a room that you are not going to be in.The room is small, bed, nightstand, TV cabinet, bathroom. That is about it, but what else do you need.We were not in our room we were out in the city, we would leave early in the morning and come in late at night.The hotel did have a very nice continental breakfast, and as everything is expensive in NYC, it was nice to not have to pay for breakfast.Next trip back to NYC, we will stay here again!

I searched the internet for several hours. The reviews for this hotel were very good and the price was competitive, so I crossed my fingers and made reservations.First, the location could not be better. We were a half block from Times Square, 2 1/2 blocks from our theater (Phantom of the Opera), and in the middle of all the places we wanted to go. When we arrived we found the desk personnel very pleasant, but even more importantly competent, professional and helpful. The lobby is small but quite adequate and clean.Upon entering our room, king-size bed, we were further pleased. While the room was small it was very functionally laid out. The decor from bedspread to paint on the walls was pleasant. Flat screen TV. Great shower with lots of hot water. Very importantly, everything was clean, clean, clean.We used the two computers and printer just off the lobby for which there was no charge. The breakfast was included and was more than adequate and the service personnel were again helpful and pleasant.etc, etc, etc. . . we would go back again!

I've stayed at this hotel three times already while visiting NYC on short trips. I've always booked online and never paid more than $80 a night. For the price and the location, I will continue to stay there!LOCATION: Literally in Times Square! Restaurants surround the hotel - chain and otherwise. It's not a very picturesque street, it's crowded with tourists during the day, what with the proximity of Times Square, but it is sooo convenient to the subway, eating, tourist attractions and shopping!THE HOTEL: Is clean and very small. The staff has always been helpful - not always 'warm', but for sure always helpful. The business center is a closet with two desktop computers - but serves it's purpose if you're just using it to check in for your flight and printing off your boarding passes. The work out room is larger and has your basic equipment. It may be small, but it is a nice amenity for this hotel. I never tried the continental breakfast, so I don't have an opinion on it.THE ROOM: The rooms that I have stayed in never had windows overlooking the street, but rather, the space between buildings - lol. Needless to say, the curtains were always drawn. The rooms themselves have been small, but surprisingly, the bathrooms have been roomier. The rooms have always been clean. And I have always stayed at this hotel alone - and still felt safe. The room size, in my opinion, would be okay for two people, but forget about anymore than that. Also, since space was an issue, even with my bringing only one rolling suitcase, I could tell if I brought more than two bags, it would not have been a pretty picture - very claustrophobic.OVERALL: I enjoy staying at this hotel. I really love the convenience of being in midtown. The price is affordable, the location is awesome. I never felt like I was too far from anything I wanted to visit, and there is always a place to get food nearby. I would definitely recommend staying here - maybe not for a week straight, as it is very small, but for a short visit, it is perfect.

Just returned from a very nice stay at this hotel. I have never been steered wrong from any hotel I have checked on Trip Advisor, and once again was not let down.When we checked in, without asking, I was told we were upgraded from a queen bed to king. Our room was on the 5th floor - we looked directly out of the front of the hotel. We were there on a Saturday and Sunday night and never heard a sound.The breakfast room is immaculately kept up with a large variety of items - our room felt brand new - very updated.I was alone traveling with my teen and we felt totally safe in this location. We will definately be returning this summer, hopefully word won't get out too fast and there will still be bargains to be had here!

Stayed here for three nights, and was *very* impressed. I will certainly stay here again on future trips to New York.Location is superb, being just half a block away from Times Square, while being down one of the quieter cross-streets, so you're certainly not getting Times Square levels of noise.Reception area was modern, bright, gleamingly clean, and manned by friendly and professional staff. Just off the reception was a small fitness room with some gym equipment, and a business centre with two internet computers and a printer, all of which you could use for free. Complimentary continental breakfast was also included, and there was also a drinks vending machine and a flight check-in kiosk for printing boarding passes for airlines based on the USA. There's an elevator to all floors.The room was compact, but it certainly didn't feel cramped and I felt quite at home there. The bed was *very* comfortable; the TV looked brand new and had a wide range of cable channels; a writing desk, chair, coffee maker and air-con / heater were provided; and the bathroom was small but functional and clean with a very good shower.And, to top it all off, the price was excellent for central Manhattan.I would recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly tourists looking for an affordable, central base for exploring NYC. It may not be the fanciest luxury hotel in Manhattan, but for the price it's unbeatable.

We had a reservation with the other Comofort Inn "Times Square" which was misnomer: long blocks away from Times Square and at rather deserted area between construction and shabby establishments. So, when I saw this Comfort Inn, I just walked in and check the availability and price. I am glad I did. Other Comfort Inn was as clean as this one. But this one's location was unbeatable and LESS EXPENSIVE (Why??). Staffs are helpful. The rooms were smallish but ,like others said, clean and well furnished. As we had inside rooms, there was no noise ( but no sun either though. We had nice view of brick wall 3 feet away.) Minor issues: our bathroom door did not close properly. All the doors to the rooms slam loudly if you let it close by itself. They had a contracted garage in front of the hotel at $23/day rather than $40/day. Over all we are very satisfied with this hotel.

I have a cheap boss who says things like "find a room for $200 or less in Manhattan." I grudgingly booked a room at the Comfort Inn Midtown Manhattan (from which I am writing this review). The facade outside is plain but not offensive, and the lobby is a little dingy with a scary-looking breakfast room. But the elevator works fine (much faster than the Marriott Marquis across the street, and the room is surprisingly nice. It's small but very liveable, recently renovated, has a 26" LG plasma TV, ample lighting, a small but useable desk, a full-length mirror and a larger-than-expected bathroom (with a good-sized shower, curved shower rod, and granite counter + a small window). The a/c is a window unit, which might be bad in summer. The bedding is acceptable and the dark wood furniture is appealingly updated. There's a nice valence above the curtains. There's no view, but I asked for a room at the back of the hotel based on reviews read at TripAdvisor. So far, it's quiet. There's even a (very small) exercise room on the first floor with a treadmill and bike. So far, I am really amazingly impressed with this room given the bargain basement price.

This is a wonderful hotel. The rates are reasonable, and the rooms have just been re-done. Some of the rooms are a bit small, but who spends much time in the room? The location can't be beat... right in the Times Square area and near many theatres. The complimentary breakfast offers plenty of choices, and the hotel staff is very friendly. We stay there every time we go to NYC.

I hestitate to write a review as I'd love to keep this place a secret!The staff are very friendly and helpful. We would phone them from the streets of New York to get advice and information.The rooms are extremely clean, and very quiet - must be well insulated as we weren't disturbed by any outside noises. Although the rooms are a bit small, there's enough room to store your baggage and move around with no problem.Free Continental breakfast and internet access is indeed a plus.Only one elevator, but we never waited for more than one minute for the elevator and we were on the top (9th floor) and the hotel was completely booked.Perfect location. Just down the street from Times Square and Broadway theatres.Room rate we received was very reasonable and one of the cheapest I found when looking for a NYC hotel .... and I checked rates and reviews of hundreds of hotels.The secret is out! This is the place to stay and we will be back.

My husband and I checked in on Feb 29th and stayed for two nights. The room was modern and very clean. We were pleasantly surprised as this is a "2star" hotel. The room was small but not nearly as small as I had anticipated. The staff were friendly and nice. The free continental breakfast was great, nothing over the top, just pastries, cereal, bread, bagels etc. There was no restaurant in the hotel but this was not a problem for us as we really didn't spend anytime in the hotel. The location was excellent less than 1 block from times square. The outside noise was a little loud at night but we were in NY so we didn't expect it to be like home. If we are ever back in NY we will definately stay at this hotel again

I'm just back from a great stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. I've stayed in a number of hotels in this price range and location, and the Comfort Inn was easily the best. Clean, comfortable and convenient, with working air conditioning (even in February, hotel rooms in New York are always hot), a great location (between Broadway and 6th Avenue, right in the theater district), and free continental breakfast and wireless internet. My room was quiet and comfortable, and the location couldn't have been more convenient. I'll definitely be staying there again.

I am just finishing a 5 day stay here and, while I have stayed in nicer hotels and bigger rooms, it's been years since I've had a better location, with a brand new room, super clean, comfortable, with free WiFi and breakfast, plus free coffee 24/7 in the lobby, plus a coffeemaker in my room for this price. The wired internet is even faster, with plugs right on the desk. Yes, the bathroom is tight but perfectly workable. My queen bed looked and felt brand new. I was on the 46th street side (at the front of the hotel), so I got a little street noise but this IS Manhattan--it's part of the "charm." Nothing ever woke me up. I stayed both on weekend and weeknights; the weekend was much more expensive, but the weeknights were among the lowest price I found.

Just got home from our stay and felt I must write a review about this great hotel. First of all I would have given this hotel an excellent rating but the wireless internet access is horrible. Spotty at best throughout the entire hotel, including the lobby and breakfast area too. And this was common amongst all guests I talked with. (Although you can use their computer room which has two computers with a laser printer you can print to for free.) EXCELLENT location!! Just a half block from the Times Square area. Lots of food, shopping, theaters nearby. VERY close to the TKTS office where you can buy same day theater tickets for up to half price. My party had three rooms and all were in close location to each other. Newly renovated rooms. And I mean completely renovated. Nice flat screen LG LED tv. Good bed. Decor, paint, trim, furnishings were all new! Quiet room, except for the occasional sirens, trash trucks, etc but not objectionable in my opinion. Front desk staff were helpful and polite. Breakfast room was small but adequate, and CLEAN. Maid staff pleasant too. I could go on with lavish praises and address some of the negative reviews others have left but won't. I do wish to address the comment from one reviewer who complained that he/she couldn't get their money back within the 24 hour cancellation period because of their cancelled flight. This person stated it was unethical and "I don't have control over the weather". Well neither does the hotel. It's only fair for the hotel to charge, at least for one night's stay, since they may be out a room fare for the night until they get another person to take the room. Overall our stay, all persons in all three rooms, was very enjoyable and we looked forward to returning to our rooms after each day's activities. I will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and I will make all my stays to the NY Times Square area at this hotel!!!

We just returned from a 3 night weekend at the Midtown Comfort Inn on 46th Street. The accomodations are very clean and nice (small but this is NYC) the front desk staff were very helpful and friendly, and for NYC it was quite reasonable (under $200 a night). The hotel is 1/2 block off Broadway at Times Square, so if you are going for theater you can't do better. They even have a few rooms with two double beds (for a small family). We recommend strongly.

This is a very nice hotel in a very busy location. Staying on 46th Street during Christmas week is not for the faint of heart, but the hotel proved to be a quiet spot of sanity in the middle of it all. We took friends who'd never been to NYC before, and they enjoyed the stay as well. The staff was friendly and courteous, and the rooms were very clean and typical size (small for all of you not familiar) for NYC. The rooms were also quiet, and the beds were comfortable, which is a bonus for the location. We had breakfast in the lounge of bagels and other pastires, fruit, etc. which was convenient and spared us the overcrowded spots in the vicinity,All in all we were very pleased with our stay and we'll be back next visit.

I booked my reservation through the hotel chains website. This hotel has a 24 hr cancellation policy which I fully understand. Until my flight was cancelled due to the weather in NY on the day of my arrival. I immediately called the hotel to notify them of this dilemma and asked if I'd still be charged. I was told yes, so I asked to speak to the manager. I believe ethically this is wrong, considering I don't have control over the weather. I had to leave her a voicemail and after 24 hrs and no response I tried to contact her again. This time I was successful, only to hear her say in an extremely rude attitude that she would not make any exceptions, and that I would still be charged. Which I was. She then proceeded to tell me that after looking at my previous stays with the Applecore chain, that "I didn't look so much like a valued customer to her".

I have no complaints at all about the hotel. I was a little nervous coming in as a lone female traveller after an 18 hour flight, but all was fine. I had a renovated room on 2nd level- facing the back, so no view, but no issues with noise either. There was *just* enough space for me but i'm 5 foot 2, and there was only me- a couple would have found the room very tiny. Bathroom was very clean- great work!- but again, bigger-sized travellers would find the shower tight. Location was good- near enough the main road to feel safe, but not so near that the babble in TIme Square would intrude. I liked that i could walk to Broadway for some action and plays, and then to 6th/5th avenue to look for decent food in a quieter place. All in all, more than adequate for my needs. I felt compelled to write as i use TripAdvisor alot in decided my hotel- so hope this review helps someone else!

I decided to book this hotel for a little mini- vacation for my wife and I after reading the reviews posted here. This was our first trip to NY so I wanted it to be a good experience for us. I was a little concerned about the noise that some of the other reviewers had mentioned, but decided to book this hotel anyway. We had room in the back of the hotel so there was little to no noise that was heard from the street (outside of the police and ambulance sirens). But hey you are in the heart of the city, so no complaints here. The doors as mention in many previous reviews do slam, because people allow them to slam. Our door slammed after the first time we entered the room and once we realized that the door did that, we had enough common sense to not allow the door to slam and to be courteous to our fellow travelers. I would suggest that the hotel invest in some type of mechanism so that door cannot be slammed. The most time that this is noticed is in the morning though when people are leaving. This is my only complaint and the only reason I couldn't give the hotel an "Excellent" rating. Now on to the GREAT things about this hotel:Location: Excellent!The location can not be beat. It is situated 1/2 block from Time Square, the Theaters and many fine restaurants. Everything is so close, from major banks ( Bank of America, Wachovia, Chase,etc), and a 24hr pharmacy within a 1 block radius. The street the hotel is on is relatively quite, but lined with restaurants. The sidewalks also were not as congested as they are on the main drag (Broadway).Accommodations: Excellent Value!The Hotel was spotless from the lobby to our room.Our room appeared to have been newly renovated, and the decor was wonderful. It had all of the usually mainstays of an iron, ironing board, coffee maker with tea (decaf & regular) and coffee (decaf & regular). There is no refrigerator or microwave oven though. The only time we wished we had a fridge or microwave was when we wanted to bring some food back from BECCO (which by the way is a must if you love Italian food!!). The bed was very comfortable and everything was very, very clean (I was looking for any type of dirt or grime and there was none to be found.) There is free wireless internet connection, which is great to plot your day out from your room or make reservations if you want. There was a 42" plasma TV and adequate room for luggage in the closet. The room is very comfortable for 2 people to move around.Our view from our room was of the building next door, which didn't bother us not one bit, because we were out all day and didn't return until it was time to shut our eyes. Hey you come to New York to enjoy the city not watch it go by from your room anyway, right? :)The elevator was small and I didn't really notice that it was super slow. It brought us up and it brought us down. The breakfast was plentiful to start your day. It's nice to be able to go down stairs and a get something to get your day started. The breakfast consisted of a variety of cereal, 2% milk, boiled eggs, waffles, assorted fruit, orange juice, apple juice, coffee (regular & decaf), breakfast muffins and even Red Bull energy drink. All this while reading your complimentary copy of the NY Times and USA Today. This is good way to save a few more dollars for stuff that you really want to spend money on.While we drove to New York instead of flying, there is a little kiosk in the lobby to check on your flight, in addition to the computers in the business center. There is also a small fitness center, which we didn't use as we got plenty of exercise walking all around the city and taking in the sights.Price: Excellent Value!I searched many hotels prior to booking this one, and you cannot beat the price. We paid $248 + tax per night for New Year's weekend! All other hotels were charging nearly twice as much. I am sooo glad that I decided to book here. There is certainly a lot of bang for your buck, and there was no compromise on the accommodations, staff friendliness/helpfulness and location. There is a parking garage located across the street that charges a discounted rate for staying at the hotel of $25 per day. Add $10 on top of the total if you drive an oversized vehicle.The hotel is located directly across the street from the "Muse" hotel which has rates twice as much as the Comfort Inn. I have to admit, I laughed each time I walked out of our hotel and looked across the street and people coming out of the Muse and thought "you have no idea how much money you are throwing away". This hotel is a little gem right in the heart of the city! I will be back and would recommend this location to a friend without any hesitation.

Stayed here for the 5th time last December. You know what your getting before you go and as for location, well you couldn't ask for more. Firstly the downside, of which there aren't many. If you get a room to the rear of the hotrel the odds are that your 'view' will consist of a brick wall. That said you ae very rarely in your room during daylight hours and the rear rooms are quieter than those at the front on West 35th Street.The rooms aren't cheap, in monetary terms, a 5 night stay cost us around £900. Although there is a continental breafast thrown in !Pluses are many. Desk staff are very helpful, the hotel is in a great location, the rooms are fairly well appointed, if a little dark. There are numerous eating and drinking locations all around you and the shops and sights are virtually on your dooor step.Don't expect the Ritz, if you want that go pay Ritz prices but for the centre of New York city we feel tat it is a fair price for a clean room and bed.

We decided to book this hotel for our first ever trip to NY Dec 07. It was a late minute booking, as we had found fantastic rates for flights only a few week before we were due to leave! Comfort Inn Midtown was the cheapest hotel we found and included a continental breakfast which was perfect.I was a little scared at what we would find after reading some reviews on here, but we had none of the problems others' found, save for the noise issue, which I'll go into later.• The HotelThe hotel is located less then half a block away from Times Square. From our window we could see Times Square's TGI Friday and all the lights and billboards. It is also very close to train and bus links and we never had a long wait hailing a taxi.If you are coming to NY for the first time, or just want to stay where the atmosphere and livliness is, then I'd definately reccommend this hotel.As it was booked as a suprise for our anniversary I contacted the hotel and asked if something special could be done for our stay, like a complimanary bottle of wine or similar. I was in contact with an amazing member of staff called Anu. He was so helpful with all my questions about the hotel, it was more like 5 star service! When we arrived, it turned out we had be upgraded to a brand new HUGE room!The downstairs features a small gym, the breakfast room, a toilet, luggage hold (which is free) and a computer room (again, free)• The RoomWe stayed in room 902, overlooking the street and the Muse Hotel. Again, the room was amazing. We had plently of room for our suitcases and the bathroom was huge and well appointed, with a shower, bath, loo and sink. The hairdryer was loctaed in the bathroom in it's own unit. I'd heard rooms in NY were teeny, but this was bigger than some rooms I've stayed in in the UK by far.As for the main bedroom, we had two huge windows which let in a lot of light despite the massive buildings outside. The fire escape on the outside of the building looked amazing (a small point I know, but at least it fit in with the character of the room and building!) The bed was huge. WE have a superking size bed at home, and this bed was a little smaller, not by much though. There is also a flat panel TV with about thirty channels (Check out the adverts... so unbelieveably strange!), a dest with powerpoints for your laptop and a chest of drawers to keep clothes in. The coffee make was on top of the chest of drawers.Next to the entrance was a cupboard with the iron and ironing board, a rail with hangers to hang clothes, and a shelf (we didn't use it, but it could be great to keep the suitcase in)It was clean (all except under the bed, don't look under there if you're a clean freak like me!) and tidy and didn't smell at all!• ServiceWe found all the staff to be welcoming and helpful. Check-in was quick and easy, and only took around five minutes. We were always greeted with a smile and a 'Morning!' or 'Afternoon!' which was a pleasant change form the NY'ers brashness!• BreakfastBreakfast was served from 7am til 10:30am. We mainly ate around 8ish. There was a wide variety of food. Cereal: Corn Flakes, Alpen-like nutty cereal and I think Rice Krispies. Bagels in every flavour were available, as well as Dunkin Doughnuts (which was a treat!) There was also toast and waffles too.Coffee, cappucino, tea and herbal teas were on offer, as well as OJ, AJ, Coke and Redbull (perfect for a much needed engery boost!)Everything was well stocked early morning, however on the few days we got up later (about 9ish) it was much harder to find exactly what you wanted, or a place to sit.Papers were available free of charge.• The NoiseWhen I booked this hotel, I was a little anxious about it being loud. I have problems sleeping, acute insomnia means it takes me at least an hour (in silent conditions) to fall asleep, and being a light sleeper means the slightest noise will wake me bolt upright.
