Despite the fact that we had a 5th floor room at the front (after a check-in request for "something quieter" than the 2nd floor room at the front we were booked in to), we slept soundly through each night without any problems. The towels and bathroom were clean and fresh each day. The breakfast, while a little bland by the 7th morning, was plentiful (though glazed doughnuts for breakfast?!) And most importantly, the staff were out-going and helpful at all times.Best Points:* THE PRICE!* The location - although given the efficiency of the subway, next time I'd be tempted to take an even-cheaper outer boroughs hotel that was next to a subway station.* Room size was much larger than expected - a good 80cm on either side of the queen bed, and at least 1.5m between the foot of the bed and the TV cabinet.* Free internet access - a nice bonus.* Free newspapers at breakfast (if early enough)Not so good points:* No fridge in the room - I guess we assumed there would be one, and had plans to get groceries for lunch and some of our dinners. A fridge can be arranged, but costs an extra $10 per night. No thanks: we ate out.* Slow lift - unless the lift was already at our floor, the only time we waited for it was for luggage. When going down 4 floors, the steps were often faster than the lift.* Toilet often required a couple of flushes, and even blocked once; but was promptly fixed after we asked at reception.But really, these are minor quibbles. None of them produced more than transitory annoyances. For where it was (and compared to the reviews of other Manhattan hotels in the price range), the Comfort Inn Midtown was wonderful.The bottom line: would I stay there again? As I mentioned earlier, better-than-expected public transport would have us looking a little further out next time; but if we stay in Manhattan in future (even when we have a little more to spend) we will be staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown!

My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn, Midtown in New York City from May 16 through May 20, 2005. Although the hotel is very small, it was very neat and clean. The lobby was decorated beautifully, and the staff was very, very nice and accomodating. A short walk to the corner landed us right in the middle of Times Square which was in our opinion the right place to be to catch our tour busses, etc. I would recommend the Comfort Inn, Midtown to travelers who don't want to spend hundreds of dollars per day on a hotel room. We will definitely stay there again.

My 2 girlfriends and I went to New York City for a shopping getaway. We wanted to stay close to Times Square and not pay too much, so we chose the comfort inn. Location was good. However, when we arrived, they had booked us with only 2 people, instead of 3, and informed us that there were only single/full size beds available and that they have no roll-away-beds! So, one of us had to sleep on the hard-as-a-rock floor in a tiny little room. We were informed that we would get extra blankets for the person sleeping on the floor, although we only received 2 extra (not enough to make the foor even somewhat comfortable!) Also, there is only one tiny elevator in the whole hotel making it somewhat difficult and long to get up or down, as sometimes you had to wait for several trips before you could get on the elevator. On a good note, the continental breakfast was great.As we were leaving to go back to the airport, we asked the concierge to call us a taxi, as we were waiting in the lobby, they told us our cab was "here" as they literally pushed us out the street and made us walk up to times square with our suit cases to hail a cab ourselves! It was very rude.Not sure I'll be back to the comfort inn on my next stay in NYC!!

I read all the reviews before I went to this hotel and am happy to say that they were all accurate. The Midtown was clean, safe and a great budget hotel for those that just want a nice spot to sleep and shower. The lobby was clean and the front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was also great, and just enough to start off your day!The location can't be beat and you are literally just steps away from Times Square and it's only a short walk to Rockerfeller Square and 5th avenue.We would definitely stay here again!!

This is the second I have stayed here - this time for 4 nights. The location is great and the rooms are tidy and clean. Just beware if you are claiming the AAA discount. I am a NRMA member and was entitled to the AAA discount and they refused to honour it despite numerous calls and faxes from NRMA and AAA. In the end we gave up despite having to pay an extra $160 US.

The Comfort Inn was comfortable! We were not particularly sure about cleanliness in the lobby when we spotted a cockroach. It may have been a one off having come in from outside. The room felt clean enough but needed a bit of renovation. Also, there were steps up from outside which was really frustrating when arriving tired with threee heavy bags. There was no doorman around to help. Also the hotel is not particularly close to a subway station. We never had breakfast but noticed it was very busy - probably a good sign. Free internet access was a bonus.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 days in May and we would definately stay here again. The entrance is very modest, but the lobby was elegant. Our room was tiny, but in the rear of the building, so very quiet. You would never know you were one block from Times Square. Since our window faced a brick wall, we had to call our friends to actually find out what the weather was for the day. But who cares, we weren't in NY to stay in our room. Everything was immaculately clean, nothing was in disrepair, the bathroom had a tub and great shower. Breakfast donuts weighed a pound a piece, delicious and free. Everyone was friendly and the price was just right.We never did figure out the radiator heating system, but it wasn't cold, so it didn't matter. All in all, we were very happy with the Comfort Inn.

My 11 year old daughter and I stayed here 3 nights in April. We came for a mother daughter getaway. I researched the hotels near time Square on trip Advisor before making a decision..and it proved to be very helpful. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. rooms were extremely clean. The 1st night we had a room with a view of the brick building next door. The room was relatively small but we expected that. the only downfall was no bathtub. On our way out that evening I asked if all the rooms only contained a shower. I was told no only 2 of them. I asked if it was possible to switch rooms as i knew the hotel was sold out. I also asked about a corner room as I had requested it originally. They offered to move me to one in a.m. With warning that it would be noisy as it was on the street side. my daughter prefeered it as she loves the noise of NY. We were moved to a room 2x the size of previous one. The rest of our stay proved just as enjoyable. looking forward to returning

What a pleasant surprise this hotel was. Excellent location and a staff better than many found at pricier sites. Breakfast buffet was fresh-room was immaculate--and I had a tub-so what more do I need?! A few steps to the right and you are in Times Square-go to the left about a block down and 46th street becomes known as Brasil Row-fabulous restaurants-then walk a little further and you are on 5th avenue. I was never scared and as a female travelling alone in NYC-that is no small thing. The hotel stowed my bags and arranged for my ride to LGA in the late afternoon-effortless and I was able to squeeze in some last minute shopping. Don't pass up this gem whether on business or pleasure-your company will be glad you saved them $$ and if it is on your nickel-you will have more for shopping and EATING!@

For the money this place can't be beat. It is far from perfect but it is clean and very convenient. The staff is friendly and the breakfast adequate (and free). They provide free internet access (if you can hook up). They have DSL, but it's so slow that in 6 days we were only able to access our email twice! It just times out before connecting, and unless you have a lot of time, it's worthless. The rooms are rather small and the bathroom was really dark - could have used some higher intensity lights. It's hard to do make up in a dark bathroom, believe me, I have stayed in a lot worse for a lot more! Can't complain for the price ($125.00 mid week) we didn't spend much time in the room anyway - I would definitely stay there again.

I stayed here 11th Nov for 5 nights, i was in NY for a birthday treat with my mother, and after a lot of consideration we chose this hotel.I could not fault it on anything, the rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and the buffet breakfast was fab. Yes the room did get a bit overcrowded, but when you consider what a rare thing it is to get breakfast included in New York, is it that surprising??Yes the rooms were smaller than average, but its New York, why would you be in your room for long enough for the size to bother you??All in all i would stay here again without a doubt, and i would not hesitate to reccommend it to anyone - i thought it was fantastic, and the location could not have been more perfect.

I checked trip advisor before booking this hotel for a week in the city. Really glad I did as the reviews are so honest and accurate. When we arrived we were told we would be in a front room and these rooms were generally quite noisy. We were offered another room straight away if we wanted or we could try it out and change the following day if we prefered. We took the 2nd option and yes, you could hear the noise from the street (even at 4am) but we thought the room itself was such a great size we were reluctant to move. I guess, we must be sound sleepers because the noise didn't bother us at all in the end although I'm sure it could really bother others. Everything else was great. Fantastic location, very clean bedrooms and bathrooms, comfy bed, great breakfasts and free internet. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will hopefully be back someday.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown Apirl 8-11. We picked this location after reading reviews on this website and we were not disappointed. It's nothing fancy, but it's affordable and it's in the perfect location. We arrived at noon and they had our room ready so we could check in early. The room is the smallest thing I've ever stayed in, but from reading reviews I knew not to expect anything big. The bathroom was decent size so that was nice. Again...if you are looking for something affordable and in the perfect location, this is the place to stay. Remember they take AAA, so you get a nice discount on rooms by presenting your card!

We fully endorse all the positive reviews on this site. A great find - great location near Times Square, clean and bright room, all staff friendly and free Internet access and breakfast. Would certainly stay here again.

We generally stay at 3 star hotels now. After reading reviews on the more expensive hotels I was not ready to spend extra money on a hotel that I was barely going to stay in. Some of the reviews on the 3 stars were actually scary. I down graded to a two star with excellent ratings. We seemed to spend a little more than most people here at $160. a night. What I really enjoyed about this hotel was that it was a non-smoking hotel. So many times even if you stay in a non-smoking room the lobby and halls of older hotels have an off odor to them. This was not noted at this hotel, I think, because of this policy. We were located in the back on the 7th floor corner room. Did not notice any noise except when it rained one night it came down onto the air condition unit and was kind of loud. Not unbearable. The couch in the lobby was tattered. I think it was an antique. I wasn't sure what I would find in the rooms but found everything said on this forum to be true. Clean rooms. Clean white towels. Maid service everyday. Family used the breakfast room and was satisfied until lunch came. We were out of our rooms by 9 am every morning and back shortly after dinner to get ready to go out again for the evening. Everything was always put back together after our rush of showers.We had a room that had the bathroom tiled. It was a small 3 inch step that all of us tripped over a couple of times. Bathroom was clean, no mold visible and new soap put out everyday. Rooms weren't especially pretty, but location was great. Would stay here again. My sixteen year old could watch all the TV he wanted and they seemed to have the sports channels for games available.I used the down stairs computer to print out our boarding passes the night before we left. Also, the morning of I checked our flight to make sure it was on time. Some hotels will charge for this service at this hotel it was free. Could have checked our email as it never seemed to be occupied. But hey we were on vacation and all could wait for our return.

I stayed here for three nights the first week of April. Be careful of the prices they charge! When I made my reservation, I was quoted a price and then when I arrived they charged me $15 a night more because they claimed my discount was no good! After taxes, I ended up paying an extra $75 for the three nights. My room was on the 4th floor. It was tiny but clean when I arrived. The second day I was given towels with make-up on them. It was also noisy. I never had a good night's sleep. You can hear doors slamming all over and also personal hygiene noises from other rooms. The doorman was the only friendly staff member I encountered. I never ate the breakfast so I can't comment on that area. Elevators ran fine---I never had an issue with them---and location is nice. I don't need a fancy or upscale hotel, but I do like cleanliness and quiet.All in all----if you don't care about prices, room size and cleaniness---it would be a good place to stay. If you want to know you'll be charged the correct price, and that your towels will actually be clean---stay somewhere else.I will never stay here again, would never recommend the place, and have informed my company to not recommend it to other employees when they come to town.

7 of us stayed here for St. Patricks day just....great stay....nice folks all around and helpful....nice clean rooms, decent continental buffet...Location, Location, Location: we walked to Lion King and Phantom Of The Opera, the parade, St.Patricks, Grand Central Station, most everything...we all agreed we'd stay here next time...even the legendary elevator seemed quite quick enough, thanks!!...And Thanks to Trip Advisor for the tip!!

Just returned from this hotel. Breakfast is great you can always sit in the window seats in the lobby and eat breakfast and watch the world go by if the dining room is full. The staff are excellent especially the lady who was incrediblky friendly and nice throughout the stay. We had a room at the front which was noisy til about 1130 and again at 8 in morning but when in new york was so busy would have slept through anything. Go to Spamalot, La CAge aux Falles, The Opera (there is a fabulous italian opposite the lincoln centre), Go see the knicks, go see jackie mason, book a helicopter ride, thefront desk will give you a discount on bus tours. Enjoy new york. This hotel is cheap, cheerful and incredibly well located.
I loved this hotel very much (in NEW YORK)It was very clean and the people were very lovely and warm We enjoyed it very muchThanks a lot

Well I feel that I owe this hotel and site a review since it was my main source of info on the hotel before my trip. I booked this hotel 3 months ago for a 3 night stay (march 17-20). I got a rate of $107 a night with AAA. I constantly looked at the site for new reviews to see how this hotel measured up as I thought at $107 a night, how nice could it really be. But after reading consistent good reviews, I decided to give it a shot. And let me say that I am glad that I did.My mother and I went to NYC and just wanted a place that was clean and in a safe neighborhood. We wanted something centrally located and this hotel couldn't have been in a better location. Just yards away from the heart of Times Square and located near theaters and subways, it couldn't have been better. I requested a room with 2 twin beds and on a corner since I heard they were bigger. I was told that they didn't have corner rooms with twin beds, but when we checked in our room seemed significantly bigger than the other rooms on our floor. We were in room 307 which was in the back side of the building. It was a bit hot in the room and we didn't want the heat on or that noisy ac unit, so we opened the window a crack which let in a cool breeze. Let me say that it was like we were in the country. No noise whatsoever...you would never imagine we were only yards from Times Square. The room was kept clean and tidy during our 3 days and everyone was super friendly, especially the breakfast man. (Don't forget to bring some money to tip him). We were lucky and got a table each morning for breakfast, but it seemed to be quite full at the busier times in the morning. There is only one elevator..the only problem I see. But being on the 3rd floor we often walked down the stairs which weren't too bad.All in all this hotel was great and I would definatley recommend it to anyone who is looking to be in the heart of the city, have a clean room, breakfast included and save the money on a room you are never in for the finer things NYC has to offer. Thank you Trip Advisor....may this review help someone else make an informed decision.

I have just come back from the Comfort Inn Midtown - I stayed there from 9th March - 16th March 05. Its a good hotel, clean and comfy beds. Goo breakfast, bagels, doughuts, toast, bananas, yoghurts, OJ etc and the man who looks after the breakfast room is so helpful, so dont forget to tip him!If you are unfortunute enough to get a room at the front, allthough it may be roomy, you will need earplugs.The noise at night is horrendous horrendous horrendous. At times I was woken in the night terrified of this loud thunderous noise! But this is also because the hotel is on Times Square which is a NY version of Leister Sqaure - tacky busy and awful. Avoid at all cost Bubb gump Shrimp on Times Square, the service is the worst, the food is in edible and you cant see out the windows for the dirt. A must however is a drink at the Marriot Marquis. The bar/restaurant "The View" is on the 48th Floor and the views are fantatsic. Do not have dinner here though. Its a buffet with the smallest plates and apalling service.The best restaurant is opposite the comfort inn called Le Tre Veneizie. Its the best Italian with excellent customer service - a very rare thing in NY.Sights:Empire State: A busy gift shop with a view. Huge let down.Sky ride: Dont do it. Statue of Liberty: Worth a lookCentral Park: Wonderful if sunny, the Zoo is brilliant, avoid the horse drawn ride, you get 20 mins around the front bit of park for $40, disapointing.Pier 17 & South Street Sea Port: Stop and a have some clam chowder.Brooklyn bridge: A walk with a view - brilliant.New York public Library: Good for 10 mins to kill.Grand central: Loved it. A good affordable place for lunch.Macys: Busy and hot but good bargians: Go to the Visitor counter, show a passport and you get a card giving 11% everything in the store including sale items.For dinner get a cab to Greenwich Village or Little Italy. Overall, New York is an okay place to go for a trip but i would not go back. If you want to go somewhere for a romantic break and eat good food Do Not Go Here. Its a lot of money for an American version of London but without the culture.

This is the second time I've stayed at this motel in Times Square. The value and location are terrific for NYC. The staff was again, very helpful and pleasant. The room, though small, was fine. Clean w/ the amenities of pricier motels. I still give it an Above Average rating.

Just came back from New York and stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Never been to New York before so it's hard to say how the hotel compares to other NY hotels. Everything else was OK but the heating made an irritating noise. I couldn't sleep through the night and woke up quite often. Stayed at the 9th floor.

What a great place to stay, plain and simple!My girlfriend and I just got back from a 5-night vacation in New York City, and we had stayed at this location. We went there because of price and the positive reviews on this site. I knew that I wanted to minimize my costs in NY while staying at a decent hotel, so this place fit the bill. So, let's get on with this review, and I'll try to detail it as well as possible, since I just got back from there today (it's still fresh in my mind).The lobby area is elegant enough. Nice marble floors give way to the concierge and the dining room, which is used for the abundant breakfast items (nothing fancy, but there are bagels, doughnuts, apples, bananas, various cereals, strawberry yoghurt, and coffee... I'm not sure if I'm missing anything, since I ate there 2 of the 5 nights there only...) There is a small exercise room up the hall a bit, with a treadmill, a bicycle machine, and I believe a stairmaster. Overall, good lobby amenities. Nothing out of the ordinary, but what is there, it's done well.We stayed on the second floor in the back. The view was nothing to write home about, simply facing a brick wall. Beware, as very little light comes through the black-out curtains and the brick walls. We wanted to wake up early and go sight-seeing, but since no real amounts of light made it into the room, we had a hard time getting up, since we were so comfortable and lazy in our cozy bed. Of course, that does ensure that you get a good night's rest, as there is very little noise and light that comes into your room!The room ameneties are excellent for what they are. Quite a large, decent TV, with about 35 channels. A comfortable, queen-size bed. A nice chair and table. Drawers. A beautiful painting hung over the bed. Just little things that you can find in every hotel, and done well here as well. The furniture, as far as I can tell however, was not run down or did not seem that it would break in an instant, a good sign. The bathroom was excellent, having a shower stall and a modern-looking basin. There is a hair dryer in there as well. Water from the shower was good, cold and hot, and the pressure was good.The rooms were kept spotless, which I was thankful for. Clean towels every day. Clean sheets every day. Amenities replaced as needed, such as new soap bars. Vacuumed every day. It was wonderful, because I cannot live without cleanliness. I've heard horror stories about some other hotels, and I'm glad this isn't one of them.The cleaning lady was one of the sweetest lady I've ever met. You'll know her when you see her. She is so sweet, in that little accent of hers, telling us when our room would be ready again, and always greeting us warmly whenever she saw us. This was a nice touch, especially when you meet lots of people in the city who are too rushed or care too little for niceties. This warmthness also extended to some of the staff members, but she was definitely the person that stuck out in my head. Oh, and so is the guy who encourages you to eat breakfast heartily. He just keeps encouraging to take food! He was also a nice guy.Staff at the front were friendly and helpful for the one time I asked for help, and that was how to take the subway to get to the airport. So I can't really comment on that. They seemed generally friendly though, always ready to answer questions that you had.Overall, a great value hotel. Clean rooms are important to me, and this had them. Oh yes, and there was plenty of space to move freely around the room. It's not a big room, but it's a big-enough room to be comfortable enough. I loved it here, and will most definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

I used this website for guidance before booking the hotel, so I feel that it's only fair to post my opinions here!Simple as this: If you're doing New York on a low to mid-size budget, you simply cannot go wrong with this hotel. The location is perfect - a 20 yard stroll and you're in Times Square. It's in a great position for all of the main attractions (Empire State, Guggenheim, Central Park and all the main shopping districts are within 10 minutes walk) and conveniently placed for the subway to other areas. There's an excellent choice of Deli's and restaraunts around the hotel (Check out the Guinness in the Irish bar next door!)As for the hotel....well, It's pretty good, even aside from the location. Yes, the rooms are small. But what do you expect for $99 per night - a butler?! The bed was very comfortable, the shower was hot and it was clean, tidy and pleasant. Internet access was free downstairs and there was a small selection of exercise machines downstairs (No-one mentioned this!!!)The breakfast is a big bonus. There are doughnuts, bagels, rolls, fruit, yogurt, cereals and tea\coffee, apple and orange juice. I don't know what people are complaining about - there's loads, I found the service friendly and it was the perfect way to start the day. Not many New York hotels offer breakfast, it's a real benefit.Staff are friendly, helpful and polite. We were able to check in an hour early, and they kept our bags for us on the day we checked out.Look, there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. If you want the lap of luxury - sure, there's much better hotels. But you will pay for them - and how!!! For the price, this is perfect, you will not go wrong.I scoured every review on here before I booked, and was naturally suspicious of all the praise being heaped on what was a very cheap hotel. There is no need to be. Everything people say is true, and you cannot go wrong with this place if you are budgeting!!!!Save $100 per night and spend it on shopping!!!!!!

I booked this hotel in July and watched the tripadvisor reviews constantly until we arrived. We stayed six nights, Feb 11-16th. This hotel was everything the reviews stated. Room was clean, spacious since we had a corner room. The view outside the window was not so exciting but who cares, we were seldom in our room. The bathroom was spacious for two and always clean towels, fresh soap, etc.Internet worked fine, no problems there. Television was great. The heat was somewhat warm but all you had to do was turn down the radiator.Desk staff were great. Rojo always had a smile and was willing to help. We never ate the continental breakfast, the tables were always full and we didn't want to wait around. So can't comment on that.Talk about close to Times Square, you couldn't ask for anything closer or more convenient.If we ever get the opportunity to go to NYC again, we'll stay at this hotel. We went into the Plaza Suite and didn't feel near as welcome as this hotel.Thanks tripadvisor!

Booked this hotel for our first trip to New York. Perfect location near Times Square and Subways. Clean rooms and plenty big... although we had a corner room which I read were bigger. Shower had great water pressure, and we never had problems with our heat, like other reviewers had mentioned. The free breakfast was great... bagels, doughnuts, apples, bananas, cereal, coffee, juice... I would definitely stay here again... You can't beat the price!

I am almost reluctant to write this review, as I don't want this hotel to become too busy to accomodate in the great fashion that they do. The room was a corner room, plenty large for 2 people and nicely updated. Of course there was street noise, but we requested a room facing the street. There was a very sufficient computer and printer for customer use, along with a nice little exercise room, if you have energy left after enjoying New York City. We were always up and gone duing breakfast time, so I can't comment on that. The staff was more than helpful, and the ride they arranged to the JFK was $45 for 2 people! We will definitely stay again!

Me and my daugther stayed here for four nights in February, and I must say this was a perfect choice. Not only for the location, but the hotel itself. I had read some nice reviews here on tripadvisor, so I expected it to be a good place to stay, but even so I was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the hotel is really clean and with nice furniture, colors, nicely decorated etc. Looks very fresh and I believe its renovated not so long ago. We had a corner room which is a bit larger than the others so we we're lucky. The TV was a big one and right in front of the beds. The room was on 7th floor and not facing the street, so the noice was a minimum and sleeping was excellent (nice firm beds too). The room was big enough and also the bathroom. Even in cold february the room was warm, and we just put the (noisy) a/c machine on for a few minutes every morning to get some fresh (New York...) air. The cleaningwomen and the man in the breakfast room were very friendly to us, some of the staff at the desk could be more helpful though (we had to complain a few times about the Internet not working and the reaction was barely visible...)Breakfast was great, with bagels, cereals, donuts and lots of fresh fruit. Free coffee whenever we wanted all day. All in all, I think this hotel gives great value for the money (which for us was 100 dollar per night plus taxes) with of course unbeatable location really close to Times Square. I really can recommend this hotel to anyone coming to New York. I have stayed in other hotels in New York but this was by far the best value for money.

the hotel, while small, gives an european air upon arrival. We got there at 10 a.m. and just expected to leave our luggage since check in time was not til 3pm. they gave us a room right away. the staff was so friendly. the room was small but clean. the bed and pillows were outstanding. we had to turn on the a/c the room was so warm but it also helped drown out any noise from below.the location was the best. right outside was times square. we forgot our cord for the high speed interntet access and they loaned up one.the breakfast was more than adequate.this hotel is a find in nyc.

Booked a room here based on Trip Advisor reviews, which proved to be quite accurate.The location is outstanding. You can't get any closer to all the great sights in NYC. The rooms are small, which is to be expected, but nicely furnished and extremely clean. I don't normally check for cleanliness if everything looks OK, but I lost the remote for the TV somewhere in the room, so I searched everywhere before finding it under the nightstand....the rooms are very, very clean.As previously posted, there is a sticker on the window saying not to open it. Well, I like fresh air, so I gave it a try, and it would fully open. I asked at the front desk about the sticker, and was told it is because pigeons tend to fly into the rooms with open windows, as there is no screening.About 99% of what has been written in other reviews is accurate...the breakfast, doors closing, etc. I will add that I was on the 7th floor, west side, which is right next to a church. For whatever reason, the church bells would go off during the day at strange times. Not as if it was an hourly event, but I could never understand why the bells were ringing....it was not a function of time. Perhaps church services or something, but never a problem.It is a 15 minute walk to the hotel from the airport express bus drop at Grand Central Station (the best way to get in from LGA or JFK). I would most definitely stay there again. Great price, great location, quality room, free wi-fi, free breakfast.

My first time at this hotel but it won't be the last. The satff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, comfortable and warm with a great bathroom fitted with a super shower. The noise insulation of the next room's plumbing could be improved and there was no view out of the window - but who goes to New York to sit in the hotel room and look at the view! There is only one lift which meant a short wait sometimes. The complimentary breakfast was first class and plenty of it. The hotel's location on 46th Street location couldn't be better - Times square and subway station at the end of the street, less than a minute's walk away. Restaurants aboud in the area. Value for money, this hotel can't be beaten and I'll certainly be using it again.

I booked in to this hotel because of its reviews on Trip Advisor.We (boyf+I) for 10 nights, 11 jan to 21st Jan. Rooms spotlessly clean. Serviced every day with fresh towels, bins emptied etc. We had a room at a corner and it was definately bigger than the room beside us which wasnt. so ask for room on a corner. Oh Location location Location!! time square is only 10 door steps away. subway on 42nd or 49th! Breakfast was also a bonus. It was cereal, juice, toast, bagel, donut and friut. as much as you like. Staff were helpful when needed. A little noisey out side but ..it is the city that never sleeps after all.I wouldn't hesitate in reccomending this hotel to others.

Stayed for 3 nights this week just past. They allowed us an early check-in and the attendent was extrememly pleasant...we even got a smile despite what some other reviewers have written! The room was okay...nothing spectacular, but then what should we have been expecting?! The heating was terrible! Absolutely terrible! We had to get an employee to bring in a space heater for us which helped but was an eyesore and nuisance for the feet given the size of the room. We were at the front on the 3rd floor and were warned that it would be noisy...we had no trouble sleeping at all.The breakfast consisted of some not so fresh bread (may as well have been a brick), donuts and powdery fruit. But hey, it was free! Go elsewhere for breakfast, it's worth the investment.The location was awesome. The hotel is a stones throw from Times Square, the half price ticket booth, subway and Broadway. We probably will invest in a higher grade hotel next time. But if you are on a budget, this is a pretty sizable bang for your buck.

Would highly recommend this hotel, stayed for 4 nights. We were lucky enough to get a corner room which was bigger than the others. Room was very comfortable, was like being in your own bedroom at home. Bathroom very clean also. Breakfast was more than adequate and we had no fault with any of the staff. But the thing that really sells this hotel is Location Location Location!!! Times Square it virtually on it's door step, with 5th Avenue and Rockerfeller Centre and Radio City a few blocks away. I would not recommend the TFI Fridays on the corner of Times Square but can highly recommend the Europa Cafe (at the door of the hotel, take a left and it's at the end of the street). It does great burritos and juices. The information centre in Times Square also sells reduced price theatre tickets if you don't want to queue at the TKTS booth.All in all can highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

The location is superb. The rooms are clean, and spacious for NYC standards. I went with a group of 10, and everybody had issues with the temperature control in the rooms. We had a VERY noise a/c unit, that woke us up several times during the night. Others couldn't cool their room enough, another couple could not get any fresh air. Our room on the 7th floor was quiet (except for the a/c); no noise from the street. The breakfast was terrific, with yogurt, bagels,cereal and good coffee.We would stay here again, with some Tylenol PM....

We spent seven nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown:Positives: Location (couple blocks from Times Square), clean, nice bathroom, continental breakfast included, excellent value for the price (AAA discount 89 + tax). One computer available for free internet usage on main floor.Negatives: our room’s view was a wall and you couldn’t open the window (there was a sticker on the window that said: “please don’t open the window, if you need assistance call the front desk”).The idea of lack of fresh air was unpleasant. The front desk staff may need a little training in how to smile, a very good exception was the man who helped at the breakfast, always polite and kind. We will definitely return to this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel from January 5 to January 10, 2005. Overall, we found it to be a good place to stay in midtown Manhattan. Its major benefits were: a great location (only half a block from 7th Avenue and Times Square on one side and just three blocks from Rockefeller Center on the other), very clean rooms and bathrooms, an excellent price (we paid $80.99 a night before the myriad of taxes were added) and a good, free continental breakfast (including, cold cereals, bagels, toast, yogourt, donuts, coffee, milk and juice). The breakfast alone could easily cost you $10.00 each in a local eatery. (Try to get the breakfast table by the window to watch the action across the street on W. 46th St., including the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School and people coming and going from The Muse Hotel, where they are paying two or three times the amount you are. It makes the breakfast taste that much better.) There is only one elevator in this nine-floor building, which can be slow. But, if you are on one of the lower floors, the stairs are easy to navigate. Our only complaints related to: noise (surprisingly, from inside the hotel, not from the outside action - the rooms are not very well soundproofed and the room doors bang very loudly, especially at 2 a.m. when the nightclubbers return) and the layout of our room (as it was small, the television was against a side wall, resulting in a literal pain in the neck). Is this a five-star hotel? No. Did we find it to be excellent value in a city where you likely won't spend much time in your room? A definite yes. (If only they could fix those slamming doors!)

Chose this hotel because of great reviews on Tripadvisor. Location of hotel is excellent, just round the corner from Times Square. The quality of accommodation was below average and extremely overpriced for the sub-standard rooms and amenities offered.Was kept awake for 3 nights by a constant noise from the hot water tank which seemed to be shared by everyone on my floor and produced a loud gurgling noise whenever anyone in another room turned on their water supply.Also, it was advertised that there were tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms - my room had an antiquated coffee machine located in the bathroom!.Breakfast was awful and reminded me of a staff canteen with hotel staff watching my every move to check that I didn't take more than my fair share of the food. After trying this for one day, we opted to eat breakfast outside.I feel that this hotel has had over generous reviews on trip advisor and was distinctly average.

My husband and I stayed here from Dec 27- Jan 3. Our first room was room # 702 which was very small. We did not stay on New Years eve and returned to room # 704 which was much bigger. Room 702 was very small and the window did not shut. We also could not figure out how to turn on the heat. One of the desk guys came up and helped us. He put a towel in the window. Room 704 was larger but more noisy because it was in the front of the hotel. 702 - the bathroom only had a shower stall and was cleaner than 704 which had a tub. It had a little mold here and there. Nothing shower sandals did not solve. On the 1st, my husband got into a fight with the guy at the front desk about us checking in early. One thing I can say, New Yorkers don't fold easy. He held his ground and they got into a shouting match. How is that for customer service? At any rate my husband was ------ and wanted to stay someplace else but we would have been charged. Plus, the guy had already promised us a larger room. So we stayed.Basicially, we discovered that New Yorkers are a tough bunch of folks. They always seem to be scaming someone or making sure they do not get scammed. Service sucked at most of the restaurants we when to. Most of the time we were treated like they were doing us a favor to serve us. Not much communication. If you can make it there, you'll make it anywhere is true

We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from Nov.28-Dec.2nd and were very satisfied overall. The location is AMAZING, it is very quiet in the hotel even though it is so close to the action. The breakfast was perfect for a quick start to our day. The rooms were small (max 2 people/room), but the bathroom was a nice size and was renovated nicely. Besides, if you are in NYC, you will not be spending much time in the room besides sleeping and showering. The elevator is slow but not such a big deal, an extra few minutes was nothing for the value being given by the hotel.

After reading some of the previous reviews on here and seeing the downloadable brochure picture we were a little worried about what to expect when we got there. First of all, may I just say that the brochure picture doesn't do this hotel justice. The hotel was very clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were adequate in size considering this is New York. And it was in an ideal spot for us as it was in walking distance of Macy's and there were plenty of diners/pubs in walking distance as we fancied more of a fried breakfast as opposed to the free continental breakfast provided. Also nearby to Macy's is a multi-screen cinema called Loews screening all the big named films so we weren't short on things to do at night. As I say, we had an absolutely brilliant stay in NYC and we are hoping to go back again around the same time this year as there is so much more we wanted to see AND we'll be staying here again.

The narrow entrance to the hotel fools you but the room, though small, had plenty of room to get around the bed without tripping over anything. All we wanted was a clean place to sleep at night. The bathroom was a good size with a warm tile floor. Very nice. Looking out the window gave a view of two very close buildings but it kept light from coming in and that gave for a good rest. A good cup of coffee or hot tea and a bagel or cereal gave you a good start to the day. We'd stay there again.

This hotel provided more than we expected. The room was about 10 by 15, plenty large enough for sleeping, and was very clean. The shower was great--very hot water, great pressure. The continental breakfast had fresh donuts, bagels, and rolls, with real butter available, as well as cereals, fruit, juice, yogut, and coffee. The breakfast room has only about 8 tables and might get crowded if the hotel is very full--at least it was crowded on our last day. They ask you not to bring food back to your room--a good idea considering the challenge of keeping some creatures out of a Manhattan building. Do not expect great views: only 9 stories high and in the middle of long block, you'll not see much. Most room windows are on the side of the building. But with the money you save you can go to one of the reataurants in a fancier hotel. There was no noise from other rooms and very little from the street. There is even a small exercise room with 3 machines. Parking, at only $20 a night, was a few doors down; again, a very good price for midtown Manhattan. Room temperature was good, although the outside temperature varied from 60 to 25. There is a window air conditioner, if that would bother you in the summer.

Positives: Location (couple blocks from Times Square), clean, nice bathroom, good lighting, continental breakfast included, excellent value for the price ($135 + $20 tax for 2 queen beds)Negatives: Small room, antiquated hot water heat (have to open the enclosure and turn the knob, no thermostat). It was very cold outside (5 degrees F), and it was cold in the room. There's a window A/C unit, and the cold air blew in thru the vents. The bellhop showed us his trick of stuffing the drapes around the window to block off the A/C vents.

Stayed here for a conference instead of at the expensive conference hotel. Room was smallish, but very clean and well-appointed. I found the staff to be very helpful and responsive. The water pressure in my shower the first morning wasn't very good -- I let them know and by the next morning, it was fixed and strong. Breakfast was more hardy than the normal continental fare. Highly recommend this for people on a budget.

My wife and I stayed here for one night in December. We had stayed at the Park Savoy (read my review) the four previous nights, but switched hotels for the last night (pre-planned, not because we were disappointed). Compaired to the PS, our room was immaculate and gigantic. I'm exaggerating, but the room was a decent size and the bathroom looked as if it was remodeled recently. Our only complaints were: the room was rathner warm and you cannot open the windows. We had the air conditioner on all night, but it wasn't very cool and the room stayed very warm. Our view consisted of a brick wall and other windows with air conditioners, but at least it was quiet. Finally, there is only one elevator and it was TINY. Overall, the Comfort Inn Midtown is in a great location (2 blocks from Times Square), the staff was very friendly, and the room was clean and you were able to actually move around. AAA rate after taxes was $165, which is pretty reasonable for the location. This is a great place if you are looking for a place to sleep, change and shower, not if you're looking to be pampered. I would probably look at trying a different hotel if I came back to NYC, but would definately stay here if I couldn't find something else that interested me.

We were looking for a place to stay that is safe, clean and conveniet. That is exactly what we got. I do not have a single complaint about my stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bargain near Times Square.

Well, first let me say that we knew we'd get what we paid for as far as room size. It was extremely small, but at least it was clean. We usually stay at nice hotels but were trying to save money this time. We have learned our lesson though and will always pay more for a quality stay.Don't even think about making a complaint to the manager. Our air conditioner froze over and we had a miserable night's sleep and not only did not care or offer compensation - she made US feel stupid in front of a lobby full of people for not knowing how to "properly use a window unit." She was incredibly rude and we are currently going to the higher-ups to get this resolved.I'd pay more to stay somewhere where people actually care about their customers.

We found this hotel brilliant although the front desk staff may need a little training in how to smile....but hey, that is just a little niggle! We had a room away from the street and we found this great - it was very quiet and the room was big enough and very clean. We stayed 3 nights and our room was serviced to a good standard every day. The complimentary brekkie was a bonus as well - quite basic (cereal, fruit, donuts, bagels) but sufficient. The location is superb!! Literally around the corner from Times Square. I would stay here again and would recommend it to my friends.

We have just returned from our first trip to New York. We picked this hotel through Tripadvisor and were very pleased with it. The location was perfect The staff couldn't have been more helpful. When we first arrived the room we were offered was very hot so we asked to be moved which they did with no problems at all. The room was comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was good. We felt safe leaving our bags on the last day as a member of staff checked them in and out and they were happy for us to leave them until late afternoon. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

It was a perfect hotel for what we needed it for. The rooms were small, but who spends a lot of time in their room when NYC is right outside?? The rooms were very clean, the bathroom was very clean as well, small, but cute. No complaints there. As far as the location, it could not be more perfect. Walk a 1/2 block and you are in Times Square, and can easily catch a taxi to go uptown or downtown. The staff was very friendly, eager to help in any way. The continental breakfast was a nice suprise, being that it was a small, inexpensive hotel. The price of the room was reasonable, even on a holiday weekend. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family - it is a nice, basic hotel in a good location for a decent price. I plan on staying there again!

First visit in NY, stayed there for 4 nights with my fiancee in sept 2004. The hotel is clean, rooms are nice enough and the staff is very helpfull. The Location is simply ideal and prices are moderate.Would definitively go there again!

Stayed here for three nights last month. Fantastic location, in a quiet street considering that its about 200 yards from Times Square. Clean, spacious rooms. Friendly, helpful staff and a great continental breakfast included.Within walking distance to heaps of major attractions. I highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy.

I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for twelve nights in October. The hotel is pleasant enough, in a perfect location, but I found my front-facing room looking on to 46th Street extremely noisy. At all hours of the day and night, garbage trucks would pull up a few doors down the street and stand there for up to an hour, grinding refuse. Fortunately I'd brought ear plugs, which came in very handy when I was regularly woken at 3 or 4 in the morning. There was also a permanent roaring, whooshing sound coming from outside - possibly from a big airconditioning unit on a building opposite. On the plus side, the room was spacious, and definitely nicer than the quieter but smaller and stuffier rooms at the back of the hotel, which look directly on to a brick wall, so I decided to rather put up with the noise.The breakfast that was included in the price was also a plus, as was the unlimited internet access available in the little computer room off the lobby. I also enjoyed having a coffee-maker and hairdryer in the room.However, on my next visit to NYC, I'll probably go back to the Portland Square Hotel where I've always stayed before. It's round the corner on 47th Street, so the location is just as perfect, and the price is far less - $105 for a standard double ensuite, compared with $162 at the Comfort Inn. I've always asked for a street-facing room there and have never had a probem with noise, and at least you can open the windows and get a breath of fresh air, which you can't do at the Comfort Inn. The rooms might be a bit more worn-looking, but are spotlessly clean with towels and linen being changed daily, and the bathroom pristine, with all the usual toiletries provided. There is also air-conditioning, cable TV and an in-room safe - very handy. No, breakfast is not included, but one can get a cheap, delicious breakfast at the Evergreen Diner right across the street, so that's not a problem. There is also no in-room coffee-maker, but I always carry my own little immersion heater, so once again, not a problem. All in all, I have yet to discover a better deal in New York City, than the Portland Square Hotel, for value for money

Trip Advisor is the best! I started making plans in June for my daughter and I to visit the Macy's parade. I wasn't sure what to expect, but Trip Advisor was right on the money with everything I checked out. Comfort Inn Midtown was great - not too high priced, the people there were so nice and helpful. The rooms are a little small - but who spends much time in the room when you're in New York? The motel is within walking distance toalmost everything! We only walked ONE block to the parade at Times Square. Rockefeller Center, theater district, Macy's, Empire State building are all close too. We had a great time and hope to do it again some day!

What can i say? We booked this hotel because off the reviews on here, and we certainly were not disappointed. We had one off the front facing rooms on the top floor 9th, the room was really big,so ask for a tront facing room if possible. VERY CLEAN maid cleaned every day, new towels every day. Staff really helpful with advising us about the area. Really decent price considering you are 20 yards from times square. Breakfast included but we normally went to Evergreen 47th st. Would definetly use again 5 *******

Can't say enough about this hotel. The entrance might not be as grand as some of the other hotels but the cost more than makes up for it. We found the hotel to be clean, quiet and quite roomy (compared to Chicago hotels which I am used to staying at.) It is really at the center of everything and within easy walking distance to several subway stations and of course Times Square. I would highly recommend it to anyone, we will stay there again!

Nice little hotel, very close to Time Square! I became a Choice priveleges member right before we left and they allowed us a 2pm checkout and also checked us in right when we arrived, about an hour early. Staff was pleasant, rooms were small but clean. Good free breakfast, but a deli down the street offered a bit more at a reasonable cost. I stayed at the Ameritania a few years ago...and this was soooo much better and more reasonable. I would stay here again

Although the room was small, it was spotlessly clean. The bathroom appeared to be recently renovated with a shower, no bath, but in excellent condition. Staff were friendly and helpful. And all this a half a block from Times Square, within easy walking distance of all the theatres, Fifth Avenue shops, and excellent restaurants. Would definitely make this my hotel of choice for a week-end getaway.

My husband and I have just returned from 3 nights in the Comfort Inn and if we are ever booking a hotel in Manhattan again this will be the place.1. Excellent location - Just two minutes to the TKTS booth. Get there early Thursday to Sunday - LONG lines even at 2.20. Monday to Wedensday lines are short and better choice of shows. We saw The Producers on one night but being Irish it wasn't really our cup of tea - different humour! Lots of people said they enjoyed it and it has great reviews so maybe it's just us. Went to see Slava's Snow Show on our last night - absolutely brilliant! It's really different and if anyone has seen any of the Cirque du Soliel productions, this show is all about the 'clowns' in those shows. It's a real 'feel good show' and I was smiling for hours afterwards. GO SEE IT. It's off braodway (14th and Broadway Union Sq.) and is every bit as good if not better than some of the Broadway shows. Try to get tickets which are on the ground floor and not under the mezanine (you'll see why when you go!!!)- Subway just a couple of blocks away. Two stops to Macy's (came in EXTREMELY handy) and Toys R us etc. USE THE SUBWAY and buy a day travel ticket for $7 (compared to $2/ride). 2. Great breakfast.- No need to waste time looking for somewhere to eat early in the morning. It DOES get a bit busy just before 9am but it isn't a problem. We always got seats and the guy setting it up is VERY helpful. However, if you do feel like a fry-up or a big breakfast there is a great place on 47th st (It's called Evergreen or something like that). Also GREAT Indian place - Bombay something on 49th st.3. Clean roomsOK there a bit small but who cares. There not cramped or anything and I have stayed in smaller. If anything it made us keep everything tidy and theres a closet which has shelves where you can put all your purchases. Room was really hot but there is air- conditioning (just turn it to 10 for maximum NOT 1). The fan does make a little noise but it's nothing to really worry about.YES towels are fairly thin and small but they are fine.4. Other.We didn't ask for a corner room and maybe if we had the room might have been a bit bigger with a view (we were looking at a brick wall). The bonus of the brick wall - no noise! We got to check in at 10.30am with no problems even though official check in isnt until 3pm.They also stored our bags until 8pm no problem.STAY HERE !

We stayed five nights here early November. Excellent location, wonderful staff and pleasant room. Two women on a shopping trip, we felt perfectly safe here and in the streets around the hotel, we really experienced the best of New York from this accommodation. Even a mishap with our luggage failed to spoil our stay.This will be our first choice for any future stay.

We spent 4 nights at this hotel in October and really enjoyed our stay. The staff are friendly and helpful and the location of the Hotel is perfect, only half a block from Times Square.We were staying in one of the larger corner rooms (802) and it was a good size. Our room was spotlessly clean. The free continental breakfast was great too, with a good choice of food, not just the usual danish pastries! There was fruit, toast, cereal, bagels, yoghurt, doughnuts and cakes. It can get busy if you are not there early, but we never had a problem getting a seat.We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. A good value hotel for the price in a great location.

I am a frequent visitor to New York City, and I always stay in midtown Manhattan. I must say that the bulk of these reviews is somewhat surprising ... they're bordering on the gushing, which I find rather surprising for a hotel that offers rooms that are rather worn (at least mine was) and somewhat, um, dingy. I found the bathroom in particular to be sub-par. Maybe if you book at a special low rate (like I did), you will get one of the "inferior" rooms. Other than the price and the location, there is nothing particularly special about this hotel. If you are on a tight budget, I would recommend this place. But I find the Red Roof Inn on West 32nd St to be far superior for about the same price. P.S. I remember staying at the other Comfort Inn (Manhattan) on West 35th Street during the month of February -- there was no heat in my room as well as in others. And this hotel won a gold ribbon award -- can you believe it? Pack your sweaters!

WOW! Was I ever surprised. Booking this hotel for a group of 7+1 infant & I was worried about it's location & cleanliness. The reviews on Trip Advisor were right on. The hotel was 1/2 block from Times Square and so clean! The rooms are small, but when you are in NYC you are not hanging out in your room as the city is so fabulous. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, allowing us to check our baggage & have something to eat prior to checking in. (It was early in the morning) Great coffee, bagels, yogurt... (all included in the price of the room.) I will definately be staying here on my future trips to NYC.

this is my second review and second stay. The last room I had was very big and faced the street. This time I booked last minute and got a fairly small room. Still amenities were there, bathroom was in excellent condition. Very clean and friendly staff. I like this place because they hold your bags after check-out. Breakfast has the essentials but if you walk to 42nd street, there are tons of breakfast places that offer a greater variety. Overall, the best place to stay. I will definitely stay here again.

stayed in one room with my husband and 3 children(1,2,6). it couldn't have been better. very clean rooms, really friendly staff (especially Anthony in the Breakfast Room- such a nice man), fantastic location.we usually stay in upmarket places but this hotel is much better value and has everything you need. we will definitely stay here on our next trip. trust me, and i am very fussy, this is a wonderful hotel

Would not recommend as the chain of hotels does not have a set policy on cancellations. It varies with the hotel and reservations person. It was impossible to cancel the hotel when not able to travel. When you call hotel they transfer you to another group who handles reservations which is independent from Comfort Inn and Choice (Kapil Care Hotels???) who said absolutely no refund under any circumstance. We called Choice Hotels again for help as we were not able to travel. They (we spoke to two different people) said they called the hotel (or Kapil_ and had no success, then when questioned they said they have a list of hotels which have no refund ever policies (okay, so why not just state that and not pretend to call the hotel to help???). Choice would not let us know how to tell which Choice Hotels did not allow cancellations. They said that is a list only they have so only they know which hotels never give refunds. Nice policy. Note, the airline gave a voucher for future travel with no fee.

This is a very good hotel, located centrally in Manhattan. The perfect starting point to discover Manhattan. Very cheap for what you get.Whenever we are back in NYC, we will definitely stat at this hotel.

Stayed here sat 9th Oct thru to tues 12th Oct. As others mentioned towels a bit small/thin but otherwise fine. location excellent for Times sq. and transport ( subway etc). Breakfast adequate and included in room rate. No in room safe but deposit boxes at reception (chargeable . Room tidy and clean, for NY a reasonable size. Bit noisy facing street - but then its the Big apple ! Excellent Deli in next street ( 115 W 45th about same position as Comfort Inn but in next street ) called Cranberry Deli . Self selection hot / cold meals and salads ( breakfast / lunch / dinner) , loads of fresh fruit , drinks etc. Upstairs dining as well as take out . Fantastic place .

We sent an overnight in this midtown Manhattan spot--for NYC it was a great value (especially if one used AAA or AARP discounts)--our room was $125.99 including a pretty good continental breakfast of juice, cereal, bagels, doughnuts, yogurt, etc.The location is great, on 46th St.,between 6 and 7th Aves., about a block from the Times Square area.The hotel has an inviting small lobby area and the rooms, while somewhat small, but adequate, were nicely furnished with new paint, wallpaper, etc.The staff goes out of its way to be helpful--you can check luggage if you arrive early or if you check out and leave later.Towels are somewhat thin, but overall this is a great place to stay in NYC. Do not miss it!!

This hotel is in a great, safe location. Staff is friendly. Rooms are a bit small (even by NY standards) but they are clean and have nice bathrooms. The price is excellent given the central location. I would definitely stay here again.

The Comfort Inn Midtown was a great place. Although the room was small, it had everything we needed. The Continental breakfast was great too. The staff was quite friendly and the hotel was clean. Well worth the money. The high speed wireless internet sucked though. Did not function properly.

This 79 room hotel provides excellent value. Very clean & secure. Rooms have TV & coffee maker. The complimentary breakfast, available 7 till 10 was a bonus. Ideal for a short visit as its close to Times Sq. for bus & subway.

Truly the best bargain in NYC at present. We've stayed in several 3-4 star hotels in the upper $200+ range, and this hotel, for under $200 is clean, comfortable and in a terrific location! "The Muse" is right across the street and is $250 a nite! While they may have thicker towels, and plusher carpet, their rooms are no bigger.Re: other concerns: the people we met in the hotel were really nice, the staff friendly, efficient and courteous, the elevator, although only one, came quickly, and the shower had great water pressure.The ac had a timer setting, and the tv had cable. Other things like a coffee maker, ice bucket, etc., were all stock amenities in the room. The ONLY downside was the not-so-thick towels, but I could live with that!Also, parking down the street that the Comfort Inn recommends and stamps for, is a bargain in NYC.Don't forget to ask for your AAA discount!

I read about the Comfort Inn Midtown on the Trip Advisor web site. It had received excellent reviews.We were not disappointed. It reminded me of anEnglish Bed and Breakfast Inn. The rooms were spotless, staff friendly and helpful, complimentary breadfast was all one could eat, the room was quiet, location of hotel near Times Square is perfect for theatre goers. The only noise we heard was the morning chiming of church bells next door.The room rate is reasonable. Also appreciated the in-room coffe-maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. The other guests were congenial.Yes, I will stay there on my next trip to New York City.

I had checked and double checked all the tripadvisor comments and took the chance on this hotel. I had never stayed in a hotel in NYC before so I was not sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms were small in comparison to what I have been used to in Chicago or Dallas, etc. but, that is what I had heard would be the case. I was very pleased with the cleanliness. My sheets were as white as snow and crisp. The bathroom was spotless. Oh, and our showerhead broke and was fixed immediately, the staff was very helpful with this glitch. This hotel is close to all the sights. We walked to The Empire State Blg., the shows, NBC, Fox and Friends, Rockafeller Center, Stores, St. Patrick's Cathederal. The breakfast offered from this hotel was a bonus each morning. Yes, the elevator is slow...and there is only one but if you are up for the stairs, they are clean and safe. I was with my 13 year old daughter and the room was sufficent in size for us (1 Q bed) but would not be for someone traveling with a family. I am not sure if they have larger accomodations in the hotel but what we had would not work for a family. Only two people would be comfortable in this size room. I would also suggest to any sight-seers to spend the money for the Hop on Hop Off Grayline New York Sight Seeing Double Decker Bus tours. We spent $72 for The Essential New York which gets you in to The Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, The Seaport Museum (where the Concord is on display), Ticket to the United Nations, and a night tour of Brooklyn via a safe bus ride. This was the best decision I have made. We went to the front of the line for all sites and we were able to SEE everything from a great vantage point on top of the double decker bus. The tour guides are very knowledgeable about NY from the Revolutionary War time to present. Jumping off when you want to visit Battery Park or grab a slice of pizza pie was wonderful. Another bus picks you up from the same dropoff point in twenty minutes to go somewhere else!I would stay at Midtown Comfort Inn again if I visited NY, the price was more than reasonable, the rooms were very, very clean, breakfast was great and we were in the heart of everything that makes NYC, New York! The Irish Pub next door was a fabulous establishment too, fabulous food and great Irish Cider!

We spent 5 nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Very clean rooms and public areas. Helpful, courteous staff, great rates and location. Nice complementary breakfast. Have been to NYC several times and I have never been more satisfied with a hotel.

Clean, spacious rooms with a helpful staff. I didn't expect much for under $100, but this place was perfect for a quick trip to the city when all we would do at the hotel was sleep. It's not fancy with lots of frills -- but is all that you need and in the heart of Midtown.

We stayed on the Comfort Inn (3 – 9 Aug) on recommendations found on this and other review sites. It was a good hotel at a reasonable price, but as we came from the UK we didn't qualify for any discounts. The check-in was quick and staff were generally friendly and helpful. On check-in we asked for a quiet room and were told that if we wanted a quiet room it would be small. It certainly was small, but as we were only 2 it was bearable. And it was quiet as long as you didn’t switch on the air conditioning. I thought I might get used to it, but after 3 nights I still couldn’t sleep well because of the noise. Luckily it wasn’t too hot after that, so we just left it switched off at night. Otherwise the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was not much of a view, but I wasn’t expecting any at this price. Bathroom was also small and clean. There was no safe in the room, but you can use one at reception at no extra cost. The lift was not fast, but I’d seen slower. I didn’t find it a big problem and we were staying on the 9th floor. The breakfast was o.k. (bagels, toast, donuts), but it was always busy in the tiny breakfast room. So you couldn’t relax, we just ate quickly and got out. Location was great, if you want to stay near Times Square. It was also close to several subway stations, so getting around was no problem. Most restaurants in this area are overpriced and not very good. However, we liked Via Brasil and especially Trattoria Trecolori where we had one of the best Italian meals ever. I recommend this hotel to first time visitors to New York. However, the crowds of tourists in that area got on my nerves a bit after a few days, so I probably would stay in a different neighbourhood next time.

I stayed here for several weekdays in June, 2004. I was very satisfied with the size of the room, cleanliness, and the friendliness of the staff. It has a wonderful location, close to Times Square, the diamond district and Broadway venues - but far enough not to get a lot of the noise. From my room, I didn't hear any bells ringing from the church next door. The only "problem" is that it has one slow elevator. If you have difficulty walking and you are impatient, this may not be the right hotel for you. I would gladly return here on a future trip to NYC.

I did so much research before booking this hotel. I stayed for a weekend in June and I had a great time. It's located a half block away from Times Square. The subway station is 2 or 3 blocks away. The room was clean and big. Get a room in a corner because the corner rooms are bigger. I really loved it and it was great for the price. I would definitely stay here again!

Great location, just steps from theaters, restaurants and the subway. Very helpful staff, they found a place to park my full size truck that didn't require refinancing to pay for. Hotel is clean, modern, and while the room sizes were moderate, they weren't cramped by any definition. No problems with the elevator either. I've paid more for less in cities other than NY. I would stay here again without question.

Our first trip ever to NYC - 10 wonderful days! Just a warning though - yes, the Comfort Inn is all of those things you're reading in the 5 star reviews. It's has a great location, good staff, nice breakfast, and is a great economy choice for a vacation.The only warning is the beds - at least ours - are cheap and hard. They have to cut corners somewhere, right? Sheets are not cotton, some sort of slick feeling, thin, polyester I'd guess. And the bed? Practice with a couple of nights on your garage floor and you'll do fine.

Just got back from a 4 night stay. Excellent Staff, excellent location. Small rooms and a bit of trouble with the plumbing, but no big deal. Much better than the rooms we had in Venice and Rome. Would definitely stay here again! Very good continental breakfast, comfortable beds, location can't be beat, affordable, clean, GREAT value.Attitude is everything. If you are looking for master bedroom sized rooms, the Marriott Marquis is just 5 minutes away, but will cost you a bunch more.What makes this hotel special is the Staff. They will take care of you. We found the rooms comfortable, the a/c worked great. I'm recommending this property to everyone I know who is going to NY on vacation.

Just back from 2 nights at this hotel. The location is excellent, just steps away from Times Square and everything else mentioned here.Parking is just 5 doors down at a rate of $20. per 24 hours with validation. Front desk staff very helpful and pleasant (Jiovanni) and bellman (Sidibi) treated us like we were at the Plaza Hotel, very friendly and courteous.Bathroom is very spacious and found it and the bedroom to be very clean and well maintained.Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking simply for location and a clean safe place to stay while visiting the city.

My mom and I traveled to New York for the first time and found the Comfort Inn to be perfect for us. The previous reviews of this hotel helped me in making my decision to stay here, so I was extremely pleased to learn that all the reviews were right on. If you are looking for a great view and lots of extra services, skip this hotel. However, if you are like my mom and I and plan to spend very little time in your room and more time exploring NY this is the perfect spot. Hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building and Central Park. Rooms are quiet and comfortable and the bathroom is spacious. The breakfast is a nice bonus and saved us the hassle of trying to find a place to eat every morning. My mom and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Great hotel at a great location. The staff and service was excellent and the continental breakfast adequate. We asked for a quite room and recieved one (albeit a bit small). But, in short walking distance to most theatres and the TKTS booth. For the money I think it was a great value (non-smoking as well).

My wife and I stayed five nights here in last week of June, paying $125/night (U.S.) with AAA discount. The hotel is very small and has few amenities but its location more than makes up for it. It's a perfect launching pad for exploring the city, especially if you’re up for walking and taking buses and trains. It’s a 2-minute walk from Times square, a 10-minute walk from Rockefeller Center and about the same to the 42nd Street subway. (By the way, be prepared for a variety of added NYC taxes on your final hotel bill!)I was on my guard regarding what the hotel would be like, after reading all the various reviews of NYC hotels. But it’s all about expectations. Expect less and you’ll be satisfied with less. Check-in was fine. Hotel lobby was quite nice. Asked about a bigger room at the back and was given 606. Smallish elevator and only one. Room was smaller than most hotels we’ve stayed in North America, but was larger than the discount rooms we had in Rome and Venice. Bathroom was very small, shower quite small, and very limited counter space at sink. View? Brick walls, pigeons, air conditioners and an alley. (Only rooms on floors 7-9 get an actual view of any kind.) Room included TV, nice firm queen bed, desk, side table, small closet with some hangers, iron, ironing board, and bathroom hair dryer. There were a couple of cigarette burns on the bedspread/blanket. Air conditioner worked great for us with temps around 28C every day. No bugs, room was cleaned every morning, room service supplied extra towels when we asked. Room was very quiet at night.One computer available for free internet usage on main floor. Supposedly Wi-Fi was available in room as well as the high-speed line, but I wasn’t able to make it work for my older Mac laptop and the staff weren't able to help. Ice is only available in basement, the biggest inconvenience we faced (which really wasn’t a huge deal).Staff were relatively helpful. If you want to be pampered, this is not the hotel for you. They will help take care of you but they generally make guests feel independent. That part of it made me think of a hostel. The bellmen weren't highly enthusiastic but did their job.Simple but very sufficient free breakfast included bagels, donuts, toast, buns, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, juice.Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it for budget-conscious couples who will spend most of their day away from the hotel.

Just came back from a 3-nite stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Completely satisfied! Hotel is clean, quiet. Staff attentive and responsive (got a bathroom problem fixed in 10 minutes after the call). Excellent location to explore Manhattan.

My wife and I went to the Comfort Inn for the last half of our honeymoon. We loved the staff. The gentleman who helped with the continental breakfast was very friendly, and even asked my wife where I was on the 2nd morning of our stay. The front desk was extremely helpful, giving us the lowdown on the city and restaurant choices in the area. Only a block from the middle of Times Square, but on a quieter street so it wasn't in the middle of everything, an excellent location! The business center and workout facilities were a nice touch for the room as well. We got the best rate by going straight to Comfort Inn's website. Parking was across the street. We kept our vehicle there for 72 hours, and it only cost a total of $60 with a hotel stamp. The room was small, but clean. And the bathroom was a great size compared to the size of the room. I would recommend anyone to stay there. May not be the fanciest, but it sure was friendly!

I stayed here for 5 nights in May. The room was small but clean and fairly comfortable. We were concerned that it would be a bit noisy with a location so close to Times Square, but we never heard a thing except for the next rooms plumbing (who has a shower at 4-30 in the morning, every day?).The location could hardly have been better, so close to Times Square and with great links to the rest of Manhattan.The only thing I would do differently next time is go for room only rather then bed and breakfast because the breakfasts were really not worth having.
Visited in July 2004, Location excellent, rooms clean, staff extremely attentive, hotel quiet. What else do you need? Will stay here again on next visit.

I resided at this property a few weeks ago. for two days. I wanted a room close to Times Square that was reasonably priced and clean. I booked through the hotel website and found a rate of $125.00. This is the max I would have wanted to pay for this room. The room is very small (as most New York hotel rooms are) and very basic. Nothing fancy about the rooms at all. The location was excellent. Couldn't have been any better. Had a small issue with the toilet not being as clean as it should have been which pretty much ruined the confidence I had in the hotel. The disgusting picture never left my mind throughout the whole trip. I do understand that the housekeeping staff can not be PERFECT and I don't expect them to be BUT...........The staff are absolutely wonderful. Front desk and door people tried to be very helpful. Previously I stayed at the Super 8 which I later found out that this hotel is part of the same ACCOR hotel group. I met nice people here and would I stay again???? I'm not quite sure. I think I would say no UNLESS the rate is very low. There is no view as might be expected. I would say that the best part of the the Comfort Inn Midtown is the staff and the what needs improvement is the quality of the furniture, bedding, carpet etc. It would seem to me that because the rooms are small it would be not as expensive to furnish the rooms with some quality items. I think that people would not mind "small" if it was small but classy and decorated with a somewhat quality items. It would give the place a whole different air of quality which regrettfully it does not have. I'll mention housekeeping may need a little improvement but my toilet situation may have been an isolated thing. Hey, I'm not perfect on my job either but constructive criticism does not hurt.Please do NOT let me discourage you from trying this property.
