It's probably fine for some but I'm telling the experience I had. All in all...two days was enough for me. I was ready to leave. Was it awful - "NO". Could it use improvement..."YES"

Have just returned from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown and found the hotel to be clean,comfortable and the staff helpful in every way. While the room was small it was clean and met our needs for two people. Everyone on the staff was friendly and the hotel is in an excellent location to Times Square, Theatres and Shopping. It is in walking distance to Rockefeller Center,NBC studios and David Letterman. Price is reasonable for Manhattan and we would stay there again in a heartbeat!

We stayed here over the Fourth of July weekend and it was wonderful! The location is absolutely perfect if you want to spend time wandering Times Square & doing the Broadway circuit! The rooms were much bigger than I expected, plenty of room for my husband & I and two large suitcases! The bathroom for roomy enough for two people at the same time and was very clean! We made a couple of requests to the staff and they responded quickly & politely! Kenneth & "The Breakfast Gentleman" were wonderful & amazing employees! The free continential breakfast was very appealing (donuts, bagels, toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, beverages). The other reviews are correct in that the elevator is slow, but it never was an inconvience. I am very picky when it comes to hotel cleanliness and it was perfect! The air conditioner was great & the bed was comfy! I would stay here again!

I spent six nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown and guess what - it lived up to the positive reviews! The hotel was clean and well maintained. The bathroom was great - white tile and marble floors and pretty big. The room, while small, was well lit and the matress was comfortable - important points for me. The only minus was the view from the window, a narrow airshaft , but at least you can draw the blinds. I would definitely stay here again.

This was our first trip to the Big Apple. I read all the reviews on this hotel and thanks to you guys, we were very well pleased. The room was small but very neat and clean. The bathroom was a good size and the internet was a plus. The bed was comfty and I asked for extra pillows and the maid brought them right away. There was plenty of room for all the shopping bags in a large closet. The breakfast spread was impressive and more than enough to get us going in the mornings. Everyone working in the hotel was extremely nice and helpful. They gave good directions and cashed travelers cheques for me. The location was wonderful. Close to everything including the subway. I felt safe at all times and we were out at all hours. We paid $125 a night. We will definetely return to this hotel.

To add my thoughts to the many others on this little hotel...this was a marvelous find for me the first time I visited NYC in July 2001 with courteous staff, excellent location and rooms that were clean. Yes, they are small, but I don't come to NYC planning to spend much time in the hotel. The continental breakfast is a nice included bonus. I have stayed there on almost every trip since and have never been disappointed. As a female who travels solo to the city from time to time, I can definitely say that I always felt very safe with the location of the hotel.

This little hotel is awesome! It was under $110 a night with a continental breakfast included. How could you beat that along with $20 parking for 24 hours and only one safe block away from Times Square. We will definately be back!

It stayed there at the end of may and it was great. Paid 120 Dollar per night and excepted not too much but was impressed. Rooms are clean and big enough, towels are changed every day, TV, Phone, Coffeemaker, Iron - all in the room. Great Hotel to stay, great location, just around the corner of Times Square!!! STAY THERE!

I would highly recommend the Comfort Inn Midtown. One block to Times Square, with clean and comfortable rooms (the entire hotel is smoke-free). Friendly and accommodating staff. Superb continental breakfast. All this for less than $170 a night for two guests! I will definitely stay here during my next visit to NYC!

The reviews on this page were helpful in making the decision to stay at this hotel. We booked online through Comfort Inn's web page and got a AAA discount at a great rate from midweek (June3-5).The rooms were tiny, although clean and quiet. The location made up for the small room. Being so close to Times Square and the subway were an added bonus.I would definately recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and want a room close to the action and in a safe location.

Great place to stay. Times Square right down the block, great if you've been walking all day. You're not overwhelmed with people, traffic, & noise as you are in the other "bigger" hotels right smack in the middle of Times Square. Room was small but pretty clean, looking newly refurbished including the bathroom. Not just the "painted over " look. Staff was courteous and helpful. Elevator was re-e-eally slow, avoid room next to it. HOT WATER CAUTION!! Hot water pipes have scalding hot water!!! Almost burned myself a couple of times when using the sink and shower when the water pressure dropped which was fairly consistent in the mornings and evenings. Price is reasonable especially for the location. Didn't pay outrageous "bigger" hotel rates. How much time does one really spend in their hotel room!? Would stay here again.
I just got back from staying one week at the mid-town comfort inn, great two star hotel rooms are nice and clean. Close by everything in New York. I will stay here again. Thanks to tripadvisor.

We just returned from a stay at Comfort-Midtown (May 29-June 2) and highly recommend it. The location is excellent. It was clean, quiet and smoke free! The continental breakfast is nice and the staff was very friendly. The rooms are small and plain, but I have stayed in the same for much more in New York. They give discounts for AAA/AARP and we were extremely pleased with our rate for Sunday-Tues. One small caveat is to avoid Sat. nights when the rate jumps (almost double). Another plus is that it is a small hotel. Many thanks to Giovanni at the front desk and to the gentleman who handled the continental breakfast each morning and was so pleasant. I honestly didn't think I could find anything (so close to Times Square) for such a reasonable price.

Stayed there May 19 - 25, 2004. Wonderful place to stay. Inexpensive; comfortable; easy access to all forms of transportation; walking distance to all theatres and hundreds of restaurants. A half-block away from Times Square and you could not hear a single sound all night. Weather was in the high 80's with 80+% humidity and the little air conditioner in the room worked like a charm! Small room, but what do you want for $100/night? Staff was somewhat distracted and aloof, but Siddidi (?) the bell captain and the little foreign gentleman in the breakfast room were incredibly helpful and friendly. Only downsides: elevator was hopelessly slow (we were on the 9th floor) and the water pressure in the shower was erratic (water temperature was fine, however.) I will stay here every time I visit New York!

We stayed at the hotel three nights in late April and loved it. My wife and I took my parents to New York for their first visit. The location, half block from Times Square, was perfect. My parents are very active and fit but still they are near seventy. It was an easy walk to many restaurants, the theaters, Rockefeller Center and the subway. The rooms and hallways are small and narrow, not unlike many hotels in New York. Yet everything was clean and in good repair. Staff was friendly and helpful. Tough to beat for the price. We are already planning another trip and will definitely stay here again.

The room was clean, the staff were helpful, the breakfast was good, the place is quiet, the price is reasonable and the location is great. What else could you want in a hotel in Manhattan? This is definitely where I will stay on future trips to New York City.

I loved this hotel. The room was very reasonable and for the price was very nice. It was small, but it had everything you need and the bathroom was surprisingly large.It was extremely quiet and very clean. I like the hotel so much I will probably stay there again although in my opinion Times Square is not really the place to stay.One thing...hope for a room on a lower floor as the elevator is slow.

Stayed here April 2004. Okay ... let's be realistic. This is a 2 star Comfort Inn. So, it's doesn't have the biggest room or nicest lobby. However ... it was less than $100 a night and half a block from Times Square. You can't beat this kind of deal!

stayed in this hotel dec 03 3 girls on first visit to new york great place as a base to explore n y would stay here again and would def go to new york again loved every hectic min of it brill , a visit to the shopping outlet is a must if you like designer at cheap prices and chinatown is a must if you love fake cant tell the diff with a lot of the bags tiffanys was a bit of a dissapointment but the fake tiffs in chinatown were great

Stayed in the Comfort Inn Midtown for 5 nights the week of April 5th. Decided to stay here because of the reviews on this website. I was not disappointed. First, the location is excellent, in between Broadway and 6th Ave. This made for quick walks to all the theaters, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and 5th and Madison Avenue shopping. Also close to Subway stations making it easy to get anywhere in NYC. Second, the hotel itself is nice. Rooms are small, but this is NY. Very clean and staff is super nice. Also free breakfast. And finally, the price is right. $100 a night for the location and the ameneties, you can't beat it. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Last week I visited Manhattan and spent the night at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Before making the reservation, I looked on the tripadvisor website and noticed that it had received some great reviews. I wasn't disappointed. Located within minutes of Times Square and right in the middle of the theater district, we found it to be quite a find. Surprisingly, it is on a quiet block. The staff is friendly, a complimentary continental breakfast is included and the rooms (though small) are adequate and very clean. It is also a smoke free establishment. Once again, tripadvisor helped me make a terrific choice at a bargain price!

We stayed at Comfort Inn..23 thru 30th March 04 Fabulous wee smart quiet hotel...staff genuinely friendly..if you make the effort also ! Rooms clean and functional....although you may face a wall !...however because of its superb location you will be out most of the times ..strolling around ! Watch out for your Air con Unit..ours needed 'fixed' as rooms built up quite a heat Some room doors can bang shut..so do think of other guests ! Breakfast room is a treat ..Antony'hovers' and makes sure everybody is serviced (with a genuine smile.. not the "have a nice day" insincere nonsense either) ...good selection of all you might need in a continental breakfast. 46th Street is a very mixed activity area..with a Church next door.Bells calling the faithful are quite pleasant..& not loud We enjoyed our strolls morning and night....with no real worries Would defineatly go back.....saw the large 'lines', at other Hotel check in/outs..you wont get this here !!

Stayed here from March 17 - 21. This is a great value for a hotel in NYC. We paid $107 per night, which included a fairly substantial continental breakfast. First - the room was a decent size. We did not feel cramped. Second - the bed was comfortable, as was the temperature of the room. Third - we barely heard any noise from neighboring rooms even though the hotel was sold out. Fourth - breakfast included coffee, capaccino, juice, cereal, good fresh donuts and bagels, apples, bananas, yogurt and jellies, cream cheese, etc. Many days we only snacked in the afternoon and ate our next full meal for dinner. Fifth - room was done beautifully each day, asked for extra pillows and they were there when we returned. Sixth - you could not ask for a better location - 1/2 block off of Times Square. Seventh - we felt safe in the neighborhood and in the hotel. Eighth - staff was very friendly and helpful.Only negative - our room faced 46th street. Needed ear plugs to block out the garbage truck noise each morning around 5 am. Believe me, it was loud. Ask for a room away from the street.We will definitely go back to this hotel.

Great experience in NYC, 11- 16 March at the Comfort Inn MIDTOWN. It's literally 1minute from Times Square - Yay. Was expecting a tiny room after reading the reviews but our room (801) was great! Queen bed & heaps of room for all our shopping bags. BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY... IT WAS WONDERFULLY CLEAN. As members of the NZ AA we receive receiprocal rights to AAA rates in the USA, so our rate at the Comfort Inn was $107:00!!! This included a really good continental breakfast - can not imagine anyone complaining about the quality or quantity of food. The staff were friendly (In fact did not get to meet any of the famed "Rude New Yorkers" we'd heard so much about). Loved New York ! Will be back, and will stay at the Comfort Inn MIDTOWN again.

Stayed at the comfort inn march 3-8 2004 after reading good reviews on this site.We were not disappointed, rooms were comfy very clean,towels changed daily.Free breakfast all that you needed to send you on your way. then theres the location 30 yards to the centre of times square,perfect location in the midtown area. and you dont suffer from any noise at night like some of the hotels on the main strip do. Great place to stay in a brilliant happening city. we would stay here again when hopefully we return to New York.And all this at a budget price.

I would definitely recommend (and I already did it!) this hotel for a stay in NYC. I've been there in January 2004 following the Tripadvisor users' advices; I indeed found it relatively cheap, comfortable, clean, and the location is great.On the "grey" side I can possibly say that some peope of the staff seemed a bit cold sometimes. But perhaps it's the NY standard, and in any case we all can handle this!

We spent a week here in February and were very happy with the hotel. The location is unbeatable, as others have noted, and was clean and comfortable at a very good price (especially for Manhattan). A number of bonuses - the free breakfast, free internet access and local calls and (much appreciated) the fact that the whole hotel is smoke-free! We would stay there again in that famous New York minute!

We stay at this hotel whenever we go into the city for an overnight stay. Don't let the furniture in the lobby provide your first impression. You'd think they'd replace it. The rooms vary in size, but are always adequate. The bathrooms are kept spotless as well as the rooms. Beds are a bit hard, but adequate. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast saves having to find a place to eat early in the AM. Great hotel, a great price and great location.

We enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. The room was a good size & was clean with comfy beds, the bathroom was spacious & absolutely spotless. Staff were friendly & helpful - we requested a replacement light bulb for the bedside lamp which was dealt with promptly (which has not always been my experience when staying in other more expensive hotels). Would stay here again as the room rates are excellent for what you get & the hotel is in a great location on a quiet street but minutes away from Times Square.

We stayed here the weekend before christmas and had a great stay. Its very convienient for strolling round times square. you can easily walk to Fifth Avenue, Saks etc, Central Park, Rockafella centre and even Macy's. The rooms and batrooms were well presented, with simple, but nice decoration and spotlessly clean. The beds were comfortable. The room were a good size, even by New York standards, but you dont go to New York to sit in your room! Within our party we had 3 rooms, all in different parts, all different and all came up above expectation. All the rooms were quiet, and i certainly didnt hear anyone in the next room. I dont think I have ever stayed in a hotel, where you cant here some noise from the corridor and even that was very minimal and didnt disturb us. Didnt really notice the elevator was slow. Would definately go back. only paid $116.00, which for the standard and the location was amazing.

I was very pleased with our stay at the Comfort Inn. Although, not my usual hotel of choice, this was quite a bargain. The rooms were large (by New York standards) and clean. The location was unbeatable: a subway stop right outside your door, Macy's 1/2 block away, the Empire State Building on the next block, and walking distance to another dozen sights. Throw in a complentary continental breakfast and an Irish Pub, it was truly a delightful experience. You could do a lot worse for a lot more in The Big Apple.

I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown during the Thanksgiving 2003 holiday. I'd never travelled to the New York area overnight before and was travelling with my mother; therefore, it was imparative to locate a decent and convenient hotel. I searched high and low at every hotel site attempting to find the best I could find at a reasonable rate and with availability. Of course every hotel ever reviewed has a bad review but when I read all of the reviews for this hotel, I felt that the overall comments weren't that bad. (And of course two people can stay at the same hotel at the same time and have two entirely different experiences or I could go to the same place twice and have two totally different experiences, but....)Anyway, we stayed there and it was excellent. We had the room with 2 twin beds which was larger than we expected. There was plenty of room to move around, nice and moderate bathroom and bedroom furniture. Our room was on one side of the hotel; therefore, we did not have the noisey elevator problems. The complementary continental breakfast was very nice along with the attendant that serviced it. The staff was quite helpful with turkey day dinner suggestions with connections so that we didn't have to wait in line, supplying coupons for local attractions, etc. It is an excellent location on 46th street and nice to be off the main street. Only had to walk to the end of our block to view the parade! Our experience was lovely and we plan to stay again this year with the hope and expectation that experience is just the same or better. For our experience, I think we got MORE than we paid for at $135/night with the room, service, location, and the breakfast. It is a 2-star hotel, what do you expect. But we were very pleasantly surprised. AND, yes, the one small, slow elevator took some patience as we once walked up to our 8th floor room!

great location, 100 bucks only about 50 yards from the epicenter of times square. Rooms are extremely clean, desk people very polite. Stayed with a group, had 4 rooms for two nights, and everyone was very satisfied. When you reserve, ask for a room ending in 1,2 or 3... like room 802 for example...they tend to be bigger rooms. Join comfort inn membership club, free and quick to do at the Comfort Inn website. You then get 10% off your room and you get a room upgrade for free. One minor negative, elevator is slowwwwww!, but not a major inconvenience. Enjoy. I will def. stay there again vs paying nearly 2x as much across the street at the larger hotels. this place is a Gem!

After reading all of the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor for this hotel, I made reservations to stay there the weekend after Christmas. Upon arriving my wife and I were sorely disappointed by the size and quality of the rooms. The room was barely big enough to hold the queen bed and the bathroom was a sink and a tub. In addition the room seemed tired and worn.Worst of all, the elevator (one only) was breaking down and my wife (needing a cane) had to climb four flights of stairs. When discussed with hotel management, they stated "Sorry, but live with it." As this was unacceptable, we had to move to another hotel.We should have known that, for the rates advertised and the hotel's location near Times Square, that we would be getting this type of room and ambiance but I did not get that feeling from reading the other reviews here. So, if you are looking only for location and a small room, go for it but be ready to accept the downside to the hotel.

Super place. I felt safe, the location was great, the rooms were clean and nice. The staff was exceptional !! The best $ rate I could find. My first trip to New York and the people at the hotel helped make it a wonderful experience.

Stayed at the comfort inn from 12/19 to 12/20 for 125.00, after reading other reviews on this site. I have nothing but good things to say. The staff was very helpful, Giovanni was very pleasant and informative during check in. The room was very clean and well maintained. This place was right in the heart of Times Square. I will not hesitate to stay again or recommend it to all budget minded travellers to NYC

After reading reviews on many websites, we decided to stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown, the weekend of November 6-10. The hotel was everything we expected and much more. The location is great and the service is wonderful. They also allowed us to have late check out (2pm).After traveling to NYC many times before, this is now our number one pick for hotels. It's reasonable price, excellent location and friendly staff make it a great choice.You can't go wrong.

After much research we selected the Comfort Inn Midtown and we were not disappointed. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom as spacious as your home bath. The marble floors were heated which was nice on cold mornings. This is a small hotel which to me is a feature..easy access to your room, no crowded lobby, individual attention from the front desk when you need it....just a few steps from the outside of your hotel to your room. Believe me after walking all over NYC you don't want to have to walk another block just to get to your room. The continental breakfast included in their rate was quite adequate. Very few hotels offer this in NYC and it is a nice feature to be able to grab a cup of coffee and a fresh pastry and hit the streets! Before coming to New York my second choice for a hotel was the Westin Times Square, so when I arrived I did check it out and I know I made the right decision selecting the Comfort Inn. The Westin is located in a very congested area and not easily accessible....The Comfort Inn is maybe a 1/2 block from Times Square - yet it is remarkably quiet and peaceful - which is very soothing after a long day of noise in NYC. I highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay there again.

This is an excellent choice for New York City. Stayed here on marathon weekend at less than half the price elsewhere in town. The room was very clean. The was staff extremely friendly and helpful. You can walk anywhere from the location. I would recommend this hotel to friends, family and even in-laws without worrying about how they would find the accommodations.

Just returned from a wonderful three day week-end in New York where we stayed with two other couples at the Comfort Inn Midtown.....it was a fabulous place! Though our room was quite small with a tiny bathroom (w/tiny shower), it was immaculate. The other two rooms were larger and also very clean and all were tastefully decorated. You can't beat the location....walking distance to Times Square, theaters, restaurants, etc....and the price was very reasonable. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. All of us would stay here again in a heartbeat. It's not luxury, but for the budget minded traveler, it's perfect.

This is everything you can ask for in a mid-town NYC hotel (assuming you do not want/need luxury): Clean, quiet, comfortable, and affordable. Just steps from the action of Times Square. I will make this hotel my first choice when traveling to NYC in the future.

I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown in New York.It's a wonderful place.........First off, I was going to stay at the Marriott Marquis on Time Square, but I saw the reviews on the Comfort Inn Midtown and it sounded wonderful.And Wonderful it was....it was very clean, VERY close to Time Square......maybe a short half of block or less.........and there you are right in Time Square.My room was a little small, but not bad...........we had a king bed with a nice size bathroom and a walk in closet.............The furnishings were all new and up to date........and very clean and nice. It was nicely decorated.............Believe me I am very very picky and do not like to stay in bad places and I very glad that I chose this hotel to stay in..............first off I saved a lot of money staying at this hotel instead of the Marriott.The Comfort Inn Midtown may not have all the glamour and glitz as the Marriott Marquis, but it's still very nice............and it's sooooooooooo close to everything.........there are several restraurants literally right across the street and next door to the Comfort Inn Midtown............chinese, steak and seafood, etc....I would stay there again in a heartbeat and suggest to anybody to stay there.............A great place for a great price.............you are literally right there on Time Square--just a few steps a way.............The staff was very nice and helpful..........I had a great stay and recommend it highly.take care

We stayed at this hotel the night of September 20. This is a fantastic hotel for the budget minded traveler who wants to be in the center of the action. this hotel is half a block away from Times Square, TKTS and the Marriot Marquis...Our room was clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful. Save your money for the rest of your NYC trip and still have a great midtown place to stay.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is a great little hotel. Location was the best. The place was immaculately clean and the staff was very helpful. We had a very early flight into New York and got to the hotel at 10 a.m. the staff took care of our luggage and told us to go out and enjoy the day, our room will be ready when we got back. The continetal breakfast was great (bagels, fruit, cereal, juice, assorted breads, doughnuts) We would bring it back to our room and finish getting ready. This saved us time so we could get out and explore early. There was no other restaurant on the premises but you are close to hundreds within a few minutes. The rooms are small and decorated to make it feel comfortable and cozy but we did not spend a lot of time in our room. The bathroom was very nice clean and lots of water pressure in the shower. I read a review about someone getting charged more for a taxi to the airport when the Comfort Inn ordered a cab. That was not the case for my daughter and I. The hotel got us a taxi to go to LGA and we were charged (including toll) $24. plus a tip. I do not think they have any connections with the cab company. I think that person who wrote that review just had a bad experience with one employee/cab. Our room was $107. So if you are not looking for the ritz and glamour this is hotel is a perfect find.

Stayed here based on reviews from several sources..and would do so again, without hesitation.. The location is great, 1/2 block from Times Square, the room/bathroom was clean and adequate for 4. Kids stay free, and breakfast is complimentary.. Found the staff at the desk to be friendly and helpful. Parking is across the street and cheaper than most lots in New York. Had some difficulty with the in-room internet...but other than that, we enjoyed our stay in New York very much thanks to the Comfort Inn Midtown.. Would, (and have), recommend it to friends!

This hotel is located right in the middle of time square so you can walk to the theatre or even to central park & fifth ave. The room was small but it was pretty clean. We got a great rate using AAA (they do check your AAA card) average $100 per night. Parking is extra though, $20/day. i guess reasonable by NYC standards. I would stay here again.

We arrived at the Comfort Inn Midtown just at the beginning of the blackout 8/14/03. We were allowed to check in our rooms (other hotels didn't allow their guests into their rooms) and were very thankful that we didn't have to sleep in the streets of Times Square like thousands of other tourists. The management was up all night trying to help everyone - they set up a battery so we had a light and radio in the lobby. The power came back 8:00 am the next morning, and we couldn't believe that they were serving continental breakfast! Although there was no hot water for another day & a half (due to the city not providing the hotels enough steam), the rooms were cleaned each day and clean towels (new ones) were provided.It might not be the fanciest place, but the location is perfect right off Times Square, it's very clean, and all personnel were extremely helpful and friendly. What could have been a miserable weekend turned out to be an interesting adventure. The Super Shuttle is available to/from the airports, there's a computer to check email, add a very reasonable price, and the Comfort Inn Midtown is a bargain in all ways.

After doing much research online, I finally settled for the Comfort Inn Midtown for my mother, 5 y/o daughter and I to stay on our 4 day NYC adventure. It was updated, clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The BEST part was the location. We were right in the heart of everywhere exciting in Times Square. It's exactly what I was looking for and I'm glad I took the time to research and find the perfect hotel. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel itself so we didn't mind that the room was fairly small for what we were used to but the price was wonderful for the location ($107/night) which included a decent continental breakfast. I will definately stay here next time!

Comfort Inn was a great location and it was clean and neat. The only problem I had was when they offered to order a cab for me and they lied saying the cab fare to LaGuardia airport was more than coming to the city. They told me the cab fare would be $38 and I got a yellow cab for $25. They have connections with a cab company that rips their customers off and the hotel must get a kick back. I think this is very bad for their paying customers. I liked staying there but please don't take advantage of their cab, suttle serv or entertainment--they rip you off.
